Reviews.Title: “Wonderful modern hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Demi1130
Reviews.Content: W Hotel HK in Kowloon is a gem of a surprise. Great location - right on top of local train (MTR) station and Airport Express train stop so coming and going to airport and other city locatioabroad a breeze. Elements Mall is also connected to the hotel with luxury retail shops. The hotel's service and modern amenities are the icing on the cake.

Reviews.Title: “5 star service”
Reviews.Author: JBECQUET
Reviews.Content: I just checked in at W Hong Kong to feel a special atmosphere: design was everywhere! Then when I came into my room I got a personalized present witch was totaly crazy!!!! I am the CEO of a food company and the W team made a field with vegetables with cakes!!! Just look at the amazing picture ... So service here is perfect with a team witch always want to serve you and the hotel il perfect with hight quality design. I highly recommand this place!!!

Reviews.Title: “It's alright to be in the shadows”
Reviews.Author: OceansideGreg
Reviews.Content: We had planned to stay at the Ritz-Carlton which is right next door in the ICC tower, but decided on the W instead as we were concerned that clouds would block our view! The hotel has a very friendly staff and we completely enjoyed our stay. We had a Corner Room that provided views of the ICC tower on one side and a sliver of the harbor and Elements mall and other residences on the other. The restaurant called Kitchen has a breakfast buffet that is worth making another trip to Hong Kong just to enjoy it. We checked out the pool at the top of the building and it was very trendy and affords excellent views of the city. While there we got around by using a two day Big Bus pass. We travelled first to downtown Kowloon using the hotel's courtesy shuttle and started our travels from there. At the end of the day we got off at a stop at the DHL balloon which is about a 10 minute walk from the hotel. Although one can see the ICC tower and W Hotel from the DHL balloon, the only way we found to access the hotel was by entering the Elements mall at the train station. Overall a very nice property and stay.

Reviews.Title: “Exciting, enthusiastic and warm service”
Reviews.Author: emansec
Reviews.Content: I had a fantastic experience at this Hotel. It's situated on Kowloon, a perfect location between airport and Honk Kong Island not too far away from Nathan Rd. The luxury shopping area in which this hotel is located is superb, a shopping paradise! The room was large (0cean view) and perfectly cleaned, the bath tube an the shower amazing! Restaurant manager greet us in a warm way and director of whenever/whatever knows how to do her job, the Woo Bar experience was fantastic, very good drinks! Spa and Swimming pool on the roof very elegant and Coomfortable! Concierge guy amazing, he answered to all our inquiries in a warm and enthusiastic way! I want to really recognize that w Hong kong is three thousands step up than the others Hong Kong hotels!!!!

Reviews.Title: “What a sweet thought...”
Reviews.Author: VictorLME
Reviews.Content: I had to go on a business trip during my birthday... Darn, what bad timing - the one day of the year out of 365.25 days and it had to be it... To my surprise, when I got back to my room on that very faithful day; there lies a birthday cake and greeting card on the table, especially from the hotel to me. That really made staying in W Hong Kong well worth it

Reviews.Title: “The staff is amazing”
Reviews.Author: Josh A
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 2 nights on our honeymoon. The staff could not have been any friendlier, from the cake in our room wishing us a happy honeymoon to the concierge helping with every request including getting us a reservation for tea at the Peninsula Hotel. Also, the views of the harbour and ICC were amazing. Thanks W for making the start of our honeymoon so amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Great as Usual”
Reviews.Author: Derek_Rader
Reviews.Content: We always stay at the W while in Hong Kong. It's a little away from the action, but taxi's are cheap and it's connected to K station which makes it easy to get to and from HKG. The rooms are excellent especially on the Starwood Preferred floors. The staff is professional, courteous, and punctual. The breakfast is worth checking out and is a Top 5 in Asia in terms of quality and selection. The pool is pimp.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hip hotel”
Reviews.Author: dan801
Reviews.Content: The hotel was amazing and hip. You walk into a small concierge area which leads to several glass elevators taking you to the 6th floor. You are treated to and ultra modern reception area with lounge music all around you. After check in and 5 star service the hotel room; Just wow - comfortable beds, a selection of 4 pillows, ultra high tech equipment, surround sound stereo with wide screen tv, electric curtains opening up over a beautiful city view, massive rain shower with tv, just wow. The feel of the hotel is that of a ultra modern, relaxed 5 star lounge bar. Roof top pool (highest in hong kong) overlooking the entire skyline. You are greeted by a towel concierge, there is a in house dj roof side and amazing small restaurant (serving pool side food and cocktails) delivered to your spa whilst watching the symphony of light show and listening to the DJ The Hotel is attached to the Kowloon station. Whilst not within walking distance to any attraction it adjoins the Kowloon shopping centre and MTR station, it's still very convenient and central. The airport check in counter is at the Kowloon station so you can check in from there up to 24 hours prior to your flight then catch the airport express (25min) to airport. Its only 5 minutes walk from the hotel. Tip - dont use your octopus card if your traveling in pairs - a two person pass is 50 per cent cheaper. Downside; No free wifi - considering most hotels offer it this was disappointing. It's also expensive but you get an awesome experience in return so value for money is there. Location - its close to train station but not walking distance to anything. Recommended for a young, trendy or modern traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Funky hotel for HK”
Reviews.Author: T H
Reviews.Content: HK has until recently not been known for having many cool, funky hotels....now they have W! Whilst the location is somewhat to be desired, when the re-development of the cultural district is complete - this is going to be where the action is!! The adjacent Elements shopping complex, Ritz-Carlton Hotel and much more makes it a great place to chill! Love the pool!!

Reviews.Title: “cool modern hotel but far from city”
Reviews.Author: rudyrafalee
Reviews.Content: been here last july 2010. the rooms are great. modern. just the right room size and the bathroom is big enough. nice "library" feel/look when you exit the elevators. everyone staying here should check out the swimming pool. one advantage is that the elements mall is just at your door step. also convenient to go to the airport with airport express just down your hotel. the only disadvantage staying here is that you have to take a taxi going to tsimshatsui downtown. but they have shuttles going there every 30 mins. sometimes you will miss it and have no other choice but to take the taxi. overall, very trendy and chic hotel.

Reviews.Title: “World Class”
Reviews.Author: Munich Z
Reviews.Content: Hotel is awesome. Room is big and technologically savvy. Staff are very very plesant.The only bad point, the location is a little off from the main MTR line that links to the kowloon markets. But a short cab right will do fine.

Reviews.Title: “one of the best w's I've been to, twice”
Reviews.Author: International_Paolo
Reviews.Content: The view from the top says it all, not to mention being able to check your bags on your flight out in the very large luxury mall area and take the subway to the airport with ease. You will have to take a cab or subway out of kowloon and into downtown, but its not a big deal. Great food at the restaurant and a really great buffet breakfast spread with an abundance of good food. Not the cheapest but this W is worth the scratch. Stayed here twice. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “experience at the pool was so great..”
Reviews.Author: kiethed
Reviews.Content: i checked in about 12:00. the room was not ready and i arranged to stay at pool until 5pm. i was so disapointed with room but i the pool lifeguard was very nice and friendly. he helped me a lot and provide me the right direction for me to change my clothes. although the arrangement was not so good but the staff is quit professional.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, wow pool, gym, spa!”
Reviews.Author: Claude_Vone
Reviews.Content: After a holiday quick stay at W Koh Samui landed in Hong Kong on business. This is the third stay at W Hong Kong and I had to write a short review. Check in and out can be slow which isn't ideal but once you get served the service is great. Rooms with a view are fantastic. The view from the gym is stunning and the rooftop pool is superb. Service is fast, personable and always right. Hotel staff are very friendly and always helpful. The spa treatments are amazing! You have to go and try them out. Great stay. Funky hotel but not over the top. My favorite now in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: maic
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night enroute from macau back home. The hotel is 5 mins by taxi from the kowloon ferry terminal. It is also nicely connected via express train to the airport. The hotel check in lobby is a bit small and can get a bit crowded. The rooms are nice and fancy like what a W is. I got upgraded to a corner room with partial ocean views. The views that are not ocean actually look into other peoples apartments across a square. The gym is very nice, with a sorts of equipment and even a punching bag. The rooftop pool has great view and the food decent. Breakfast was goos, with excellent variety. The resturant does try to be creative with food choices. However, the hotel is currently under renovations and if you intend to stay in the room during the day you might find the noise irritating.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: tony b
Reviews.Content: Amazing place, great location and the best buffet breakfast ever i really loved this place and will go back again when i am in hong. The airport link is just a 5 min walk through the shopping centre, very convienient.

Reviews.Title: “Fine, except room-assignement”
Reviews.Author: Wiesi
Reviews.Content: This hotel is first-class, unfortunately after a long flight from Germany our room was not ready till evening, we got an other room so we could refresh but then our reserved room did not have the connecting doors which we needed because of a 2year old. We were given the free upgrade to the presidential suite, which is very large and beautiful but didn't have 2 bedrooms. So we had to do with an other room for the night. Only the next day we got our initially ordered rooms. Otherwise everything was fine, except we got into the taifoon vicente which hit Hong Kong, but this is another story.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect also comparing to other W Hotels. Easy Snobish Perfectly Organized.”
Reviews.Author: stefanomichelini
Reviews.Content: Hong Kong is the capital of the World and New York its vintage version. W Hotel defeats ands down all the other old fashioned Hotel. If you want to get bored avoid W as well as if you aim being unconfortable. W Hong Kong is a must for any kind of traveller who enjoy perfection and trendy beauty and rythm.

Reviews.Title: “W Hotel Hong Kong, It is A B C to Z that good”
Reviews.Author: SFMD
Reviews.Content: We stay at this hotel every time we visit Hong Kong. It's location is a bit odd, away from the busy commercial district but it is ok for us. The train from the airport will take you to the hotel directly. It is also above the subway station and you can take the subway to the Hong Kong island. What we enjoy so much above the Hotel W in Hong Kong is their superb service and the facility. The rooftop swimming pool is out of the world, the gym and hot tub is amazing, the buffet breakfast will suit any appetite, and I do recommend the many kind of fresh squeeze juice and pastry. Every room has a great view with a large flat screen TV and KEF surround sound and DVD player. For music lover, there is a CD record company next to the the hotel, do go in and explore, you can make a request to open any CD and listen before you buy, and I mean any sealed CD and listen for as long as you want.

Reviews.Title: “W Hotel Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: cludie
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend spend a weekend in W Hotel Hong Kong, we had wonderful time. Service was amazing, rooms and service was spectacular. It was my my birthday and the Hotel brought me to the room a piece of cake which was very nice! I highly recommend it, if you get a "spectacular room" you can get a better view to Lantau Island.

Reviews.Title: “When everything goes wrong...”
Reviews.Author: Ioannis78
Reviews.Content: I have just stayed at the W Hongong with my wife, daughter and parents-in-law for 3 days on a stopover on our way to Bali but our stay was covered with mishaps and problems from start to finish. First, the airport transfer the hotel organised broke down on the highway, then our rooms werent ready when we arrived at the hotel, then the rooms that we booked werent interconnecting as promised and once we finally got our connecting rooms we still had trouble with the room service. Granted, the hotel staff and in particular the welcome relations manager Alex Beatie were keen to sort everything out for us and make up for the bad experience but obviously these things shouldnt have happened in the first place and the resoltutions should have been smoother and quicker (eg we had to wait until 6pm for our rooms to be ready!). As an SPG Platinum Member i woud have expected that the hotel is better prepared for my arrival and also prioritizes my requests over others. On the bright side the design of the hotel, the rooms, the spa and the rooftop pool remain top selling points and the location and easy conncetion to the airport are also a plus. But in the end its the staff and the service that make a hotel truely 5* and here there seem to be a few weaknesses...

Reviews.Title: “This hotel sets the WOW (W) standard!”
Reviews.Author: Softlanding
Reviews.Content: Over the years, I have spent many nights at this hotel, in many different rooms and suites. Always, I have come away with the indelible impression that not only does this hotel try to be different, it is different and it retains that elusive WOW factor ... one that does not diminish with repeat visits. Many of the W hotels in this global franchise lack the sheer class of this property and/or the staff attitude of nothing is too much bother. This property is my unhesitating preference in Hong Kong, even compared to the swank new Ritz Carlton next door.

Reviews.Title: “High tea @ the W”
Reviews.Author: Duccio A
Reviews.Content: Great pastries at W's High Tea... perhaps followed by a drink by the rooftop pool! Quite a wide selection of teas and infusions, cool atmosphere, young crowd, great views on the harbour... Definitely a nice way to spend a fancy afternoon away from the heat and the bustling shopping malls.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: FabulousDD
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a fantastic weekend in W Hong Kong. The location is so convenient as it's situated above the Kowloon Airport Express Station. Staff is professional and courteous, in-room dining is of really high quality (although not cheap), and best of all is the rooftop pool that overlooks the harbor. Just beautiful! I would definitely stay here again, highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Shame about the facilities - or rather, lack of”
Reviews.Author: Alistair J
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at the W Hong Kong on our honeymoon for the last couple of days. The hotel has a great vibe, is centrally located and the staff are really friendly and accommodating. The biggest disappointment by far is access to the pool, which for the last 4 days has been closed due to a 'deep clean'. Particularly annoying is that there has been no update on (i) when the pool is expected to reopen (ii) why the 'deep clean' is taking so long - every time you speak to the staff, although very apologetic, they really don't seem to have a clue - we've been told on 4 separate occasions now that the pool will open 'later today', or 'tomorrow' . . . perhaps next month eh??!! It's a pity, as this has left a slight bitter feeling about what on the face of it at least is a pretty decent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “one the best in HK”
Reviews.Author: ThomasTravelFun
Reviews.Content: First time in W HK, love the concept and music in the lobby. The whole hotel smell great. Room and bathroom are great with reasonable size. However only lobby have free wifi for us. This doesn't really bother us. We order drinks and enjoy the ambience! Lovely gym and pool! Staff working are friendly, helpful and with great attitude!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience !!”
Reviews.Author: hims281
Reviews.Content: I stayed there on a work trip earlier this month. Fantastic property - The hotel is very contemporary, which is the way I like it, and yet the feel is very personal. I really liked the tray in the room with all sorts of nick-nacks including an umbrella, a power adapter, a first aid kid and an emergency kit in case you bring someone back to the room after a good night out ; ) The bed was comfortable, and I understand I was in the entry-level category of rooms. The roof top pool is really nice too. Service - They have a Whatever / Whenever number to call at, in case of any wishes. We used it past midnight, and they lived up to their name. Everyone who works there seemed very happy and always eager to help. Would recommend this property to all !!

Reviews.Title: “Stylish and cool!”
Reviews.Author: saber13
Reviews.Content: This is the 3rd W i have stayed at the other two being in New York and Shanghai and it lived up to the expectations set by the brand. I have generally found design driven hotels to be lacking in service but this was not the case here as the service was as good as the design. The hotel is a stones throw away from 118 floor high International Commerce Center in west Kowloon that houses the Ritz Carlton Hotel. As i stayed there only for one night i couldnt really use all available facilities but the breakfast was extensive and the cafe had a great view. Within the room the most striking feature is the mini bar that had the most extensive selection ever, right down to an umbrella and a multi pin adapter! All in all it was a very nice stay and like all hotels in Hong Kong, quite expensive.

Reviews.Title: “The best W's out there!”
Reviews.Author: hongjo
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently completed a 2 night stay at the W HK. I have to say that this is my single favorite W property. I absolutely love the brand (I bought W towels and bedsheets for my own home) so I've stayed at a fair share of W's over the years. So what makes this W so great? The seem to do everything right. And when they don't, they make every effort to make it right. As a SPG Platinum member, I was pre-upgraded to a Fabulous Suite. There was a mix-up during a previous stay of mine, so they made sure I was taken care of at my next stay. The suite is fabulous as its name suggests. There is a 50" LCD in the living room that's probably too big for the room (the couch is only about 6' away). When have you ever been in a hotel room that you can say the TV is realistically too large? In the bedroom, there is a high end B&O A&V system (although the remote is a bit difficult to use). I love that they didn't hold back on A&V as most hotels do. The bathroom is just as impressive. In addition to the overhead rain shower, they have 3 small jets that project water horizontally. When both are fully turned on, its like taking a bath standing up! In additon, they provide extra large Bliss spa toilettries. Those happened to find a way straight to my suitcase on check-out. As others have reviewed, the breakfast at Kitchen is excellent. SPG Plats receive free continental (cold only) with an optional $100HKG upgrade to the full. Between the selection and quality of the food, this is one of the best breakfast spreads I have ever had. The rooftop pool was closed because of the typhoon, however I've used it during previous stays. Like everything else at this hotel, it is very impressive. My only negative for the hotel is the location. Its super convenient to the Airport Express so getting to/from the airport is a piece if cake. However, getting to Central is not as easy. It takes one long subway stop and a 10 minute walk to get to the good parts of Central. That might not seem as much, but for a city as closely packed as HK, its a bit of a trek. The hotel is plenty good enough to make this a non-issue, but if access to Central is your #1 priority, this may not be the best hotel for you. Thank you to the wonderful staff at the W Hong Kong for another exceptional stay. It should be a case study for all W's on how things should be done. I'm already looking forward to my next stay.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: Nisse N
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in May 2009. I just fell in love with W hotels. The hotel was very modern and amazing. I have no bad word of anything! This is most probably the best hotel in the world. Room was amazing, we were upgraded to city view room as my company had a gold card for Starwood hotels. Service was just outstanding! Whatever, whenever service worked perfectly. They brought cigarettes to my room. They were not sold near the hotel at night so they quickly solved my problem. I have and I will recommend this hotel and every other hotel in the same chain for anybody. Rooftop pool and Bliss Spa were amazing. I'm still remembering my stay. I also bought the hotel music cd home and had been enjoying the memories of this hotel and Hong Kong, last time a week ago. GO THERE AND YOU CAN FORGET EVERY OTHER CHAIN!

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great ...”
Reviews.Author: Fanny X
Reviews.Content: Staff were friendly enough but a lot of attitude. Food was great. Breakfast team were super efficient and friendly. Location ... I prefer the island. Sleep was fantastic. Overall the hotel was a bit too designed for me ... Felt like I was in a Disney cartoon ... Which I am sure some people love this ...

Reviews.Title: “Ahhh.... if only the pool was working”
Reviews.Author: nadia m
Reviews.Content: I happened to stay during the renovation of the swimming pool, which was a bummer. I got to swim there just once and the rest of the time it was closed. Spa facilities are really nice. The hotel is very comfy, service is excellent. Fast, correct, seamless. Rooms are very well thought out, great views and great beds / pillows / comforters! Breakfast is fantastic. Perfume smell and techno music in the elevators did not bother me.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite hotel in my favorite city!”
Reviews.Author: ADAMLG
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here a number of times. All with SPG Platinum status. My most recent stay was this week. Overall, this is my favorite hotel in Hong Kong, although it may not be for everyone. Pros: - Location. I'm probably the biggest fan of Hong Kong Airport Express in the world. This hotel is within steps of the Kowloon station. It makes getting to the airport easy. It's also easy to zip into central. Overall, the location of this hotel is very well rounded. -SPG recognition is pretty high. I've always been upgraded. Not always to a suite but usually to a much better room than booked. - The rooms. I really like the style of the rooms and I think they are very functional and trendy. -Ambiance, The W Hong Kong doesn't give off the vibe of some of the other hotels in the W Chain, which is a good thing. I don't necessary feel like i'm in a club every time I walk through the hotel. -F+B, The food at the hotel is very good, I've had some very good breakfasts here. -Pool, this is one of my favorite hotel pools in the world. I could spend a whole vacation sitting by the pool. Cons: - The service execution is very average at times. It's three star quality, and when i'm paying five star prices I want five star quality. I do feel like the staff tries very hard, I just feel like they are overwhelmed often.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: naushad_hussain
Reviews.Content: Just spent the last three nights at the W Hong Kong. Checking in was a breeze and the whole process done within a couple of minutes. I was upgraded to a ICC/Harbor facing room. The room had everything you can ask for and more. I found the staff to be extremely efficient and friendly and did really make the stay more enjoyable. I am now sure that I have found my preferred address in Hong Kong for all future trips. The roof-top jacuzzi was just the remedy for tiring work day and was a delight to take a dip. Had Breakfast at The Kitchen on two of the three mornings. I found that The Kitchen Staff did not live up to the same lively standards or enthusiasm as their counterparts across the hotel. The stay was definitely a refreshing change from a lot of the more formal/stuffy hotels. I definitely look forward to staying here during my future travels to Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: tasfamilyoffive
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W hotel for 3 nights and loved it. The service was great - very friendly and relaxed but extremely efficient. The room was great - fantastic view, incredibly comfortable bed (best hotel bed I've slept on) and all the necessary amenities (even a coffee plunger and proper coffee, and a great range of good quality teas). The spa was very impressive - the nail bar has full length windows with a stunning view of the city/harbour. Breakfast was a highlight - we particularly enjoyed the variety of fresh juices and smoothies and the variety of fruit as well as the excellent yoghurt however the food presentation and art in the cafe stole the show. The location is fantastic - huge shopping mall, train station and countless restaurants nearby. I would highly recommend the W to anyone wishing to stay in Kowloon.

Reviews.Title: “Great views, good location”
Reviews.Author: Eat-Sleep-Walk
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed the great service in this newly renovated hotel. Views from the corner suite on the 33rd floor were amazing. We had some issues, but they were promptly addressed and rectified. Location is perfect – above the Elements Mall and Kowloon metro station. Heavenly beds were very comfortable and spa is well worth a visit. Roof top pool is great – although beware of random closings as previous posters have mentioned. Food and drinks at terrace restaurant at the pool looked reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Best and happening hotel”
Reviews.Author: Littlewormmy
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the W hotel for 2 nights and the experience were mind blowing. All the staffs are very polite, helpful , attentive and smilling all the time. The room was superd with a great view of the harbour and we could enjoy the sun rise from our room. We love the interior design of the hotel- simple , warm yet refreshing. My daughter enjoy the infinity pool so much that she didn't even want to leave the pool. The lunch at the Kitchen was great too. We really enjoyed our stay and thank you so much to the W Hotel HK for such a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Roof top pool a winner with kids”
Reviews.Author: drmaitai
Reviews.Content: Our family had a great stay at the Hong Kong W Hotel. The breakfast buffet was amazing and very cool design wise. The rooms had fantastic views of the harbor and were well designed as you could see the view from the shower. The kids really enjoyed the rooftop pool. The pool had an infinity edge which overlooks the adjacent skyscrapers - cool. Leaving is a breeze as you can check in your bags at your airlines booth right below the hotel in Kowloon station. People who complain about the attitude at the W should go to New York or LA and really get offended.

Reviews.Title: “Now this is a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: PaulfromCanberra
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel that is respectful to guests, stretches to ensure guests are well cared and catered for and nothing is too much trouble. It has earn t the five stars. The rooms are spacious, modern, clean, well appointed and decked out. The food in the Kitchen restaurant is outstanding as is the the professional, attentive team looking after you from the time you arrive until you depart. I was particularly impressed with the best concierge service I have ever experienced and the porters who personally assisted me with two large and heavy bags to the station airport check-in, some 500 metres away! I look forward to returning to the W Hong Kong!

Reviews.Title: “Kids Not Welcome”
Reviews.Author: John C
Reviews.Content: Pretty cool rooms, kids not welcome in pool area (apparently the pool is a "the pool is a very sought after venue ", bar was dead on Sat. nights.... Would be a fun hotel for a 20 something looking for a home base, 30+ with kids I do not recommend - feel like I am at a exclusive night club where the staff is pretentious.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the wait”
Reviews.Author: Manoj M
Reviews.Content: I'd been waiting to stay at the W for some time after seeing photos of it. Having stayed numerous times at the other Starwood properties in HK (Sheraton and Le Meridien), I can safely say that the W leaves them for dead. Yes, the harbour view may be better from the Sheraton, but overall the style, the service and just all the little things about the W HK all truly lived up to my expectations. From the moment I arrived I was made to feel welcome, and the service and attentiveness of all the staff was just superb (with one exception, there was one doorman who I asked for help in getting a taxi who had a nasty attitude, but other than that it was flawless). As many others have pointed out, you will either love the location or not. For me, being able to check in for my flight at the station directly below the hotel and being able to get to all parts of HK via the MTR when I wanted to made the location work very well. Overall, it was a wonderful stay and I look forward to my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “High design, high hopes, highs and lows in execution”
Reviews.Author: clareyb999
Reviews.Content: For me a perfect location - train from the airport was spot on and it is great that you can stay in air conditioned comfort from leaving the plane to your room, with the station taking you pretty much to the hotel front door. I arrived late, and had a very friendly check in experience, with a room upgrade which was a lovely touch. Bags taken to the room without hesitation and the bar team looked after all of our requests even though they were due to close in five minutes. Great art installation at present, and mixologist are of a reasonable standard. Our waitress was very friendly and advised us of her name, (emma) and what promotions were happening and when. Suite lived up to it's name "fabulous". Views incredible, and all amenities accounted for - excellent steam iron, good water pressure and temperature. Some quirks - UK iPhone could not play through main tv even after following instructions. And a word of warning, when you walk into your room the slot for your key card to turn on the lights is very difficult to locate, as there is NO light in he room, and very little from the corridor. Bed was comfortable, but I struggled to get the lights to turn off for sleeping. The system is complex and not very intuitive. I did have a letter advising me of renovations but I was not affected by any noise or construction presence. Breakfast choice is huge - with the ambient and cold items of a lovely quality. The hot breakfast is good in choice, but poor on execution. Mine was cold... Coffee is delicious and the service on morning one was really lovely, and morning two lacking in presence or friendliness. Pool area is quite special from a view perspective, but the service is just rubbish. Which is a shame because the drinks that were mixed for us were lovely, when we eventually got them. The presentation of the bar area is cluttered and feels back of house, and like an after thought, which could explain why the team were disengaged and lacked energy. The lifeguard and towel team were very friendly and took the time to show us the best place to sit for views, breeze and sunshine. Check out was reasonable, bag stores and taxi finding wasn't.... Which unfortunately my last customer touch point. Overall the hard product is exceptional, and the environment is typical W. and yes it is loud, in your face, designed to wake up your youthful senses, and that is why you stay at W. However, the service doesn't make the W, in fact it breaks the W promise of a wonderful stay. Some team members trying too hard to be as pretentious as some of the W guests, which is not only letting some of the great team members down, it is letting the opportunity of being a fabulous EXPERIENCE slip through the net. Go on W ... Start delivering some of the basics of customer service with some love, flair and care... You could be amazing... And we all love being amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Stay there for the view and the facilities but not for the service as it does not exist!!!”
Reviews.Author: Chrisinasia
Reviews.Content: Spent one night there between two flights from Bangkok to Taipei. Location is not the best and quite far from the beat of Kowloon... Check-in was ok, quite unpersonal with a bit nose up/arrogant male receptionist...who does not really care to give you any info about any facility of the hotel... Had to request to change of room as the first one was smelling a kind of wet paint... part of the rooms at this time are already under renovation... quite surprising for an hotel opens for than less 2 years... Same receptionist changed and escorted me to a second room, same situation and when I informed him about the smell, he replied to me that it is probably the W smell... I did not know that the smell of this brand is made with paint... Unfortunately for this male receptionist I stayed in several W properties and for sure this smell is not the W smell. As I had only one night to spent there I did not want to change again of room.... but this gentleman must be careful to confirm such incorrect info especially when you are facing a fan as me of W. Definitely a bad point for them... Went to the pool, nice, breathtaking but main issue is at 2pm there is no more sun and you have to squeeze in a very tiny part of the terrace if you want to enjoy a bit some sun.... I know that usually Asians are not really keen about sunbathing but what about us...???? Stayed there for almost 2 hours, no one from the bar or the pool came to ask me if I want to drink or eat something... too bad for them... a lot of staff... just making wind and not much more... When back to my room (3208), some very annoying noises of drilling were on until I phoned to their operator who informed that there are some renovations going on... too bad that a notice is not displayed in the room to inform... TV channels are not really clear and many times cut by "no signal", quite annoying at the end if you try to watch a movie as I did... Evening turndown service was done at 5.40pm, a bit early by a great gentleman very polite and professional who actually the only one to ask me if I need something... Wanted to check my e-mails and got the info that internet is not included in the room rate and have to pay 40 HKD per hour... such ridiculous and cheap it is,,, if you do not want to pay you can go down to the 6th floor where is the lobby and bars of the hotel to enjoy a complimentary wireless but you have to order a drink who cost you more than 40 HKD per hour. Such a shame for W to be so cheap of not including internet in the room.... Good point of the room was I watched for more than of one hour the sunset from the daybed and was great and certainly THE memory of this stay. Check-out was fully inpersonal, no one to assist with your luggage or to assist you with the elevator... maybe too early when I left at 7.30pm... In conclusion, the hotel has good points and go for there if you like trendy but for the W effect from the team go somewhere like in Taipei as I did not find it in Hong Kong... Too bad, the management have a nice toy to play but it seems they do not know how to make it great....

Reviews.Title: “Young, stylish, happening....excellent, professional, five-star service”
Reviews.Author: evelynegomis
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W for several days and had time to really observe and appreciate the dynamics of the place. Hotel room, view, deco and little amenities were fab: ultra modern but absolutely cosy. The staff was wonderful and bent over backwards to make sure all our needs were met. The hotel holds an excellent location inside the elements shopping center with direct access to metro, seven eleven, dirt cheep dry cleaning, haagen dasz etc. all adjacent to the ICC building. The shopping center offers all the conveniences of most malls in Hong Kong (I.e. a huge array of luxury stores, an upscale supermarket, many well accredited restaurants -both local and international). Do make use of the hotel's signature whatever/whenever service: they will assist with any information/assistance you may need in and outside the hotel. The concierge team was absolutely fabulous: from booking tickets, to recommending restaurants, local stores, beauty salons, to writing addresses in Chinese for the taxi ride. Definitely enjoyed our stay. Make sure your room rate includes breakfast, which will probably the only meal you'll need for 4 days....

Reviews.Title: “Very cool”
Reviews.Author: daniel1008
Reviews.Content: Great hotel- you won't be disappointed. Great rooms, awesome restaurant and on top of a upper class shopping centre.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: go12345
Reviews.Content: Trendy, fun, and friendly hotel. Room was crisp and modern with a great view. Everyone was incredibly helpful. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: 2LITravellers
Reviews.Content: We loved the W Hong Kong. It was great going downstairs and walking straight into an upscale mall and train station with direct connections to the airport and downtown Hong Kong. Our view of the harbor was beautiful and our room was sleek and trendy. The breakfast room and buffet were definitely our favorite EVER, and I would recommend this experience even if you don't stay at the W. The infinity pool on the roof disappearing into the surrounding city made for some neat pictures. The staff throughout the hotel go out of their way to add to the great experience, and as an SPG elite member, I felt well taken care of. My partner turned 50 while we were there, and the evening of his birthday we returned to our room to find it filled with sparkling tea lights, chocolate covered strawberries and cake compliments of the hotel. I honestly can't say enough good things about the W Hong Kong. It's a long way from New York, but we can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Best of Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Robert D
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here a few times and really enjoy this W. It is a very high end W and has a great design in the lobby and rooms. I have stayed at many W's and would definitely rank it at the top. The service is excellent and they truly take care of SPG elite members. I was upgraded to a Marvelous Suite once and it was truly amazing. The standard rooms are also great, with high end amenities like power drapes, a TV in the bathroom mirror, and amazing views. The beds are luxurious and so comfortable! The location is great as you are on top of the train station. It is so easy to get anywhere, including the airport. The mall also has many high end shops and great restaurants. The pool on the roof is really something to see. It is an incredible sight to see and is the best city hotel pool I have ever encountered.

Reviews.Title: “Top hotel in HK”
Reviews.Author: Ahmed N
Reviews.Content: The W Hong Kong is located in the new prime real estate area in HK. The Elements mall is connected to the hotel and is convenient with Pret a manger close by! :) Rooms are very comfortable, we took the spectacular view room but the view is not all that great. The views from the Peninsular hotel rooms are better. Make sure you stay over the weekend and go for the pool party on Sunday, good vibe / good music and good crowd. Service was good at this hotel and staff are accommodating..

Reviews.Title: “Great service, Great rooms, Okay location”
Reviews.Author: Mr_Luu
Reviews.Content: When you stay at a W Hotel you kind of know what to expect in terms of quality and experience. I stayed here for a week over the New Year holiday and will say that my stay here EXCEEDED all expectations. I got upgraded to a corner suite which was huge for me and a friend. The bed was comfortable and I slept like a rock every night. The amenities were awesome and all the cool little things they had in the room added to the "wow" factor. Lots of electric plugs, converters if you forgot yours at home, AV plugs for the TV and stereo, easy to use lighting controls as well as a panel for curtains and shades. The shower was amazing. Actually the whole bathroom was top notch with big mirrors, a separate bath, and privacy toilet. The staff was quite friendly from check-in to check-out. No complaints here. In terms of location, the mall downstairs is great for shopping and food. Access to MTR is right downstairs in the mall as well. Only downside is you have to take it every time you want to go somewhere or take a cab since you're in Kowloon and walking to TST is not easy.

Reviews.Title: “Best "new age" hotel in HGK”
Reviews.Author: rahul316
Reviews.Content: Of all the starwood hotels we've stayed at, The W hong kong has been the most impressive city hotel by far. Its new, chich and contemporary. We're a family of architects and couldn't help but be impressed by the whole vibe of the place. It was a family trip which included my 1 year old niece, the hotel was extremely helpful with the baby's food needs and were very courteous. The roof top pool is amazing with great views and the hotel bar is 1 of the popular hot spots of the town. The hotel itself is in a great location attached to elements mall and right next to kowloon station. Highly reccomend this one, its the only place I'll stay on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury experience. Loved it.”
Reviews.Author: RhiemmieYum
Reviews.Content: I stayed there with my Mom for two nights last summer, and we had a wonderful experience. We actually live in Shenzhen - the great city immediately to the north of Hong Kong - but I was leaving for Taipei, so I HAD to stay in Hong Kong before I could go back to mainland after Taiwan, and I didn't book the hotel until 20 days beforehand - well, sorry that's another story. My point is therefore W Hotel was kinda pricy to me (compared to many other non-branded upper upscale hotels in HKG), but it was worth a visit to the leading boutique hotel and the adjacent Elements Mall. $$$$$ was well-spent. The location is great. The hotel is right above the Kowloon Train Station, and it's only 20-30 minutes train (subway) ride from the airport if my memory is correct. Based on my experience, the train still ran at 9:40PM and 5AM. Also, I flew Cathay Pacific to Taipei and got checked in right at the train station, so I didn't have to carry my checked bags to go on the train- I liked it so much. It's connected to the Elements Mall, and I personally liked it better than the Harbor City because it was newer and far less crowded. I had no trouble finding things I wanted that I would be able to get at the Harbor City. Front desk staff spoke fluent English and okay Mandarin. Hotel staff were nice and always greeted us with smiles, especially service people at breakfast buffet. W Hong Kong truly met its service level and my expectations. On the first night, we chcked in late and were lucky to get upgraded to a harbor view double room for two nights. Beds were really comfortable, and I absolutely loved the compartmentalized bathroom. I had never used Bliss before, but in-room Bliss body/skin-care products totally turned me into a loyal Bliss customer now. Use of technology and decor were very advanced and artsy, but not too overwhelming. Their housekeeping did a good job, too. It has happened to me many times before that your room didn't get fully cleaned if your stay is longer, but everything looked nice and clean again like a new guestroom after housekeepers came in on our second day. I also used their infinity pool. You'll have to try it, if it's your first stay at the W Hong Kong. It was just so good to see all the skyscrapers nearby in your bathing suits on that fancy rooftop. Although I could smell the chemicals, my hair was fine after swimming in the pool. I heared the spa is really good too. Breakfast was good but not impressive, basic Western style. Don't remember if it was complimentary. If I do have to pay next time, I probably won't have it. (228HKD or something). Personally, I'd just prefer to go to some yum dim sum at other cheap places. Come on, you're in Hong Kong. BTW, passed by W Barcelona last week, and it looked so gorgeous - even better than this one. Regret not having statyed there. I'm kinda a W fan now. - 距离香港国际机场搭机场快线很方便。早上5点多和晚上10点左右都还有车。还可直接在九龙火车站就办理手续。 很喜欢圆方，比海港城人少，逛得舒服。东西很全也很高端，也可丰简由君。 海景房很宽敞，浴室很棒。Bliss的产品很舒服。游泳池值得一去。早餐一般，如果要自掏腰包，不划算。 很喜欢这间W, 以后有机会还会去。

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel ever...!”
Reviews.Author: MiyagiMan
Reviews.Content: Being a W and in Asia, I expected a small but well designed room. Well, it was well designed, but also very spacious - and that was just the beginning. Great service and staff, perfect location in the city, connected to public transportation and on top of a fantastic shopping mall (Elements), to/from airport couldn't be easier on the connected Airport Express, killer gym, and the pool. Yes, the roof - too cool. 76th floor with infinity pool and jacuzzi overlooking the city. Too cool. Love it.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel in the heart of Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: gsk2007
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at many different hotels in Hong Kong, I dare to say that W Hong Kong is by far the best hotel I have stayed in the territory over the last five years. Other 5-star hotels will find it difficult to match up to the high service standards offered by them! This high service standard is maintained consistently across all departments, right from the moment you enter the hotel to the very moment you check-out. The concierge staff who greeted me was warm and cheerful. With a very good command of English, he directed me to the check-in counter at Level 6. Upon reaching the front desk, I was greeted by Francis, who processed my check-in efficiently. He also made some small chats with me and I really like his friendliness and enthusiasm. I was initially a bit worried whether or not I would get a room at 8am but the early check-in request was granted and the whole check-in process was a breeze! I was up in my room within minutes! The luggage also came promptly and I was ready to start my day in the Pearl of the Orient! The Cool Corner room was very spacious and came with full amenities, including their signature Bliss toiletries. In particular, I love the ensuite bathroom as it came with a magnificent view of Victoria Harbour. The bed was very comfortable to sleep on and the flat-screen TV came with numerous entertainment options. The decor was very chic too and it gave a homely feeling at the same time. During the stay, I managed to go up to the rooftop pool on the 76th level for a few laps. The view of Victoria Harbour was brilliant. It's a place where guests shouldn't miss out on! Although I didn't use the gym, I did briefly stop by to take a look and was impressed by the equipment - latest and comprehensive! All in all, I had a terrific stay at W Hong Kong and I'm looking forward to many more stays at this outstanding hotel located in the heart of Hong Kong. A tip for all guests who have intention to stay at W Hong Kong - take the Airport Express and alight at Kowloon station. Upon arrival at the station, there are clear signages which lead you to the hotel. The hotel is just a mere 5-min walk from the station! :)

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but not my style”
Reviews.Author: nessjoy4
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the W in Taipei, which I absolutely LOVED, so perhaps my expectations were a bit high when we went to Hong Kong. The hotel is typical W style, but dark and a bit dreary for my liking. Every surface in the room is a shade of dark gray, which made me feel a little depressed in all honesty. The bathroom counter top was concrete, I think, and had two planks that jetted out into the room with sharp edges/corners and was quite dangerous for our (18mo old) son, who nearly knocked his head/face on them about 50 times - I had to watch him like a hawk! (Yes, I realize that W is not reknown for being child-friendly, but nonetheless...) On the positive side, the beds/pillows were incredibly comfortable, the tub was nice and deep, and my favorite random feature of the room was back lighting behind the toilet paper roll which was a perfect night light - so if you get up to go to the bathroom, you are not fumbing in the dark. The pool on the roof was cool, but it dampens the "top of the world" feeling when the building next door soars another 50 storeys or so higher than where you are. The staff were all very friendly and the location was ideal for us - the attached mall and train station straight to the airport (and the fact that you can check your bags right there!) couldn't have worked out better. We decided to have breakfast at one of the many amazing bakeries in the mall instead of at the hotel and it was great. Our toddler also loved the view from our room and was completely enamored with watching the boats and commenting on the water. Overall, we had a very pleasant stay, even if it lacked the WOW factor we experienced in Taipei.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: g00fba11
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located, although if you take the MTR or the Airport Express, the signs to the hotel are kind of confusing. Once you figured it out, it's great....check in at the train directly below the hotel mall. The rooms are typical W...spacious and clean. The view from the hotel is also very good. The staff is friendly and helpful. The pool is on the 73rd (I think...my memory is hazy), from where you can appreciate the Ritz Carlton/IFC's 110+ story building. Breakfast and lunch buffets have very good selection. Pleasant overall.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: GerardKoh
Reviews.Content: This is an amazing hotel. W is conveniently located next to Elements mall and a MTR, making travelling to and fro a breeze. It's trendy and chic interior decor assails your senses from the moment you step in to the lobby. The staff are all very friendly and helpful, offering suggestions and alternatives to your every need. Special mention to David, Klien and Sammi from the reception and Kelvin from Woobar. They were exceptional and made the trip very special. The food at the hotel restaurant was surprisingly good. The cantonese restaurant in the lobby has an amazing dish, the lychee chicken. An absolute must try! We will definitely be back again and everyone should try this incredible hotel at least once.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but expensive”
Reviews.Author: RobertoDaniel_12
Reviews.Content: Great hotel but expensive the average price of other hotels in hong kong, but no breakfast included. Perfect room, very nice swimming pool at the 72nd floor! Buffet restaurant excellent, but very expensive!

Reviews.Title: “Funky luxury with heavenly spa”
Reviews.Author: Claire S
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 5 nights and the rooms are excellent - really well thought out design and very comfortable. The pool and spa are brilliant. Bliss Spa deserves a mention all of its own - what a stylish and relaxing experience and the products (in your room) are great. Huge selection of food in the 'kitchen' restaurant - a great concept.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Pool”
Reviews.Author: DEK649
Reviews.Content: Very trendy hotel with friendly and helpful staff (most hotel staff in Hong Kong are though). We had a harbor view room which was spacious, comfortable and well appointed. The bed and linen were amazingly comfortable. Very centrally located to the MTR and shopping, great location. Best part of the hotel though was without a doubt the 76th floor. Spectacular pool with great views. The hot tub was unfortunately way too hot and could not be adjusted but we loved swimming under the stars till 10pm in the sweltering Hong Kong heat. Wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: GayleComo
Reviews.Content: WE recently stayed at the W Hotel over a period of 5 nights (2 different stays) i found this hotel to be exciting and innovative in their design and restaurants and bars. The food and buffet in the "Kitchen" area was amazing like nothing else I ache seen int eh world a great breakfast bar. Great room designs and very comfortable beds nd close tot eh MTR at Kowloon.

Reviews.Title: “One of the better hotels in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Bobng80
Reviews.Content: Just back from Hong Kong and I thought I should write a review on the good and bad of W Hong Kong from Pre-reservation to check-out. I would like to compliment Cyndee who have assisting me in some of the pre-request that I wanted. Although not all are granted, the service from her was excellence. However, the bad experience came from the arrival. I am totally disappointed with the concierge team. I came with my friend by taxi to W Hong Kong with 2 big luggages and upon arrival, none of the staff came to approach us or even help us in our luggage. That happen a few times when I returned back to hotel by taxi. That was the first impression of my visit. I drag the luggage up to the lobby at 6th floor and do the check in. Check-in staffs are reasonable good, young and trendy which match W style. They do communicate well in English. We went up to the room and it was what we expected, a clean, nice and trendy W room which I loved it. We got a welcome letter from the manager for SPG platinum member. After that I went back to the lobby to look for Cyndee. I have pre-arranged a cake for my friend's birthday and also arrange a surprise limousine back to the airport. I told Cyndee that I will pass a box of chocolate to be delivered with the cake at midnight and it was perfectly done. Good job, Cyndee. However, my surprise limousine was ruined by the concierge AGAIN. I fully paid for the limousine on the spot so that my friend wouldn't know about it and I mentioned to them that it was meant to be a surprise so I do not want the limousine service to be reflected in the room bill. But the concierge left a message in the room and also delivered a letter to the room. My friend saw it and even advice me to cancel as it is not necessary because airport express is just round the corner. At that point, I did want to cancel it cos is no longer a surprise. Word of advice: Never trust the concierge to do things. W Hong Kong location was good as is near to MTR and also next to Elements mall. The view was good. After coming back to the hotels, I decided to visit the steam room next to the gym. Door was automated using key card so only hotel guest can access. 3 mins after I step in, W staff came in. For one moment, I thought I was at Sheraton. An "uncle" who doesn't match W style approaches me. I told him I wanted to use the steam room and he asks rudely:" Are you the guest here?" I show him my key card. Why would he ask a question when the door required key cards to enter. Not only that, most of the lockers are locked when only 3 guests using the gym and steam room. Most of them are not stocked up too. No comments to Woo bar. Breakfast at the Kitchen was good but only 3 chefs attending and no one attending the crepe section. Staff at the pool was attentive too and approaches us when we were there. Finally is time for us to check out, the staff should have informed the concierge to assist us in either taxi or airport transfer but none was offered. In my case was airport transfer. I drag my luggage to the ground level and told them that I have the limousine service. Sam was kind and helpful to end the trip with W Hong Kong. Good Job, Sam. Overall summary: I will still give a very good grade for W Hong Kong in their locations, rooms, and services except for some of the department (eg: concierge and gym) which need lots of improvements.

Reviews.Title: “Marvelous”
Reviews.Author: Frequent T
Reviews.Content: Great location, easy access from airport by the airport express, just right on top of the Kowloon station of the Mass Transit Railway, quick and easy to reach different area in Hong Kong. Connected to one of the largest shopping mall, Elements, great for travelers with limited time of shopping. We stayed in the Marvelous suite, which is really marvelous, hip and chic deco, extremely spacious, bathroom is gorgeous.

Reviews.Title: “W Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sohailisd
Reviews.Content: One of the best places to stay in Hong Kong , Great Hotel with friendly and helpful staff

Reviews.Title: “A well rounded awesome place”
Reviews.Author: DandiOne
Reviews.Content: Excellent staff - attentive, always a step ahead of your needs. Breakfast - awesome with tons of choices. Freshest items. The room - smelt great, super clean. Spa - great massages with an awesome view of the ocean. Gym - 24 hours and facing the harbor

Reviews.Title: “Funky very Funky”
Reviews.Author: Busi Traveller X
Reviews.Content: Absolutely one of the best hotels I have stayed in. The photos don't do it justice. The staff bend over backwards to help. Any request is considered in fact while I was at the bar I was dared by the staff to come up with a request they couldn't deliver on. This is where the rock stars would stay I didn't see any but the car park was filled with Lamborghini, Ferrari and ever a Pagani Zonda. An amazing expirence I will not forget for a life time. Thanks for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: CarefulSlippery
Reviews.Content: Wow! You feel like entering a club when walking into this amazing hotel. While places like the Sheraton or Ritz Carlton are without doubt world class hotels, they can not beat the W when it comes to style and vibe. In addition to the convenient location above the Kowloon MTR station, the Elements shopping mall just underneath etc, the hotel itself is amazing. We happened to stay there when their new bar ("The Woobar') was officially launched as well as a photo exhibition of the famous music photographer Mick Rock being opened in the foyer (The exhibition will be open till September). All hotel guests were invited to the opening party in the evening which included free champagne, cocktails and canapes. The pool on the rooftop is spectacular, featuring one of the best views over HK. The brunch buffet that the hotel offers is not cheap (~40$US) but it is really worth the money with a huge choice of freshly prepared food, including excellent sushi, a wide range of authetic thai food, fresh praws and lobster, salads and a huge selection of delicious desserts. If staying for a few days I can definitely recommend trying it out!

Reviews.Title: “Great attentive staff. Aware of personal service”
Reviews.Author: Emma A
Reviews.Content: Great spot. Eclatic decor in hallways Well thought out rooms Plenty of gadgets Relaxing Great eating and pool on the roof

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hong Kong choice”
Reviews.Author: Alena&Steve
Reviews.Content: Comfortable , modern rooms. Awesome rooftop 25m lap pool. Gym is fantastic with great views over the harbour. Staff are super friendly. Location is great , very convenient and all rooms look to have great views over the harbour. Breakfast buffet was superb. If I had to look for a downside the two stage lifts to get the rooms and the only 2 lifts servicing the top floors was a bit slow but in all this is a fantastic hotel.

Reviews.Title: “ANOTHER FANTASTIC SPG PROPERTY”
Reviews.Author: thesmdm
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in June 2012. Have stayed here before. The hotel has an excellent location situated above the Kowloon MTR station and part of the Elements shopping mall which has just about everything. The beds are excellent and offer such an excellent opportunity for a great sleep. Being above the Airport Express station i went and checked my bag in and got my boarding pass, then returned to my room watched a movie and worked on my laptop until late in the day before jumping on the airport express only about 3 minutes away. Fantastic stay

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fabulous!!”
Reviews.Author: qb76
Reviews.Content: Writing this review after staying there for 2 consecutive times. In addition, on both occasions, it was simply great. Chic, stylish & very voguish. Being a property of MTR management, it sits above on the Kowloon MTR station. A mall (Elements) is also attached to the hotel and carries almost everything (Cinema, Organic Super market 360, ice rink, restaurants etc.) Therefore, from convenience perspective, it is an ideal location. A family of 4 (2 adults/2kids) can easily stay in a FABULOUS (this is how they define their room) twin bedroom. Breakfast was average & pricey therefore i'd recommend you explore options in the mall too. Pool, which is on the 72nd floor, has some breathtaking views of HK Island. There is a free shuttle service from hotel that goes to Sheraton on Nathan road. Issue is, it only accommodates 5 ppl at a time. I never used to stay in Kowloon side but W has become my top favorite in HK... Will recommend to everyone....

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ccandyy
Reviews.Content: Always love the W. This one is very convenient as you can get there from the airport on the Airport Express and get off at Kowloon station (takes about 20 mins only). The rooms are lovely and the views of the harbour are nice (on a clear day). Great location for shopping and lots of great restaurants. Love the Bliss toiletries they use. Always stay here whenever I can in HK.

Reviews.Title: “Unparallel”
Reviews.Author: SriramKrishnan
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a couple of times before. The devil is in the details..and this hotel has it all. Ooh, and a top floor hot Jacuzzi ;)

Reviews.Title: “Funky First Class”
Reviews.Author: Tbird2631
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fabulous if you like trendy, funky sleek style, which this property is in spades. It has great service, friendly staff and a mall that is attached to the hotel full of high end stores. I really enjoyed the experience as the rooms were large and comfortable. If you are wanting to walk out and experience Hong Kong, this is not the place to stay as it is off the track a little and there are no stores close by other than the mall. However there is a huge plus with staying at this hotel. In the mall there is a train station below it which has an express line to the airport. At this train station you are able to check your luggage in like you would normally do at the airport as they have airline desks all lined up just like the airport counters where you can get your boarding pass and not worry about your luggage. This is especially great if you have a late flight and you have to check out of your hotel. There is always the problem about what to do with your luggage. Hotels will hold on to them for you if you want but this way you can check your luggage in which means you don't have to be at the airport so early giving you more time to shop!!!! We all know waiting at airports is not fun even if you have lounges to go to but I think this system should be adopted everywhere around the world. It is a fantastic service. My husband was with me and he was flying on to London whilst I was returning home to Australia and we had no problem getting our luggage when we arrived at our respective destinations. The only negative about this hotel is that wireless internet is not free and is charged daily. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “W stands for WOW!”
Reviews.Author: discerning1980
Reviews.Content: My first experience of the W group, what a brilliant one it was! We had a suite overlooking Kowloon Harbour - very industrial but edgy and interesting at the same time. This hotel just bowls you over - the decor, the scents, the pool - there has been so much thought and creativity that has gone into making this hotel a world class experience. Everyone, absolutely EVERYONE, was friendly and went of their way to be helpful. It's pricey, but completely worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Wow starts and ends with a W”
Reviews.Author: Saclin
Reviews.Content: Spent the weekend here during a short visit to HK and had an excellent time. Everything from the service at check-in through to room service was great. The rooms are beautiful and spacious, especially in comparison with other hotels in HK. Having had a chance to peek in at a suite I could tell that it really does get even better, not just a little couch and tv but a proper suite. Aside from all the great things about the hotel there's even a airport check-in counter in the same building.. The only downside might be that it's in Kowloon and not on the main drag but there's a free shuttle to get to the main part of Kowloon and a train that takes you to central HK. Definitely recommend staying here and will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience at W HK”
Reviews.Author: stevechatnyc
Reviews.Content: Their wow suite was amazing. My friends really enjoyed this special retreat for his birthday there. Their staff are attentive, nice restaurants and it is convenient for anything with a shopping mall next to it. Will definitely recommend other to stay there. If you go up to the rooftop spa and pool, that's totally memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal”
Reviews.Author: Justin R
Reviews.Content: My room exceeded every single one of my expectations in terms of it's unbelievable views of the harbor, exceptional room service, cleanliness, etc... The list goes on & on. Typically I'm the type of person who despite how much I love a hotel, the next time I travel to the same destination I'll try out a new hotel to see what's out there. Not the case for The W HK. I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service, beautiful Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ElenaKalina
Reviews.Content: Me and two of my friends stayed at W Hong Kong last week (2 rooms 6 nights), and I am absolutely blown away by the service level the employees are providing! Their whatever/whenever concept is not just words - it really works, we had asked for eggs at the pool bar at 8 AM when it is still closed and got it with a smile. We have requested for a dinner when Kitchen has already been closed and they extended just for us. We had to check in second time because we left for one night to Macao and came back and I had mistakenly booked another room type (without a bathtub) and the agent saw my disappointment at the time of check in and gave me an upgrade without me asking! There were many more small things employees did, you Management can be really proud of them! The way they look is absolutely cool and they treat guests in a very friendly yet respectful manner. The Hotel itself is absolutely fantastic, every single detail is well though of and very creative. Since I came back I keep telling all my friends and colleagues about W Hong kong and how amazing it was. Team are doing great job. I Hope to come back again and will definitely stay in other W hotels in other parts of the world.

Reviews.Title: “Two Thumbs Up”
Reviews.Author: Mei-Leng H
Reviews.Content: Love everything about W. It's trendy & hip. Staff are courteous & polite. Room is excellent & clean, with a great view and the bathroom is just so beautiful. The duvet bed is a WOW, soft & cozy.... My sister & I love the open concept. Waking up in the morning, still tucked in bed, you draw the curtain and the water view outside welcome you with a smile... So pleasant !!... Lots of shops & eateries are just down below & it is so convenient to catch the MRT to get across to HK side, just one station away. Everything is so convenient... Buffet breakfast is excellent... and kudos to one particular staff (sorry, forgot his name) who handled a very rude & demanding patron in a professional & polite, yet firm manner - incident happened on the morning of Saturday 4th Feb 2012.

Reviews.Title: “Yet another WOW”
Reviews.Author: nivla83
Reviews.Content: 2nd stay in W Hotel after W Taipei and the standard is still there, though the theme is slightly different. Beautiful rooms, great views from 36th floor. The pool and wet lounge is great too. The staffs services are excellent, kudos to them. Location is perfect as both MTR and Bus station transportation is just in the basement of the mall integrated with the hotel. Will definitely come back when visiting HK again!

Reviews.Title: “WoW”
Reviews.Author: MAMMelbourne
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last week for a six day girls' break. Location is ideal - right above Kowloon station which is the start and end of the airport train, so you don't have to juggle your luggage any further on the MTR with the crush of workers. In town airline check in at Kowloon station was a dream when leaving. The hotel is pretty new and the rooms, while uber modern, are designed for maximum comfort and amenity. The bathroom walls retract so you can be cleaning your teeth while watching TV, or they close completely for a totally private bathroom - inspired design. Every room has a great view, and the gym (cheekily called "SWEAT") has such a great view that my workout time seemed to halve. The bar can be a bit noisy; probably due to the bright young professionals taking advantage of the 2 for 1 after work drinks from 5 - 8 pm, but then, so did we! Sin Ying restaurant in the hotel was superb food, attentive service and good value (for the set menu lunch) and the hotel is attached to the "Elements" shopping centre which has a roof top of really good restaurants, so you aren't confined to the hotel. I would avoid the roof top pool bar if they are having a pool party (once a month on a Saturday, I think) unless you are looking for a noisy crush of young, hip flesh. If you are, then this is the place to be in Hong Kong once a month. Otherwise, it's well located for inbound airtravellers, the staff are UNBELIEVABLY friendly, the rooms and beds are incredibly comfortable and nothing seemed too much trouble. Get an Oyster card at the airport and jump on the MTR to everywhere. This will be my destination hotel on future Hong Kong trips.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding experience”
Reviews.Author: DDR333
Reviews.Content: I gave my 19 year old daughter the choice of 4 highly rated hotels in Hong Kong and she picked the W. I believe it was the "trendy" atmosphere that first attracted her to the W. We had the Hotel pick us up by the Audi which was great after a 17 hour flight. The moment we arrived we found everyone to be friendly, helpful, and most eager to accommodate. The breakfast buffet in the restaurant is not to be missed. From the front desk, concierge, and supervisors everyone made us feel very welcomed. The three night we stayed there were just not enough and we certainly look forward to our return. Amenities in the hotel room were also great. The workout room was quite spacious with great staff to assist if desired. Overall and outstandiny experience.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, Trendy & Efficient”
Reviews.Author: Pradeep_ramachandran
Reviews.Content: The W is a well located, stylish and trendy hotel with super efficient and warm staff. The location of the hotel minutes from Kowloon station makes it accessible to the Airport and the island city easy. The hotel occupies a portion of a an upmarket shopping and commercial multiplex with other hotels like the the Ritz Carlton nearby. The W stands out as a hotel with its high style quotient that is hard to miss with a combination trendy design, lighting effects, colors and music and above all a young and energetic front office staff who complement the hotel's youthful and stylish design. The rooms are large, technologically up-to-date and most of them offer a view of the harbor. The bathrooms are well appointed and the shower experience was flawless. The bed and bath linen were of a very high quality and well maintained. Adjacent to the main reception area is the chic 'Living Room' which unfolds into a lounge with its lighting effects by sundown. The 'Kitchen' offers a sumptuous buffet for breakfast , lunch and dinner alongside an interesting a la carte fare. The gym on the 73rd floor( I think) is basic but offers a breathtaking view of the harbor. The gym instructor was friendly and engaging. It was overall a wonderful experieence to stay at the W.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: zakami
Reviews.Content: While the facilities are in line with expectations of a W (which means trendy and luxurious), the service at this hotel is excellent. For example, on a recent stay, I forgot an item in room. I was able to coordinate with the hotel to have it dropped off at the Sheraton HK when I visited Hong Kong next the following week. It all worked like clockwork with just correspondence over email with no follow-up necessary. This is just one example of the hotel going above and beyond what is required of them.

Reviews.Title: “Getting there”
Reviews.Author: RSally
Reviews.Content: I was really disappointed at first when I arrived and saw the amount of construction that was going on right next to the hotel and to find out that due to this it was impossible to walk anywhere. I thought we picked the worst location in town! BUT, once you get to know the city a bit better, the location is actually great and it looks like all the development is moving. So hopefully in a year or two, this hotel will be a great place to stay. Luckily in HK and Kowloon you can walk almost the entire city without actually beeing outside (you can walk from one shopping mall to another without ever beeing outside). There are also plenty of bars and restaurants right behind the hotel (unfortunately all international). Hotel was good, no surprise it felt a bit empty. I was missing the 'hip' crowd in the bar. We had dinner at the hotel once, it was ok, pool bar is great - offers amazing views and so does the gym. Btw - rooms are very large!

Reviews.Title: “New Hong Kong Favourite”
Reviews.Author: zerogeewhiz
Reviews.Content: Until a few days ago, I would brook no argument that I should stay anywhere but Le Merdien Cyberport when in Hong Kong. But, I had to be in the thick of things for a flying business visit of just two days and while the comparative serenity of Cyberport is great, I just couldn't afford the back and forth time-wasting I'm happy to do when here for fun. I'd previously looked at the W's hotel and thought that it was a bit too clever by half. Shamefaced, I must confess to you that it was I who was too clever by half and that this is one of the finest hotels in which I have stayed. The staff were a friendly bunch, always happy to help. It was nice to be offered an upgrade and I didn't get a frown when I said I couldn't have that room because it was on a smoking floor. I think that's what she said. Anyway, no problem, she said, and dug up another one for me, with a view of Victoria Harbour. The room is spacious, the bed gigantic, the view brilliant. The room is full of really clever touches, the bathroom is well designed and clean with very nice amenity packs laid out. The room was extremely soothing which was a bit of a surprise because if I had one criticism of the thorough check-in service, it was that the thumping music from the bar made it hard to hear. The W sits atop the Elements shopping mall which has a few very nice restaurants and is just a few minutes walk into Kowloon MTR. If you're arriving late at night - or early in the morning - it is very handily placed for the Airport Express train. The hotel staff go to great lengths to help you out with late check-out and offers of showers in the gym if you can't be in the room. The epic breakfast is something to behold. It's a brilliant mix of whatever you might want or need. There's no point in me going through a list because it's too long. It more than matches Le Meridien's epic efforts. If you can, then do. There are many hotels that pretend to be cool in HK but end up being irritating or just not cool at all. The W is very cool but very good at looking after you when you've arrived late and just want to be somewhere quiet to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Feel young at the W”
Reviews.Author: NongFooTom
Reviews.Content: I've never stayed at a hotel that made me feel so young and fun as my recent stay at the W Hong Kong. So many formal, stuffy, scripted hotels in the world! This is the anti-stuffy hotel. I remember not one but two guys delivering my luggage to my room after check-in. One guy was Billy, wearing big thick rimmed glasses. Couldn't tell whether he loved his job, or was really well trained to demonstrate fun... regardless I really felt the W's cool atmosphere. The Kitchen (name of the buffet restaurant) is really cool too. I am a simple cereal eater for breakfast, but I found my favorite cereals already in a little mason jar. I grabbed an other bottle of milk and a mango juice with the same mason-jar lids. So cool. Only bummer was I was helping run a conference in one of the meeting rooms, and the doors to the meeting rooms are like city gates. Massive and hard to push open! You cannot quietly slip out of the room without heaving the doors open. Ok, I had to say something negative! But that's about it. I still prefer the InterContinental, but this one's a must stay if you need to see how cool and fun a hotel can be.

Reviews.Title: “Love the W effect”
Reviews.Author: MizzMin
Reviews.Content: Love the W - I stay here on regular basis when In HK and besides their mindblowing beds, the service and hotel concept in general is excellent. All the restaurants are good (breakfast scarily big!), the spa is amazing and their gym actually makes you want to work out. Another big bonus is that the airport express stops at Kowloon station which means it literally is just 5 minutes walk through the mall to the W.

Reviews.Title: “Very cool hotel”
Reviews.Author: Paul T
Reviews.Content: First time at the W hotel in Kowloon and thoroughly enjoyed it. Unbelievably convenient location above the MRT so easy to use the Airport express. You can also check your luggage in on the return journey at the MRT station which works perfectly if you still haven't found the way to pack light! Service was excellent. Good tips from the Concierge. Great rooftop pool, awesome breakfast bar and their W burgers are to die for. I would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service !!. very good otherwise”
Reviews.Author: prince80
Reviews.Content: I was on a business trip to HK for 5 days in April 4th week. I stayed at the W, Kowloon.
