While I have been around quite a few places and stayed at a fair share of hotels, the service of this place stands out. They are exceptional with their service. Location is very good, very accessible. One tip - their matress is tooo soft, though they turned it around for 2nd night onwards and that greatly helped. If anyone faces a similar issue, please ask them to turn the mattress around.

Reviews.Title: “Temple of cool high in the sky”
Reviews.Author: kofty
Reviews.Content: My second visit to the W Hotel in Hong Kong, because I enjoyed the first one so much. Location is excellent, on top of the Kowloon railway station, with direct access to the nice Elements shopping center. The room is super-cool, perfect for one person. Lighting arrangement can be a tad difficult to handle, but I got the hang of it. Toilet flush did not work at one time - but was fixed in no time, so no points deduction here. Concierge work is excellent, front desk, too. And even though everything is sooo koool at a W, it did not make me shiver, as some W experiences in the US have. I love the pool - 76th floor, view of the island, next to the huge ICC tower - another 40 floors higher - quite amazing view. Nice hot pool (like a monster Jacuzzi), decent food and coffee at the pool bar - I still think this is one of the best and stylish places to stay in Hong Kong. Will be back.

Reviews.Title: “simply superb, in every way.”
Reviews.Author: ShanghaiPandas
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay at the W HK. while not in the heart of Kowloon, it was still very well located, above the airport express station and a few stops to Central on the other side. It is above a high end shopping mall, with many food choices including a great supermarket. But enough about the location.. I loved the hotel. I am a platinum member so scored the upgrade to a corner suite which was fantastic (including my own Nespresso machine!), great view, perfect bed and wonderful amenities. The staff were really helpful and friendly and breakfast was great. The hotel has an "Alice in Wonderland" theme in the public areas so the decorations and artwork is wonderful. Do look out for the "Alice" touch. The pool on the top is also amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome! Exceeded expectations!”
Reviews.Author: royellis1973
Reviews.Content: W Hong Kong was the first stop on our honeymoon on the way to Southeast Asia. The hotel is part of a giant luxury/high end/world-class shopping mall on Kowloon. Fendi, Prada, DeBeers, Jimmy Choo etc. The ground floor of the mall connects the HK public transit MTR and the Airport Express which makes it an ideal location for convenient transit. From the airport, we caught the Airport Express and it was super easy. The train was safe, fast, quiet and extremely clean. It took 20 minutes. Upon arrival, the hotel staff was extremely friendly and welcoming. This level of service continued throughout our stay. The design decor and staff were all top-notch. As this was our first time to HK, the concierge was available and knowledgable with regard to points of interest in the city. Our room was on the 37th floor and had breathtaking views of the harbor. The room was impeccably clean complete with a huge luxury spa-like bathroom. The rain head shower was THE best showering experience we've ever had--AWESOME water pressure! The decor and furniture is modern/minimalist. The bed was super comfy. This was our first W Hotel experience and we've made it our plan to stay at a W in every city we visit. Hip music grooves can be heard in all the common areas. The designers put a lot of thought into every detail and it all works towards making a pleasurable and aesthetically pleasing experience. The W has a positive strong brand identity--on the same level as Apple. We feel it's definitely worth the premium and we would highly recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel, great staff”
Reviews.Author: JamieHerts
Reviews.Content: What an amazing trendy hotel and a great start to 3 weeks in China. The location couldn’t be better, 2 stops from the airport on the airport express and 1 stop from Central on HK island. We paid using SPG points so it’s hard to judge value. The welcome from all the employees was excellent and very friendly. They recognised we had come off a long flight and suggested we use the gym and sauna showers or pool as the room wasn’t ready, by the time we finished that they had a room ready. The design of the room was very stylish and spacious with the best bed we had in our whole trip. The buffet in the evening was fairly expensive but great quality as was the breakfast although at £18 each we only tried it once as I can’t honestly eat £18 worth of breakfast. There are a few café’s in the shopping centre for quick/cheap breakfast options and a number of bars and restaurants 5 – 10 minutes walk away. Taxi’s to the waterfront are not too expensive but it’s tricky to walk out of the development, the only exit I saw was near the cinema in the Red zone of the shopping centre.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel up to the W standard”
Reviews.Author: Nick W
Reviews.Content: I have been fortunate enough to stay in W Hotels in London and Bali and now Hong Kong was my third W experience. I love the W Hotel brand as they are still up there with 5* quality and service but it is delivered in a modern funky style. The service, attitude and quality was excellent and next time through HK I would be planning to stay with them again.

Reviews.Title: “Zero Complaints, Must be the best in HK”
Reviews.Author: gerardad
Reviews.Content: Lot's of great reviews here so not sure what I can add but: Been traveling to HK for 20 years and I think this was the first time I was there for vacation with wife and son. So many great hotels in HK but the W has all the details worked out. Service - no attitude, very helpful. At check out the line was a bit long for getting my paperwork, staff was subtle asked what room number and if I needed a car somewhere. Told me to go down to the car and would bring the paperwork. Smart service indeed. Hardware - The rooms are interesting with sliding doors and automatic shades, good size for HK and great rooms from everywhere. Gym had everything and wasn't jammed with people. Views from the gym and pool are indeed breathtaking. Value - yep, it's pricey, but it's worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: wallyQ
Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel. Convenient Location. Wonderful Room Design.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Time”
Reviews.Author: fantasticalg
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the W Hong Kong for 5 days. We flew in from Guam to catch Lady Gaga's concert. The room was very comfortable, service was excellent, food was delicious, and the Bliss Spa was oh so wonderful!! Patrick, the concierge was so helpful! Love the W Hong Kong!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best W anywhere!”
Reviews.Author: rchu
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at MANY W Hotels in the US and overseas, the W Hong Kong is by far the BEST! We had a King City view and then a King Harbor view, both room has a great layout, plenty of space and the Bathroom is excellent! The daily maid service is without question better then even a St Regis! There is a free spa area right by the Bliss spa, hot tub, dry and wet steam room, and most of the time its empty! Its not right at city center, but its a great location with the Elements mall right at the door step. Starbucks, grocery store, a bakery, restaurant and shops galore!!! Hotel staff can be uneven, we had extremely friendly to 'i have to do this job'......

Reviews.Title: “Amazing 5-Star Stay!”
Reviews.Author: aaucello
Reviews.Content: Last month, I stayed at W Hong Kong for one out of 3 nights in Kong Kong, located at 1 Austin Road West in Kowloon. After hearing many rave reviews about this property, including its convenient [walking] proximity to Kowloon Station, we decided to give it a go and spend our first night in Hong Kong here. A room at the W Hong Kong usually sells for somewhere in the $380 range, so having the ability to redeem SPG points definitely factored into our decision to stay here. We lucked out and were able to book a room for 12,000 Starpoints literally a day before the property had increased its redemption rate to 20,000 points. We arrived in Hong Kong a little before 5:00 am. The Airport Express MTR at HKG does not begin service until 5:54 am, so we headed straight to the Cathay Pacific First Class Arrival Lounge to freshen up and grab a bite to eat. Two one-way tickets from HGK Airport to Kowloon station cost us 140.00 HKG (~$18.50), and it was about a 20-minute ride. Upon arrival at Kowloon Station, getting to the hotel was a breeze. We followed the signs to the W Hong Kong by walking through the upscale Elements Shopping Mall, leading us to the entrance of the hotel. It was so nice to just be able to go straight from the airport to Kowloon Station,and not have to worry about getting a taxi to take us to the hotel, especially after a long flight. I was really impressed with my first glimpse the hotel; it totally embodied everything you’d expect from the W brand – upscale, trendy, artistic and unique. The lobby had a distinguished artistic flair in its design and decor. Since we obviously arrived at the hotel wayyyy before the standard check-in time, we had to wait about an hour for a room. In the meantime, we used the wait time and free lobby wifi to our advantage by answering emails and making phone calls back home. Though the W is not exactly walkable to the heart of Kowloon as tourists know it (Tsim Sha Tsui), there is a free shuttle that runs every 30 minutes to the top tourist destinations nearby (Star Ferry Terminal, Avenue of the Stars, Nathan and Canton Roads, etc.). On the plus side, the W is walkable the popular OZONE bar (Ritz Carlton) located on the 118th floor of the International Commerce Centre, the third tallest building in the world. Unfortunately, our unplanned jet-lag naps prevented us from checking it out (next time, for sure). We were given a room on the 29th floor, and it was absolutely fantastic. The room was bright and modern with great floor-to-ceiling windows. The bathroom featured a European open-floor plan, which I have grown to love in modern hotel design. After about 20 minutes in the room, the jet-lag creeped upon us, and without even knowing it, we slept a solid 7 hours. Whoops. Once we mustered the energy to get out of bed, we decided to take advantage of the free shuttle service to the Avenue of the Stars and to catch the Symphony of Lights. Do note that there isn’t a return shuttle service available. Once you are dropped off, you have to arrange your own transportation back to the hotel. Don’t fret – our taxi back only cost the equivalence of $5. We returned back to the hotel at around 10:30 pm, and saw that there was a festive cheese and wine tasting event going on at the lobby bar. Priced at $43 per person, we passed on the tasting and opted to just order a cocktail instead. The ambiance and service of the lobby bar was great and was a perfect way to wind down our first night in Hong Kong. Everything about our stay at the W in Hong Kong was pleasant, and I’d absolutely stay here again in a heart beat! Our beds were SO wonderful and comfortable! TV, desk, & lounge chair I loved the modern design and detail of the room. Mini-bar items available for purchase. We did get two complimentary water bottles though. High-tech shades and lights controls. Gorgeous open-floor plan bathroom. Fun, lighted vanity mirror. Bliss bath products For the complete review, including pictures, please visit my blog post at: http://boardingarea.com/blogs/justanotherpointstraveler/2012/05/08/hotel-review-w-hong-kong/

Reviews.Title: “Starting to slow down and age though still convenient and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Rm_1272
Reviews.Content: This used to be my favorite hotel in Hong Kong, but the consistent lack of upgrades (SPG Platinum) and trial stays at other properties (many newer now) in Kowloon and Hong Kong has me thinking twice about booking this hotel again, especially as the hotel moves into its 4th year of operations (signs of aging starting to show). The hotel staffs have always shown to be friendly and accommodating (except for suite upgrades), the beds/bedding have never disappointed, the convenience from the airport via the Airport Express link, and the adjacent Elements mall are all upsides that should not be ignored, but there are many options of newer hotels with superior views and more central locations to be considered. There are definitely W Hotels at other locales that have more of a hip feel.

Reviews.Title: “Improvements needed for the 5th star”
Reviews.Author: Anditz
Reviews.Content: - Hotel location: W Hong Kong is located in Kowloon area. Although it is far from the city center, it is well connected by train. You have direct access from the hotel to the train station and to Kowloon Shopping Mall with a wide range of first class shops for your entertainment. - First impression and Check in/check out process: The hotel opened in 2008 and it still has a new and modern feeling. It is located in a huge building and the lobby is on the sixth floor. This is quite unconfortable because the lifts are not very big and we always had to wait for them. On arrival, we also had to wait at the front desk because there was a long queue for the check in proccess. This area is too small for such a big hotel and there was really big crowd of people with guests waiting for checking in, guests going in/out of their rooms, staff members... Rooms: The room was a reasonable size and had floor to celling windows with front views over the new ICC tower. This is quite a pitty because it does not let you see Victoria Bay area. It had a king size bed with a Tivoli radio, and a full equiped bathroom with a separate toilet, a shower and a bath with a television. Internet Wireless System was not free in the room and you have to go downstais to the lobby for free internet connection. Facilities: There is a big swimming pool on the hotel roof with sun loungers and good views over the area. There is also a well equiped gym and a separate sauna and relaxing room for men and women. Restaurants: You can find freshly made juices and all sorts of bakery. However, service was very slow. It is a big hotel it gets crowded at peak times. Service: Staff members are young and some of them need more trainning. We saw a couple situations they did not manage efficiently. Conclusions: It is a hotel with a young and vibrant atmosphere, but it clearly needs to improve to be considered a 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cheng Z
Reviews.Content: Still one of the best hotel on my list. Nice people, nice room, nice experience.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in HK!”
Reviews.Author: cnc7
Reviews.Content: Rooms are spacious. Excellent service and the location is superb! Fun chic hotel. You can never go wrong with W.

Reviews.Title: “WOW, Wonderful and all the good W words for this hotel”
Reviews.Author: BareeK
Reviews.Content: This hotel cannot be beat in Hong Kong, it has a fantastic location (Airport Express you get out and walk to the lobby) its right under a great mall, fantastic cinema in it and the mall offers everything. the room is fantastic, spacious, big, the lighting is tremendous, by a press of a button you can control literally every light in the room as well as the curtains. the room view is fantastic. i would recommend it to anyone going to visit Hong Kong and my choice for any of my next trips in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, expensive hotel. Just expect to pay for all the amenities.”
Reviews.Author: EZIsrael
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful and amazing and luxurious. The amenities are costly, though. You would think they would be included in the hotel rate, but they are not.

Reviews.Title: “W ... wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Ricenchips
Reviews.Content: Great place ... nice guys ... and really good gym ... get a personal training session with Rabi ... he also does muay thai sessions ... great way to unwind after a tough day ... the pool is also good for lengths.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Luxury, and Service”
Reviews.Author: stellaNJ
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here 3x in 3 years and it is my hotel of choice there. The location can't be beat. You get off at Kowloon Station from the airport express, walk up and through an amazing high end mall and you are there. The Ritz is in the same mall. Once you walk in, you are welcomed and guided to the lobby. It is modern, fun and yet the rooms are relaxing. The fitness center, SWEAT is amazing. The pool WET is the highest in the world (outdoors). Bliss spa is there too. The food in the restaurants is good but there are better in Hong Kong. I eat there when i am too exhausted for going out. The beds, bathrooms etc, is all great. It must be one of the best W's in the world and last year was in the top 10 modern hotels list. This hotel is best for business or couples. I rarely see very young kids. It does have a club vibe, esp at night. Some of China's young, rich and beautiful are spotted here. I will absolutely stay there again. Service is great.

Reviews.Title: “This is a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Muppet50
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights on a business trip to hong kong. Easy to get to and from the airport by train. Well located in the elements mall with plenty of restaurants and shops located within the mall. The hotel just oozes energy and life. It's got a good gym, spa and a wonderful roof top swimming pool. Normally I struggle to get myself out of my room to the gym, but not here, you feel compelled to.. The staff are exceptionally good, (I stayed previously at the ritz carlton with a different experience), ate both nights in the restaurant, you can be seated in the thick of things or quietly in the back as is your preference, the waiter remembered me and my order from the previous night, pretty exceptional for me anyway!!. Rooms are just great, beds the most comfortable I have stayed in anywhere, and I was genuinely sorry to leave the room. Also the view of the bay is spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “Great location! Easy in and out of Central! Much less than Hong Kong Island Hotels!”
Reviews.Author: Royandrobinuk
Reviews.Content: I hadn’t stayed at this hotel in at least 3 years but it was as good as ever. I like Kowloon and the Elements Mall that sits adjacent to the hotel has everything I need- A Starbucks, A Pret A Manger, a Three Sixty grocery store etc. The train to and from the airport (only $90 HK and takes 15 minutes) is right downstairs at the MTR station. I was only a stop away from Central on the MTR. I paid at least 1/3 less than I would have paid for a comparable hotel on Hong Kong Island. The Bliss spa is first rate. The pool and gym are also impressive. The business and concierge services are excellent. The rooms are great. They are spotlessly clean. The bath products are from the Bliss Spa. The tea and coffee offered in the room are top-notch so unless you need a morning latte there is no need to venture outside your room. I will stay here next time I go to Hong Kong without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Way groovy W hotel”
Reviews.Author: HKGRegular
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a corner room with partial harbour view. Floor to celing windows with electric blinds. Mini bar selection not your standard boring fare - included CD, sun hat and umbrella, health bars. Big bath had tv and view of the harbour - not sure how much the people in the offices opposite could see through the shade curtain though! Really nice bathroom "condiments" included. Toilet separate - as it should be in a civilised world. Hotel facilities great too. Well equipped gym with inspirational view and helpful staff. Breakfast buffet fabulous. Juices and cereals presented in individual glass containers. Interesting view of containers and ships outside dining area. Wine tasting night (I think Tues?) is good value and interesting people watching. Location great for upmarket shopping and airport check in. Free shuttle every half our to the TST (in people mover so book with reception). Free WI-Fi in lobby which is handy. Helpful staff. Will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “It's good but can be better....”
Reviews.Author: xgrievex
Reviews.Content: I spent 5 nights in W Hong Kong last year November 2011. As my 1st experience in W Taipei was really good and awesome, i thought I'll be getting the same experience here in W Hong Kong. To my expectation, there's no 'automatic toilet' and the rooms are slightly smaller and old compared but if you talk about Hong Kong, the size of the spectacular room is alright and this hotel is better than my previous stay' in Panorama Hotel TST. Location wise, it's alright. Just next to the mall and getting to MTR is within 8minutes walk but there's nothing much to shop or walk around. I will not consider to stay due to location wise but definitely worth to give a try @ W Hotel. Oh yes, staff is very kind and helpful. A must to compliment.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for stopover”
Reviews.Author: LondonTex
Reviews.Content: Great hotel product, and the location is perfect for easy access to the airport. On a recent trip we wanted just to overnight in Hong Kong before connecting to another flight, so this was ideal for the 18 hours or so we had. It sits on top of the Kowloon Airport Express station above the shopping mall. You can be off the plane and in the hotel in half an hour. In the mall there are great shops and restaurants, with a very good and reasonable Cantonese place with dim sum and other dishes...much cheaper than the famed Lei Garden there. The website is intentionally vague on what you will see from the rooms. We opted for the spectacular room with harbour view. You do have an amazing view over to Hong Kong and out to the sea, but of course you have the skyscraper in front (which houses the Ritz higher up). This isn't a big deal and you have a huge view to take in around it. The room is gorgeously done. On the roof there's a pool and bar with jacuzzi overlooking the sea, Victoria Harbour, Kowloon and beyond. It was a bit breezy up there but definitely worth spending time to take it all in. Friendly, efficient service with check in.

Reviews.Title: “another great w experience”
Reviews.Author: nycsir
Reviews.Content: as always.... amazing attention to details.... phenomenal staff!!! great service. the suite was romantic, large and gorgeous. highly recomended

Reviews.Title: “Trendy but does not miss the impecable service!”
Reviews.Author: Joao V
Reviews.Content: My home in HK. Some trendy hotels tend to forget that service is also a key aspect in the industry, the W HK does this mix in a perfect way! Quite rare.

Reviews.Title: “Wow what a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: PippaBroome
Reviews.Content: This was our last stop on a 3 week tour of China. We saved the best for last. The staff at the hotel were so friendly and helpful. The rooms were immaculate with all the mod cons. We were very impressed and glad we paid for an upgrade. There was a TV in the bathroom, buttons to change the mood with lighting, buttons for curtains, great mini bar and items. The bed was one of the most comfy I have ever slept in and great linen. The view of the harbour was spectacular. The bar made great cocktails. Located on a mall and the subway so it was easy to shop and get everywhere in Hong Kong and great to catch the train to the airport. A perfect place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully Wow!!”
Reviews.Author: GlobalSwagger
Reviews.Content: Location: Great. Subway below hotel Design: Excellent. Very trendy Shopping: Super. Hotel is inside a mall Service: Top notch Breakfast: a perfect 10 Gym: Fabulous This hotel is THE trendiest in Hong Kong. And the location is perfect as the airport express train stops directly underneath it. Don't even hesitate. Just book it!

Reviews.Title: “Stunning hotel!”
Reviews.Author: andrecrespo
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the W on several business trips during 2011 and I can say it's the best hotel i've ever stayed. Loved the trendy high end rooms, nice size, great view and amazing beds. Totally enjoyed the 77th rooftop swimming pool and jacuzzi during my weekends. Spa facilities and treatments are to die for. W focus on delivering the most spectacular service to every guest 'Whatever, whenever'. After the experience in W, staying in another hotel it just a continuous disappointment!

Reviews.Title: “Great location & service”
Reviews.Author: dhl_atlanta
Reviews.Content: Two of us stayed at the W HK in January 2012 for 2 nights on a leisure trip (first time to HK) for 12K points/night . We couldn't have stumbled upon a better location, as it sits right above the Kowloon station, which is easy access from the Airport Express but also provides easy access onto Hong Kong island. It's also a cheaper cab ride from HK if you stay so late the MTR doesn't run. I will say that getting to/from the MTR station requires walking through a shopping mall, past nice restaurants, with your luggage - it's quite a long distance. As an SPG Platinum, I expected a bigger/nicer room upgrade, but none was available (some celebrities were apparently staying there at the same time and took all the suites). We did not have a view of Victoria Harbor, but we did have a view of the water where all the boats/ships docked (rather than the other side, looking toward Kowloon). The King room was large by Asian standards, with an interesting sliding mirror setup as doors to the bathroom. We did not use any of the pool or gym facilities, nor did we eat in any of the restaurants. Overall, it was a good stay - on par with all my other W experiences worldwide. Staff was gracious and spoke perfect English, which was helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Anna M
Reviews.Content: I've just returned from a week staying at The W Hong Kong in one of their Fantastic Suites. The whole experience was indeed, fantastic. I arrived after a very long flight so opted for the pick up from the airport in one of the hotels cars. I would reccommend this if you are arriving from a long flight and can't face the thought of finding your way by other means (although the hotel is also accessible on the airport express train line - exit Kowloon). The staff couldn't do enough to help - superb customer service in every respect. For example my flight back to the UK wasn't until 11pm, so I asked if i could access the gym showers etc after check out to freshen up before my flight. This was no problem whatsoever. The food is great, super cool bar, roof top pool, spa etc. The beds (as with all W/Westin hotels) are the most comfortable I've ever slept in. I just wish I had one at home! I can't fault this hotel in any way whatsoever - would love to spend another week there

Reviews.Title: “WoW”
Reviews.Author: Bumble8r
Reviews.Content: Standing tall above Elements luxury shopping centre and the Kowloon MTR station The W hotel really makes a statement. A well positioned hotel only a short taxi ride or one station from Hong Kong island on the MTR. The interior is a designers dream this funky fit out is waiting to be explored as to is the highest rooftop pool and spa in Hong Kong with the most incredible view. The only thing that I was not 100% happy with was the temperature of the spa, so hot we couldn't even get in (but let's face it is that is the biggest complaint I have, its pretty damn good) From the pick up at the airport until the moment we left everything was so smooth. This along with the BEST buffet breakfast I have had and incredible service from every one of their Talent left me trying to find another excuse to come back. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: dgvictor
Reviews.Content: W Hong Kong is one of my favourite hotels in the world. Great connection from Airport - station in Elements Shopping Centre (adjacent to hotel). Awesome customer service, nothing is a problem. Great restaurants in the hotel and in Elements. This hotel is good for everyone....children and adults. The buffet breakfast is a highlight....so fresh and such a wonderful variety. Strong reccomendation. Far enough away from the "tourist zone" to allow peace and quiet (if thats possible in HK)

Reviews.Title: “Dont think twice..stay there!”
Reviews.Author: DubaiBeenthere2012
Reviews.Content: Stayed there twice in March 2012..our first visit to HK. The hotel was difficult to fault in every respect. The only problem we had was an incorrect listing on our invoice which we noticed at checkout time. This was professionally resolved by Alex Beattie without fuss. There have been some negative reports on Trip Advisor regarding reception and check in. These complains are , in my opinion, unwarranted. Upon arrival at the hotel our cases were collected from the car which met us at the airport. We were greeted by an incredibly polite man who welcomed us and immediately escorted us to our rooms. We offered our credit card details,he described the hotels facilities and at this time our cases were delivered to the room. Always a smile, names remembered, fresh plentiful quality food....prompt room service... incredible beds...great location for Star Ferry, MTR, shopping mall next door !!

Reviews.Title: “Simply Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: Mariagarcia17
Reviews.Content: W is a chic hotel, with extremely good customer service to rival Ritz Carlton in Hong Kong. Every spot is picture-worthy you don't want to leave. It is also conveniently attached to the Elements shopping mall and the MTR. The crispy chicken at their chinese restaurant is a must try; and oh, don't miss taking a dip into their pool at the 76th floor - you literally feel like you're on top of the world. As for the room, it is big by Hong Kong standard. Overall, my family loved it!

Reviews.Title: “A W to top Many other Dubs!”
Reviews.Author: marcmcman
Reviews.Content: What can I say - full architectural, and contemporty ecclectic coolness, abundo. Prompt good staff, otherworldly breakfast room, where a royal figurehead could not be more decadent. The rooms are techno forward, with a focus on total serene comfort. Expected bathroom amenities, beautiful , varied, mirror etching, front up lighting and fully cohesive decore. Nothing comes up short here at this fave W.

Reviews.Title: “Gets better with each visit”
Reviews.Author: Moxo2020
Reviews.Content: Great as always. Fantastic breakfast buffet. The airport express stops in the hotel building and you get great views over the harbour and the city. The service is attentive and if you don't want to pay hotel prices for food, below is a mall with options.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: LKnSF
Reviews.Content: We were so happy to stay there 5 nights and then travel to Macao and to come back for a final evening. Being on top of the Elements mall provides you with all the services.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at W Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: al9249
Reviews.Content: Just returned from another visit to Hong Kong and once again had an excellent experience at the W. Great style and service are expected here, but what I have really come to appreciate are two things: 1) The location. After a long day / night in Central, it is nice to be able to get off the island and escape to the refuge of the W. The trains make it so easy to get around, and if you want to go into TST, it's a short cab or free hotel shuttle away. 2) The gym and spa. There is no better way to cure jet lag than a hard work out and nice soak in the jacuzzi with a view. I'm addicted.

Reviews.Title: “Best HK Staycation”
Reviews.Author: Jehan C
Reviews.Content: We had a great time "getting away" in HK by staying in HK! It was only for one night but it's amazing how much the right environment can transport you. In actuality we didn't do anything special other than stay in the room, go swimming twice (heated pool helped b/c the wind on the 76th floor is brutal in March) and borrowed DVD's from the concierge. That said, the harbor view was lovely and even though we weren't in the most expensive room in the hotel it was still amazing. Was very impressed that after I Facebooked a pic of our room, some mini-cupcakes were sent up with a little facebook logo on them. Nice out-of-the-blue touch. Would def reccomend to others looking for a getaway!

Reviews.Title: “Wow – Spectacular room and a Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kanguro10
Reviews.Content: We stayed a total of 3 nights (Sat 3, Sun 4 and Tue 6th March). We travelled to Macau on Monday 5th. As we were planning to arrive in HK very early in the morning, we called the Hotel the night before to advise them that we needed an early check-in at 6.15am. We originally booked the wonderful room, but it wasn’t ready then. However, we were offered the “spectacular room” with full ocean view for an extra charge. At that early time of the morning, no complaints, we were grateful we had a room. As you walked into the room (3803) we understood why it is called the “spectacular room” with full ocean view (photos), it has a fantastic luxurious feel, with unique W characteristics. Photos posted speak by themselves. You just don’t want to leave the room, except if you are going to the gym, sauna or pool of the hotel. I was impressed with the gym facilities. Indeed, it is a proper fitness centre which is located on the 73 level. It has fantastic views while you are doing cardio. You can even find a PT if you need some fitness assistance. After the gym, you relax in the sauna located in the same level. We managed to use the pool on Tuesday 6 March, the only sunny day during our stay in HK. The pool or Wet deck on level 76 is wow! This is the highest outdoor pool in HK. I would like to go back in summer just to use the pool and have some drinks at the bar. W Hotel is located next to the Element Shopping Mall Centre where you can find up-market shops, cafes, a beautiful bakery, a supermarket, and nice restaurants. Kowloon Train station is just a short 5’ stroll from the hotel where you can catch the airport express and do your early check-in before heading to the airport. The location of W hotel is great. Unfortunately, we didn’t see much of HK because of the weather conditions, but staying at the W made our HK trip an unforgettable one. Thank you Sammy Yiok from Welcome desk, for giving us a late check-out!

Reviews.Title: “Cool, fun hotel to spend time and super staff like Eric Li with endless enthusiasm”
Reviews.Author: Otperry
Reviews.Content: We arrived late and had a couple of problems with our room (shower wasn't draining) which were promptly fixed by the wonderful staff. We changed room, enjoyed the room service and had a very comfortable nights sleep. Special mention to Eric Li who went above an beyond the call of duty and walked our bags from the hotel all the way to the airport check in making us laugh all the way there. Brilliant.

Reviews.Title: “W Hotel Elements in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Cindy W
Reviews.Content: This is hotel with a perfect location. Situated above a huge shopping mall of Elements and airport express. You will find a great range of restaurants and coffee houses nearby. Only complaint of the mall is its too upmarket selling only expensive items. As for the Hotel, the check in took around 20 mins which as a bit long in my opinion. But the decor and mood is super cool and modern. Room with harbour views can see Hong kong island side. Great place to stay for business but perhaps not for families with young children. Tip: Great breakfast coffee next to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “My favourite HK hotel”
Reviews.Author: Academic47
Reviews.Content: I go to Hong Kong on business two or three times each year and have stayed in a number of hotels, both in Kowloon and on the island. The W has become my first choice when I have the opportunity to stay there. Although the location is not ideal for tourists in Kowloon, being right above the MTR and Airport Express stations make it ideal for getting around. More important, the level of service is consistently excellent. Staff are proactive in asking if they can help, from the moment I arrive, a service I don't need as a regular, but do appreciate. And I love the rooms, especially the corner rooms and suites, with their view over the harbour. The W style is refreshingly different from the regular corporate hotels I often stay in. I also enjoy the Bliss bath products. My work usually requires that I eat away from the hotel, so I can't comment on the restaurant food there, but it is worth commenting that having a location in a shopping mall makes it very convenient to go out for meals in the restaurants there, and there is also a supermarket to go for snack foods. Finally, the rooftop pool and outdoor hot tub have a spectacular view over the harbour. This is always my first stop when I arrive from Canada in the afternoon.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel but not my speed - hk view blocked by ICC”
Reviews.Author: trippyNYC
Reviews.Content: i don't voluntarily choose W chain because it's too "hip" for me. i prefer a hotel that doesnt have people milling around everywhere with clubby music playing all the time. this stay was booked by host company and has decent rates. hotel is pretty easy to get to via airport express/subway. check-in was very slow. very slow. i wasn't in a rush but i also noticed that the check-out line was very slow so i took note of that for my departure date. the staff apologized for making me wait so long, looking for a room. i requested a view of the HK skyline but i didn't realize that there'd be a huge ICC bldg in the middle of my view. the elevators to the guestrooms are very slow. sooo slow. and many times the key card doesn't work so i had to exit and catch a different lift that could read my key. the room itself is nice and the bed is comfy tho it has a lot of the annoying/cutesy W taglines labeled everywhere. some design elements of the room are pretty cool, like the sliding wall doors for the bathroom and the floating bathroom counter with the lamp post down the middle. the toilet has a blue deodorizer in it that makes it smell like an airplane bathroom. at night with the shades closed and lights off, there's still a ton of stuff glowing everywhere. the light control panel is glowing, so is the analog clock, and the big screen on the phone. it's a bit distracting for me. also you can hear music all night long. i couldn't figure out if it was from the downstairs lobby or from the hallway. i just remember wishing it would go away in my half-sleep state. the outdoor pool is a nice spot. it's 25m long and very toasty. it was a bit difficult doing laps because the floor is too dark and i couldn't tell where it ends and would get too close to the walls. it never got too crowded in the pool. up on the 76th fl it can get pretty windy/cold and i wondered why they didn't just make the pool indoors, but i was thinking that it can get pretty windy poolside on a beach resort too. the lockers here are pretty nice, with steam, sauna and jacuzzi with built-in chairs. i didn't find a swimsuit spinner. this is the first hotel gym where i've seen a heavy and speed bag (the speed bag was a little under-inflated and the heavy bag was on a stand so couldn't work around the bag--but there was boxing equipment!). they also provide wraps and there's a few gloves hanging around but i prefer not to use communal gloves. the fitness room is pretty spacious and has basic equipment. there's also a kinect360 video game which no one was ever using. the gym was not staffed all the time. if you have some spare time, stroll over to the ritz at to the top of the ICC for some great views of HK. so far, the views from ritz are not blocked.

Reviews.Title: “the rooms are wonderful - the rest just annoying....”
Reviews.Author: worktravellerglobal
Reviews.Content: Once you get to the rooms its all ok. The most comfortable bed you will sleep in. Great selection of toiletries. However, everything in the lead up and during you stay is just annoying. You que to check-in and the whole process takes forever. The buffet for dinner and breakfast while visually impressive, is cold and lacks flavor. Getting a wine at dinner impossible (not to mention the definition of "a glass" being a third anywhere else in the world) and trying to get the bill like waiting for your water to turn to wine.... the staff are just so slow. I have stayed at the W Hong Kong probably 8 times in the last 4 years - this will be my last.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay.....Again!”
Reviews.Author: CK L
Reviews.Content: Every time I stay here it is as good as the last!!! Never Dissapoints

Reviews.Title: “Best W hotel so far”
Reviews.Author: fleurdsoleil
Reviews.Content: Love the decor, modern and whimsical. Elevators and screens in the floor, were fun too! As everyone else has stated, this is not in the center of HK, but on the Kowloon side. We did a few day at the Intercontinental in the main part of HK, and then stayed at the W for a couple nights before we headed out of town, as its closer to the airport / just above train station, and was a perfect spot to check out the in's and out's of Kowloon. The pool here was probably the crowning jewel for me. I have never swam so high up, with such and amazing view -it was exhilarating! Yes, rooms are a nice size, and staff was very attentive and friendly. But I still fantasize about that pool!

Reviews.Title: “Smart and trendy if that's what you're comfortable with”
Reviews.Author: Traveller25351
Reviews.Content: Excellent access by fast train from Hong Kong airport direct to Kowloon station, W hotel had nice large rooms that are very modern and well kept. I felt it was trying too hard, finding the hotel and staff somewhat brash when I like my service relaxed and unobtrusive. Arriving at night, the entrance was dark and inconspicuous for the first time visitor. The lift floor lights up in bright flashing blue and white. Reminsicent of a night club. The room facilities were generally good, though I found equipment difficult to operate - even the cordless phone did not work intuitively. TV was a bit unresponsive to the remote, but did delivery one of the nicest full-bodied sounds I've heard in a hotel. Some reviewers have thought the bathroom did not close off for privacy - if they had the same room style that I had, they are failing to observe that the mirrored walls them selves slide as one large whole and do close off the area. I wanted easier equipment and better room lighting. Even the 'daytime' rating was too low for me. After the first breakfast, I skipped in favour of Pret or Fairwood, who are amongst the many already in the mall complex. Hotel breakfast was short on selection and lighting a bit too subdued to allow an easy choice . Nevertheless, the overall standards were good and, in season, the 76th floor pool must be wonderful. The hotel offers a half-hourly one-way free shuttle to Tsim Sha Tsui - very necessary at the moment on account of the large amount of build and road work. Returning by taxi is only about 3USD. It was quite impressive, but perhaps an older person like myself, there on business, prefers life more gently toned and relaxed. If you are young, like clubbing, into technology, you'l probably love this hotel. If, like me, you are not you'll probably think. "quite nice, but a bit jarring at times".

Reviews.Title: “a fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: marina88-60
Reviews.Content: We were unsure about this hotel, as I heard it was "a little away" from Kowloon, but how wrong they were! We disembarked off the plane,straight on a fast train,(HK100.00 per person, A$ 12.00 per person), the second stop was our hotel. The staff is is excellent, the rooms are great and quite spacious, with a great bathroom, the bed, so comfortable. The buffett breakfast is terrific, and the decor of the hotel, modern, quirky, but not over the top. By taxi,the hotel is approx, a HK 20.00(A$2.50) from everywhere, but a free shuttle bus is available, or the train, 1 stop to Hong Kong Island. The hotel is attached to a wonderful shopping centre,with plenty of resturants and coffee shops for either a quick snack or dinner. Both the pool and spa are located on the 76 floor, great view over the island. What made it even more special, upon check out, we walked into the train station (directly from the hotel), and checked in our luggage at the counter (all airlines represented), we than borded the train with just our hand luggage, and arrivedat HK airport within 20 minutes, with plenty of time and no luggage and no queuing. We are going to Istanbul next, and will definitely at the W there.

Reviews.Title: “Jewel in Kowloon”
Reviews.Author: drmark77
Reviews.Content: Perfectly situated in Kowloon, near public transport, adjacent to spectacular mall and shopping. Our room was extremely large, perfectly prepared and immaculate. Amenities cannot be overstated. In-room check in. The bar on the 7th floor had a spectacular view of Hong Kong and the service, drinks and free snacks were terrific. We had made arrangements for pickup at the cruise terminal and also for transport to the airport. The beautiful, new Mercedes vehicles and attentive drivers was a very nice experience. Every staff member could not have been more helpful and courteous. We would return to this property in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I have stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: Kelly T
Reviews.Content: I have traveled A LOT with work and this is one of the best hotels that I have stayed in. Things that are important to me: Check-in/out - After traveling for 26 hours my check in was very fast and super easy. Check out was just as pleasant. I ended up over packing one bag and the bell man (in the blink of an eye) appeared with a free W tote bag that was perfect for the rest of the things I had. Quality of room - This was (by far) the best room I have stayed in! The design was very interesting, extremely comfortable and the Bliss products were a nice bonus. Breakfast - The breakfast is amazing!! I only get to eat breakfast in any hotel that I stay at because I work long hours when I travel so I really like a breakfast with variety. This breakfast was so good that I actually woke up 30 minutes earlier so that I could have some extra time to make my selection and drink an extra cappuccino with a view of Hong Kong. Location - Although the hotel is connect to a mall with plenty of dinner and shopping choices the location was not that great. I had to take a cab to get to downtown Kowloon or to the ferry to go across to Hong Kong. The 10 minute cab ride was really cheap ($5 - $7) but not as nice as being able to walk. Overall the W is great and I will definitely be staying again on my next business trip.

Reviews.Title: “My Favorite W - Fabulous Experience - LOVED IT -”
Reviews.Author: petitebrioche
Reviews.Content: I have stayed with W in NY, DC and LA ... and pretty much thought I wasn't the W demographic. I was Wrong - W in HK is just fabulous. Staff Excellent - This is what makes the W! Rooms Superb Beds Just Wonderful Bathrooms Terrific Great location in Ko'W'loon On the Airport Express and Train Lines Great Shopping at Elements Perfect - 5 Minutes from Hong Kong Station / Central. Great Sunday Brunch 4 nights here wonderful - sad to leave and go home. Friends had a 40th Birthday in the Penthouse - Fabulous and you should see the tub in that bathroom - OMG! In room dining, champagne, friends... Perfect - thank you W!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel , wonderful Service- not the best location”
Reviews.Author: itfb
Reviews.Content: This W hotel was great, it is worth going there just to take in the breakfast Buffett. The service was great, rooms more than comfortable , how could you go wrong with the heavenly beds. The rooms also had controls at the bed which allowed you to turn off all the lights and lower the blackout shades directly from the bed. The internet was a good speed and there was a good selection of restaurants in the immediate area. If I have anything at all that I was not thrilled with it would be the location, the Harbor and harbor shops are not close enough to walk to but the hotel sits directly in the same complex as the Kowloon Station, this train takes you to DisneyLand the IFC mall where the Apple store is in Hong Kong ,directly to the airport which the ability to check in for most airlines and leave behind your bags directly in the hotel complex and if you know the subway system you can get to virtually. I previously stayed at the Sheraton Hong Kong with is within walking distance of hundreds of shops and restaurants, I enjoyed both locations you can't go wrongs with either but the W is outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: KGinDallas
Reviews.Content: I travel to Hong Kong about once a year and usually stay with family at The Arch (connected to the W through Elements the mall) but this time I was traveling with my husband and we stayed at the W Hotel. It was a great visit. The room was so much larger than I expected. So much bigger than the standard rooms in New York City. They put us in a great room that overlooked the bay. The service was great and attentive. Everyone speaks Chinese and English so you never feel lost. There is always a smiling face to greet you. SWEAT is near the top of the building and has a great view of the water. There is a trainer on premises from 7 a.m. until sometime at night (I work out in the morning so I did not pay attention to the evening hours). Bliss Spa is always a treat wherever you go although there are great spas everywhere in Hong Kong. I hear the dim sum is not so great but that is coming from people who know dim sum. If you are casual in your appreciation for the traditional breakfast, then you should enjoy it just fine at the W. Overall, I would stay at the W again in a heartbeat while in Hong Kong if I'm not crashing with my family. It was a debate between the Ritz (also in the same complex) and the W and for the price and the space, I am so happy that I chose the W. And the convenience of the location is something to consider. It is a two-minute walk through Elements to the MTR station with a connection directly to the airport. It costs virtually nothing to catch the train to the airport too. And since you need to check your baggage two hours before your flight, you can just hop down (or have a bellman guide you and your bags) to the station, buy a ticket for the train, and check into your airline with your bags. Then you can go up and grab a bite to eat or go to this great Japanese bakery right near the MTR entrance, and then go back later to take the train to the airport. The train leaves about every ten minutes and it only takes about 20-25 minutes to get to the airport. The W is simply clean, comfortable, warming, well priced, and convenient. What more could you ask for in Hong Kong?

Reviews.Title: “Great Brunch!”
Reviews.Author: boulderjim77
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night stopping through to fly back to London. The hotel and staff were very attentive and the property was amazing. The best W I have stayed at. I also happened to be checking out on a Sunday and I happened upon the brunch in the Kitchen restaurant. It was probably the best brunch I have had in some time. Lots of sushi and sashimi along with chinese dumplings and other dishes. Terrific deserts as well. I also took advantage of the airport express being in same building so easy transfer to and from airport. The elements mall is also a very high end.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and love the decor”
Reviews.Author: Joy_loves_traveling
Reviews.Content: Loved the location of this hotel as it was attached to an enormous mall, had access to the metro without even walking outside, and had a view of the shipping container harbor... While many may call it an eyesore, it was still a very nice view and I appreciated the blackout curtains. The bed was really comfortable and I loved the modern bathroom with a big luxurious tub (although I didn't use it) and great shower with multiple shower heads. I would highly recommend staying at the W. Another great feature of this location was that you could check in to your flight downstairs in the mall and then take the train straight to the airport. This was extremely convenient. We also took the metro straight to Disneyland (one switch to the Disneyland line). Only disappointment was that the pool was closed but I seemed to hit that timing at both hotels I stayed at on this trip. Must have just been the time of the year to maintain the pool.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best”
Reviews.Author: Danify
Reviews.Content: Just checked out of the W Hong Kong an hour ago and I am waiting for a flight at the airport so I said lets do this review now. First of all I could not believe how fast I got to and from airport on the express train. It literally stops at the W. 26 minutes from picking up my bag to the check in desk. Awesone and all for 90HKD. Very Chic very modern with a great atmosphere. Staff was super nice and did everything to make me feel welcome. Upgraded to a suite I was really pleased. Rooms were amazing , bed was the best I have slept in and the shower was fantastic.Workout room is good and the views spectacular Pool on the roof so very cool. I am going back in Jukly and will 100% stay at the W

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what you'd expect!”
Reviews.Author: Emil K
Reviews.Content: The W Hotel is an incredibly dependable and consistent brand. From the techno music pumped into the lobbies, the psychedelic light shows, cool bathrooms and bliss bath products, its the same whereever you go around the world. I am a starwood gold member and was upgraded to an ocean view when i checked in. The staff were young, energetic,and helpful, the room was completely modern, clean, and comfortable. I had the most wonderful massage on the 73rd floor Bliss spa (I used my Starwood points to pay for it.). The hotel is located in West Kowloon, a part of the International Commerce Center development, is in the heart of HK's financial district where you have access to all the shops and restaurants you'll ever need. You are also at the West Kowloon station of the MTR (subway) which is easy and convenient. Lastly, you can check in for most airlines right there for the In-town check in. (Meaning you can drop off your luggage right there!!) and take the airport train to the airport. A huge time savings. I will definitely stay here on future visits to HK.

Reviews.Title: “Modern style in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Miss_Sascha81
Reviews.Content: The Hotel had really nice modern design and location was perfect. Really easy to go anywhere with the train. But the things that make us disappointed when we were reach there the check in counter area so small, queue so long and the receptionist didnt say anything to me or even looked at me, only greet my husband (maybe because he is caucasian). So yeah thats really turn me down, cant imagine it happened in A class hotel like W. As Platinum SPG member normally they have separate check in counter and in this hotel is nothing. In the other Starwood hotels if you are Platinum member, you will get tons of benefits and they will treat you like a king but unfortunately not in W Hong Kong. We only got upgraded in corner junior suite (Cant remember what it called). Even when we were check out, we only drop in check out cause the queue (again) was so long. other than that nothing to complained. Restaurant was good, and pool was amazing. But we need to think twice if we want to back here or not after the experience that we got, really ruining the first day of our holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive hotel, great staff!”
Reviews.Author: bootowork
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the W Hong Kong at the beginning of our 2 week trek throughout Thailand (Hong Kong being our anchor city before heading to Thailand). Perfect way to start the trip! Tired and jet-lagged from 16 hour flight from NYC, we were worried we wouldn't be able to check-in since we arrived at the hotel at 6am...however, staff was more than accomodating and even gave us an upgrade to Harbourview as I am SPG member. Room was great...attention to detail was impressive. View of the harbour overlooking Hong Kong was beautiful...we kept the curtains open entire time (remote controlled curtains were a really nice touch!)--don't know difference in price for upgrading, but i'm sure the amazing view is worth it! Different room lighting settings were different and nice to have. Bathroom was spacious...large rain shower and bathtub with own tv was relaxing. Bed was very comfortable and made it hard to leave the room! Pool on 76th floor provided an impressive view of Hong Kong as well...and although it was only 60 something degrees out, we used outdoor jacuzzi which was really relaxing--despite pool area being pretty desolate, full staff was there to provide towels and asked if we wanted anything to eat/drink. We didn't try any of the restaurants, but had room service for breakfast and once for dinner since we had full days out in the beautiful city of Hong Kong...food was excellent. Everytime we saw lobby staff, they greeted us with a smile and congratulated us on our anniversary. Concierge was very knowledgable and helped us see key sights in the quick 2 day stay we had in the city. Although hotel is in Kowloon and not on main island, MTR and Airport Express is right below hotel and less than a 10 minute ride to Central station (metro is clean and extremely easy to follow). Overall would definitely recommend this hotel and would love to stay here again next time in Hong Kong!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible”
Reviews.Author: Roluke
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a convenient location. If you are coming from the airport, it is one of the airport express stops. The hotel is very modern. Check in was seemless. Our room was very nice. The bed was comfortable. It had a large flatscreen TV, ipod hookup, and electric blinds. The bathroom had nice amenities like, toothbrush and paste. The shower had excellent water pressure. You have to check out the pool on the 76th. floor. The views are spectacular. Plus, the common area is very inviting. Overall, a great hotel. You can't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Back again for the shower!!”
Reviews.Author: LeeCK
Reviews.Content: Back again after almost a year.. the shower was still fantastic.. thats what i like most about this hotel. Got a room on the higher floor this time, with water view... faces waterfront with tugboats... realized it is called the Fabulous Room... vs the ones which face the apartments, they are called Wonderful rooms? correct me if i am wrong... Price to move from Wonderful to Fabulous was HKD 200, which is approximately USD25 per night, before tax and service charge. Slept very well though.. the mattress was firm enough, pillow was a little flat but made it up by stacking 3 beneath my head. Used the gym during this stay, great equipment but not a very big one. 5 treadmills were all in use during peak hours... Xbox Kinect installed... good feature to have but wonder how many guests actually use it... state of art equipment by TechoGym,, great stuff! Given the space constraint at the reception area, 5 persons in the line makes the reception look crowded, saw staff speaking with those in line waiting to check out, if they have no incidental bills and room rates to settle, they can leave the hotel without seeing the cashier. Thats one way to cut the waiting time. So an improvement there. Despite all the great hardware, I somehow did not manage to identify any outstanding staff offering that warm and hospitable service.... no one went beyond that "hello" "good morning" and welcome back"... am i asking for too much? or are they jaded with all the Chinese visitors from Motherland?

Reviews.Title: “unique, refreshing”
Reviews.Author: bmsaigon
Reviews.Content: I stay at many hotels throughout the year but in HK I do enjoy the W as it is a bit unique. The rooms are modern and the upper floors have incredible views of the waterway, the bathrooms and ammenities are of top quality as is the bed and large television screens. The food is pricey so I generally avoid it, so depending on what part of HK you are doing business or exploring the W is well worth a stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Jochen K
Reviews.Content: Went to the W Hotel twice in the last year: great place to stay: - Not central but right above Kowloon Station - Suites are brilliant and normal rooms are great also - Views over the harbour are beautiful, however building in front (with the Ritz Carlton in it) cover a fair bit of it - Service is good - Pool is great (outdoors on top of the building)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hong Kong Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Robh9999
Reviews.Content: Came from the airport on the airport express which stops in the basement of the Elements Mall where the hotel is situated & it was an easy two minute walk through the mall to the hotel entrance. Checked in at the dedicated Starwood Platinum desk and was double upgraded to a Marvellous Suite - and it was indeed marvellous! A corner room with stunning views over Hong Kong harbour, and beautifully appointed. We particularly enjoyed sitting in the large bath watching the boats in the harbour, although my wife preferred the bathroom TV! Nice big tubes of the bliss toileteries were an added bonus. We ate in one of the many restaurants in the Elements Mall, but had a drink in the great bar in the W after dinner. We took the free hotel shuttle to Nathan Road and a taxi back was only a few dollars. Only a one night stay - we would like to have stayed longer. The rooftop pool was spectacular, next time we hope to have time to use it. In summary - I would stay here again. A great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel awful service in bar”
Reviews.Author: rrlondon500
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Very modern tad funky like most Ws. Only let down was service in bar. One of the ladies there was very very slow and rude. I ordered a beer and it took 33 mins to arrive even tho bar was pretty empty!!! I could see it on bar but she was too busy doing nothing. So watch out for lady with long wavy hair !!

Reviews.Title: “My favorite Hong Kong Hotel”
Reviews.Author: chipboy07
Reviews.Content: Having lived in HK for two years, the W Hotel is my favorite hotel in HK. As a point of comparison, I've stayed at the Sheraton in TST, JW Marriott in Admiralty, Marriott in TST, L Hotel in Causeway Bay, and Landmark Mandarin Oriental in Central. I love this hotel for several reasons: (1) First and foremost, the location is PRIME. It's conveniently located directly above the Airport Express station in Kowloon so it makes it even easier to get in and out of Hong Kong. On your check-out day, you can check out of the hotel and go downstairs to check in for your flight along with your luggage. This frees you up to travel around the city without worrying about carrying your luggage and having to get to the airport earlier to check your bags. (2) The rooftop pool is great (on a good day). It's on the 70-something floor and overlooks the harbor so the views are amazing. Unfortunately, there are often days where the fog rolls in and obstructs the view. I also wish there were hotter chicks consistently in the pool (but hey you can't win them all). (3) It's located within the Elements Mall, which I believe is the nicest in HK. It has every luxury goods shop that one can hope for (though admittedly these are everywhere in HK). The location makes it easy to drop off bags if you end up buying too much. (4) It's also a short cab ride (five minutes) or one stop on the MTR (train) into Central. I prefer the cab ride because I'm lazy (if you couldn't tell from my descriptions above). The hotel is right in front of the Western Tunnel, which is more expensive to travel through than the Cross Harbour tunnel but it saves you at least 15 minutes. (which is more expensive) I've never had a bad experience at this hotel. Food leaves something to be desired but that problem is easily overcome since you should really be out trying the HK restaurants anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: birdspotter13
Reviews.Content: The W in Hong Kong is so attractive, with a young, energetic staff that was very helpful. The easy access to trains to the airport, Disney, Big Buddha, etc. makes the location prime. While there is nothing outside within walking distance, the high-end mall beneath the hotel is beautifully designed with so many restaurants in all categories, and some that are destination restaurants in themselves. We loved staying there so much that we cancelled a stay in a hotel across town and extended our stay at the W. We had a great view of the outer harbor.

Reviews.Title: “Best in HK with best service!”
Reviews.Author: gbpatel76
Reviews.Content: This hotel blew us away! I travel a lot internationally and this is one of the best hotels I have ever stayed. The room was clean and nicely decorated. Loved the service. No issues whatsoever. I will definitely stay there again next October when I will be going to HK again.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: mswendy
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel, as what I expected from a W. Quite spacious room and bathroom for hong kong standard. A modern and stylish interior typical of W. Friendly and helpful staff. Tried the bliss spa, very impressed with the location on the top floor, and the facial was relaxing. However, the location is quite secluded, other than the element shopping mall adjoining the hotel. Taking MTR is a hassle. Not a good choice if you are a tourist coming to hong kong to shop. But I stayed there with a couple of my girlfriend for girls' trip, and we found the hotel excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Ben M
Reviews.Content: Absolutely one of my favorite hotels. The room we had was not huge and was on the "highway" side of the building but it was high enough that the view was not a problem. Very modern, clean furnishings. The bathroom is oddly open to the bedroom but with a sliding wall that closes for privacy. Very convenient to airport shuttle as it sits over the station.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Marcus W
Reviews.Content: Excellent location (both in relation to the airport and HK island), very friendly staff always ready to help out, nice gym (with a view) and a high quality breakfast you would expect from the W. And of course amazing views, especially if you get a water-facing room. All in all a top class hotel, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Not too Wow”
Reviews.Author: karim_sie
Reviews.Content: W Hong kong is a trendy, cool, great decorations hotel like others W hotel. Located in Kowloon by harbor , get upgraded to Room with harbor view but I wish I get my original room with city view, look over Kowloon which is much better view than harbor view. Great location, only few minutes walk after get of from Airport Express at Kowloon Station. The Staffs are very helpful, Free Shuttle bus to go around. shame about the pool, its closed, which is very disappointing, over all is a great stay, a bit expensive tough.

Reviews.Title: “If Carlsberg did hotels........”
Reviews.Author: Peter A
Reviews.Content: Oh my..... What a treat it is to stay in this hotel. Front to back, absolutely nothing other than an awesome place to hang out, eat and sleep. The staff get it, they are friendly, thoughtful, kind and helpful. I would recommend this hotel above any other I have stayed in throughout the world. My room on the 36th floor was awesome, the kitchen is awesome and the staff really make a difference. I have stayed at several W's but I think this has been my favourite. 10/10.

Reviews.Title: “Real Gem”
Reviews.Author: PA_Bank
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel ! Everything is perfect the rooms, the view, the amenities, the design , Food quality is also superb. The location is on the island across the city so you will have some extra costs for transportation but that's the only issue. Kowloom island has plenty to see and do. Great hotel in the great city for business and/or pleasure. Would love to return some day. Must try the buffet !!! enjoy SPG Platinum is recognized and upgraded.

Reviews.Title: “What stunning views!”
Reviews.Author: asoloist
Reviews.Content: The W chain is not ordinarily my cup of tea, but this one is pretty fantastic for the views, the quality of the rooms, and the gym. The service--though very efficient--can be a little inconsistent. Maybe it's would-be hipster vibe, the club music, or the crazy light display, but the reception desk can be a little snobby when you check in. (It's also a bit convoluted--you have to take the lift upstairs to check in.) My hotel room overlooked the western side of the Hong Kong harbour--containers and ships galore--which was very cool. The window is huge so there's a lot of natural light. The room is well-appointed with iPod docking station, a wide flat-screen tv, the usual W hotel CD and stereo, Bliss Spa products in the bathroom, great big beds, and a decent amount of space. The bathroom is also very large with a separate rainforest shower and huge tub (and a tv screen). It's also very quiet--no hallway noise, etc. The gym is excellent and has even better views of the harbour and Hong Kong island. There's a wide selection of weight machines, treadmills, elliptical machines, etc. Fresh towels and ice-cold water plus very good a/c. The rooftop pool is worthwhile, too, although it gets quite busy and somewhat scene-y on the weekends with people to-ing and fro-ng. I did not try any of the bars or restaurants as HK has an excellent variety for far less cost. The hotel is located in West Kowloon, right above a swank shopping mall and an MTR (subway) station so it's well positioned--especially from the airport (takes about 15 minutes on the express train). There are many decent restaurants and coffee shops in the mall plus a cinema that shows current films. If you can wrangle a discount or a deal, the average room cost is not bad for a HK hotel of this calibre.

Reviews.Title: “W - The only alphabet you need to know”
Reviews.Author: cccc9999
Reviews.Content: Spent our last summer holiday in Hong Kong and decided to check out the W Hong Kong after a great experience at the W Montreal. Arrived at HKIA at night, hopped up the airport express which brought us straight to Kowloon station. This station is connected to a mall and easy instructions lead us to the W Hong Kong. Can't help but to admire the cool lift which brought us to the lobby upstairs. The check in process was fast & friendly. The lift lobby on the guest floors looks just as interesting as the rest of the hotel, but wait - we've not even seen our room yet. Must have already taken at least 30-40 photos during the short trip from the entrance to the guest lift lobby. Of course, our camera would be really busy capturing images of the interesting deco once we get into our room. The room size is comfortable and larger that the usual Hong Kong sized rooms. A full size bed with other full sized furniture ensured comfort. No bumping on furniture or squeezing around the room. This is a proper sized room. The mattress was very comfortable & the pillows were just right. There were a few preset lighting modes which you could pick depending on the time of the day or on your mood. Large TV, iPod/iPhone dock, DVD/CD player - take your pick. You'll also find a CD with some cool music should you not have any cool music in your iPod/iPhone. It was really fantastic to have Adele on while enjoying the view from the comfort of the room. The bathroom is also a proper sized one, with a separate shower & bathtub. Toiletries were well stocked, large clean white towels, comfortable slippers that were well padded. Room was clean, sheets crisp, so far, very happy with the room. Then, there's the view. Looking out the large window, we got a great view of part of the harbour (Western part of HK Island) and a great view of the mighty ICC building. Although not a full harbour view, it was nevertheless a breathtaking sight. Funky, cool, sophisticated, understated, young, trendy, lively, colourful, friendly, awesome, filled with energy... some words I'd use to describe the W. In all my previous trips to HK, I've stayed at TST (Sheraton & Kowloon Hotel) so this time, we seemed a little further from the action. However, a quick shuttle ride on the complimentary W shuttle (Toyota Alphard) gets you in the heart of the action in less than 10 minutes. Don't forget, there's the Kowloon station right under the W, which gets you over to HK island in a flash. I'd say the location was more convenient that I thought. You can grab all you need at the mall below the W, with a large supermarket there where you can grab quick snacks, drinks, wine & more. It's HK, so shops open late. You'll be spoilt for choice with the number of restaurants there too, but since we were in HK, we were not going to just stay in the mall. Off to the streets of HK we went. I've always felt safe in HK and absolutely love the energy of the city. Went up to the pool in the morning, which is situated on the roof of this tall tower. Of course, the much taller ICC continues to be a majestic sight from the pool level, but from this level, the view of Kowloon & HK island was something else. There is a little store at the ground level of the W which sells cool Chinese art, sculptures and souvenirs. Guests are given a little discount and purchases are sent to the guests room directly. Fantastic items, fantastic service. The only problem I had was the fact that the holiday had to end. The weather was perfect all the days we were there except for the day when we were leaving - it rained. However, with the Kowloon station being just downstairs, we checked in our bags at the Airport Express flight check in and got our boarding passes there too. Hopped up the train and we were back at the airport. Rain? What rain? I would highly recommend the W Hong Kong to everyone. The W experience is really something else and I would stay at the W Hong Kong again without a doubt. Thank you W Hong Kong, the W experience rocks!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Service at W”
Reviews.Author: MelSeattle
Reviews.Content: I stay at this hotel 2x a year when I travel to China for business. It is truly one of the nicest hotels I have experienced. From the moment you walk in the door, every piece of service is top-notch. From the front desk, to room service, to the restaurant help, the level of customer service is amazing. One of my favorite things about the W is their amazing breakfast selection - this amazing room filled with delicious options, from multiple fresh-squeezed juices in beautiful glass bottles to made-to-order omelettes, crazy great dim sum, you name it. If you like to jog, it's well placed, too, to take a run along the harbour. Lastly, gorgeous roof-top infinity pool! I highly recommend this hotel for a very enjoyable stay in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “W Hotel, What-a-fun Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dunnocolor
Reviews.Content: This is definitely a fun and forward thinking hotel. The décor and facility are modern; TV screen on elevator floors, wall looks like a book case on the hall way. I like how they play with the words, whatever, whenever. They even have condom and lubricant at the minibur just in case you get lucky ☺. It’s definitely a hip hotel. I feel definitely younger the moment I stepped into this hotel. The room is large overlooking a harbour. It has modern touch with grey/monochrome colour scheme. The blinds are motored. The lighting has different settings for day, light, and sleep. The bathroom in the corner is basically a section divided by moving walls. If you open the walls, the bathroom becomes a part of your room. Nice rain showers, double sink, and deep soaker tub. The soaps/shampoo/lotions are from a spa in New York. They are really nice. There is also a drawer size safe. The wireless is not free in the room, but it’s free for a couple hours in the lobby. I didn’t have breakfast there, but the dinner buffet was really good. They have all exotice seafood from crab to oyster. The gym is a nice size with decent equipment. It has almost everything you need. I has a WII sport too. The changing room is Wow… beautiful. It has steam room, jacuzzi, sauna, nice multi head shower rooms. It’s very nice to relax after the gym. I actually booked this hotel since I want to check out the swimming pool. Unfortunately it was under renovation when I was there. Location of this hotel is good, but it's not perfect. It’s right at the Kowloon station. You will only need to walk for 5 minutes from the train station to the hotel. It's nice if you stay here to transit for a couple of days, but if you stay here for a vacation/business it's not really practical. If you want to shop, you will need to take taxi/trains to the shopping area like Tsim Sha Tsui. There is mall attached to this hotel; which has high-end stores and some restaurants from Prêt A Manger to fine dining restaurants. I don’t see much of Hong Kong brands in this mall. Most of them are world luxury brands. All in all things Went Well at W… And Oh I got a birthday wish on my birthday from W Hong Kong. It’s definitely one of my favourite hotels now ☺.

Reviews.Title: “Where do you find real good service where people remember you and welcome. W Hong Kong does have that.”
Reviews.Author: Theo W
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the marvelous room for 5 days. We loved it. We love the decoration, the smell of the place. The lobby high tea set, the view, the amazing pool. Our healthy breakfast with berries and more. The most important thing is the team from martin and many others are ground floor to the reception on the 6th floor with Alex and many others to the floor where you actually stay. The experience makes the difference. Yes their is a lot of choices but in our opinion W hotel is amazing. A must try. In two days we stay in W Barcelona which is a must go too. Same experiences with pool and beach and same amazing people, decoration and views. Greetings Theo theo@onlinefashion.hk

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay”
Reviews.Author: fozzbear
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights at the end of our honeymoon and the hotel could not have been better. We opted to be collected from the airport by their limo service which is brilliant and sets the standard for the whole stay. Rooms are great with very high quality furnishings and perhaps the best nights sleep we've every had! The buffet breakfast was great with anything you can imagine on offer. Location maybe a slight let down for some but the hotel is connected to the Metro via Elements Mall, two-three minutes walk away. Could not fault anything and can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great decor, comfy rooms and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Therooster
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my family, which includes two kids aged 7 months and 3 years. The room was spacious enough to ensure we were all comfortable, and everything was of very high quality. The cot for the baby was excellent and the big bed was super comfortable. Amenities were good and everything was fairly functional (though perhaps they do tend to err more on the side of design rather than functionality, but that's ok). Staff were very friendly, helpful and professional. They are obviously well trained and are keen to help customers. Food was fairly good. The only thing to consider carefully is the location.
