It's kind of in the middle of nowhere but does enjoy very good views of the harbour on one side (though partly obscured by the massive ICC tower) and is close to a shopping mall if that's what you're interested in. Everything is within quick reach by taxi though, and the hotel cars and drivers are also outstanding and affordable. Another odd arrangement is the reception... when you arrive you have to catch a lift to the 6th floor and get out. That's where reception is. Then you catch another lift to the room floors. A bit tiring after a while, especially when travelling with kids (though I'm being picky here). There was wireless internet but it wasn't cheap. Finally, you must check out the pool at the top. Fantastic spot with a stunning view! The pool was closed for a few weeks until January 20120 but is not open again. Overall, we had a great stay here, enjoyed the cool design and decor, as well as the great service and hospitality, and would probably recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy, luxurious and convenient”
Reviews.Author: SNT113
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as a couple and found the hotel very hip and trendy with modern furnishings and a great view of the harbour.The hotel is on top of the Elements shopping centre which is an excellent shopping mall (we spent a whole day just hanging out at the Elements). Buffet breakfast is excellent and what you'd expect from a W Hotel. Bliss toiletries were also a great bonus. The hotel is not right near Central or the other main tourist areas but these are only a short metro ride away. The metro station is right underneath the Elements mall and you can also catch the airport express direct from there which we found very convenient. If I was after another luxury hotel experience in Hong Kong I would definitely consider coming back here.

Reviews.Title: “Best in town”
Reviews.Author: B L
Reviews.Content: simply the best hotel in town. Best facilities, best services and best location. It's linked to the shopping mall "Element", which is one of the top shopping mall in HK. and the shopping mall is linked to the MTR which is the most convenient transport in HK. Love everything here. will surely wanna come back

Reviews.Title: “An experience not be forgotten”
Reviews.Author: LiveOn_2010
Reviews.Content: I with my small 10 months old daughter & wife went to W hotel, hong kong on the Christmas Eve for 3 nights. The details of the hotel Location: It is very near to the Hong Kong Ferry terminal. Also below the Hotel there is a metro station which is easily accessible all around the Hong Kong. Even the Metro station have all the airlines Check In counters which is the Excellent part of it. The ticket to Airport costs only HKD 18 per person. It also have a big Mall Elements below the hotel which have all the big brands. Also you can go to the Club & bar at the 118th Floor of Ritz Carlton hotel which is again can be accessed from, inside the hotel. The Location is one of the best as it is easily accessible through metro & road. Room: We took a Fantastic Suite room. The room size is bit small but the view from the room was simply too good. It was Full Harbor View room. The best thing which i liked was the accessories tray in the room which was equipped with everything, even the condoms also..:p The Bathroom is quite nice with two basins. The bed was quite comfortable & cosy. You can open the curtains from your bedside only. They are electronic one. They also put the baby cot in our room for the little baby. Also they put a welcome gift for my baby. All together it was a V good room. Breakfast: We tried the Breakfast area on our last day & mind you it was an awesome setting. Service was v. good & you will find all the options in one of the best setting you had anytime saw. Staff was quick to respond. You have a free wi fi connection at the Lobby area which was again a Good part. If it wuld have been free in the rooms as well it would have been awesome. Concierge: The Concierge is bang on target knowing there job very well. Altogether a must must recommendation to this hotel. Just close your eyes & head for this hotel if you are going to Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Great alternative to staying in Central”
Reviews.Author: nrexjp
Reviews.Content: The W Hotel in Hong Kong is located above Kowloon Station / Elements Mall; adjacent to the newly built ICC Tower. The hotel is 5 minutes away from Kowloon Station; which in turn is 5 minutes away from Hong Kong Station. It's a great alternative to staying in Central where comparable hotel rooms (Shangri-La, Grand Hyatt, Conrad, Four Seasons, Mandarin) are smaller, older and more expensive. If you want to be closer to TST (Tsim Sha Tsui - Kowloon's main shopping & entertainment district), you're better off staying at the Peninsula (expensive), Sheraton (moderate), Intercontinental (moderate) or the Marco Polo brand hotels (inexpensive). These hotels are within walking distance of TST / Star Ferry landing while you will need to take a cab from the W. The Elements Mall is great for business travelers who plan to stay only a few days and want to avoid touristy places like TST. It is a high end mall with lots of nice shops and restaurants. It also has a movie theater, supermarket and ice rink if you're looking for further diversion. Besides being close to Central, the next best thing about this hotel's location is its proximity to the airport. I've gotten off the plane and into my hotel room in less than 45 minutes. The rooms at the W are modern and sleek like most new W hotels around the world. It's comparable to the new W in Taipei if you are familiar with that property. Everything works well inside the room and everything is where you'd expect them to be. Most of all, it's clean. My favorite features are the rainfall showers, the extremely fast wireless broadband and the intelligent lighting. The floor to ceiling glass windows make the room look bigger and brighter; especially if you are lucky enough to get one of the rooms facing Hong Kong Harbor. I've stayed at this property at least 15 times in the past 3 years and the best rooms are corner rooms facing the harbor. You get windows on two sides of the room as well as a great view at night. Hotel amenities are good to great. The check-in procedure is usually smooth, but you maybe out of luck if you try to check in before 3pm. Since the ICC Tower was built, hotel traffic has increased and with all these Starwood Preferred Guests asking for late check out these days, you maybe asked to wait until after 3pm to check into your room. They'll usually buy you a drink at the lobby bar while you wait, but it's a minor hassle if you just flew in and are tired. The pool is fantastic for either exercise or lounging. It's the second highest pool I've ever swam in after the Ritz Carlton pool next door atop the ICC Tower (118th floor). The W pool is outdoors on the 76th floor which is usually fine as long as you avoid winters and typhoons. The hotel rents the pool deck out for parties and photo shoots so you could be swimming while there's a runway show going on - only in Hong Kong. The gym, located on the 73rd floor, is more than adequate for hotel guests on short stays. It has all the exercise machines you require as well as a great view. I've never eaten at the hotel restaurants since there are so many great places to eat inside Elements. I usually dine there or order room service which is good to very good. The lounge bar is always crowded at nights. The vibrant decor and hip music make it a great place to unwind after work or for a night cap after an evening out. The hotel staff is young, but surprisingly courteous. The W attracts a hip / trendy clientele so they hire staff to match. I've never had service issues at the hotel except maybe at the concierge. They weren't bad, maybe not as talented as those at other HK hotels such as the Four Seasons or the Ritz Carlton. The staff, in general, is accommodating and does try to make your stay as pleasant as possible. From a cost / performance perspective, you'd be hard pressed to find a better value. My tips for this hotel: (1) Ask for a corner room facing the harbor if possible (2) Specify early check-in if you plan to arrive before 3pm and want to use your room right way (3) You can find the cheapest rates on Starwood's website. You can find great deals if your dates are fixed and you pre-pay.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect stay in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: mmmotta
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just amazing. I recommend it for my young friends who are in Hong Kong for pleasure or business. The hotel is hip, design, hi-tech, and the bar by the reception rocks every night. The outdoor pool on the 74th floor was the hotel highlight for me, along with the uber modern train which takes us from the hotel to the airport in 25 minutes. I can forget to mention the super mall in the hotel complex... All big international brands in mega size stores.

Reviews.Title: “Wow & Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: starofjupiter
Reviews.Content: Stay 2 nights on Dec 24 and 25, 2011 before continuing our journey to Malaysia. Check in was smooth and courteous and the agent even escorted us to the elevator, this is REALLY PERSONABLE & A GREAT TOUCH! We were on 32nd floor with harbor view! The window is from ceiling to wall and has a space that one can sit. I sat there in the evening watching the sun set and my 2 and 6 years old daughters LOVED sitting there and watching the ship passing by at the front and the cars and buses driving passed on the street below. This keeps them amuse in the room. The room decor is of dark and light silver grey combination. Amazingly, I don't feel gloomy but feel relaxing! Separate walk in shower, bath tub with TV and toilet. The shape of the sink is elongated and with depth, I like the design because I can wash the baby bottles easily like the kitchen sink at home. Not sure why but sometimes, the floor outside the walk in shower flooded, guess didn't close the door properly?!? No need to hang Do Not Disturb Signage. Just remember to press the button outside the door that look like a open book with your room # there, the housekeeping personnel will not disturb you at all. Everyone that work here seemed to greet and smile at you all the time except maybe the gym room person, scowled at us all the time while we were there, as my daughters weren't behaving well there by trying out those equipment and I guess as parent, I am to be blamed for not supervising them STRICT enough or we should not have visited the gym with young kids since the gym looked like a play room to them except with giant equipment around. Now, wouldn't it be NICE if W can consider creating a room for younger kids to have fun, a mini indoor playground next to the gym so that parents can work out while watching through the glass to see their kids having fun in the other room?!? This is my Wish and hope the next time I visit again, this Wish can be REALIZED?!? Overall, as a family travel with younger kids, this hotel seems to FIT MY NEEDS PERFECTLY and to me, almost like Home Away from Home. The only downside is, PRICEY! But, what you pay is what you get! So, it is WORTH it!

Reviews.Title: “The hotel is a new, chic and convenient to airport via train system coonected to the hotel.”
Reviews.Author: cp313
Reviews.Content: All rooms are suites with full breakfast package. The atmosphere is typical to a W hotel, on a larger scale. Views of a commercial harbor add a contrast of real business HK is known for and the elegance this hotel offers. The rooftop pool and spa are beautiful with butterfly tile mossaic, large pool and spa with top service. Food is excellent in all the hotel restaurants. It's the only hotel of its type where you take in all that HK has to offer in a very cool, down to earth vib.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but too flashy for me”
Reviews.Author: Rhone_Man
Reviews.Content: Normally when I stay in Hong Kong on business I get a serviced flat, but as I was only in town for 3 days my office booked me into the W Hong Kong. The W has all the exemplary things you expect of an Asia hotel - beautifully clean, impeccable service, well appointed. I only had about four real issues with it. (1) Most annoying thing: There are only three elevators linking the entry area to the lobby. Thereafter you connect to a bank of six elevators to take everyone to their rooms, bars, restaurants, etc. Predictably enough, at "peak times" you have to queue to get into the bank of three to get up to lobby to access the second bank of elevators. Again, very annoying when you are tired at the end of a long day. (2) It is eye wateringly expensive. You get what you pay for (or, in my case, what your firm pays for), but Aye Caramba... (3) It is decked out an awful lot like a waiting room to a trendy nightclub. Music, lights, energy. Extremely bling. If that is your thing, then great. If you just want a quiet bed after a hard day at work, or are with a family, it may not be your thing. (4) You have to pay for wireless in your room. That always irritates me. Especially at those prices. You do get free WiFi in the "lobby" (use that word loosely) area.

Reviews.Title: “A modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: neetu76
Reviews.Content: It was my first visit to hongkong and me and husband stayed in this hotel for 4 nights.The hotel is in kowloon which is very well connected by the rail from the airport.The restaurant have a great choice of food and the rooms were very well decorated with a great view.

Reviews.Title: “Hip Hotel, Location So-So”
Reviews.Author: rafkam
Reviews.Content: There have been lines and lines written about how great the location of the W is: atop the swanky Elements Mall, and directly on the MTR and Airport Express stations. However, you feel isolated as the hotel is not within walking distance of anywhere (unless you fancy an uninspiring walk in through a mega construction site). And the MTR connection is only good for taking you into Central. Having said that, the W is a pretty new hotel, with great views of the harbour and a great party scene. The pool on the 76th floor is great, although we were unlucky to be in HK during the tail end of a typhoon... With regards to the rooms and service, as other people commented, you might as well be in Mexico City, London or Santiago, this is still your same W standard, for good or ill. As SPG Platinum, we got upgraded to a big corner room, which featured a nice bathtub with great views, and complete with its own TV. All type of gadgetry is also available, including iPhone docks, etc. Note that the hotel is flanked by the enormous XXX tower and an extremely tall apartment block, so even the highest floors will have their harbour views partially obstructed. Other than that, it's worth noting that there are always taxis outside, there is a very convenient supermarket in the mall for supplies (as breakfast has never been the strong point of any W), and that the restaurant on the ground floor has what seems like a great Sunday brunch dim-sum all you can eat deal, but it finishes really early (like 10 or 11am) so we missed it. Concierge is hit or miss, as in most hotels. On our previous trip to HK we randomly walked in to check out the hotel and asked the concierge for some tips in the area, and despite knowing we weren't guests, he gladly recommended and booked a few meals for us. This time, we got the classic automatic: "what type of food do you like?" questions and then got recommended some very obvious tourist spots. Budget allowing, would obviously stay at the Peninsula, or Mandarin Oriental, but hey, we were using our points so we can't really complain!

Reviews.Title: “Atmosphere +”
Reviews.Author: cathnedonhols
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights in early Jan 2012 in a Cool Corner Room while our son stayed in a Wonderful Room. Overall our experience was very good and on a scale of 1 to 10 we give it an 8. Positives first. Location is great being right on top of Kowloon Station which also has a direct airport link check-in. It is also attached to the Elements Shopping Centre which has plenty of designer boutiques which don’t get as crowded as Harbour City. There are also dozens of restaurants and cafes in Elements. W has two restaurants: Kitchen and Sing Yin. Kitchen is the main restaurant for breakfast and has a buffet for lunch and dinner. The breakfast buffet is definitely one of the best we have experienced anywhere - wide variety of both Asian and Western foods and they have new items each day. The Western food selection at breakfast is surprisingly good for an Asian country. The lunch and dinner buffets are quite good as well (but not great). Sing Yin is their Chinese restaurant - the food and decor is exceptional. The room and lobby design is very hip. The lift lobby on each floor looks like a library and you get free wifi in the restaurant and ground floor lobby. The rooms have an open design and floor to ceiling glass gives you a great view across the city. The showers are very good, you actually get an overhead rain shower as well as a wall mounted one and you can turn them both on at the same time. The swimming pool is on the 76th floor. It’s worth going up there just for the sweeping views of the city. If you don’t want to swim you can jump in the spa. Now for negatives. The lighting in the bathroom is inadequate and there is insufficient space on the vanity bench to place your things when you are trying to do your make up. The bathroom seems to stay wet for a very long time and can have a musky smell. The towels are excessively bleached. Probably our biggest gripe was the lack of wardrobe and cupboard space to unpack. We could only hang up a few items and then we had to leave most of our clothing in our suitcases. So overall, we were very happy to have chosen this hotel in Hong Kong. Service levels we thought was good, staff were always available without being overbearing. We would be happy to stay here again on our next visit to Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy Business Hotel in Kowloon”
Reviews.Author: duyster
Reviews.Content: Trendy business hotel next to the ICC in Kowloon. Excellent Service mentality from the staff whether it is reception, housekeeping, restaurant or concierge. The whatever, whenever principle is really embedded. Excellent breakfast as well as diner buffet. The hotel even takes care of arranging visa if you go to mainland China. Rooms are great, bed is superb and all facilities to be online of docking your ipad are there. Arriving from the airport just take the train which brings you right under the hotel for 90 HK$. On the way back you can even check in your luggage at the train station, liberating you from carrying it.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fabulous ...One of the best hotels EVER!”
Reviews.Author: slaughterbeach
Reviews.Content: This is one of the most fabulous hotels I have stayed in the world. Excellent service, all the amenities in the room. While on long international trips I prefer chains (I know we should get the local flavor but we do that with walking and eating locally) but I want a management team that can solve any problems I might have and this place is tops on my list. Fabulous tubs, beds, linen and more. The technology was actually more than we needed my husband and I couldn't figure out how to use the volume control on the TV which had to go thru the DVD player. The roof top pool and bar was amazing. I threw my back out he night before we were leaving, immediately got a massage appt in the fabulous spa and even after being gone from home for 18 days I did not want to leave the "W". On the Kowloon side but didn't matter in the least w cheap cabs and easy access to subway. Best yet the rail line to the airport is on the lower level AND you can check luggage there!

Reviews.Title: “rock star gorgeous”
Reviews.Author: neilsonparc
Reviews.Content: Rarely has a suite been so aptly named as the Wow Suite at the W Hong Kong. My wife and I got the feeling of being rock stars immediately on walking into the lounge room. Then we saw the full-size 'minibar'... and the walk-in wardrobe with crocodile skin textured walls.. and the bedroom with huge TV and fabulous harbour views. And then we saw the spa bath... I reckon it was 8 feet long, and backed by a mirror wall... great for the after-gig party (or after we've picked up a sandwich and coffee from downstairs!)... And I haven't even mentioned the awesome pool and rooftop jacuzzi... WOW

Reviews.Title: “A trendy hotel”
Reviews.Author: amit4717
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to Hong Kong.Great hotel to relax and chill out.The hotel rooms are very modern with TV in the bath.Amazing view from my 26th floor window. The swimming pool in on the 76th floor of the hotel.The food was quite ok but overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved it!”
Reviews.Author: KikiDhollywood
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W Hong Kong for 6 nights at the end of December/beginning of January and had a fabulous time. The room was clean, standard W style, with Bliss products. The spa is great and there's an amazing pool and terrace at the top. The bar is also good fun, with great drinks and good atmosphere. The staff was nice, helpful and welcoming at all times. From the airport it's very easy to catch the Airport express and get off at Kowloon station (inside Elements mall, so you don't even have to go outside). Also on the location, we worried that we might be a bit far from the action, but the MTR makes it super easy to get to Hong Kong Island (maybe 10min including the walk from the hotel to the station). I would definitely go back and recommend this hotel to all my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great for kids”
Reviews.Author: tonymerricks
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W in a suite with an interconnecting room (for our 8 and 4 year olds). It is a luxurious hotel with excellent service....let down only by the comparatively low quality / banality of the room service and in-house restaurant food. Easy fix: eat at any of the great restaurants in the Elements Mall directly connected to the hotel. At HKD 7500 for the suite and 3500 for the room the W does not come cheap, but it easily passes the "would I stay there again" test. Great access to Kowloon station and Airport Express via the mall, and a busy rank provides a steady supply of insanely cheap HK taxis. (As an aside , we loved the new Three Sixty supermarket in the mall, with great fruit and all the essentials, including Weetbix and Vegemite)

Reviews.Title: “A pretty standard W in a unique location”
Reviews.Author: boat1021
Reviews.Content: I have to start out by saying I’m a bit of a W skeptic. From lackluster initial experiences in some of the NYC current and former W properties that have room sizes I’d more expect from a cheap hostel or are located in buildings located well past their prime, the “mystique” of the brand is worn out on me even on a recent 5-night vacation with my girlfriend. That said, our stay here was “fine” if relatively unremarkable. Probably the most worthwhile element to discuss is the location. As others have said, the hotel is conveniently located attached to the Elements Mall that is atop the Kowloon MTR and Airport Express stops. We frequently took advantage of this top to zip over to Hong Kong island and could easily utilize the Airport Express “In-town check-in” desks at the Airport Express stop to check our baggage up to 90 minutes prior to departure (Something has to be said that HK can have multiple facilities to check baggage like that ~25 km from the airport without hassle when many North American airports seem to struggle to do so an hour before…). And yes, the hotel is right along the water in Kowloon. But don’t get to excited about the accessibility of where the hotel is situated. The mall complex it is attached to might as well be on the moon to some extent – the entire site is bordered either by water or the vast construction site of the coming high speed rail to the mainland and additional development. Walking even to TST (a more convenient subway station), elsewhere in Kowloon, or the Kowloon ferry terminal is possible but requires navigating an unclear cavalcade of roadside construction cones that represent sidewalks. The direct subway line the hotel/mall is on will cross you to Hong Kong station in central, but going elsewhere on HK island will require a in-network walk to Central station. But back to the actual hotel….It was fine. The bedding and the complementary Bliss toiletries were the same great W standards you’d expect from Doha to Santiago to Montreal. As a Platinum member, I was “upgraded” to a slightly better view room of the harbor. The room was clean and spacious enough but nothing to write home about. The hotel is setup as such behind the XXX building and with separate condos built in that HK Island skyline views do not seem to be available as far as I can tell. As we were there in early January, probably the most notable aspect of the hotel – the 76th floor pool – was closed. The gym on the 73rd floor was reasonably “hotel-good”, and exciting as many of the aerobic machines looked out on windows which allowed a bit of the skyline view. We did not check out either of the hotel restaurants or the lobby bar as nothing really caught our attention and feel there are a lot more interesting selections in this city. Overall, as stated initially a “fine” stay. No real major deficiencies beyond a bit of a “buyer beware” on the location. Service was probably friendly than the somewhat detached experience I’ve seen in other Ws as well. That said, would probably check out another hotel in HK the next time I’m around – the Sheraton may offer a more convenient still Starwood location and other brands or independents may be better able to match the much-hyped “style” the W is often seen as offering.

Reviews.Title: “A good experience, tempered by machine-like services”
Reviews.Author: sinvinceng
Reviews.Content: W Hotel, with its quirky styling and nice ambience, does leave one with a feel of excitement and wish for more. PLUSES are many, from a great connectivity to the airport and fantastic hotel rooms and amenities. Another huge positive is its Bell-team, who were informative and helpful. A personal negative I encountered during my stay in December is the service staff on the LOBBY level, who I must say operates with machine-like efficiency but cold service attitude. Perhaps this could be an exceptional experience (or a modus operandi) but given an early afternoon arrival and unready rooms, a small favour of a nice thermos flask of hot water should not be too much to ask from the service team. A brusque reply was definitely unexpected, especially given the significant improvement in service level in Asia over the years. Personal views aside, the hotel is great for business (although I still prefers Central hotels) with its fantasitc connectivity to the airport, but from a tourist perspective, it may be less attractive as it is poorly connected via tube to the rest of Kowloon.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: Kibong
Reviews.Content: I stayed in many great hotels but this hotel is the best hotel that I have stayed so far. This hotel is certainly not a kind of hotel with high-end luxurious service. However, the hotel approaches in more friendly service. The check-in service was very quick and convenient, I could feel that staffs respect me in various ways. Hong Kong hotels are famous for it's small sizes but W hotel has one of the biggest room size among all hotels in Hong Kong. As soon I walked inside I was amazed by how big and clean the room was. Moreover, I loved the bed which was beyond comfortable. The only bad thing about the hotel is that it is hard to move around with MTR since kowloon station is not a accessible station. Yet, there is free shuttle service (Not a shuttle BUS!!) to Tsim Sha Tsui every half an hour. If is a comfortable van and I used it all the time. All you have to do is to tell your room number to staff at the lobby and they arrange the van for you. The driver was very kind and I was impressed by how smoothly he was driving! I think you should definitely use the shuttle service! The Kitchen restaurant was also fantastic, I don't recommend the dinner buffet there but there are various types of a la carte available. I had a teriyaki salmon fillet and rib-eye steak and I absolutely loved them! Moreover, you should try the breakfast as well. it's 230hkd per person plus 10% service charge but I can tell you that it is worth the money. There are tons of fresh baked breads, it just feels so good to start the day with a good breakfast. Some say the W hotel is too trendy but I think that is the characteristic that differentiates the hotel with other hotels. If you come to Hong Kong, you should try this hotel. I strongly recommend it to you!

Reviews.Title: “Utterly WOW experience at W Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: VictorLME
Reviews.Content: W Hong Kong is by far the best hotel I stayed in for my travels. The staff are friendly, genuine and always out to ensure my stay is as comfortable as possible. Even my slightest discomfort is a BIG deal to them; which made me feel so special every time I am there – even better than staying at home. When ever I am statying in W Hong Kong, they will always make sure that they go out of their way to ensure that I have a pleasant and comfortable stay. The rooms are trendy, comfortable and very well designed to suit any travelers. The bathrooms are uniquely designed and comes Bliss Spa toiletries – which are very appropriate for a hotel of such status & quality. On top of that the location of the hotel is also very convenient for travelers as the MTR and airport express train service are located in Elements (the shopping mall linked to the hotel) and you can check in your luggage prior to boarding the train bound for the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid Tours is over priced for W Hotel guests”
Reviews.Author: LavendarPhoenix
Reviews.Content: I signed up with Splendid Tours for a Macau day tour through the hotel. Not only do you pay an extra fee on top of the tour rate, the W does not provide ground transfers from the hotel to the ferry station which is only 5 minutes away! One has to cover your own cab ride to and from the ferry while other hotel guests are provided ground transportation. This is the only tour exclusively offered by the hotel, they should at a minimum provide ground transportation since you are paying an extra fee for them just to make your reservations. Otherwise the hotel is well maintained and the location is convenient for the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Very trendy rooms, away from centre scene”
Reviews.Author: TheLing
Reviews.Content: The hotel is new, beautiful and trendy, no doubts about it. I was missing the excitement of staying where everything happens in Kowloon, the area around Nathan road. Rooms very well designed and decorated, I have been given a supersuite. Good ambiance, nice people, everything you would expect from a W. A bit expensive too.

Reviews.Title: “Wow factor, my oversea colleagues were impressed”
Reviews.Author: Zendi
Reviews.Content: Brought my UK colleagues for happy hr wine tasting and everyone left with a smile on their faces. Colleagues were wowed by the food & wine (great jarmon ham) and shoutout to Emma Tsang the receptionist in the living room lounge kept us smiling all night. Colleagues They still talk about W hotel night-! Had a blast, thank you guys!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience in W Hotel, Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Selvi R
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time in W Hotel, Hong Kong recently. We loved the creative and unique decor which was trendy and appealed to the adults and young ones alike. We had a fantastic view of Hong Kong Harbour from our room and it was pleasure to return to the room after our outings. The bed was exceptionally comfortable and the Bliss toiletries added a very nice touch. The staff provided exceptional service. From the doorman to the lift attendant to the receptionist, everyone went out of their way to make us feel welcomed. I could feel the pride they took in providing the service, which is very rare, it has been culturally ingrained in the staff, kudos to the management for achieving such a feat. Our visit to Hong Kong was hugely memorable due to our stay at W Hong Kong. A BIG thank you to the team of exceptional 'insiders'. PS: They have unique names for everything - whenever and wherever was a service button and people who delivered things to the room were known as 'insiders' - my kids were absolutely thrilled when an 'insider' delivered chocolates. They thought the chocolates were delivered by a frined in the hotel I knew and felt very special!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wow!!! Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Philip L
Reviews.Content: The W Hong Kong tops my list of hotels. First, it was very convenient to get to. From the airport, take the MTR transit train directly to Kowloon Station. The train stops in the Elements Mall directly below the W Hotel. It was a snap to get to. The same goes for traveling around Hong Kong. It's centrally located to everything.The rooms were very upscale & modern. The beds & pillows were super comfortable. I've read other reviews about how great the beds were for sleeping and they were right on the mark. Zzzzzzzz. You can't beat the price for what you get. The restaurants are much better than expected. The most impressive thing about the W was the staff. They were most courteous, friendly, and professional. This hotel is definitely5 Stars!!! You'll love it.

Reviews.Title: “Wow.............”
Reviews.Author: carol c
Reviews.Content: We had a three day stop over in Hong Kong at the beginning of December 2011 before spending a month with family in Australia. We stayed in a cool corner room on 26th floor......what a fabulous hotel, modern, super friendly and the most delightful and helpful concierges in the world. Aged in our late forties/fifties I was completely at home here. The pool was brilliant, the view magnificent, and the service just excellent. We were picked up from the airport on time, and did not have to lift a finger..........the bar is really cool, and you can have the most stunning afternoon tea or glass of good wine and take as long as you like.

Reviews.Title: “WOW for W...”
Reviews.Author: anthonyruk
Reviews.Content: Loved the place- location, as everyone says, situation above Kowloon MTR makes this a dream when using the Airport Express, where you can also check you and your bags in at Kowloon for most airlines when leaving for HK International. Rooms are well designed, as you'd expect, pool on 76th is stylish and very well maintained (check with hotel, but had a note in my room saying it would be closed for a couple of weeks early Jan for maintenance) Celebrated New Year's Eve there, which was great fun- staff are a delight, and on our final morning, we got to enjoy the most INCREDIBLE breakfast room i've ever seen.. WOW..! Go there just for the breakfast.. not cheap (250 $HK) but worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Start to Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Laurmingo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a few days in Hong Kong on our way to Bali for our honeymoon. It was a great hotel for us. Perfect location to get around Kowloon and Hong Kong via public transportation and taxi, wonderful staff, and fun/trendy atmosphere. We opted to have W car service pick us up from the airport after the very long direct flight from NYC. A gentleman was standing by to greet us, escort us to the car where refreshments waited. Once we arrived at the hotel, we were immediately taken to our room and did not have to wait at the front desk. All of our check-in paperwork was done in our room. While it cost more than we usually would spend, it was well worth the price for the convenience of getting situated in an unfamiliar country and first-class service. I would highly recommend that service for first-timers. The other thing we loved about the hotel was we didn't feel nickle and dimed the way we do at Starwood properties in the US (ex: Bottled water in the room and around the hotel was complimentary)

Reviews.Title: “A very trendy quirky place”
Reviews.Author: AaaaandEeee
Reviews.Content: Our first time in a W. This hotel was excellent and we thoroughly enjoyed our two nights here. It was a little difficult to find - we had arrived from the Chinese mainland and were travelling on the underground system. But like anywhere, once you've got there, then directions and location are subsequently no problem. The reception was efficient and the public area was quite trendy and extremely welcoming. Our room was really quite quirky - cannot think of another way to describe it. The decor, fabrics and furnishings were just out of this world in terms of colour and design. I just loved it. The bathroom was quite unlike any I'd ever experienced in a hotel. And, the sliding mirror doors, which mean that you can leave the bathroom quite open to the room or close it off, were quite something in terms of design. The TV in the bathroom didn't seem to work properly, but, hey, not a major problem! The hotel location could have been better from the tourist perspective, but when it came to getting a train to the airport, it was just great. The station was effectively in the hotel basement - well, through the shopping centre and down some stairs. The most interesting thing for us was that on our homeward journey from the hotel, we never went outside once on our travels until we arrived in Edinburgh!! We would just love to go back to this hotel and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “It's alright but you can do better”
Reviews.Author: mattriand
Reviews.Content: W hong kong.  The demographic for this hotel seems to be early 20's rich kids who really really wanna be cool. Trying a bit hard perhaps?  The top good things:  the pool and wet area on 73 and 76 are genius. The mall attached is pretty good. The airport express underneath makes it very handy to get to the airport or to central station in hong kong.  The not so good things: badly designed rooms esp' the bathrooms where shower floods the whole bathroom if you aren't vigilant.  its weird! The tv/sound system is awfully complicated with half the channels having no sound at all. Also weird.  We were woken twice during a 6 day stay before 830am (!!) with the maid ringing on the door asking to clean our room. ("...um... Since I'm in my underwear, maybe later?...") The location: apart from getting to and from the airport, or to central train station - there is no life around the hotel at all apart from the shopping mall. You had to get cabs instead. (which are really really cheap but you can't just wander and discover from this hotel which is sort of a deal breaker.) Food: the kitchen buffet breakfast I found pretty average sadly... Other things I ate we're okay but not outstanding. No complaints but it wasn't brilliant. Overall: it's a good hotel, desperately trying to be cool and the staff are nice. I would perhaps stay again but would probably opt for langham place in mongkok where all the action is if I were paying and wanted a real HK experience. Or around Hollywood road on HK island.  In retrospect I should have stayed at the sheraton On Nathan rd (which is another spg hotel - I booked my 6 day stay on SPG points).  I don't wanna bag this hotel as there is nothing really wrong with it at all but W didn't "wow" me other than the pool area.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what you would expect from a W!”
Reviews.Author: Lisa N
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, especially location-wise as it is right on the Airport Express train line. It is also located within the Elements shopping mall which has every store one could possibly want. The hotel itself is swanky (not dissimilar to most Ws). The rooms were nicely designed with great views. Our bathroom in particular was amazing with a separate shower and tub with a TV and a view of the city and water! The bar was decent (although drinks were slightly expensive). Staff was generally attentive and friendly. There were only two things that were less than ideal. First, reception is on the 6th floor, not the ground so you have to take the lift there. And at certain times, there were waits. Second, the lobby is rather small and full of guests on their iPads and iPhones doing Skype and FaceTime calls. It was annoying to be in the lobby and listen to people shouting to their iPads. Not a deal breaker, but kept my rating from being a 5. Overall, it was a good hotel and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: _Lini_Abe_
Reviews.Content: I had a great experience in the hotel back in 2009.. and I am pretty sure everything got even better!! Besides the fact that the hotel itself has a very nice and pleasant environment, service was great!!! I recommend it, and whenever I'm able to go back, I will for sure!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic W !!”
Reviews.Author: BforBoy
Reviews.Content: It is one of the best hotels in Hong Kong. It is located right next to the ICC tower and the view of the rooms is spectacular. You can walk down from your room and within a few minutes you are at the Elements mall where they have great shops and restaurants. It is very close to the MTR station and airport express station. I was upgraded to a suite and the room was so beautiful that I didn't want to leave! The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. Highly recommended!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Christmas day lunch”
Reviews.Author: DenandJim
Reviews.Content: Being away from home, what better way to spend Christmas day lunch then at the W hotel in Kowloon. There was a table of 14 (qantas cabin crew) and a great day was had by all. The buffet in the kitchen restaurant was outstanding. Plenty of seafood, including freshly shucked Irish oysters,, sushi and sashimi, salads, turkey, ham, pork and of course the desserts! And this was just some of it. Sorry to say i was a bit of a Mr piggy, but hey it was so good! The staff were absolutely fabulous and even tho the restaurant was full, there were no queues for food. The buffet was continually replenished and the champagne flowed. Not usually a big fan of buffets, but this was so well presented and organised to the nth degree. Did I mention how fabulous and friendly the staff were? From the moment we walked in, until we left there were smiles and "merry Christmas" for everyone. Santa was there ringing his bell and handing out gifts for the children. Well done W

Reviews.Title: “great W experience”
Reviews.Author: v_traveler88
Reviews.Content: Location - Very convenient despite being in Kowloon. An easy cab ride the central area of HK island if you take the western tunnel. a few minutes walk through the Elements mall to the MTR station as well as the airport express station. Rooms - Excellent decor in the usual W-esque style. Service - Great service. Very attentive staff especially if you're a loyal member of the SPG program. Restaurants - good food. The SingYin chinese restaurant is excellent. Very good food, but not as crowded as the usual big names in HK. Great dimsum buffet on Sundays as of time of writing.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy Hotel in Kowloon!”
Reviews.Author: Juju B
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel in one of the best areas of Hong Kong, right next to the Elements Mall and the Airport Tram. The Hotel has an amazing swimming pool, overlooking Hong Kong Island and right next to the ICC Tower, very inspiring view! The room was very clean and comfortable, with a trendy design. Our only poblem was that another guest next door was making noise at 2am, but we informed the front desk and they addressed the problem immediately. The restaurants were very good as well, you can't go wrong in this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Normal W”
Reviews.Author: qschzt
Reviews.Content: It wasn't as hard to find as said below - a couple elevators from Kowloon station, then follow the signs. I had a pretty bad check-in experience, my bag was lost for almost an hour somewhere in the abyss of the hotel, after our other room's bags were delivered with delay. There is rust in the shower in both rooms we had. Everything else is rather precisely what you would expect as a W guest - which I wanted - including the concierge's local knowledge. We wanted to ask a question from Whatever/Whenever a little after midnight and there was no-one to pick up the phone. The concierge is unavailable here after midnight (!). This W is not particularly near anything, taxis are cheap though and the MTR is very close. In conclusion, I won't stay here again, but if you insist on the W, this is a normal quality W. Not a 5 star hotel. (Plain SPG)

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: Magsy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W Hong Kong for two nights in November. We had a great stay overall. Check-in was smooth. Although we were on a lower floor, the view of the harbour was okay, a view of the container shipping yard. Woo hoo. Upon entering the room, I was pleasantly surprised that the room was bigger than the two W's I have stayed at in New York and Atlanta. The room was at least 1/3 bigger than those in the US, which is surprising as real estate is usually much $$$ than the US. Help me understand that. Additionally, the W's in US are usually really dark. W Hong Kong was sufficiently lit and very pleasant. The hotel is attached to the Elements Mall, a very upscale mall, which is also connected to the Ritz Carlton and the Kowloon Airport Express Station. It's an odd location, has a bus terminus, two metro lines, but yet rather isolated. There are lots of construction nearby but does not affect the noise level at the hotel, just not very convenient if you can't find a cab from TST and need to walk back to the hotel. Staff was extremely friendly but not particularly knowledgeable, hit or miss, mostly misses. Hopefully the staff was be more better trained and more empowered the next time I come back. Overall, we enjoyed the facilities at the W Hong Kong but would suggest they ramp up the staff service and knowledge. Thank you for hosting me in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “W stands for WONDERFUL!”
Reviews.Author: Gia R
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the W Hong Kong for 3 nights alone. I travelled from Sydney to meet with my friend from South Africa. Friend stayed at other 5 star hotels which simply did not compare to the W!! I was mostly alone at my hotel and felt welcome and cared for. The staff are so attentive without being in your face. Always greeted with the most genuine smiles and questions about my day and stay. By the end of my trip had experienced a lot of struggles (personally) and was wiped out. Needed a BC ticket back to Sdney urgently and the concierge took care of it without any hassels or problems. This is one of the best hotels I have stayed in anywhere in the world and I am making it my personal mission to go to every W hotel in the world!!! Thank you W for making a challenging trip seamless and enjoyable!! On a practical note: rooms are gorgeous! Mini bar even has effervescent Vit C tablets for a boost on a down day! Every room service tray came with a little plastic toy car just for fun! Adored the gorgeous and spacious bath. A little loofah is provded in the bathroom which I loved!! Staff always accomodated me at the lobby bar which was usually full. More personal attention than I have recieved even in the most exclusive hotels in the world!!!! Well done W for somehow managing to get it "just right". I Will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully Welcoming”
Reviews.Author: epicurious_chicagoan
Reviews.Content: The W Hotels have always blown me away, and W Hong Kong was no exception. From the minute we walked in, I was enamored by everything that was going on around me. W Hotel really does pay much attention to detail! We arrived at the hotel at 1pm, and wasn't supposed to check in until 3pm. However, my mom wasn't feeling well and upon asking for an earlier check-in, the hotel granted our request. That alone made a huge difference for our experience there! The rest of our stay went smoothly, and the staff was gracious to respond to any requests with a smile and in timely manner. The pool on the 76th floor is undoubtedly the most breath-taking feature of the hotel. It was never crowded, and offered a beautiful peace & tranquility of the city. My other favorite part about the hotel were the beds and the comforter. Whatever it was made of, it was heavenly. I briefly contemplated bringing the bed and comforter home, but it wouldn't fit in my suitcase :)

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional.”
Reviews.Author: Jess Y
Reviews.Content: I don't write reviews very often, but my stay at the Hong Kong W has been truly exceptional. The first thing you notice is the space -- that its attractive and well designed is a given; what is surprising is the number of places you pause to consciously acknowlege that something has been well done. Like the elevators from the ground floor to the lobby. Or the entrance to the pool. Or the view of the harbour from the bed in your suite. Little things, to be sure, but the kind of little things that make an experienced traveler stop and smile. The second thing you notice is that the staff manage to strike the perfect balance between deferential and cool. Its as if they intuitively know when you need a professional to solve a problem, and when you need a friend to explain where the beautiful people will be on a Thursday night. Its easy to get one or the other, but hard to get them both right. These guys just nail it. I'm not sure when I'll be in Hong Kong again, but there is no way I'd stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: susannyNewYork
Reviews.Content: The W is convenient-right at the train station from the airport with free suttle service to the main part of Kowloon. The staff was very well trained and friendly. The view from the rooms is spectacular. The bar in the lobby is a little loud. The attached mall has great stores, restaurants and a supermarket.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and delicious food”
Reviews.Author: LIChanlic
Reviews.Content: We had a really nice dinner at the Chinese restaurant - sing yin at the W hotel. The food was delicious and the service was excellent. We have been to all the restaurants at the w hotel and each time the experience has been really good. They make things really easy and straight forward for you. It's never pretentious or complicated and that's why we like going there.

Reviews.Title: “Exciting and Incredible!”
Reviews.Author: TorontoTraveller1976
Reviews.Content: We ended th least of our Asia trip in HK and sooooo glad we booked the W. Good Rooms are spectacular with amazing views, we were on 23rd floor with cool view of the harbour Hotel is ultra modern with sleek finishings that transports you to another time in the future Even tho standard room, the decor and setup felt like we were in a suite Didn't partake in the hotel restaurants as the city of HK is one huge edible city with an overwhelming amount of eateries The Best Below the hotel and Elements mall is the express train to the airport within the subway. I was able to check my luggage the morning of the flight as there are airline check-in counters right there!! The awesome staff at The W (Eric Lee) helped to checked all my luggage and purchased my train tickets and I didn't have to see the baggage until I arrived in Toronto - it was wonderful! Wished more major cities were this accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “W is for "WoW"!”
Reviews.Author: JNolan123
Reviews.Content: I stayed here between 13th and 17th October 2010 before heading to China and visiting the Canton Fair. We're from Sydney, Australia. First time in hong kong and china. This was the only hotel we stayed at in Hong kong (first time visitors). I stayed at 6 different 5 star hotels over just 13 days, and W Hotel Hong Kong was by FaR the best!! So modern and funky! Amazing, and I mean AmAZiNG service!!! We paid for the fabolus room and paid extra for breakfast each morning. The breakfast was SO good!! There's a wall full of freshly squeezed juices (Inc Guava), and smoothies. The spread of food was extensive to say the least! This was also the last place I could get a decent cappuccino before heading to China. I am shocked this hotel isn't ranking number 1?? It's in an amazing location, next door to the ICC building (one of the worlds tallest super skyscrapers which has the worlds tallest hotel and bar "ozone" inside (amaZing views). Also below the ICC building is one of the best shopping centers I have ever been to! AND below this shopping centre is Kowloon train station (express to airport makes it super easy for English only speaking ppl like me). The infinity pool on the top floor was absolutely stunning. I could not believe how perfect the sights were! Infinity pool amd bar with Hk skyscrapers lining the sky as far as the eye can see in the distance!! Gorgeous!! My friend said he's been all over the world Inc new york and said these views in Hong Kong were by far the most impressive! Will DEFINITELY be back as soon as time is right and o can afford oT again. It Is not cheap but once you have been you easily justify the costs. The girlfriend will love the shopping centre (Elements) which has stores such as Hermes, YSL, versace, etc as well as more affordable fashion. For those interested in knowing what other hotels I went to after my stay in hong kong and W is by far superior, are: The other hotels we stayed in china on our stay were Shangri-La (Shenzhen, China), Sofitel (Guangzhou, China), Sheraton (Shunde, China), Crowne Plaza (Ningbo, China), Radisson Blu (Shanghai) over 13 days. W hotel Hong Kong absolutely blows away the others!

Reviews.Title: “What an amazing place”
Reviews.Author: jillypops55
Reviews.Content: Faultless service and all you could wish for in the room. Most comfortable bed I have ever had in a hotel but so comfortable that it was easy to become overheated at night. Breakfast amazing and spectacular rooftop pool with great views over the harbour. Only complaint is that there is not really anywhere to sit quietly and have a drink as there is only one bar and it is often full and very dark. Overall a place worth visiting, not to mention the shopping mall underneath the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Fast-Deteriorating Hotel in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: bengo333
Reviews.Content: I was staying in the W Hotel for a few days when I was in Hong Kong about three years ago. At that time, it was a brand new hotel, everything was nice, clean and attractive. Last week, I stayed in the same hotel again for 4 days, my feeling was totally different. It was very obvious that this place is running down rapidly. The washroom has a large, irremovable stain mark near the toilet - a very disgusting look as if some one just pee on the cement wall. Then inside the shower, same kind of mark on the wall. The sliding door was not able to stop the water from leaking out during shower, the result - very messy and wet floor afterward. There was a flood in the shower stall on the first night after I showered for just 10 minutes. After some investigation, I had discovered that the drainage was plugged due to a massive hair ball was clogged in there - an absolutely horrifying experience for a trendy hotel charging me HK $2,500 ($300 US) a night! Then the bedroom, the curtain definitely need a wash. The writing desk (made with the same gray cement/stone as the toilet wall) had the same ugly looking stain mark as in the bathroom ... and yes, don't go the Chinese restaurant called Xin Yin (used to be a steak house) for dinner at the lobby level even when they offer you a 20% discount if you are the guest of the hotel. It was a total rip-off, I regretted very much to go there with my friends on the second night of my stay. Food was average but the price they charge me was ridicules! The positive side is, this hotel is right above the fast train station to the airport so you can check-in your luggage at the train station before taking off. The high-end shopping mall, Element, is attached to the hotel and is a great place for shoppers for brand name products. Staff at the hotel are overall very helpful. Still, I will not go back to this hotel again. I blame it totally on the management, not the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Really good hotel-relaxed, efficient, great staff but location okay but not fantastic.”
Reviews.Author: Anglotraveller
Reviews.Content: The one thing that W-Hotels have in common is the positive, helpful and friendly staff and this was no exception; it was a pleasure being in the public areas of the hotel. Rooms are large for Hong Kong with one of the best beds I have ever slept in. Gripes: Internet is too expensive and the checkin/out is woefully understaffed. Marked down for value because it is priced as a Hong Kong island hotel when in reality it is not the best located hotel in Hong Kong. Having said that I would stay there again for personal use but for business one really needs to be on the island.

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable Views!”
Reviews.Author: NYCnana
Reviews.Content: Visited only for one night but it was worth it. The pool terrace on the 76th floor of this hotel is something that you have to experience. The view is unbelievably beautiful... Would go back just to experience it again. So amazing!! Their breakfast is the one other thing I will never forget. It was expensive, but really worth it. I feel almost embarrassed to say that the best meal I had in Hong Kong was at a breakfast buffet. But looking back, it was! I wasn't particularly fond of anything I ate in HK except for this breakfast. You should try it!! The hotel feels very modern and chic (as is the case with most W's). However, it seems that by trying so hard to be trendy they take a hit on their service. The young staff, the "cool" way in which they act and how they approach you... It just doesn't seem to work as well compared with much higher levels of service that can be experienced in other hotels in this city. Also, location is great but the area is a bit busier (and dirtier) than if you stay at a hotel in the Waterfront of HK island. However, please take these as observations rather than complaints. My stay at this hotel is one I will never forget, and I would definitely visit again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Far from the promise W makes and the premium charged!”
Reviews.Author: RolandUO
Reviews.Content: While I quite like the W concept, in this case they didn't deliver what they promise and less what they charged. It starts with a reservation confirmation signed by the General Manager, you reply to it with a late check out request you receive an answer "Dear Valued Customer...." outlining the cancellation policy but nowhere near your request! Computerized customer relationship management of it's finest. One of the best experiences was the porter, he didn't only deliver the luggage to the right room but added quite some nice destination info. The "wonderful non smoking room" bed was smelling of a solid smoker staying in the room before! The harbor view we reserved was the view on the back of the Ritz Carlton! Why the suitcase provision in the room to unpack if you can't even get a regular size Samsonite opened on it? Quite some fancy schnick schnack in terms of merchandising but this most important feature used by probably each and every guest is under-designed. I quite liked the room design but opening a coke a few drops went onto the floor. Like a good guest I got a wet cloth from the bathroom and removed the drops from the carpet realizing that there was truckloads of hair all over the floor! Disgusting! That was not the only spot where hair was to be found. The stone used all over the room is quite nice but if not treated the right way like the shower in my room this can be a counter productive feature looking dirty. Also the shower ceiling was damaged. The sound system was quite cool although the TV speaker covering textile was full of food or beverage splashes. The moveable light attached to the beds headboard made a horrible sound turning it. The TV at the bathtub could be a nice feature....provided it works! Calling my colleague to pick me up at the room resulted in a workout as you can't get on another floor without being escorted by the staff. The living room was quite poor visited despite it being a Saturday, staff here was stone cold. The rooftop bar was closed "open only in the summer", we had something like 25 degrees.... The SPG TV is one of the nicer features, nice information about the city but an overdose of Starwood! Upon check-out I commented on the internet being a workout to get it going, my colleague had the same issue, the Front Office staff nodded but didn't even bother to ask for details. Although the attached shopping mall and underground connectivity the location is still a little off the beaten track, this despite the hotel being on Kowloon side and close to the harbor. The concierge team was quite helpful but the best part of the W experience def was the breakfast buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish hotel but sorta off beat location”
Reviews.Author: HDYankee
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the W for three nights. It is a highly stylish hotel that prides itself as being thoroughly branded, right down to the language. The rooms are nice, comfy beds, nice, clean bathrooms. The library style hallways are a nice touch. The pool is on the top floor of the hotel - which is not the top floor of the building though. I didn't like it too much, it didn't give you that infinity-pool-wow-effect and the view isn't the greatest. The hotel is attached to a big mall which is also connected to the subway and the Airport Express, which is fantastic: you check-in to your flight at the subway station, turn over your luggage and board the train that takes you right to the airport and your done. The hotel location is sort of a problem though. It is theoretically in Kowloon, which has a vibrant night life, but it is not too close to it, and if you want to get to HongKong Island, you have to take the subway, a cab, or a ferry (which is far from the W) across the bay. One more thing: the lobby of the W is always blasting with extremely loud club-like music, mostly house. It kind of reminded me of an Abercrombie store. It's really annoying, especially during check-in, cause you can't really understand anything the guy says.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel and Staff”
Reviews.Author: ThingsToCherish
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the W Hong Kong in November of 2011. We hold the Platinum Starwood Preferred Guest level and were upgraded to the Mafia Suite, which was one of the best Starwood rooms we have ever stayed in (and we have stayed in many W hotels and properties from the Starwood Luxury Collection). The hotel is positioned over a luxury mall and the Kowling Train Station, which makes getting around incredibly convenient. You can even check in for your flight downstairs and they will transfer your baggage to the airport while you ride the high speed train. The staff was very helpful, especially the concierge. We will stay here again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at W Hong Kong!”
Reviews.Author: nbmiami
Reviews.Content: My second stay at the W Hong Kong. They were out of 2-bed rooms, so we were upgraded to a really nice large corner suite over looking the harbour and HK island. The location directly on top of the Airport Express/Kowloon station is what always sells me which means no taxi rides to deal with. This was only a one night stay and we had lots of bags. It's not cheap, but besides a really upbeat pleasant atmosphere, a great morning buffet breakfast (make sure it's included in your rate before just showing up--it's a bit pricey otherwise!), the location above the truly upscale Elements mall and Kowloon station is great. Also, it's a pleasant walk to the Temple Street market--out the back of the mall and about a 15 min walk--even better if you're coming back stuffed like I usually do!

Reviews.Title: “Hip hotel with great service - something different”
Reviews.Author: kkwek01
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel more times than i can count. After the first 3-4 stays, things become less impersonal and i have always enjoyed the stay. its a short train ride from the airport (exit train, elevator up, walk 50 meters through Mall, you are there!), you are in a Mall with a number of good restaurants without having to actually step outside, and yet within a 5 min cab ride you are in Tsim Tsa Tsui for more food and shopping, and within a 5 min train ride you are at the financial heart of hong kong. Rooms are modern and has all you need. Service generally good and responsive. Great gym with a Xbox Kinnect console where you can get a different workout playing shadow boxing, or have some fun in between weight training. Pool on 76 floor - what more can you ask for? the jacuzzi should be tried- great view right in front of you while you soak - also on 73 floor. I did have some initial service hiccups on first few stays but have nothing but praise now.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing beats W the Wanderlust!”
Reviews.Author: Ben_Edmund
Reviews.Content: I wuv the W Hong Kong! Unbeatable! I love the style, the interiors, the immaculate designs. And all the crew are so hawt! :) Starwood Rocks!

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: tanyasydney2000
Reviews.Content: A fantastic hip hotel located directly above the Airport Express train terminal (20 mins from the airport) and the Elements shopping mall full of beautiful designer boutiques. As far as W Hotels are concerned it is one the best I've experienced so far. The service is great, the breakfast buffet is very contemporary and beautifully presented and the beds are soft and cozy (unlike many hotels in Asia where the floor is softer than the bed). Great outdoor swimming pool and bar serving snacks on the 78th floor. If you don't want to leave the comfort of air conditioning you can can catch the train to Hong Kong Island (a few minutes away) and you land right in the middle of IFC Shopping Mall. Alternatively you can catch a free shuttle bus to Tsim Sha Tsui for more shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Get Wow @ W Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: flypiggy
Reviews.Content: I was totally felt spoiled by the special modern chic designed hotel. I was stayed at room 2702, the Beautiful ocean sunset make me room full of pink and golden color. The soft bed and SPA style bath room make me feel sooooo good! Besides room, the hotel located alongside and relitively a big new shopping mall and above the MTR station, it is easy go to everywhere in Hong Kong. On the 76th floor was probably the best feature of the hotel - one of the world’s highest rooftop infinity pools. With stunning panoramic views of the city below, and the illusion of the water extending to kiss the horizon, it makes for an extremely impressive view. It was centainly an unforgetable and memoral experience and bowled over me when I was stay at W Hong Kong!

Reviews.Title: “W Hong Kong = Stylish Modern”
Reviews.Author: S3CR3T3X3C
Reviews.Content: The W in Hong Kong is a stylish, modern hotel which personifies "Hong Kong cool". It is decorated stem to stern in "modern Chinese" fashion and is over-the-top glitzy & glamorous. The rooms are large, comfortable and the beds were amazingly comfortable (not always a given in Asia). The bathrooms are really nice but a bit "starkly modern". Come to think of it, the whole place is "starkly modern". If you don't enjoy sleek, modern design, you will not like it. The breakfast is really nice but quite expensive. The service is probably the only weak point: the W is trying too hard to have "style" and be "hip" and this erodes a bit of the Asian hospitality one has come to expect in Hong Kong. The young folks the hotel has are trying too hard to "trendy" and "awesome". This is probably the only small ding on an otherwise impressive and comfortable place. I will gladly stay here again and if the service improves, I'd gladly rate it a 5 point maximum.

Reviews.Title: “w-hotel in hong kong fashion designer advice”
Reviews.Author: odabash
Reviews.Content: I travel all over the world for work i am a fashion designer and have been very lucky to always stay in amazing hotels I went for the first time to w hotel in hong kong as i have stayed before at the w hotel in maimi i totally trust there service.My room was beautiful it had a view over looking hong kong the pool on the 78th floor was breathtaking along with a huge jacuzzi surrounded by glass wall so you can see everything it had a very chilled atmosphere and amazing crowd to watch .drinks on the terrace at sunset is an experience.i held my melissa odabash trunk show there and i cant even begin to say how amazing the service was.The hotel arranged everything i needed from hotels to taxis to special meals i would highly recommend this hotel having the spa and the jacuzzi helped me get over jet lag instantly

Reviews.Title: “My favourite hotel”
Reviews.Author: chipchop_1
Reviews.Content: Went to the W Hong Kong in 2009 for our honeymoon, and have to say, the hotel added to our experience. Having stayed in several W Hotels, this is my favourite one. Staff were very welcoming and attentive to our needs. We had a room on the 38th floor overlooking the harbour and the views were amazing!!! The whole building is unique and magical. From moving paitings to a trendy bar, to a rooftop pool on the 70th something floor to unique items in the restaurant. Ever tried red bull jelly with gummi bears?? Nope neither did I but have to say all those different things just make your stay memorable. Booked a limo to the hotel and a nice cake on arrival as a surprise for my wife and all was just brilliant. All hotels are unique in its kind, but the W raised the bar for all other hotels. Just a quick tip when travelling back home, underneath the hotel is a check in desk for the airport express, you can check in there and drop off your luggage even before you have to leave the city.

Reviews.Title: “very good”
Reviews.Author: aaltowave
Reviews.Content: Great design, good vibe, grand views and absolutely excellent connection to the airport (check-in at the train terminal in the same building). Some small hick-ups in both rooms we stayed in, for example the bathroom tv wouldn't turn off. Had a meal In Sing Yin Cantonese which was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “As Expected-Great!”
Reviews.Author: Lynn_0130
Reviews.Content: I stayed here twice during a business trip (went to mainland China in between). It was just what I would expect it to be - great! Had their standard room; it was certainly big enough. I had views of the harbor both times. Service was top notch; everyone goes out of their way to be helpful, or at the very least say hello. Bathroom was lovely; separate shower from bathtub. The bed was it's usual wonderful. Housekeeping does a great job, including turn down service. I used both the infinity pool on the top floor, as well as the ladies hot tub in the locker room. Very nice how the hot tub looks out over the city. Location is perfect; attached to Kowloon train station. Also attached to a high-end shopping mall that includes a very nice grocery store. I recommend the restaurant "Nahm" in the mall for Thai food. I plan on staying here each time I am in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Always our place in HKG.”
Reviews.Author: Dorian B
Reviews.Content: Amazing hotel located about a huge shopping mall. The hotel is always quite busy in my experience so can often be tough to get seats in the Living Room and up on the pool deck. Love everything about this hotel but expect more children than other W's around the world.

Reviews.Title: “W stands for Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Thinkalot
Reviews.Content: As an exhausted teacher who has been loyal to SPG for 12 years as a Platinum member, I can honestly say that when you need anything--from a pickup for my husband and me at the airport, to a room when they were all booked and our flight back to the USA was cancelled (after we had taught three weeks in 5 countries, in Asia) they are there for us. Ricky, the airport W chief manager, will meet you at baggage claim, Charlie unloaded our bags and rush us upstairs where, Amy and Sammy and Frances checked us in. The spa for my aching body (Momma Letty) was heaven. The food is authentic and the service what you would expect. Great! Dim Sum downstairs (thanks Ben), snacks on the roof near the pool or a dinner in the hotel. The rooms and views are great. Thank you, W Hotel! I sincerely couldn't do this job without you! Seriously!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely!”
Reviews.Author: RaoulM
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just wonderful as every Hotel W in the World. The rooms are just wonderful, smoking is possible and is very Hi-End, you can switch your Iphone on the dock and connect the room with your music which is very nice! The hotel is located just in Kowloon St which is just 24 mins from the Airport with Airport Express. Is well connected with the Subway and is helpful to get to nice places like Night Market, Victoria Peak and Hun Hom station. The only problem with the hotel is the location in terms of access to the City it self ... walking distance, you have to walk all over the Mall to get out and see some of the outside Kowloon. Very recommended

Reviews.Title: “Bliss Spa”
Reviews.Author: HKSHB
Reviews.Content: I am writing on my experience of the spa. The spa is located on the 72th Floor but you have to walk upstair to the 73th F to get change. The decor is blue and is like to department boutique store rather than a spa. The spa receptionists do not seem to understand their own services can have difficult time to explain. For all of the time they just stay inside the counter just like they are selling goods rather than service. The steam room and sauna room are quite small like a home sauna room. The jacuzzi has an open bath facing outside. As it is situating on the 73th F, there is a nice view of the city and the adjacent skyscraper residential building--I trust the bath is visible from outside as well. A very unforgettable experience is the service of the locker room. The locker room staff allow all the towel on the floor and ask the client to pick them up and clean the floor. I believe he may be trying to "train the client" instead of serving the client. This is very unusual in Asia where the service is normally good. Unbelievable is that there is no Q-tip in the room. When I ask for the Q-tips, he ask me one or two Q-tips!!! I guess he should know at least I need 2 for my 2 ears. On the other hand the massage is good and better than more hotel massage. But I have to say I will not be there again because of the attitude of the receptionists and the locker man.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: KikiHanoi
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed in a "Fabulous Room" facing the bay for three nights. The room was spacious and the facilities were good, including comfortable beds, automatic curtains, good size bath tub, a separate shower, etc. I slept well as there was the automatic thick curtain to block any lights from outside the window. The room already had a world-wide plug adaptors, so it was easy for me to charge my phone. The hotel location was certainly very convenient to arrive from the airport. It is also close to shopping areas, so taking a taxi to those places were also inexpensive. We were there only for a weekend, so we felt our time was quite limited, but being close to many tourist areas, we could use our time efficiently by staying in this hotel. I enjoyed the heated swimming pool and the jacuzzi on the 78th floor. The view towards the Hong Kong Island is little bit blocked by a high rise next door, but it still has a beautiful view. The room did not offer free internet. It was 40HKD for one hour. If I go back to Hong Kong, this hotel would certainly be one of my options again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Kickazzboy
Reviews.Content: Just 2 words about this hotel, Impressive and Funky. This is a must choice hotel to stay in Hong Kong, The staff is very friendly and helpful, the room is excellent with complete amenities, perfect for business travellers. The location is very convenient, Element Mall is just next door and accessible from the lobby. It will give you a memorable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Top Class”
Reviews.Author: Beckyfergie
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fantastic from the moment i checked in, to the moment i left. The hotel is funky and very different from any other hotel i have stayed in and the art work around the place is interesting and different. The room was fantastic and the bathrooms where to die for. The beds in the hotel were so comfy that it made them very hard to get out of! The staff were always helpful and friendly and the pool staff should thanked for the excellent service they provided during my stay, the cocktails and food at the pool bar where amazing and the views over hong kong spectacular. The hotel is so convienent to everything and the airport express makes travelling to the airport stress free! I will most definalty be visiting this hotel again in the near future. Top class!

Reviews.Title: “W Hotel Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Stephen L
Reviews.Content: Excellent Hotel, located in Kowloon. Can not complain about anything. Rooms were spacious, rooftop pool heated, Spa & Heath Club good.

Reviews.Title: “Fancy hotel, but inconsistent service”
Reviews.Author: raffywu
Reviews.Content: Stayed at W Hong Kong for 2 nights before my trip to Thailand. The hotel was in the same building as Airport Express Kowloon Station, which made it very convenient for stopover. And if you are on business with Morgan Stanley or Deutsch Bank, W will be a good choice for you as the companies are located in the adjacent ICC building. The hotel provided shuttle service to TST, but it was only for one way. So you will have to find a taxi on your way back. I like the hotel's modern and club style design. And the biggest selling point is their rooftop swimming pool located on the 76th floor overlooking the city and part of the habour. However, sometimes it can get very windy on the roof which makes it impossible to swim. The room was big enough by Hong Kong standard, with an over-sized bathroom. I particularly like the bed as it was by far the most comfortable one in all of the hotels I stayed at. However, the room didn't seem to be well-maintained as there were scratches on some furnitures. Also, there was noticeable stains on the toilet. The ocean-view was a big disappointment. Instead of the typical view of the Victoria Harbour that you get from Sheraton, Intercontinental, or Peninsula, at W, what you will actually see is a port of shelter for a lot of small fishing boats. Upon check-in, the frontdesk staff spent 3 minutes looking for my reservation, and finally, I was told by the front desk staff that I would get a NON-SMOKING room that I requested. But when I got to the room, it was filled with strong smoke smell. I called and complained and the answer I got was:" Oh of course sir, your room was on A smoking floor!" Other than that, most of the staffs I met were friendly and helpful. When I was waiting for the hotel shuttle in the lobby, a young female concierge staff came to me and we had a very good conversation. W Hong Kong will still be one of my many choices when I visit Hong Kong in the future. Overall, I think it is a good hotel but the inconsistency in service keeps it from being one of the top class hotels in Hong Kong.
