If you have the budget for W, you might as well spend a bit more for Mandarin Oriental or Peninsula, which I think will be a much safer bet.

Reviews.Title: “A great introduction to the W brand.”
Reviews.Author: ramblinAmerican
Reviews.Content: The W hotel in Kowloon was incredibly impressive. Very swanky and hip and the staff were very nice and incredibly helpful. They gave me a free upgrade (not sure why, must be my amazing personality) and I had a view of the harbor through big bay windows. The concierge staff hooked me up with some great places to eat including the Kowloon night market which I think I had far too much fun at. I had never stayed at a W before but if they’re all like this then I most definitely will try others. So if you’re going to stay in Kowloon I really do recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Whatever, whenever! seriously fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: manium
Reviews.Content: Truly the whatever, whenever motto is upheld. From the airport limousine pick up in the Audi Q7, to the baggage drop off at the airport train. Our experience was truly perfect. I was travelling with my mother to India, and I had never been to Hong Kong, and this hotel was perfectly located. Attached to a mall which had great shops and restaurants. Best of all, direct trains to the hotel, with baggage check in. What a fantastic option. This way we arrive at Hong Kong airport and dont have to lug our bags off the train, and to the check in. The beds were heavenly, and the rooms beautifully appointed. Whatever we asked for in terms of recommendations, were excellent. Great unique hole in the wall restaurants, to gourmet asian cuisine. Good shopping tips, and friendly helpful service to my mother whatever she requested. And she did, often! the restaurant in the hotel has an amazing buffet and worth trying! Best of all, the decor and design were cutting edge, yet comfortable. This is the place to say in Kowloon!

Reviews.Title: “Starwoods Best”
Reviews.Author: Mybrico
Reviews.Content: W is fairly new on the scene in Hong Kong and has now been joined by the Ritz Carlton in TST. This hotel is part of my favorite chain but don't let the word chain put you off. This is a great and truly trendy hotel. Its location at Kowloon Airport Express station is super convenient and Elements an upmarket mall is attached - or is it the other way around!. However it's a bit far from Nathan Road, MTR and the Star Ferry but you can't have everything. The staff are wonderful and the rooms great. Fantastic Cantonese Restaurant on the ground floor, lively bar with lots of special events. I feel its my home away from home. Nothing better in TST or Hong Kong

Reviews.Title: “A near-perfect experience at the W”
Reviews.Author: Digicision
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the W before heading out of hong kong. An amazing hotel - love how modern and trendy it is. Lots of shopping connected to the mall, and subway easy accessible (one stop to central area). Also love how easy it was to get to the airport on the airport express. Room was very nice and complimentary water was a bonus. Spent a great afternoon at the pool. Erica checked us in smoothly, and we were helped with dining suggestions from Patrick. Service was excellent. Until we went to the bar in the living room for a drink. The bartender was so intent on saying hello to people coming in, but then managed to ignore us while we were at the bar, wanting to get a drink. We moved from the bar to another table where a checkers set was set up, and managed to finish the entire game without one person taking drink orders from us. We eventually finished the game... And left to have drinks elsewhere. Lol. Perhaps the servers were too busy, but we didn't go back even though we had planned to have breakfast there. Other than that blip, i would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “W never disappoints!”
Reviews.Author: Feigum
Reviews.Content: A colleague and myself spent a couple of days at this great hotel on a business trip. Due to several conferences and exhibitions, the price was higher than normal as the hotel was running at almost full occupancy. The rooms were modern and very comfortable. They have really paid attention to ever single little detail. The breakfast buffet was great and the other restaurants better than expected. Only negative point would be some of the staff lacked a bit of knowledge and could definitely improve to complete this more or less perfect hotel experience. Would definitely go back on my next visit. Tip: visit the pool on the 76th floor, and drop by the great SPA!

Reviews.Title: “luxurious and stylish in a great location”
Reviews.Author: gaffelaar
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here a couple of times and each time I feel the same, great! Waking up here is a pleasure, the bed, bathroom, seating and study area, it all puts you in a great mood. In the hotel and adjacent luxury mall there is a huge choice of all types of restaurant plus good supermarket, main metro station and airport express with in town check in. Only drawback is the long walk to star ferry (dont) but taxi is cheap in HK. Getting back more an issue when taxi is harder to find. Every where else in HK is easy by taxi/metro.

Reviews.Title: “Flawed concept”
Reviews.Author: g_gekko2011
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 8 days on business on the top floor. Sumptuously finished, rooms are high tech and really unique. Staff were fine. Biggest issue is the lobby, or lack of one. You go up this nightclub style lift into...well nothing really. There is no focal point or heart to this hotel - it never feels like anything much more than a room the whole time I stayed. I think the concept is ineffective overall - but everything else is fine and well executed.

Reviews.Title: “Chic and hip, shame about the service...”
Reviews.Author: never2tired2travel
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights choosing this hotel because of the pool and reviews. Whilst our 'cool corner' room was well appointed one could not help but feel a bit hemmed in by the newly completed ICC mega-tower. Pool was indeed special but so-called guest executives failed to mention the wonderful steam, jacuzzi and spa facilities on offer as well. Breakfast in The Kitchen was excellent. Will avoid staying there again however because of the very slack checkout service (we had to call 3 times for a porter before giving up) and the fact that despite leaving a designer item behind in the room it was mysteriously never found. Would choose the nearby Ritz Carlton in the ICC, better view and superior service.

Reviews.Title: “great place to experience”
Reviews.Author: jktpe
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the W for the second time in June 2011 on a private / business trip. The W has all to make a trip business efficient and relaxing at the same time. I do love the great combination of the Wow elements and somewhat flashy design parts mixed with the warmth of lots of wood at the lobby and public areas. The guest rooms are I've stayed in are very well appointed and I personally love the sliding cabinet so that one does NOT have to look at the TV set at all time. Played the W CD set up in the Bose audio system in the room. Great sound, great to work or to chill out. Receptionists and Concierge are quite efficient and have a nice attitude about themselves without being arrogant, to make guests feel "cool" when checking in or out. On weekends, the lobby - called "living room" becomes full of activity with a DJ and lots of people enjoying drinks and food in the hyped up ambience. I liked it but it may not be everyone's taste due to sound levels. In comparison, the service team on two different stays were very transactional and had nothing of the qualities of the receptionists. Probably try to be cooler than the guests, Used the gym, just had everything in there which I needed and offers a great view over the outer harbor. Perfect for me. Used the Bliss Spa on the last trip, nice but pricey. Altogether, another great stay at the W, definitely to recommend.

Reviews.Title: “W = winning”
Reviews.Author: CrunchyJiff
Reviews.Content: Not Charlie Sheen-winning, of course--but rather an excellent overall experience. From the trendy decor to the digital "welcome" in the arrival floor elevators, the hotel presents the wow factor from minute one. The nice vibe carries through to the library-themed lift lobby on the guest floors and on into the room, with its soft palette and clean design. Our room had the nifty bathroom feature that allowed you to slide the floor-length mirrors closed for privacy; it also boasted a super-comfy bed, plenty of nooks for storage and a lovely view of the harbor. We enjoyed the in-room bells and whistles, too, from the bedside lighting/shade controls to the minibar stock, iPod dock, and daily newspaper. Our room upkeep was immaculate and all staff were friendly and helpful. We also took advantage of the rooftop pool--such a cool way to catch some rays and/or enjoy a cocktail from 76 floors up. For our purposes the location worked very well. The W is connected to the Elements mall and the Kowloon MTR, as well as the Airport Express line. Our outing to Lantau Island was a straight shot on the Tung Chung line; getting across to Hong Kong Island underground was just as easy; airport return was a breeze; and cabs were readily available for everything else. We had a blast and hope to be back.

Reviews.Title: “Best stay ever...”
Reviews.Author: MrYokyok
Reviews.Content: All hotels should be like this one, 4 nights stay with NO mistakes. Amazing service (light and discrete but so classy), great food quality, perfect decoration, amazing events concepts ("Wet" party at rooftop pool)... and so much more. From now on, this will be the only place I will stay in Hong Kong and "W" is definitely my favorite hotel chain, so much above all others. Go there and you'll understand...

Reviews.Title: “On the top of the world...”
Reviews.Author: BrotherYo
Reviews.Content: Views from this Hotel are great, rooms are fresh and pleasant, the dining area has the best brunch with the Alice in Wonderland theme show kitchen. Astonishing decor and pleasant employees. Wow is the right name for this place.

Reviews.Title: “Close to one of the best hotels I've stayed in”
Reviews.Author: scottpevans
Reviews.Content: This hotel is full of 'wow factor'! Whether it's from the 76th floor rooftop pool or the reception area....you find yourself in awe at the decor, architecture and overall experience. I just love the 2 days spent at this hotel. A perfect location right above Kowloon station, very handy for flight checkin (at the station) and easy access to all areas of hong kong on the underground. I would definitely stay here again for a weekend away!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Kowloon”
Reviews.Author: souyang06
Reviews.Content: Whenever I'm in Hong Kong I always stay here for many reasons. Though the location is not central or on the Hong Kong side the hotel is connected to Elements mall and the MTR Kowloon station. The mall has just about everything you need or want including brand name shops, a fabulous supermarket, multiple food options and much much more. The MTR is also extremely convenient and only takes 5-10 minutes to get to Central station. The hotel is always busy- which is a good sign. The views of the harbor are fantastic and different. You still get the the feel of having an ocean view but you also get to see the bustling ship and cargo docks which make for a great and interesting view. One of the bests parts about the W Hong Kong is their rooftop pool. Located on the 76th floor of the hotel, the pool is to die for. Their gym is very convenient, though not the most spacious. I've been to the W Taipei and their gym is way bigger and better than W Hong Kong's. As for the rooms, they are very comfortable and clean. Noise is kept at a minimum and service is usually prompt. I would recommend this place to anyone but the only draw back would be the location. If you have meetings or business on the Hong Kong side then I would suggest booking a hotel on the Hong Kong side for convenience reasons.

Reviews.Title: “Quality hotel, great staff and exceptional loction”
Reviews.Author: tippd
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the W HK when it first opened a couple of years ago, I was keen to revisit to see how it was faring. When we originally stayed at the hotel, there seemed to be a bit of brand confusion and the staff seemed to be struggling with the "W" concept. This is no longer the case. The hotel has that fantastic "W" vibe and has really come into it's own. The one thing we noticed during this stay is the exceptionally good staff. All friendly and helpful without being over-bearing. Special mention must go to Kathy at the concierge desk. She was extremely helpful in securing bar and dinner reservations and remembered me from my previous visit two years prior. Nothing was too much bother and she is a wonderful example of what quality service is all about. On this occasion, we stayed in a cool corner room. Great amount of space, excellent layout and very comfortable fit out. The beds are extraordinarily comfortable! Food quality in "the Kitchen" was great and I think reasonably priced. The "living room" bar also has a great ambiance with helpful staff. The location of the hotel is the icing on the cake with easy access to kowloon station to travel either to the airport or to central. All in all, a wonderful property and I can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey, but an amazing W with great amenities”
Reviews.Author: GeraldSingapore
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights and was pleasantly surprised by how different, and way better, this W is from it's American properties - from room size, service to amenities. The room was huge and came with standard W bedding and sheets. The curtains and lighting are controlled by a bedside panel and lighting options are preset with Day, Evening and Sleep settings to give you the right amount of lighting required. The curtains are electronically operated too. The bathroom was also very spacious with separate bath tub, shower with rain shower, and bathroom. Housekeeping was diligent and made sure bathroom amenities are constantly replenished when they come around for bed turning services in evenings. The room also had a water kettle for boiling water, and the property provides 2 free bottled water daily. If you need more, you can ask for them or just head to the gym and get it. The amenities of this hotel is truly the star. The open air pool is located on the 76th floor and the infinity edge gives a great view of Hong Kong. The gym is on 73rs and is equipped well. The changing rooms also had an awesome whirlpool that looks out into the Hong Kong skyline. The location, though not brilliant as it is not near the more often used and better connected subway lines, is sufficiently good as the airport express train reaches this hotel below directly (mere 20 min from the airport). The property is located within a huge development of malls and residences and the Elements mall (with many big brands) is connected to it. If you do not like to walk around alot, this hotel and the mall is more than enough. Although, having been to HK countless times, Elements is one of my least favourite malls as I find the layout confusing and dining options limited (though the average tourist may be awed by it). Personally, I like exploring HK island's Central (Landmark, IFC, the streets with dining options) where I can take the tram, or Harbour City in Tsim Sha Tsui with it's huge shopping variety and restaurants in and out of the mall. If you want to get out of the hotel, the Tung Chung subway line under the hotel gets you to Hong kong island's Central a stop away. If you want to explore Tsim Sha Tsui, the hotel does have a shuttle half hourly to get you to shopping mecca Harbour City with it's wide shopping assortment, or you can get a cab and it costs less than 30 HK dollars.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: tiny8463
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in April 2011 - Great location - right next door to a mall w/ a train station on the lower level. We simply walked down after breakfast each morning and jumped on the train to get going. We upgraded to a Fabulous room - I highly recommend. Very sumptuous and spacious w/ super cool mod touches. Each room in the hotel has a water view (not necessarily the harbor, but still a view). The breakfast buffet was delicious every morning and we enjoyed the friendly, efficient service. We really enjoyed our stay here and would highly recommend it if this is your first trip to Hong Kong - it was nice to get a taste of something familiar so far from home.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, need to be kept well maintained!”
Reviews.Author: Hotelier1983
Reviews.Content: Stayed there in 2010 with my family and we got a nice room with Harbour View (which was slightly blocked y the new Raffles opposite). The rooms are spacious, the furniture and carpet however need to be looked after well. The hotel opened only ~3 years ago and I stayed there in 2009 already, by then it was really WOW. The ipod dockingstation, the TV above the bathtub all great stuff, but need to be looked after well by housekeeping. The food was nice, well presented and reasonable priced. The Metrostation is just below in the Mall and gives the traveler the perfect link between the Airport and Central. Thanks to the W-Team, the FO and F&B Staff are really great!

Reviews.Title: “HIP - hip hooray!!!”
Reviews.Author: robnadcol
Reviews.Content: A totally happening hotel, where beautiful people come together. The cool lobby area on the 6th floor is perfect for gawking at the well-heeled, well-dressed, and ummm, well-endowed human traffic. Since my travelling companion and I fell into neither-of-the-above category, we were content to just admire from afar. Rooms were spacious and well designed, with all the latest in gadgets and fittings. Fantastic sound-proofing ensured a blissful, quiet sleep each night. No complaints about service or housekeeping - couldn't ask for more. The only grouse being that such a top-class hotel actually charges for wifi connection - something even HK's MTR (public transport system) provides, free of charge!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: windclems
Reviews.Content: Great service , the hotel itself is really well design, spacious room , the fully equipped gym is great for workout open 24h . There is a nice swimming pool and a jacuzzi on the top of the building with a fantastic view over hk skyline . A definitely can be trusted place in hk which enhance the hk experience

Reviews.Title: “'W'onderful Hotel for a short Hong Kong break”
Reviews.Author: RSSEnglishTraveller
Reviews.Content: If you need to visit Hong Kong for business or shopping this is the place to stay. The rooms are absolutely perfect and views terrific. Ultra modern, every conceivable room amenity has been thought of - mood lighting the lot. Yes it's expensive (as is the W Hotel in New York, where we stayed a few years ago where we found the rooms small, slightly shabby & staff very unfriendly) but it's worth the treat. The staff in HK are very helpful and friendly. We didn't eat there at all (too costly for 2 families of 4) but the W is next to a 'posh' shopping centre with a Pret a Manger (for Breakfast) and good restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great service & attentive staff”
Reviews.Author: HMCinSG
Reviews.Content: Undoubtedly people visit this hotel because of it's reputation of being hip, but it deserves the attention it gets. Staff here are genuinely happy, eager to help and are really well trained. The lobby on level 6 can often be very crowded - check in and out can mean long queues and you sometimes have to avoid groups from mainland China intent on photo taking. For some peace head to level 76 @ Wet where the pool is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: TravelEatPrayLove
Reviews.Content: We visited Hong Kong for 3 nights and it was my first time here ever. Hong Kong is crazy. Very loud, busy and fun. Definitely a culture shock at first. It was so nice to come back to the hotel after a long day of exploring and trying to navigate around in the chaos. The staff were friendly and very helpful. We arrived jet-lagged and out of it, so the staff whisked us out of the car, past the check-in desk and straight up to our *upgraded* room. They checked us in while we unpacked and relaxed in the comfort of our room, which was amazing. Quiet and extremely comfortable stay. The food in the lounge is great (the flat noodle dish was a fave), the cocktails are good. The pool is on the rooftop of the building, but is relatively small (compared to others) and lacks sun past a certain point in the day. Also, it fills up quickly, as there aren't a lot of lounge chairs. This hotel is attached to a mall, which is full of great shopping and really good restaurants. Cab ride to the main part of HK was about 10 minutes tops, and about 10 dollars. Or you can take the train, which is in the mall also. Will definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “The hip hotel in HK.....”
Reviews.Author: GeorgeSingapore
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here for 5 times and always been excellent experience. Being a platinum SPG they always upgrade me into a suite. State of the art systems in the room including a lighting dimmer, Bang & Olufsen home theater, etc. Cons: location & at one time they didn't do a proper turn-down service in the room.

Reviews.Title: “A very cool hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rich2809
Reviews.Content: I only stayed for one night on my way to Shenzhen but I enjoyed my stay very much. Room was a good size, well equipped and comfortable. The breakfast was very good and as with all W's I have stayed at the staff were great. Lots od smiles etc. The train ride from the airport was only 22 minutes and stops more or less at the hotel. It was much quicker riding in by train than taking a limo or a taxi. On the way back to the airport, you can check your bags at the train station. A great time saving idea. One little niggle, no executive lounge.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Will stay here in the future”
Reviews.Author: sunsamny1
Reviews.Content: The W is a new, modern hotel with many amenities. The rooms are spacious and comfortable. Service was very good, everyone was very friendly and helpful. It was very quiet and has great views. If working in ICC tower, this is a great hotel to stay. The underground mall is convenient for restaurants, shopping and Three Sixty (groceries, desserts, meals, beverages, etc). Would definitely stay here again when returning to Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Party on, Wayne. Party on, Wang”
Reviews.Author: mediageezer
Reviews.Content: Awesome hotel. Best beds ever. Great views. Great location. Great bar. Great food and one of the best pool parties I've ever been to - being a hotel guest you get in with no need to score a ticket in advance. Stylish to the max. Top shopping next door. Only complaint - the dark lobby and bar which mean that you don't get to see your companions at their glamorous best.

Reviews.Title: “W always delivers above and beyond”
Reviews.Content: As a frequent traveler it is so nice to stay in a hotel that gets everything right. I am so used to excuses and apologies that to stay anywhere that delivers on its promises has become the exception instead of the rule. You can take the airport train directly into the complex where the hotel is located and the subway is also in this complex making entry and exit effortless. The staff at W is top notch and a breathe of fresh air. It is so nice to give raves and the W deserves it. The views of the harbor are fantastic, spend the extra cash, it's worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Craig A
Reviews.Content: The W Hotel is an absolutely amazing place! The staff are very helpful and there was always someone on hand to provide advice. The room was excellently designed with some fun additions (pre-set lighting to suit certain times of day, a back lit mirror in the bathroom, soaker tub with built in tv). The pool on the 76th floor affords amazing views of the harbour and Hong Kong island. Built right above the Elements Mall (and Kwoloon Airport Express MTR station) this hotel is incredibly convenient (especially if you are departing for the airport in the morning). The food at Kitchen restaurant was excellent, however the atmosphere was a bit lacking. Be prepared for lots of kids if you're going to eat there. Overall and amazing experience.

Reviews.Title: “stayed here four times - great experience every time.”
Reviews.Author: ap0k
Reviews.Content: I regularly travel to Hong Kong for work and always try to stay at the W. The amenities are fantastic and the rooms have good views of the harbour. Additionally the bar has some special wine/cheese-tasting nights which are super affordable and fun. The staff at the W are always helpful and friendly and i've never had a problem at check-in. Its always fast and efficient. The pool is a definite highlight of the hotel where its on the top of the building. great views and lots of sun( when its not smoggy ). The location of the W is inside the Elements mall which has tons of shopping and different restaurants to try. The only downside of the W is that its on the Kowloon side; if you're accustomed to being on the main-land, there is the subway right below the hotel where you can take it one stop over into HK island. On the other hand, if you want to see the REAL hong kong, kowloon is the place to be.

Reviews.Title: “What an experience, what a view and what a swimming pool!”
Reviews.Author: RplusS
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights. This hotel is amazing! Conveniently located above Kowloon Station on the express airport/city train route, and within the up-market Elements shopping centre, and nearby Tsim Sha Choi – hotel shuttle (ie Ocean Terminal and Nathan Road shops). We upgraded to a waterview (western aspect) and 36th Floor – stunning unimpeded view and the room and fit-out was superb. The service and staff were impeccable. As swimmers, we were amazed and thoroughly enjoyed the outdoor pool – situated on the 76th Floor (with work-out gym one floor below) and perched along the eastern edge of the building with spectacular views N, E & S over HKG and the harbour and neighbouring islands – an experience definitely not to be missed.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, fab service ... busy design”
Reviews.Author: Mel S
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for work for two nights. Hotel service and comfort was great ... although the room design was a bit too busy for me. Breakfast was delicious and the bar at night was fun. Cool buzzy hotel with attitude too match (fun respectable attitude) ... pity it was not on the island!

Reviews.Title: “Like Kelly Wearstler threw up.”
Reviews.Author: PickACard
Reviews.Content: Perhaps the most over-designed space I've ever been in. The ground level entry with the huge backlit 'W,' giant stylized tree trunk and horse sculpture made out of speakers is is cool, but from the minute you step on the video-screened floor of the the elevator to get to the reception level, things start to go a bit crazy. There's simply too much going on everywhere you look. The design concepts are completely disconnected and it's a shame because some of the elements are rather interesting. Reception was very friendly and efficient. The hallway to the guest rooms was great and had a sort of Alice in Wonderland feel, kitted out like a private library shelved with various books and personal items all sculpted in white. (Good luck finding the elevator call button which is hidden in the design.) The room was spacious and fairly cool with sliding walls that could be moved around for heightened bathroom privacy. The bathroom was large with separate bath, shower and toilet areas. Like the rest of the hotel, there was a bit too much going on in the room design-wise, but it was nowhere near as disjointed as the public spaces. The room had a nice view of the harbor, but don't expect the the postcard picture; this hotel is nowhere near the iconic waterfront of Hong Kong. In fact it's not near very much you'll want to see as a tourist (except the rather outstanding mall that it's attached to) but it's only about a twenty minute walk to the ferry. The rooftop pool is a highlight of this hotel. The view is mostly blocked by the neighboring buildings, as is the sun after about 1PM, but if you go early it's a great place to hang out and recharge. The giant wall mosaic is a standout design feature of the hotel and reiterates the 'down the rabbit hole' theme of the hallways. Overall we enjoyed our stay here, but next time I'd opt for a better located hotel that's not trying so hard to prove something.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent bar and breathtaking pool”
Reviews.Author: hennessyparadis
Reviews.Content: Stayed at W Hong Kong in Feb 2011 when the nearby area was undergoing major renovations. Location Literally above the Kowloon station, very easy access from/to the airport and to the Island. If you like to walk like myself, the location exposes challenges - due to the construction going on around it's not easily accessible. The hotel provides a shuttle service to Tsim Sha Tsui luckily. The rooms The rooms sport floor to ceiling windows around the marina area. The densily lighted Island looks fabulous in the evenings. The rooms we stayed in were modern, very clean and spacious with a lot of excellent details with regards to lighting, ipod connectors, music facilities and gadgets - the bathroom was also lovely. The shower tap felt slightly hard to operate and could perhaps pose a problem for the elderly. Having said that, we experienced a disagreeable smell - something I would describe as "moth poison" - in our first room. Front desk staff took our issues very seriously and changed our rooms the second night however the same particular smell prevailed. The bar Fantastic furniture, decoration and a wow ceiling. *Excellent* drinks. Five o'clock tea definitely worth a shot, too. The pool Breathtaking experience at the outdoor W pool on the 76th floor. Wonderful views from the 28 C heated pool! Would benefit from changing rooms Overall Excellent hotel and facilities. The room scent was however an issue and the location was not ideal for our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and modern, like all W hotels”
Reviews.Author: Jack_Islington
Reviews.Content: Good location if you plan to be in Kowloon as opposed to Hong Island. Easy access to Kowloon train station which provides fast airport service. The Sin Ying Cantonese restaurant is excellent, and great for business with tables set up in a relatively private manner. Not within walking distance to many attractions outside of a shopping mall, but never have to wait for a taxi. Rooms are slightly small for the money, but that's typical for any W.

Reviews.Title: “Big WOW factor with this hotel...make sure you swim in the pool”
Reviews.Author: MrShhh
Reviews.Content: This is an impressive W Hotel in every sense of the word but it may not suit traditionalists- it is trendy hip & definitely has swagger. Don't leave without swimming in the pool- watch the numerous planes, helicopters and especially the light show from the island. The view is pretty special. This hotel probably has the best breakfast of any hotel we have stayed at- WOW. The dinner buffet too was very impressive but- perhaps to be a little picky- at times a bit inconsistent. We stayed for the Sunday lunch with champagne- WOW. The position is not central- if you like walking then you will have quite a walk into town (there is a free shuttle) but you are positioned very close to the trains- how good is checking in for your flight home from the train station-WOW. The attached Elements shopping centre is good but you do need to venture out for the real shopping. The staff are just good, they don't show a lot of personality. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “My best W experience”
Reviews.Author: DrinkByThePool
Reviews.Content: Had a great experience at W Hong Kong. It is in the mall directly above the Kowloon station connecting to the airport as well as Central, very convenient. The staff is friendly and confident. They gave me a room upgrade when i presented my SPG gold card. Nice chocolate plate was waiting for me in the room. The room is large and gorgeous, with a view to the harbour. The breakfast was delicious with many choices. The rooftop gym and swimming pool were also very nice. If I had the time, I would definitely use them. This is a hotel I will come back for both business and vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish W”
Reviews.Author: cinclus
Reviews.Content: As a fil rouge of W chain, the hotel displays a minimal design furniture both in the hall and in the rooms. The location in Kowloon allows a gorgeous view on the bay and on the skycrapers on the island. Reception and concierge staff always available for any request. On of most delicious breakfast I have ever had (alongside with Grand Hotel Stockolm) in a spacious restaurant while looking at the bustling traffic in the bay. Very wide offer of pastries and juices, in addition to typical Asian breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience overall”
Reviews.Author: yichiban
Reviews.Content: Fun and modern decor. Rooms are well equipped but a bit small. Nice rooftop pool with a great view of HK skyline. The staffs were very friendly and helpful. We will be checking out more Ws around the world. This one did not disappoint.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel,will Surely come back”
Reviews.Author: saurabhkh
Reviews.Content: I travelled with my family for 5 Nights,One of the best hotel in Hongkong,I did lot of research before booking this Hotel and recommend to all traveller,it is next to one of the best Mall "Elements" and Kowloon Station,it was very Convenient to travel as Train is the best way to travel within Hongkong,it is 5 min away from Ferry Station if people have to go to Macau/Shenzhen,best thing i like about this hotel is that the bell boy take your baggae to Check In counter at Kowloon and you dont have to carry baggage to airport and you check in and get boarding passes at Kowloon Station only and it is 20-25 min to airport,so you can relax

Reviews.Title: “Best W Hotel We've Stayed At (for work or play)!”
Reviews.Author: cdellacava
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel is outstanding - from the very friendly and helpful reception/concierge staff (who helped us book babysitters and see the best of Hong Kong) to the modern and incredibly comfortable rooms, wonderful Bliss Spa, state-of-the-art gym, and rooftop pool. I had stayed here for work in the past and it was a fantastic business hotel; what surprised and delighted us was that it translated into a fabulous family hotel as well. Great location to boot - very easy access to airport, Hong Kong island and elsewhere given literally co-located at Kowloon Station.

Reviews.Title: “"W" has me sold!”
Reviews.Author: flightcrew1
Reviews.Content: We were booked in here for 4 nights. We arrived into Hong Kong very late and thus arrived at hotel around midnight. Train direct from airport to Kowloon Station was handy but as the mall was closed it took a bit of searching in the closed mall to find the hotel. Check-in was really quick and as it was a Friday evening the lobby bar was quite busy and looked fun. We had a booked their basic "Wonderful" room and as we were tired settled in for the evening. Great bed and great sleep. Shower was great and Bliss products supplied were so good that I ended up purchasing the face wash and shower gel in the shop before leaving. We had booked a great package of stay 2 get 3rd free with breakfast included. Breakfast was great and is not to be missed and one night we had dinner at the "Chef's Table" as the main restaurant was booked out. Dinner was also great. We have been to Hong Kong many times and basically only went for the summer sales and of course were not let down. As the hotel is located above the Elements Mall this makes for great convenience with many shops and restaurants. The late afternoons/early evenings were spent at the pool which is amazing and the gym which has everything we need. We had coffee in the lobby one afternoon and the "afternoon tea spread" looked great. We were full from lunch but asked would it be possible to get some cookies from the spread. They brought us a whole plateful and did not charge Concierge service was great and helped us to get some elusive famous egg tarts from "Pie and Tart", which we are never able to find. They called and ordered them for us and had them delivered to the hotel. I've stayed in many hotels in Hong Kong and have to say this one so far is my favorite. It's convenient for both the airport and getting around Hong Kong. Rooms are a good size and comfortable. We were there just to shop and eat and relax and the "W" did not let us down. We are looking forward to our next stay with "W".

Reviews.Title: “Because of W hotel, my holiday in HK was such a memorable impressive one.”
Reviews.Author: Travelaholic_10
Reviews.Content: I LOVE W HOTEL! The moment when David (a Sweden who handled my check in) brought me and opened the door to my room at 32th floor, my eyes were wide opended and so amazed with the spectacular view of the Kowloon harbour , oh my , this. is so. beautiful. Room was very spacious, clean, cool, and modern. Bed was king sized and very comfortable. Bathroom was luxurious, bathtub with individual controlled TV, strong and powerful rain shower and Bliss shampoo and bath soap , plenties of towels to use. Complimentary coffee was really good. I was really in haven. Everything is perfect, location is excellent, MRT at Element (the hotel is linked to Element) , I easily checked in my luggage at the Airport Check In counter located at Element. and took the airport express train to airport (about 30 mins). Fast , easy and hassle free. (MRT ticket is HKD90.00) OH there is one con, i must say, i was really reluctant to go out to shopping and walk around HK, as I just want to stay in the room as long as possible. That defeat my purpose to come to HK for shopping and eating.

Reviews.Title: “Liked the hotel ... but a bit too much for me”
Reviews.Author: denisejw_trip
Reviews.Content: Great food. Interesting Design. Delicious food. But overall the hotel was a but too intense for me. It was you would expect at a W ... but this hotel's attitude was turned up. Don't get me wrong, staff were friendly and service was fine. But i was left cold and found the rooms not suitable or comfortable for me.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning view, gorgeous rooms, unparalleled service”
Reviews.Author: UncleDMD
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night and couldn't have been more pleased. The check in was courteous and solicitous beyond belief. The Starwood staff were full of information, advice and suggestions and helped with a lost luggage problem with the airline. Our room had a truly stunning view of sunset over the harbor. We were given a 100 HK dollar discount at the restaurant, which we took advantage of. The only regrettable part of our stay was dinner, when we were stuck in a brighly-lit back room, seemingly a function room, rather than in one of the romantic booths in the front. Nevertheless, we were extremely pleased with our experience overall. The convenient high-speed train to the airport makes transfers a breeze and obviates paying for taxis.

Reviews.Title: “Classy hotel with a vibrant setting”
Reviews.Author: althaus
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 2 nights on rate that includes breakfast and internet. Was told to wait for an hour before I could check in as room is being cleaned, but as I arrived at 11am it was early. Complimentary wifi with lots of seating area in the lobby which is reached via an elevator. Lobby location can be inconvenient since guests have to switch elevators to exit the hotel. Room has an open plan setting and bathroom doors cannot be locked which could be a problem for families. Offered an upgrade to full ocean view room but I declined since ocean view is not worth it in is property. Partial Harbour view rooms have some view of Central and IFC since the best view is blocked by th ICC tower in front anyway. So just pick for the partial Harbour view rooms which are better in my opinion. Smartly designed rooms have a mirror cabinet covering the plasma TV when not in use. Bathroom has separate bathtub and rain shower area. Bathtub has a tv screen which works very well. Cool stationery and amenities in the room exudes a very hip and trendy feel for the W brand. The location of the hotel atop Elements mall is great for access to the airport but it's a bit of a walk to other tourist hotspots. Hotel provides a shuttle but the service was not that satisfactory, but the transport is via a Toyota Alphard which was cool. Breakfast at the lobby was one of the best hotel breakfast and do arrive early for seats by the window with great Harbour views. One drawback of this hotel is that lobby and public areas can get busy and loud as they play some hip trance music. The hotel gym and swimming pool at the top offers guests the best views from the hotel and the gym is one if the best equipped, providing guests with earphones and water bottles, Overall it is one of the nicest hotels to stay and definitely a very stylish property. It has become a favorite hotel in HK though first timers to the city should choose hotels in Tsim Sha Tsui for better access to the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great New Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bassetthound18
Reviews.Content: Fantastic property with fun and quirky details expected from the W brand. The rooftop pool is incredible, as is the spa and fitness area. The only downside is that the pool & spa are located so far above the hotel rooms and its only serviced by one (maybe two) elevators that the elevator waits are ridiculously long!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it but....”
Reviews.Author: dorycook
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our 3 night stay in W hk. Great roof top swimming pool, great that its part of a shopping complex (elements Mall), great that it has new rooms and Bliss is their copmlimentary toiletries. Rooms are not that big. Restaurant or food outlets arent that many. I im counting correct they only have 2-3. Not really the hotel for you if you wanna do some window shopping as is the case if your in causeway bay or central or nathan road. I dont agree with their policy of charging a very stiff security deposit. This hotel is up there but still far from the standards of a grand hyatt, four seasons or a ritz carlton at least in hong kong. Staying in this hotel means taking the cab a lot. I just love also that the hk airport express terminal is part of the complex so checking in is always a breeze. Something is lacking in my overall experience in my brief stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Had breakfast at Kitchen”
Reviews.Author: deltaalpha
Reviews.Content: Kitchen at the W Hong Kong is freaking awesome for breakfast. I'm not overselling it, it just is. Breakfast starts at 6:30-10:30(?) and it's priced at about HKD230 +10% per person. Truly, one of the best breakfast buffets we've ever tried. They've got a pastry table that is just to die for, some fresh juice in a bottle. Salad bar, juice smoothies (yes they blend it themselves), eggs station however you want it, and other breakfast choices for the health-conscious like steamed egg, congee, cereal, etc. The ambiance is great, the staff is even better. They clear your table after you're done with your plate, and they really take initiative with refilling your tea/coffee. I wouldn't go often because it's a little pricey, but I would, in all honesty, go back. Classy place, fresh food, good people. That's all you need to know.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, slightly out of the way”
Reviews.Author: tnu
Reviews.Content: The W is a very nice hotel that lives up to the brand and image of the W hotels globally. Cool, chic, stylish... Very comparable to other branded 5 star hotels in HK like the Four Seasons, the Shangri-la, Conrad, Upper House, etc. Hardware and service is good, but the location is its weakest point. Taxis are not an issue, but the only area one can walk to in the middle of summer is the Elements Mall downstairs or the ICC office complex (if you are working there). The Elements Mall is very nice with lots of shops and restaurants to choose from. However, the only subway lines provide less convenient access to other parts of Hong Kong. Tsim Sha Tsui is not very accessible, other than by taxi, and most of Hong Kong requires a change of train (slightly inconvenient - particularly at rush hour) which is less than is needed by some of the hotels that sit on top of Central or Admiralty stations. Admiralty (Conrad, Upper House, Shangri-la) seems to offer the most seamless subway access to TST as well as all of HK Island.

Reviews.Title: “So convenient”
Reviews.Author: StarrySue
Reviews.Content: I will definitely stay here again, it's located right above the mall that not only houses a Starbucks (when you need consistent coffee, Starbucks in China is a life saver), but numerous shops and restaurants, as well as the train and MTR. Subway is one of the most convenient ways to travel, if not on foot, when you know your destination. You can train it from the airport right to the hotel and back, even check in at the station. You don't even need a cab, air conditioning throughout, a welcome element when dealing with humidity in a metropolitan city. The train is also great if you are attending the Accessories trade show, if you're registered, your trip on the train is free (if I remember correctly). So much more convenient and faster than taking the bus. Service was fantastic, the staff (bell men, concierge, registration, gym, pool) we're all helpful and informative. The gym is very clean, tons of water bottles, so you will never be dehydrated. The pool has a great view, but I didn't stay out to relax since it was overcast and drizzly. High speed internet was fast and nothing was censored online, totally a different store when on the mainland. The iPod dock was a little confusing at first, but in 10 minutes I was listening to my own music while prepping for the work day. Rooms are spacious and the bathrooms are nice. Bliss spa products are a fantastic bonus. This hotel is really convenient if you like public transportation and exploring Hong Kong. Didn't try the restaurants, but we did have some drinks at the bar - expensive, although convenient if you're tired at the end of the day.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: ssinlon
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, stylish, comfortable, all the amenities and comforts you would want with great service. We loved the gym and the roof-top pool. The breakfast is amazing and well worth trying. The location in Kowloon is very useful as it is above the underground station and affords great views over the island and the harbour.

Reviews.Title: “Great view from WET”
Reviews.Author: Selectscott
Reviews.Content: Quick and convenient to reach W Hong Kong from the airport, and easily accessed through Elements shopping mall. The welcome and check in was great and efficient, and took us no time until we were relaxing in our corner suite. Quite a funky hotel and cutting edge design, but what else would you expect from Hong Kong? WET on the 76 floor has a great view over Victoria Bay and quite impressive after the sun goes down. The sauna/steam/hot bath has a great view through huge windows of very calming. Dinner Buffet at Kitchen was quite a spread and offered a huge range of delicacies. Originally thought that 5 days in Hong Kong may be a bit long, but was extremely comfortable and could have happily stayed longer. As always the shopping in HK was great and having Elements downstairs was too tempting when at a loose end. Great hotel and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “What a shame -poor service - last orders at 12.30”
Reviews.Author: alexandert
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this property for three nights - unfortunately this is the first time a W hotel disappointed me. The rooms product is ok - more of a Sheraton feel than the usually cool W style. Arriving at the hotel at around 1 in the afternoon my room was not yet ready and I was promised a call on my cellphone - I waited until 5 only to find out they had forgotten to call. The gym facilities are decent enough, but again compared to other W properties I have stayed at in recent weeks a little basic. The gym was staffed every now again - staff were however too busy playing on the xbox to look after guests. The breakfast buffet at Kitchen looks fantastic - unfortunately the food quality on quite a number of items was not great and the service mediocre at best. My orange juice twice turned out to be pineapple juice, waiting to sign the bill every morning was very annoying and most pastries and breads were very dry and not fresh. The pool on the top floor is very impressive, great loungers, cool infinity pool with fantasic views - unfortunately the usually great W pool ingredients of music, beverage service etc were missing. Though there were plenty of staff they were too busy chatting with each other to notice guests. To me the most disappointing aspect of all was that at 12.30 at night the bar staff would go around and asked everyone for last orders. At 1 in the morning, the bar pretty packed lights are turned on as brightly as possible, the music gets switched off and the drinks at the bar get covered by purple towels. My colleague and I watched in amazement as group after group of potential guests got turned away from about 12.15 onwards - once again service is very slow as staff are too busy chatting. Overall the hotel's hardware has the potential to one day be a proper W hotel - the hotel's service however is very poor.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, would be better if located closer to the action”
Reviews.Author: dancemonkey
Reviews.Content: I have been a fan of W Hotels for a while now and I was interested to see how this most American of hotel chains would translate in Hong Kong. The W Hotel is Hong Kong doesn't disappoint. Visually it is stunning and the rooms are in immaculate condition and jam packed with the usual neat features and technology. We had a standard room on this trip and while it wasn't large, it was spacious enough. The hotel comes with a free gym that has a great range of equipment. We also had the dim sum in the hotel's Chinese Restaurant and it was one of the best meals we had in Hong Kong. Location wise it is a bit out of the way, but it is a short taxi ride to most of the key sites (taxis are also very cheap in HK). The one bonus of the location is that the hotel is located right above the fast train from the airport - it couldn't be easier to get into town. Would I stay here again - maybe, the hotel itself was great - it just needs to be more centrally located.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and busy hotel”
Reviews.Author: jechho
Reviews.Content: Just finished a stay at this hotel. Like others here have said: This is a truly great hotel. Loved the pool area! However, be aware that the hotel is fully booked almost every night, and that there seem to be a party or other type of function there most days. It creates a buzz, but can also be overwhelming. The lobby area is e.g. busy, very busy. Day and night. In addition: If you are a light sleeper, you might try to get a room not facing the freeway - or at least a high floor room (16 is the lowest, 38 the highest). It seems that the rooms/suites ending in xx01 (and the ones close to that) is most effected by the freeway and harbor traffic. Oddly, those seems to be the most expensive rooms as well - so there are usually no problem changing rooms (as we did).

Reviews.Title: “Fixed the pool problems!! well done”
Reviews.Author: teamflames
Reviews.Content: Just stayed for a week at the W with my grandmother. I live just nearby and have had mixed experiences with the W in the past. I have had visiting family stay here on numerous occasions in the past with generally positive experiences but the pool was always a letdown as the staff were lazy and we struggled to get food and drinks which was always a shame given the spectacular setting of the pool - luckily that has all CHANGED!! The pool staff were less in number but twice as useful and they now have a pool bar - we had dinner there twice and numerous drinks - so thanks for fixing that issue! Room was great, as usual beds were extremely comfortable, large bathroom and lots of little gadgets. The staff did a terrific job cleaning and turning down the room everyday. My grandmother used the car service which was efficient but driver not friendly. I used gym everyday, it has great views and great equipment and the staff were very friendly. Check -in and check out was easy, we tried to join SPG but they wouldnt give points for the accommodation which was a shame. As mentioned we ate and drank regularly at the pool which is a superb location. Food was good (the portion of some of the snacks was a bit small for the price). We ate at the new cantonese restaurant and it was great dim sum - up there with the best in HK. Had drinks again at the living room, terrific service. Drinks were good but inconsistent when the bartenders changed. Didnt use Bliss Spa as I have had numerous problems with them in the past not honouring promotional offers and have found the desk staff there to be rude and unprofessional. (Recommend the spa at the four seasons - expensive but awesome). Location - I live in the area and like it but understand for tourists its not perfect. In terms of getting to/from airport its great as its at Kowloon station (convenient to get to HK island). You have elements shopping centre which is much like most of the upmarket shopping centres in Asia - also has a cinema and ice-rink. There is a free shuttle to TST and taxi's are cheap anyway so not a big deal. All in all a good fun hotel, comfortable rooms and now a pool worth hanging out at! recommended

Reviews.Title: “I could have quite happily moved in for good”
Reviews.Author: rwhite732
Reviews.Content: A few years ago I stayed at one of the W Hotels in New York and it was amazing. As a result I look out for them when I travel and was pleased to see there was one in my most recent stop over - Hong Kong. In saying this, I was so in love with my experience in NYC that it can be a tall order to live up to that and invariably you come away feeling let down. Thankfully this wasn't the case. It was fantastic! Great service and the room was brilliant. I couldn't really think of anything that wasn't there that i may have needed and everything felt like it was top quality. The location was great - so quick to the airport by train and an excellent shopping mall on the doorstep. It had everything I looked for in a great hotel and I will most definitely be back and recommending.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: snokie
Reviews.Content: impressive entrance, lift to the lobby with all the lights, everywhere a modern, clubstyle athmosphere we liked a lot. Great view if not raining or foggy. Extremly nice and helpfull staff around. Pool location 76th floor with an stunning overview about the city. Room design awesome. Little downsides: many coffeespots on the carpet, location a bit far away from the hot downtown aerea of Hong Kong Island and they should buy different soap-dishes :-) Another upside the flexible booking proceedure patienly dealing with my booking request.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, loved the breakfast and the pool”
Reviews.Author: eplekake
Reviews.Content: A bit on the pricey side, but the breakfast, the pool and the views made it worthwhile

Reviews.Title: “Really Cool Hotel. Loved the energy, but it's not for my usual Hong Kong shopping trip!”
Reviews.Author: BexTravel82
Reviews.Content: The W Hong Kong was really nice! The hotel was awesome, ultra modern, chic, funky but all in a good way! If you're idea of traveling to Hong Kong is for party, laid-back hanging out and you really don't care for the shopping - this hotel is for you! Especially if you're just gonna party with your friends this will definitely complete your trip. But as for me, I love the shopping side of Hong Kong - whether I stay on Kowloon side or Hong side. That's why the location of W wasn't ideal for my HK trips... sad... I really did love the hotel! W's downside - the mall Elements where its connected to... hmm.. Boring, compared to the other places in HK! But if you like to go around and not just stay around the area of your hotel... W would be very accessible since the Kowloon station is just under! The food - it was ok . Nothing great. Kitchen; W's breakfast area was very cool! ambience wise but the food was not that great! Still, after all I 'm happy I stayed and saw the different vibe of W Hong Kong! And I think the Spa was really nice - by Bliss! Though I wasn't able to try it.

Reviews.Title: “Great design with even better service!”
Reviews.Author: Passionflower200050
Reviews.Content: Situated above the Kowloon MTR station this hotel is amazingly convenient and certainly lives up to the hip W reputation with one additional surprise being exceptional service! Having visited HK before, we didn't get out to see any sights but spent time in the hotel and Elements Mall - the hotel has everything you need for a relaxing, fun weekend. Having stayed in W's before the staff can sometimes be a little on the aloof side however this is not the case in Hong Kong. It was our second visit to this hotel and all the staff were attentive and friendly, going the extra mile to help with a smile or a laugh. The room design is well implemented, relaxing colours and plenty of space. The property has been very well maintained, not showing any signs of aging (another pleasant surprise for an asian hotel). You will find an Ipod dock, KEF sound system, fun mini bar and bathroom amenities from the Bliss spa which are great. The pool on the 76th floor has a fabulous outlook and catches the morning sun. It's not a huge area but more than adequate for a relaxing weekend (that we had). Breakfasts in the Kitchen are delicious and cocktails in the living room are not lacking in alcohol!! We love this property and will be back.

Reviews.Title: “cozy rooms, decent location”
Reviews.Author: taipa
Reviews.Content: The standard rooms are a little on the small side, but very nicely appointed with modern bathroom and comfortable bed. The location is kind of a tossup. It's directly connected to the airport express MRT via the mall, but theres not much in the direct vicinity. Views are of the shipping cargo yard. Would stay again if the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Reb_Jim
Reviews.Content: Such a stylish and amazing hotel. Attention to detail with the finish and service is amazing. We were escorted to our room by a manager as staying for 7 nights was longer than the average traveller. Made to feel welcome and enjoyed that the staff (especially the concierge boys at ground level entrance) had some personality. Totally convienient location - being above the train station we did not have to leave air conditioned comfort to get to Central in no time. And the pool...the view from the pool, and the mosiac art! We loved being able to see the purple beacon of the pool when over on the Island, which made us want to hurry back. Recomend it 100%

Reviews.Title: “Amazing.”
Reviews.Author: portfolioflyer
Reviews.Content: This hotel was amazing. The views were great, the W Hotel is located inside a huge mall, and it was amazingly easy to get to from the airport. We arrived in HK, took the airport express, and 24 minutes later, we were at the front door of our hotel. There are a few things that were slightly less than desirable, but it did not detract from the overall experience. First off, the location is about a 10-15 minute walk from the city. So if you wanted to go anywhere, you either take a taxi or the shuttle provided free of charge.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, keeps getting better!”
Reviews.Author: wrigsfes
Reviews.Content: I have been staying here since it opened - the service keep getting better. The staff is helpful and responsive and the ease of travel from the airport to the hotel can not be beat. The bed is one of the most comfortable beds that I have ever slept in. View of the city from the pool is not to be missed - even if you don't plan to swim you at least need to go check out the view!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: ivoryhorns
Reviews.Content: It was an anticipating trip to the hotel. I was thrilled to be able to stay in of the top-notch hotels in hongkong however there were 2 factors that put me off First, guest service was ridiculously below expectations. Second, breakfast was way too expensive and there wasn't a great variety for selection. The location is alright and there's a big mall. The views from the rooms are good and the interiors are modern and sleek. However, the hotel is still far from being top notch and they need lots of improvement in terms of customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy, Chic, but noisy!”
Reviews.Author: fleurbean
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights after reading some great reviews from this website. I did not meet any booking problems as some people have mentioned, but while i was checking in, i did see some angry people at the other counter scolding the manager for having them to wait for hours trying to fix booking problems. The room was really noisy when we entered, as they had turned on the TV with a fashion with really loud house music...... which was turned off immediately. The hotel breakfast was really nice, with a large selection of food to choose from, and the service was really great ! Cons: The hotel is far away from the main attraction and tourist sites, but easy access to airport. The music is always turned on too loudly in the rooms. No high speed internet in the rooms, only available in the lobby....very inconvenient. Pros: chic, trendy hotel, comfortable beds!

Reviews.Title: “Confusion”
Reviews.Author: GoldenDragon338
Reviews.Content: Total confusion with my booking. Got another guest's booking and messages. Informed hotel about it during stay. When checking out, still the confusion remained. Have complained to them and they say that it is not their normal procedure but no explanation as to why it went wrong. Surely a hotel of this calibre can cope with guest with similar name? Breech of privacy was overlook too. The hotel was not too bad otherwise. Best thing for me was the direct link to the airport. Offered upgrade next time I stay.

Reviews.Title: “The Best”
Reviews.Author: nihongo69
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the best I have stayed at, for me it is exactly what I like. The designer of this hotel is amazing. Modern , Unique, Trendy and most important functional! I guess what I like best is the attention to detail, but 100 little details that in the end add up to an amazing stay. The details extend for the room to the great details to breakfast buffet in the morning. The pool on the 76th floor amazing and pool side food was great. I only stayed one night so only had breakfast the next morning. Sorry I never had more time to enjoy this fantastic property a definite return!

Reviews.Title: “Really chic!”
Reviews.Author: lennyfoust
Reviews.Content: I stayed a couple of nights with a few friends. Really chic hotel coupled with friendly service made it one of the best hotel experiences. Love the art-deco theme and of course the pool on the 76th floor except it was not really sunny the day we were there so kinda spoiled it for us but nonetheless we still had fun up there. Funny thing, some of us couldn't find the elevator buttons which were cleverly camouflaged in the book shelf. Oh another thing, celebrated my 30th birthday at the lounge/bar, a tad disappointed it didn't have pastries or something similar. Ended up sharing a tiny dessert between the 4 of us haha but still it was cool to welcome the big 3 0 at W Hotel. TQ W.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel - didn't want to leave... Superb.”
Reviews.Author: KarenLN75
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the W for a couple of nights after staying with some friends in HK. I felt like pampering myself and my word did the W deliver. Without exception all the staff were wonderful - when I went down for breakfast on day two the girl greeted me by name on sight - pretty impressive! The room was phenomenal, with a wonderful view of the harbour and the ICC. So many mod-cons in the room, with fantastic sound from the TV and docking station - it felt like Ibiza in a hotel room, for want of a better description! Bathroom was exceptional and the bed was almost ridiculously comfortable. Whatever bedlinen they use, I am tracking it down and having it - amazing. Breakfast was the most plentiful I've seen in Asia in a long while - and the quality was superb. The rooftop pool was the main attraction for me - incredible views of Hong Kong. Since it's a newly opened hotel, there was no bar or food area up there, but I understand a bar is due to open by the end of June. Some HK friends came to meet me in the Living Room bar one evening and all were very impressed. It has great decor and great tunes - the Beachcomber cocktail is fantastic. If they can replicate that kind of vibe upstairs in the pool area they'll be laughing. Location wise, it being in Kowloon, it's not so great for business on the island - however Kowloon MTR and the airport express is downstairs within the same building (and you can check in for your flight down there prior to getting the airport express) and is less than a 5 minute stroll from reception. I got a cab there from Soho and it was $140HK, which I thought was fine. All in all - the W hotel group has made a new fan out of me and I am already looking forward to my return in a couple of months. Superb.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in kowloon”
Reviews.Author: AjmMelbourne
Reviews.Content: Perfect location for overnight stop in hong kong Room is very comfotable Resturants also are good standard

Reviews.Title: “one of the best in asia”
Reviews.Author: Peter S
Reviews.Content: First time we are staying at W hotel , we loved the room and the decoration (like the door bell) their Lift is lovely, though there is a big shopping centre downstair but the location is a bit far from other main shopping areas,. Anyway is a 5 stars hotel and next time we will be back next time

Reviews.Title: “Chic & stylish”
Reviews.Author: imvvirgo
Reviews.Content: 'W' hotels are known world-over for its high end fashionable and stylish stay. This one in HK was no different. Gives a great sense of luxury. We celebrated new years at this hotel so the prices were at its steepest. But the ultra morden rooms and oversize-walkin-bathroom with sea view made it all worth it. We had 3 rooms and all three were equally great. Other big advantage is the location of this hotel. Its located adjacent( almost inside) of the most luxurious mall in HK. This is a shoppers paradise. You can find great restaurants on top floor of the mall. Hotel concierge was more than willing to assist us. This is defiantly pricey but worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Totally Pampered”
Reviews.Author: VanCanucksFan
Reviews.Content: from the moment I checked in I was totally pampered with absolutely everything I ever wanted (and I took advantage of everything!). A few examples 1. The staff at the lounge were quick to give me recommendations on places to go when I needed to know about Hong Kong (Thanks Noemi) 2. The "Welcome Ambassador" helped me get taxis, the paper, and restaurant recommendations (thanks Eric) 3. The concierge knew where to find the Michelin Starred dumpling place, the great wine shop, the bar my friends recommended 4. When I went to check out, I had a late flight, so they gave me a key to the locker rooms to use the gym, showers, and the rooftop pool The rooftop pool is amazing, the spa was great, and the squid ink pasta at Kitchen was delicious!

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary, cool hotel”
Reviews.Author: Msjsong
Reviews.Content: Really quirky and contemporary, quite a breath of fresh air after staying at traditional hotels. Really friendly professional staff, super funky interior and spacious rooms. It was so comfortable I didn't want to go home and I usually love going home after staying at even really nice hotels. Loved the pool and especially the sauna area - great to chill all day before an evening flight.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy and Cool hotel”
Reviews.Author: tokyotiger17
Reviews.Content: Trendy hotel in a convenient location with excellent service. Room: Very spacious when compared to other 5 star HK hotels. Unfortunately, I was coming down with the flu when I arrived in Hong Kong and the W bed was exactly what i needed. I think everybody that has stayed at a W says they're the best hotel beds in the world. Well, it's true and the W HK didn't let me down. The view from my room was overlooking the West Harbor Tunnel and West Kowloon shipping yard. The view was not overly spectacular but you can see across to central on HK Island. I'm told the night view is amazing, but it was overcast during my trip and I wasn't able to see much. Location: The hotel is located right next to Elements, one of Hong Kong's big shopping malls. It's only a short taxi ride to Tsimshatsui or the Star Ferry for access to Central. The W is a good choice for those that don't want to stay on HK Island or those that want to try the developing West Kowloon area for something different. Restaurants: (breakfast) Breakfast at the Kitchen was up to the usual high standard of other W hotels with a HK flavor. You get to enjoy a nice view of West Kowloon as you sip your coffee. I heard from one of the other guests that there is a good Cantonese restaurant called Sing Yin. I'm going to try it on my next trip. Pool: I took a trip up to the 76th floor to check out the pool. It's one of the highest rooftop pools in the world offering spectacular views across the city. Liked: Extra friendly service from many staff members, easy access from the airport and the beautiful swimming pool (just wish next time I'm not struck down with flu and can actually take a swim). Disliked: I've heard others complain on Tripadvisor about the showers. They seem to leak causing water to trip into the toilet and bathroom floor. Although not a major issue for me it might annoy some guests. Room Tip: Rooms facing the harbor are best on higher floors. Summary: The W Hotel HK met and exceeded my expectations. It's very convenient, staff are full of energy and friendly and the rooms are a good size and in excellent condition. I'll stay again and next time bring my wife for a swim on the 76th floor.

Reviews.Title: “relatively new hotel with excellent service but so-so location”
Reviews.Author: whoisthis
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W for 3 nights in May. The customer service was great. When the check-in/check-out got too long, more staff came and open up more lines. We called housekeeping a couple of times and they showed up within 5 minutes. We got a Fabulous Room with ocean view. The room has a great rainshower with good water pressure, there is a tv by the bathtub, and we like the mood lighting in the room. There is a decent size flat screen built into the bedroom wall, along with floor-to-ceiling window with electric shades. The room also has heavy soundproofing so we couldn't hear our neighbors or doors slamming outside. It came with the usual amenities and we have no complaints. As to the location, it's located above the Kowloon MTR station, which is one of the stop for the Airport Express, which means you can get here from the airport without stepping foot outside. You can also check in your bags at the subway station. Other reviewers have noted that it's convenient because of this, but I would note that the Kowloon station subway is the Disneyland subway line, and this is important for two reasons. One is that the frequency of the train is a lot less than other subway lines, so instead of the usual less than 2 minutes per train, it's about 7 minutes or so per train. I know this may not matter for most people. Second, while it's convenient to get to the hong kong side (only one stop to Hong Kong station), it doesn't have any stop on the Kowloon side. So if you want to get to Tsim Sa Tsui or Mongkok, you will have to take a taxi (I heard the hotel has a free shuttle but we didn't use it). There is nothing around the hotel other than the Elements Mall located underneath it, although the mall does have restaurants should hunger strikes. As for internet, the hotel charges a fee for in-room wifi or wired connection. I think it's USD $20 per day, or you can buy per hour. There is free wifi in the lobby if you bring your laptop downstairs. I believe the business center let you use their pc for a time limit without charge (I think it's 30 minutes). Other than the location issue, this is a good hotel to stay in Hong Kong. It's in a up-and-coming area and I imagine there will be more things to do around the area in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “The amazing Whatever/Whenever Experience you have to try!”
Reviews.Author: MarvinHo
Reviews.Content: I was indeed looking forward to experience the "W"hatever, "W"henever experience and it had indeed overwhelmed me and exceed my expectations! From the moment I checked in at 1100hrs, my room was ready, the staff were very friendly, notated all my requests! Every touchpoint from the lobby to the room was indeed a "W"elcome experience! Not to mention the heavenly bed to tuck you in every night! The gym that you have to go an in additon with an Xbox Kinect for you to enjoy playing the simulation games! The room was tastefully furnish giving the convenience to the guests from the lighting controls to the fantastic sound system! You do not want to leave the room at all! You have to visit the pool on the 67th floor, having the best view and the skyline and the contrast in lightings between the day and night. Staff was welcoming and ready to answer all questions that you have! Next to try is the Bliss Spa, you need to relax and massages! Compliments to the Houskeeping who are ever so accommodating to my needs and requests and you only need to tell them once! Highly recommended to stay to enjoy the W experience!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel I've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: woodbj1
Reviews.Content: This was by far the best hotel my wife or I have stayed in. The view of the harbour was unbelievable. Floor to ceiling windows. At a push of a button the shades opened in the morning to this fantastic view. The hotel was clean and the beds are the most comfortable I've slept in. Going to look into purchasing their bed from Simmons. Breakfast buffett was fantastic. Bar was exciting. Staff was very helpful. I can't say enough about this hotel. It there was any downside was that is was a bit of a walk to the shopping areas. No big deal though. Highly recommend this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The W Hong Kong is like staying in a nightclub.”
Reviews.Author: SingaporeStephy
Reviews.Content: This trendy hotel located on the west side of Kowloon is not for the average tourist hoping to see the sights of Hong Kong. More useful for a business man attending a conference at the ICC next door. The Elements Mall also next door is high end and has a stop for the airport express with in-town check in availale which was useful. Despite the trendy image, the service offered was not up to scratch. At check in, we were almost forced to fill in a Starwood rewards card which we didn't want, internet service is not free in a 'wonderful room' grade, I repeatedly had to ask to have a daily newspaper delivered and when one did arrive, it was 12 hours later at 11.30 at night! Some member of staff thought it appropriate to ring our door bell until one of us got out of bed from sleeping.... I am still waiting for the apology. Breakfast is expensive at SGD$40 and not a great selection of yogurt or cereal. The best thing about this hotel was the rooftop swimming pool on the 76th floor and the under used gym on the 73rd floor. I wouldn't rush to go back to the W Hotel and would probably look at another hotel if staying in that area.

Reviews.Title: “W HongKong Rm2515-W is for Wow!, Wonderful, and Warm”
Reviews.Author: Lance-Travellot
Reviews.Content: Took a short vacation to HKG with the spouse. Since I was not on business, there was no need to stay on HK Island side, I agreed with the spouse to stay in Kowloon, using my SPG points to redeem 4 nights at W Hong Kong. The LeMeridien sister brand may be trendy/chic, but this W is trendy and warm, W HKG deserves all the good mentions found in the 400+ reviews. From the moment you step into the hotel entry on the ground, to the reception on the 6, and to 25th floor where I was staying, it was a "wow" experience. The elavator lobby especially thrilled us. And we are not easily thrilled. And the room had more electrical outlets that any other I have seen. I counted at least 14 outlets strategically placed at the bedsides (2 each side), the desk (4), the TV, the coffee table, safe, the walls, etc. Most impressive. The staff were absolutely helpful and down-to-earth, ie warm, From the room service staff who delivered a 3am hot-chocolate to the Dir of Ops (James W). James actually stepped out of the elavator to listen to us. Only 2 small minus points for this property. The lack of clear signage guiding guests from the Elements Mall (downstairs, linked to the Airport Express) to the hotel. I understand from James that the hotel is working very hard to add more signage. The other negative is the location of the property on Kowloon port area. It will not be convienient if I was doing business on the Island side. Now I need to find some business activities on the Kowloon side so that I can stay at the W.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with attentive service”
Reviews.Author: Quiky
Reviews.Content: I stayed there with my partner for 5 nights in a harbourview room, having been upgraded from a standard WOW room. Check-in/check-out was a breeze. The room was very clean, with most of the fixtures in quite new condition (though there's a round stain on the carpet). Just like Westin's Heavenly Bed, the W Bed was extremely comfortable. The rainforest shower was also a great indulgence. It could work in conjunction with the handheld shower, not one or the other like in other hotels. One slight problem though, some water did seep through to the toilet next to the shower as both share a large sliding door. With the sliding door, you could only have either a closed toilet or a closed shower, not both. In terms of the location, because it is on the Tung Chung MTR line (on top of Kowloon Station), it will take a fair bit of walking at Hong Kong/Central station in order to reach the Island Line stations. I must also compliment the staff as they were very courteous and helpful. As I fell sick in the middle of the night, the duty manager even came out of the office to hail a taxi for me to go to the hospital. The Elements Mall is just beneath hotel, so lots of great shopping there. There's free wifi around the lounge area. In room wifi or wired connection costs HKD115 per day or HKD40 per hour.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid room 1616”
Reviews.Author: Bigapple05
Reviews.Content: This is one very trendy and beautiful hotel. I would of given 5 stars if it was not a couple of things we experienced.
