I'll list that later on because there are definitely a lot of good things to say about this hotel that out weighs my annoyances. First of all getting here from the airport is so easy and convenient. Grab your bags buy a ticket to Kowloon. Train is right there and it is super clean. Probably less than 20 minutes you are the bottom of the W Hotel. I wish NYC had something like this. I know it sucks to arrive at JFK and if you take the air train to Jamaica and then transfer to the E train to get into the city. It could take you close to an hour and half. So we check in and the reception area is very nice. The staff there are extremely friendly and just like the hotel very trendy. Same goes for the concierge. We spoke to Patrick and he took the time to tell us all the good places to eat and how to get there. The 6th floor reception area is the only area you can get free wi-fi unless you pay for it. You can sometimes pick up their signal downstairs in the lobby as well. They gave us room 1616. Knowing the W hotel goes up like 70+ floors I was hoping to get a room on a higher floor. No worries it still was a very nice room with a nice view of Hong Kong and the Harbor. Their beds and sheets were extremely comfortable! I had such a good night sleep while staying here. I need to get their pillow and comfortable. The room is a typical W Hotel. Very trendy with many nice features. Like a control panel near the bed to control the blinds and lighting. The TV was behind the mirror and the bar was nicely built into the table. The bar on the 6th floor is definitely happening place. The nights we were there it was packed. They play some really good music as well. The use of their gym was great as it was 24 hours. Located on the upper floors you get some nice views. Kenneth was on hand the day I went and he offered some nice training tips. Extremely friendly. The pool on the roof has some amazing views and it is heated. It is a bit windy up there when we went. I don't see this being a factor once summer kicks in. The W Hotel is located inside a very nice shopping area. Almost all the stores are high end. They even have an ice rink downstairs. There were also a lot of places to eat inside if you didn't want to travel. Their noodle restaurant seems to especially popular. Probably because of the cost. Fairwood's downstairs was your best bang for your buck. So my only minor annoyances with our stay our room constantly flooded or leaked water from the shower. I was surprised they didn't offer to move us to a new room. You can actually see the water line from the constantly flooding. We just learned to point the shower head away from the sliding door. Seems more like a design flaw if you ask me. Secondly, we made coffee in the mornings. Every time we came back to our room. Everything was cleaned and put away except for the coffee put. I am not sure why they don't clean the coffee pot. They even replaced our coffee cups so they must of know we used the coffee pot. Third, the location of the W hotel is a bit inconvenient if you wanted to go to Mong Kok, Jordan or Tsim Sha Tsui. Even those these area was right next to Kowloon. The MTR lines goes around these areas. This is very minor as the W has a free shuttle service. This is not a typical shuttle. We got an nice Audi Q7 with a driver to take us over to this area. Nice touch by the W. Lastly, and this is no fault of the W. If you come down and visit the shopping area. You are going to be constantly bombarded by these young sales guys trying to sell you something. I believe it was condos or apartments. It gets kind of annoying pretty quickly. Just say no thank you and they will leave you alone. We never got a dirty look. Overall I loved my stay here and in Hong Kong. Would love to come back soon.

Reviews.Title: “World's sexiest rooftop pool”
Reviews.Author: sasjennie
Reviews.Content: Loved the fantasy garden theme of this W. Amazing rooftop infinite pool on the 78th floor overlooking the hong kong harbor....making one of my most amazing morning swims. The spa has great facilities with a view in jacuzzi lounge...great spot to do a girls day. Location is a bit away from shopping, but just a short cab ride away. It's also next door to the Ritz with the world's highest hotel lounge. A must see. Rooms were plush with ornate decor and great water pressure rainbath. Many "ahhhh" moments at this stay.....Perfect hotel for a short visit in HK. My favorite W hotel so far.

Reviews.Title: “Now I know where to stay from now on.”
Reviews.Author: CFSUN
Reviews.Content: Room was trendy...bathroom was nothing less than what you would see in any washroom renovaton magazine.. TOPS. Out the window? wow...HK harbour... beautiful.... wondering if any of these freighters have my goods on them! Staff was attentive but thats what I have come to expect in the hotels I stay at in Asia... W did not do me wrong... A+. (Example... I went outside for a smoke waiting for my brother to come downstairs... then went inside to wait ...maybe 15 minutes... in that time 3 people asked me if there was anything they could do for me...(and yes...I was in business attire). Elevators... cool o rama... the floor is an giant tv screen. Was always fun to ride them.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel!”
Reviews.Author: cougrz007
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the W Hotel twice in the months of March and April on business. I chose the hotel because I generally enjoy W Hotels and due to the easy public transportation to Central Hong Kong. The rooms here are very nice. They are large by Hong Kong standards, with a comfortable work area, large bathroom, and a very comfortable bed. It was easy to get a good night's rest here. The room contained a good minibar selection, an iron, safe, bathtub, separate shower, and a lounge sofa near the windows. Also, it had great blackout curtains that made sleeping easy and also had good light settings that were preset depending on the time of day. Overall the rooms are great at this hotel. The facilities are quite nice also. The pool area is a bit small, but that's to be expected at 76 stories in the air. It had a good vibe to it. I also used the bliss spa for a massage and thought it was average - the massage was nice, but I didn't feel that the overall service was that great. Just a bit impersonal for my tastes. I ate a couple of times at the "Kitchen" restaurant - both the breakfast and dinner buffets. I felt that the restaurant was a disappointment- both times I felt unwelcome as a solo business traveler, and as if I were inconveniencing the staff simply by wanting to eat there. The breakfast buffet was completely empty with about 15 minutes before the cut-off time. I would suggest avoiding "Kitchen" and eating elsewhere. It was the low of my stay here. With that said, the hotel is in a huge mall with tons of shopping and eating options. It's also directly above a subway link into Central and to the airport. This somewhat makes up for the out-of-the-way location in a huge construction zone that's about a 20 minute walk from central Kowloon. I also stayed at the Sheraton during this trip. I like both hotels quite a bit. The rooms at the W are much nicer, and the commute to Central is a little easier at the W. The W also has a better bar and pool scene, so it's more fun to hang out at. The Sheraton on the other hand has better restaurants in my opinion, and a better location because it's in the center of the Kowloon action. The views from the Sheraton (if you get a Harbor room) are better as well. You really can't go wrong with the W Hotel in Hong Kong - I look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “W takes it one better again”
Reviews.Author: Moxo2020
Reviews.Content: This is the best W I have stayed at. The fast train from the airport arrives below the W. Food was good and my one piece of laundry was collected straight away and returned on time. Incredible rain shower and a great view over the water. I couldn't get the iPod dock to work and I'm quite tech savvy. The TV was also complex.

Reviews.Title: “The entire experience.”
Reviews.Author: johnnyno6
Reviews.Content: The staff are incredibly courteous & helpful and everything is super efficient. Care and attention to detail, second to none.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy, Convenient, Cool Pool”
Reviews.Author: tulipjones
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a four-day holiday. Very conveniently placed Kowloon hotel near the airport and subway lines. The walk to TST really isn't that bad, and it is a pretty quick taxi ride as well. It was just as convenient (and incredibly cheaper) to eat meals in the mall below as it was in the hotel. The one breakfast I had at the hotel took a very long time, although when it was finally delivered to our table it was excellent. Both the pool and gym facilities are excellent. The rooms come with several technological bells and whistles. Get your own coffee from the supermarket in the mall--the coffee in the room was terrible. The internet is a rip off.

Reviews.Title: “High tech, high class and Trendy”
Reviews.Author: Truthfu1
Reviews.Content: My father and I just stayed 4 nights at the W Hotel in Hong Kong. This is easily the best hotel I have ever been to. And I have been to many hotels for business and leisure. I will tell you why... 1. Location W hotel is located in the Elements mall which has a number of stores, restaurants, theatre and a grocery store. The mall is connected to the Kowloon MTR station that allows you to travel to the airport in 24 minutes via the Airport Express train. Moreoever, you can check-in your luggage at the MTR station with your airline before you arrive at the airport. Talk about seamless connection with the airport. The view from our 28th floor room over the Victoria harbor was stunning. Although, it was partially obscured by the 100 plus storey high ICC building. 2. High Tech The room comes with all the expected amenities like a flat screen TV, wifi and comfortable bed but it has much more like... - automatic shades and blinds that close with a touch of button - tv in the tub - rain shower - night time turn down with chocolate - DVD player with integrated speakers 3. High class On the 76 floor, it has a large infinity pool and high tub that over look HK. There is nice patio area for you to relax. On the 73 floor, there is gym with sauna, hot tub, plus spa services. There is a dedicated shuttle service throughout the day that drops you off to Tsim sha tsui for shopping and sight seeing, All the materials used in the hotel were first rate...even the drinking glass were made in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Style with no substance?”
Reviews.Author: danjed
Reviews.Content: Firstly location this hotel is convenient for the airport and the tower block next to it but if your office is on hong kong island forget it. 45 mins bracing death in a local taxi just to get to work in the morning is just too far. There is a shopping centre next to the hotel but that's it everywhere is a taxi ride so net result you feel miles from anywhere. The hotel itself is cool hip and trendy. However not being able to buy wifi in the room is a pain. You have to goto somewhere buy a card, goto the room type in the card. Who has time for that. The rooms themselves are beautiful ultra trendy and cool. But at night don't expect the room to be dark as even with all the lights off the switches emit enough light to disturb you. Bed is amazing very confortable, rain shower us great. Bliss toilteries are a nice touch. Pool is nice amazing view but take up your bath towel as the pool man religiously stops any pool towels leaving the pool area. Which is great as you are dripping wet in the way back to the room. I ate at kitchen which was good but there werent many other dining options in the hotel. Overall this is a great hotel but there are a couple of niggles that stop this being an amazing hotel. Maybe w hotels aren't for me but having stayed in many top hotels on hong kong island my view is there are much better hotels for your money in hk.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of Luxury...Lots of Fun...Lots of Service”
Reviews.Author: TurtleCreekTraveller
Reviews.Content: On my last trip to HK a few years back, I stayed at the Peninsula so I knew going in what a premium HK experience should look like, and the W certainly delivers. To keep the review brief, the standouts were: Quiet...For a fun hotel in such a vibrant city, I was pleasantly surprised at the absolute calm and quiet in the room, even though the lounge and pool areas provided a buzz of activity and socializing. Luxury...The bedding and linens were of stand-out quality and made the perfect end to the evening and a perfect start to the day. Creativity...A W hallmark for sure, but very well executed here...especially in the bath, the lighting, and the hotel common areas. Pool and Wet Areas...Although the new Ritz Carlton just upgunned it in terms of height, a 76th floor infinity pool and hot tub is impressive and the area well turned-out. Likewise, the indoor spa, steam, and sauna are equally well-done and kept spotless. Convenience...Great to be able to take the train directly from the airport to the hotel at Kowloon Station in 20 minutes and to check in with Cathay at the train station upon departure. Some might find the location less than the best because construction and traffic make it challenging to walk to Star Ferry, Nathan Road, etc. The hotel mitigates the issue by providing shuttle service to those locations and Hong Kong island is one stop away on the MRT. Overall, there are slightly better locations both in Kowloon and on the island, but then again, the newly-opened Ritz Carlton, which is the world's tallest hotel, is in the same complex of luxury shops and restaurants, so it certainly can't be bad.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: anish_2109
Reviews.Content: W hotel is just too good ; if you want to check modern trends ; technology . W hotel is there ... roof top swimming pool from which you can see entire hongkong ; great food and beverage faciliities ; amazing rooms ; great ambience .. in all aspects , W hotel gives a feeling of modern ness and trendiness .. must visit hotel in hongkong

Reviews.Title: “Good but expensive”
Reviews.Author: inder98374849
Reviews.Content: Good and contemporary rooms. I would recommend the rooms on the top floors with the harbor view. helpful staff. Next to shopping mall. Check-in took a lot of time as the front office is very slow but the rest of the trip is worth remembering.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel... but needs more atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: 2xelmundo
Reviews.Content: The hotel is amazing, rooms, restaurants, spa, service.... All views from the rooms, elevators... and the best place is the swimmingpool in floor 73 or something. The only thing I recommend.... is to put some music at the pool. They can do lots of profits if adding a nice bar, and music in the afternoon over there. Is strange for a W not to have it already. Also... the location can be far away... but I still recommend to have at least the last 2 nights in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: tlc240
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Location was a little out of the way, but I loved the hotel, it was worth the taxis everywhere. The W is on an isolated side of kowloon, you cannot just walk out and be in a bustling city, instead there is a highway. However, the… hotel is very modern, sleek, simple and luxurious - you may never want to leave! The shuttle to TST was always fully booked when we needed it, so we never took advantage of that. HK island is only one stop away by metro, but to get to TST you need a cab (there is no direct line). The hotel is very convenient for the airport express and is connected to elements mall. There is plenty of places to eat in the mall and lots of high end shopping. The pool was incedible and open in january. There was no one there, and the water was very warm. I would stay here again if im on a budget and want a 5 star hotel. If not, i would consider staying at the 5stars on hk island side.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect as Prefection can be”
Reviews.Author: HONkiev
Reviews.Content: I've staid at the W Hong Kong 10+ times over the last 2 years - and will stay in the future. Why? - because it's very stylish - Due to my SPG Platinum membership I always get one of this fantastic corner suites with stunning view, superb bathroom/shower - because of the unique roof-top infinity pool - because of the location next to Western Tunnel (so perfect connection wherever within Hong Kong) - because of Elements Mall with great shopping- and good restaurant selection - because of the AAA service - because of the freebies like the muffin - ..... It's simply a very stylish & extremely good hotel at the price.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Hotel, if you are staying in Hong Kong and want the best, stay here.”
Reviews.Author: AhmadAtalla
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels I have stayed in in my life! Outstanding personal service, very modern, really cool decor, brand new hotel, incredible beds, great rooms, great view, amazing gym, excellent food and service. This is a top quality 5 star hotel where if you want to have fun and be looked after by people who love what they do and have clear international standards,, this is the only hotel to stay in. Far better than the Four Seasons, the Mandarin Oriental and the Peninsula. This place is really cool, they have incredible attention to detail and have every need catered for. Their concierge staff are also excellent and looked after our every need. The only very small downside is you are a 5 minute train journey to Hong Kong Central, but the hotel sits above a massive mall connected to Kowloon station where the train is one stop to Central. The metro system si super efficient so this should not affect your choice of stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in Cowloon with no good view”
Reviews.Author: alexzhdanov
Reviews.Content: Pretty nice pricey hotel with good trade center inside, modern rooms, great facilities, but the service is only ok, view to ocean (no skyscrabers view)

Reviews.Title: “Great hip hotel with energy”
Reviews.Author: spddemn
Reviews.Content: Upon check in we were upgraded to a Fabulous room, and I have to say Fabulous indeed it was. Great view of the harbor that spent several hours just watching as the tugs worked, interesting to spend time watching an actual working harbor. In a great location close to the markets and with the train MTR right next door in the attached mall. Excellent breakfast in the "Kitchen" and afternoon/evening cocktails in the "Living Room" were really enjoyable. The vibe and atmosphere of the W is really great I thoroughly enjoyed it. My only question is the whatever/whenever... I did not see anything of this or see what the big deal was. But from my experience here I would definitely stay again at the W.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy-licious hotel for people who like to splurge in style”
Reviews.Author: HelenAmsterdam
Reviews.Content: Following earlier visits with my partner to Hong Kong, we decided that we really wanted to be absolutely comfortable this time around, especially after a very active (and often not so luxurious) 2 weeks in Vietnam. The only kind of establishment that can help in this case is one of Hong Kong's many 4 or 5 star hotels. Of course those hotels come with an equally 5 star rate, especially in Hong Kong, so we took a long time reading reviews here and looking at many, many, many websites for prices. After some hours, we got to the W. Known for being uber-trendy and, according to some, a little dark, we were especially charmed by the fact that it's right at Hong Kong's new premier mall, Elements (shoppy shoppy shopping!) and therefore at Kowloon station, the second stop of the airline express train and MTR stop. Super handy for a short stay! If you're around longer, you might want to stay more towards Tsim Sha Tsui or Hong Kong Island. The hotel itself: when we walked in, we could only think of one of the words the W group love to use themselves: fabulous! Amazing detail to modern design, a hotel bar looking more like a lounge you'd actually enjoy visiting on a night out (good DJ and fab cocktails), and the smell...W could you please start selling that room scent you use, I seriously need this for my house! And then the room...a lot of people here mention they were in one of the higher ranked rooms...well we decided the splurge was big enough to stay in the standard one. But, seriously, we were more than pleased! Now personally I'm not very much into grey interiors, but this room was done really nicely, the bathroom was good, the Bliss products a real treat, and the bed was everything you'd expect from the whole group of hotels - perfect. Hadn't slept so well during our whole holiday. What's more, we had a pretty good view of Hong Kong Island, at least as good as it gets considering there are a couple of apartment and office buildings blocking some of the view - but good enough! Try asking for room 2520, which was our room. Apart from the room, the rooftop heated swimming pool and gym are also good fun, even in winter! Drawbacks? Hard to imagine, but I have a couple, just to be complete(ly honest): - breakfast is never, ever, worth 25 Euros (sorry I cannot remember the exact amount in HKD). However wonderful it is, you already pay a lot to stay at the hotel, and with Hong Kong's food being of high quality, and found throughout the city (including the Elements mall) for good quality at a mere fraction of the cost, you are cheating yourself to pay such a price. If I had one suggestion to make to the hotel, I do believe they'd also gain more out of their breakfast service by slashing it by a couple of EUR/USD/HKD. - however pretty the view was, the windows were very dirty. I know it's hard to maintain such a building and acknowledge the hotel did inform about a refurbishment going on, but we did find it a little disappointing to find our windows having a pretty visible layer of dirt on them. Now I am from Hong Kong originally so I've seen the island many times, but I can imagine that someone who's on their first visit could find this a major let down. Last but not least - this hotel is great for us and for like-minded people, but, as all W hotels, I would not recommend this to couples who prefer classic looking hotels, people who dislike (dark coloured) modern design, and young families. This IS the place for couples who enjoy design, groups of friends on a hip getaway to HK and business travellers. We would definitely come back to the W, it is to me one of the best hotels I've stayed in HK!

Reviews.Title: “Streamlined elegance”
Reviews.Author: 7J1AIL
Reviews.Content: Sleek, modern and efficient. That's a good description for what Starwood tries to get across with design and service at the W chain. The W in Kowloon is no exception. I have come to prefer the W at Kowloon Station for quick trips in and out of Hong Kong. It's a quick ride from the airport on the express train and attached to a modern and expansive shopping mall. You won't necessarily get the flavor of Hong Kong cocooned here or enjoy the level of personal attention at the Peninsula or Four Seasons but if you plan to spend the bulk of your time in Kowloon this property is a great choice for business travelers and the well-heeled not needing the opulence of Hong Kong's legendary hotels. My only quibble was the poor attention given to hotel guests by the bell desk (which is at the ground entrance while the lobby and check-in is on the 6th floor). They failed to offer personal service to hail a cab, didn't ask where we were going and inform the taxi driver in Cantonese, hence we were taken to the wrong place twice by a driver who was either befuddled or looking to make a bit extra coin off of visitors.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and luxurious but with frills that were a bit ridiculous”
Reviews.Author: someflipster
Reviews.Content: The hotel was comfortable, service was good. Internet was a bit slow but usable. Overall it was a bit too much for me. Little butterfly cutouts in the lamps, "story book" themes on the floors with fake bookcases containing mock children's books, decorative frills painted on the walls.... this was just a little too much for my tastes. Some may really like it. I would have preferred it to be toned down a bit. Checkin area looked more like a nightclub than a hotel, flashing lights behind the checkin people, disco music playing in the elevators. If that's your thing, you'll love this hotel. Swimming pool was spectacular with a great view of hong kong.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I`ve ever stayed”
Reviews.Author: karott002
Reviews.Content: You cannot describe how wonderful this hotel is. Our "fabolous room" was breath-taking: clean, beautiful interieur, comfortable and hipp. The staff there is extremly nice and attentive. The check-in was super-fast and they`ve upgraded us from a normal "wonderful room" to a "fabolous room" (we don`t know, if it was on purpose or a mistake! But anyway-thanks!). Beautiful bathrooms and design furniture like eames chairs in the whole hotel. I don`t like breakfast, but this breakfast was very, very, very good, diversified, fresh, made with love. The whole hotel smells celestial and the pool looks gorgeous although with rain and storm (february). I think, this is not only the best hotel in Kowloon, it is the best hotel in whole Hong Kong!

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Big room for HK. Trendy and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: sreilly008
Reviews.Content: Great location. The mall nearby has some fantastic restaurants. Close to subway that takes you to Central in minutes. Easy access to airport due to the airport express stop right there. Restaurant and bar was pricey but beautiful place and great service. The pool is on top of the building and it's a great escape from the hustle and bustle of Hong Kong. Pool service was very attentive. Spa is also beautiful there.

Reviews.Title: “truly unique”
Reviews.Author: SachinM
Reviews.Content: got a corner room, and boy what a view. decor was quite grey, but very very modern. one could find everything right in the room, whatever one could think of. the tv, hidden behind a mirror panel. ipod dock, dvd player, with full home theatre, made our stay truly relaxing. right below the hotel, is the kowloon station, with its amazing selection of restaurants, shops, etc, one could not want anything more. however, the best best best part of the hotel was the rooftop pool, at 79th floor!!!!!! it was always like a dream to be swimming there. amongst the clouds, in the heated jacuzzi, one could not be at a better place, after a long walking day. amazing service, 'watever wherever', is truly unique. would love to definitely go back anytime!

Reviews.Title: “This is one "oh wow" hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TorontoRooster
Reviews.Content: The new W Hong Kong ... whose promise is "whatever, whenever" is also a W for "wow" property! Sparkling, modern, full of art and gracious staff, a truly fine buffet restaurant (and this from someone who doesn't usually like buffets!) as well as a traditional Cantonese restaurant and great views, who could ask for anything more? A swimming pool and Jacuzzi high on the 76th floor (above a spa) do I hear you say? It has that too ... one of Hong Kong's highest pools and truly an extraordinary experience. We took our early-morning tea up to the Jacuzzi (during February) and watched the sun rise over Hong Kong ... what a memory! The location is fine ... the property soars above a very fancy mall which contains the subway directly from the airport and it's only one stop to Hong Kong Central. There are also inexpensive taxis everywhere ... bujt visitors to this property should know that it's not very convenient to WALK from the property. It can be done, of course, in about 15-20 minutes' walk you can be in Kowloon Park, but for the time being it's through some construction zones. But don't let this put you off this fine hotel ... it's so easy to get around via subway or taxi. I hope all readers of this enjoy as much as we did.

Reviews.Title: “So far, the best W experience”
Reviews.Author: QCInspector
Reviews.Content: Initially, I was hesitant to check into W Hong Kong especially after a bad experience in W New York and a mediocre one in W Barcelona. But W Hong Kong really wowed me and exceeded my expectations. 1. Location, Location and Location The location is great! The MTR is located in the Elements shopping mall which is just besides the hotel. The MTR has a direct train service to the airport. The ride is less than 25 mins and costs about HKD90 per trip. And the MTR station has the down-town check-in counters for major airlines. You save the hassle of towing your luggages up the trains. You can check in your luggages and go shopping at the Elements shopping mall before heading to the airport. 2. Transport W Hong Kong is one station away from all the action in Hong Kong. The hotel also provides complimentary shuttle service between the hotel and Tsim Sha Tsui. 3. The room As usual, the room is well stocked with Bliss toiletries. Unlike the W's in New York and Barcelona, this W has a bath tub in addition to a shower area. There is a small TV screen at the end of the bath tub. You can take a bath and watch TV at the same time. The room is big by Hong Kong standard. In fact, I invited some of my friends to the room for a drink. The bed is comfy and the hotel provides turn down service. 4. The restaurants We tried the new chinese restaurant, Sing Yin. The food was good but the price is on the high side even after the 20% discount given to W hotel guests. You can get better food at a cheaper price if you venture outside the hotel. If you don't fancy hotel breakfast, there are a number of cafes and restaurants in the shopping mall located just besides the hotel. 5. The Gym, pool and other facilities I'm really impressed with the gym and pool. The gym is well equipped. The pool at the 76th floor overlooks the habour, excellent view especially in the night (however, it's partially blocked by two residential blocks). There is also a hot jacuzzi pool just besides the main pool. The separate men and women steam/ sauna and jacuzzi on the 73th floor is very much appreciated. Although it's rather weird to see female attendant walking into the men's dressing room occasionally to clean up the dressing room and stock up the towels. 6. Business Centre We wanted to print the boarding pass but the business centre was closed. I wish they had a 24 hour business centre where guests can print out their boarding passes (just like the one in W Barcelona). 7. Staff The service was impeccable and the staff did not disappoint us. They were so much friendlier than those in New York, and the Hong Kong went the extra mile just to accomodate our needs. The excellent service also extends to the Sing Yin restaurant. Other than that, I will defintely be back at W Hong Kong if I happen to be back in the country.

Reviews.Title: “Real cool place”
Reviews.Author: mikezens
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the W Hotel in HK for the first time, after good experiences with other W's. The hotel is very fancy and cool. Directly linked to a shooping mall and the HK Airport Express, however quite far to walk to Kowloon. But Hotel has a shuttle bus and taxis are readily available. Rooms are very nice and have all features a modern traveller requires. From comfy beds, to flatscreen TV, i-Pod connection, DVD player. Even a TV in the shower. Really enjoyed the place and getting a small suite, allowed for sitting with friends in the room to conjoy some drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Great for business or pleasure”
Reviews.Author: gwera
Reviews.Content: Great young, cool, energetic staff. Views of the water were great. We got a competitive pre-pay rate on hotels.com. Roof top pool was enjoyable with views of Kowloon below and Victoria harbor. The room was big and comfortable with a modern bathroom. The windows have an automatic curtain so if you are on business and need sleep this is perfect. Also, room was absolutely silent. Moreover, the room included razors, shaving cream, and toothbrushes. Our first room was smokey and we were relocated (after asking) due to the smoke odor. Hotel breakfast was world class and over the top. The decor is modern and the ambience is the typical over the top W experience. Our last W experience was at W Lake Shore Drive in Chicago. Finally, the location is great to take a taxi or the train from the mall below to the airport. You can check your bags at the attached mall and train it to the airport if needed. I wanted to thank the bellmen who were extremely knowledgeable and friendly especially "Max"! The hotel concierge was good but did not posess the psychic powers of some high end concierges. Nevertheless, our concierge did an excellent job securing us a table with a view at the Peninsula's Felix restaurant. We also ate in the W restaurant "Kitchen" and enjoyed a mixture of western and Chinese foods. In summary great for vacation (our purpose) but extremely business friendly as well. We have already reccomended the hotel to friends and colleagues.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, hip hip hotel”
Reviews.Author: sfgirl3
Reviews.Content: Can't beat the location - right upstairs from check-in to the airport on the trainline - I think you could even check in the night before if you wanted to. Mall downstairs has several food options. The suite was very modern but very nice - comfortable bed, huge living area (esp for HK), and a huge bathroom and walk in closet. The tv and room controls were a little cutsey (rather than on and off, they have "day" "night" and "sleep", but the kids had great fun playing with the gadgets and window shades. Nice helpful staff. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “best " w hotel" ever”
Reviews.Author: annarita1
Reviews.Content: Wonderful elegant but modern hotel. Great rooms with view of the port. Excellent service. In a very strategic area for shopping in Hong Kong. I loved it because it is trendy but sophisticated and chic. The spa is very nice and the staff is extremly kind and professional. I do suggest it for both business and pleasure

Reviews.Title: “Kool Kowloon - just add a late bar and a bit of a buzz and you'll be a winner”
Reviews.Author: RRH_Panta_Rei
Reviews.Content: I’m a thirty-something high end traveler, spending my time between the US, Europe, and the Middle and Far East. I love HK and visit frequently. I've made it a habit to try a new hotel with each visit, having done the top end Mandarin and 4S, as well as a few funkier hotels like the W and ideally located though more down market LKF. If you've been to other W hotels worldwide, you already know the story, you get the brand. They're mid high end range, though focus on the cool factor that other upper high ends seem to eschew in favour of more sublte elegance. Wacky, Wild, Wonderful, Whimsical, whatever.... I actually tire of the 'W' thing pretty quickly. The positives are easy to identify here, service is very good, the look and feel of the interior is sleek and modern, all the furnishings are new, the rooftop pool is way beyond awesome and, having booked a corner room, I especially enjoyed standing naked in the shower, a couple of hundred feet up, facing across to HK Harbour and singing to Christina Aguilera's 'Beautiful' piped through the speakers in my bathroom to shower room conversion space, thing. But that's just me. Oh, I was joking about Christina, though, and it pains me to admit it, it's kinda a decent song. The location is good, but not central - it's in the Kowloon Union Square area near the massive ICC. Kowloon is to Hong Kong what Brooklyn is to Manhattan - though not quite as cool as Brooklyn. It's easy enough to hop on the tube to IFC and onwards, or to take a cab through the tunnel (under HK Harbour) and right into the City, and the connection to the airport is fantastic, but you can't just walk out the door and step into the hustle and bustle, which is something I always enjoy from a City hotel. A few other notes - room service brought up the wrong Champagne twice (we still drank it...), and they ran out of Moet Rose by the 4th or 5th bottle, which seems unreasonable for a large hotel (it wasn't just me drinking...). Check in and out wasn't as fast as I'd like it to be, though by no means slow. The spa was WWWonderful - there I said it - though the Gym only average. Overall, why the 4 stars for the W Kowloon, a hotel I would gladly stay at again? Well, the reason I go to the W is for the vibe, for the scene - I want to step into the lobby and feel the excitement. The W Kowloon lacks that thrill;; the bar closes early and the evening scene for pre-party drinks was quite subdued. It's fine - that's not a terminal issue and there are plenty of people who really couldn't care less, but if you're used to the W in Manhattan, well Kowloon just doesn't compare. For prospective travelers, I would recommend you see if there 3 nights for the price of 2 deal is available, they do it occasionally, but I think it's more supply and demand driven rather than a regular occurrence. Based on that deal, the value proposition is very good.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, great room”
Reviews.Author: matthilein
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for one night in a Fabulous Room on a layover back to Europe. When we arrived at 7 am, the room wasn't ready yet but we were quickly handed a key card to use the showers and spa facilities to freshen up. We then proceeded straight to the fantastic breakfast buffet -- we were really taken aback by the choice and the freshness of everything on offer. The service at the restaurant and throughout the hotel was impeccable. At about 9 am, we got the keys to our room, which had a great view of the commercial harbor area. Note that a giant new office building pretty much blocks the view of Hong Kong Island itself, but the views are still stunning. Everything else was in the usual W style, so no complaints. The location of the hotel on top of the Kowloon train station makes it perfect for a short stop because the airport is only a short train ride away. Likewise, Hong Kong Island is just one more stop on the subway. The hotel also has a shuttle bus that will take you to the Kowloon shore where the ferries depart. On the last day, we used the Bliss Spa -- again, no complaints. The outside (heated) swimming pool and the jacuzzi are fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Wow we loved the W”
Reviews.Author: Family_Herts
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights in this hotel in October in a wonderful room and we loved every minute of our stay. The staff are really helpful and friendly but its the decor and atmosphere of this hotel that makes it really special and fun. As you come up from the lobby to the main reception you get a feel of what to expect, all neon, glass floored lift and funky lights. We were on the 36th floor which had amazing views over the bay to central HK, the view down below is of the working docks and the roof area of the Elements shopping centre which are interesting and colourful but at night the view is amazing. But if you want an incredible view just go up to the top 71st floor where the pool and spa are surrounded by glass walls hundreds of feet up in the air! We didn't eat in the hotel as there are do many reasonable restaurants in the shopping centre below we did look at the menu and it looked good but expensive as you would expect. If you are there at a weekend there is a really fun atmosphere in the lobby/reception bar at night, its like a club where all the cool young people hang out, loud music and low lights. The rooms are beautifully designed and very clever, with sliding walls round the bathroom that you can open in the day to give more space. Fittings are all quality with plasma TV and hidden fridges and bars. Windows are floor to ceiling to make the most of the views, electric blinds were fun too. I can't recommend this hotel highly enough we are certainly W converts we look forward to visiting them elsewhere in the world. If there is one small downside to this hotel it is the location from a walking out perspective, you need to take a taxi to the ferry terminal (about £3) as the road is v busy and dusty but taxi's are always waiting outside. It is excellent for the trains though as Kowloon station is in the Elements shopping centre below. Go if you can!

Reviews.Title: “A brief stay in a very lovely property”
Reviews.Author: Tobeconfirmed
Reviews.Content: We stayed only a night before a flight out of Hong Kong. The location is perfect for such occasions being directly above the Kowloon Station for the Airport Express and Elements (for shopping and food). A lovely hotel with unique, modern and eclectic touches. The room was spacious, elegant, well appointed, modern and very comfortable. As it was a flying visit, we didn't really take advantage of the amenities, but what we did see was of a very high standard.

Reviews.Title: “A Hip Hotel on Kowloon; Highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: lhaganmich
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Hong Kong. I selected this hotel because i had a half off coupon from starwood. Even with half off, our room was about $190 per night. Price aside, this hotel had some very positive attributes. This hotel is extremely easy to get to from the airport. you just take the train, get out and go up the escalators. This hotel is located above the train/TMZ station, in a mall. Having a mall at your doorsteps is extremely convenient (and tempting). The W is defintely trendy. Hip music plays in the lobby and music videos play in the elevators. The lobby has free internet. Rooms are spacious. We had a floor to ceiling view of the harbour. The room is extremely high tech. You have to insert your key in the wall to turn everything on. With a push of the button, the lights dim, the shades rise/close and tv clicks on/off. The room has flat screen tv and also flat screen above the tub. Rain fall shower. I didn't care for this. One negative..it would flood our bathroom. Bathroom was crammed with bliss toiletries plus some (razor and toothbrush daily). The infinity pool looks fantastic. We were there in december; not quite warm enough to use the pool but warm enough to use the infinity hot tub. I also signed up for a spa service. This is one negative. The spa waiting area was dirty. It looked like they had been very busy prior to my arrival. There were lots of dirty cups and dirty plates. The spa service was nice. I was pleased. One good thing about this hotel. They offer free shuttle service to 3 different shopping areas in kowloon. This is good since it is hard to leave the hotel and walk somewhere. you can take the ferry to hong kong island or take the TMZ. Both are very close. We ordered roomservice. Food was good.

Reviews.Title: “Very Enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: specialk23
Reviews.Content: 2nd time I have styed here in 3 months. I really like this hotel. Funky and functional rooms. Quiet location. Great vibe. Breakfast is very good. My only issue is with location. If you have business in TST this is not a great spot. need to taxi in and out. If you have business on the island this place is great. Great hotel - thoroughly recommended

Reviews.Title: “W WoW in Hong Kong!”
Reviews.Author: yeohsa
Reviews.Content: WOW! WOW! WOW! We stayed from December 19-24, 2010 and had a wonderful experience. We stayed in a Cool Corner Room that was very spacious with a giant bathroom. The rain shower with soaking tub and floor to ceiling windows is out of this world. High-tech room with all the amenities you need. The 3 meal a day restaurant called the Kitchen is awesome. The food quality and service is the best. You have to try their breakfast buffet. Though we did not use Wet (swimming pool), too cold in December, it looked amazing as it is located on the top floor of the hotel with views that cannot be matched. The location is unique as the hotel is connected to a huge mall and to the Airport Express train and MTR. Very easy transportation options to go to the airport, Tsim Sha Tsui or even to Hong Kong Island. Though you are not in the of heart of Tsim Sha Tsui, the W's location is good as it is away from the hustle and bustle of Nathan road. I would like to acknowledge and send my appreciation to Katherine Ribeiro, concierge agent, who patiently helped me throughout my stay. She was very understanding and knowledgeable as she helped me make my travel arrangements a breeze. The W Hong Kong is a great luxury boutique experience. Its rooms and service cannot compare with North America. The only negative is the loud club like music that is played in the living room (lobby) of the hotel. If you have the money, spend it in W Hong Kong as it is well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Very Modern, very cool”
Reviews.Author: ParrotfishToronto
Reviews.Content: Stayed at W Hong Kong for a week last November for a business trip. Loved the rooms, the bed was exceptionally comfortable. Great service from in room check in to the mini desserts left in my room and full size Bliss products! New views as well of the Harbor. The roof top pool is amazing. The buffet is really good too, I ate their every morning and one time for dinner. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “From skeptic to fan….”
Reviews.Author: Terps37
Reviews.Content: In researching the W HK prior to our visit, I was nervous based on reading up on reviews characterizing as somewhat snobbish, stuffy, and over the top. My actual experience was far from my perception as the staff is of the highest caliber. My numerous of emails to the reservations dept prior to arrival was always answered timely. We stayed during Xmas and therefore upgrade opportunities were limited. Depsite these constraints, James W. and Winny L. were able to accommodate us into a Fabulous room with our SPG status. Opening the curtains after a 20 hour journey from DC was inspiring and our 2 year old toddler was the most inspired. She spent numerous of times counting the multitude of ships in the bay and just marveling at the view. Also deserving of mention is the awesome concierge desk. The staff is extremely knowledgeable and conversing with them for a few minutes to organize your day will help out immensely. The property is pricey but the final product is commensurate with the higher cost and deserving of the various international accolades and recognition. For example, paying 230 HKD for breakfast is usually against my better judgment but once you experience the entire spread (see pictures) its worth your hard earned money. Needless to say, we look forward to our next visit to the W and recommend the TA community for a visit as well.

Reviews.Title: “Best bed in the world!”
Reviews.Author: thehound181
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W Hong Kong for 2 nights in August 2010 in a Fabulous Room - and it certainly lived up to its name. Coming from the airport it was dead easy to find the hotel, which is above the train station in the Kowloon area. Check in was smooth and quick, and we were shown to our room which looked over the harbour. The room was fantastic - very modern and swish, with electric blinds, bathtub with TV, huge in-room LCD on the wall, and a fantastic rainshower. My partner who is an interior designer was extremely impressed with the design. But the best feature by far was the bed - it was heavenly! By far the most comfortable bed we've ever slept in in our entire lives!! It was bliss. The lounge near the lobby was terrific, and they had some great food and cocktails. We ate at the restaurant one night, which was actually a bit disappointing. The rooftop pool is amazing (the highest pool in Asia I think), and a twilight swim looking over Hong Kong harbour was magical. Overall we'd highly recommend this hotel. The only downside is the location in Kowloon, but the hotel is very ready to shuttle you into the heart of Kowloon at a moment's notice.

Reviews.Title: “Funky business hotel”
Reviews.Author: freeier
Reviews.Content: Well, its the first hotel I have seen (that's not a love shack) with a nice box (a picture of a screw on the box) of condom as part of the room's amenity available.. 8-P i.e. funky hotel that's classy and good. nice services. good place. at 2k hkd (corporate rate) there's nothing much more than I could have asked for. internet is chargeable but it was reasonable i guess.. not extremely cheap nor expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Extraordinary”
Reviews.Author: tina_belz
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, we had a cool corner room with a great view. Very stylish - just everything in the hotel. The pool is great with an excellent view from 76th floor! Free shuttle to the ferry. Located in "Elements", the mall. Nice short walk to Nathan and Cantan Road. Just maybe a little too expensive...

Reviews.Title: “I'm a fan!”
Reviews.Author: voyageur1980
Reviews.Content: I really think that W has a solid market; guests that are seeking for new and exciting features other than cookie-cutter hotels with standard service or amenities. After staying in a few W hotels and lucky enough to spent a week at W Retreat and Spa in Maldives last summer, I'm convinced that I'm a fan. W Hong Kong is excellent in all areas; the rooms are spacious and modern (without sacrificing comfort), the Bar is the epitome of 'Social Space', the al-fresco pool is simply breathtaking (on the 73rd floor with views of Hong Kong harbor and surrounding Kowloon neighborhood). What surprised us also was the scheduled shuttle drop off service from W to TST (Tsim Sha Tsui) for either more shopping or the Star Ferry. While a few friends informed me about the unfavorable location (Kowloon side), I actually prefer that W is not on the Hong Kong side - It's somewhat quiet, but with all comforts and amenities (right above the Kowloon Airport Express station & Elements Mall right at your door step) while Hong Kong with all its hustle and bustle only a couple MTR stops away. We didn't eat at the hotel - choosing instead to enjoy Hong Kong food at its best - where the locals go!!! The Star Ferry to Central and an eating fest beginning with lunch at Caprice; followed by drinks waterfront; egg tarts & king prawn wonton noodles before dinner of hot-pot and the must-do karaoke! We did enjoy the Bar at W with its range of unique concoctions, coupled with the loungy atmosphere and good music. Daily selection of coffee & teas in the room was a nice start (and savior from the nights before) before starting it all over again!

Reviews.Title: “A very chic hotel but there's not much outside”
Reviews.Author: kim0404
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in the spectacular room. The moment we arrive in the hotel we were greeted by friendly staff, they took our bags and escorted us to the check in counter where friendly and efficient staff checked us in. My hubby thought he types fast but the one in the check in counter was just crazy fast. lol. the interior of the hotel is very modern and posh. even the left is decorated like a book case with fake books and shells for design. the whole hallway was carpeted and our room was just amazing. The room is spotlessly clean! Big spacious bathroom with a big tub. separate rain forest shower with another hand held shower, two sink with big lighted mirror and a toilet bowl with a sliding door. The king size bed is just blissful i could sleep in there forever. theres a big mirror that when opened, there's a wide screen TV. the bar was cunningly hidden as well as the coffee and tea maker. there was a big sofa without a backrest and when you open the window (it has an automatic sheer and black out drapes with the buttons just beside the bed) you will see the harbor. its quite stunning in the evening where you can sit and enjoy the view. we have a DVD player, iPhone dock and a paid internet connection. we also have a big closet to hang clothes in and there are drawers for folded clothings. we checked out the pool on the roof top and it was really nice. the water is heated but the weather is just too cold so i guess thats why the pool area is deserted. we checked the gym as well. it was properly equipped and maintained. the staff everywhere is there and ready to assist you in about anything. We took the shuttle to Sheraton and I was expecting a mini bus or something like that but instead it was a posh van with spacious seats. you have to call the concierge first to reserve a seat. there are various drop off points. if you want to go to the avenue of stars you can use the Sheraton drop off or take a taxi, it will cost you around 25-33 HKD. the hotel had a mall connected to it called the elements mall. I recommend the sala thai for authentic thai food. order the chicken satay and green chicken curry. its very very good!!. the mall have a website so you can check it out for more info. all in all, our stay was a very enjoyable one but like I said theres not much outside in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Easy access from Airport, and right in Kowloon”
Reviews.Author: MaximusOliver
Reviews.Content: Very nice modern hotel... High tech room sand close to a variety of markets. A bit difficult to find when walking through the mall from the Airport Express. Make sure and visit the pool while you are there!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, nice bar, forgetable restaurants”
Reviews.Author: HKGRoaming
Reviews.Content: I stayed there with my partner for a weekend away. The place has a decent location, the bar is lovely but the view is distinctly limited and can be more of a club than a quiet hotel bar. The rooms were actually very nice and the pool on the "75th" floor is actually well worth a swim. Went to the spa, more relaxing than is therapeutic. Only problem is that the two main restaurants are either very average for food and in the case if Fire - dark, with low ceilings and just not a great atmosphere. However I have to say, it remains to be fairly cool for a big chain hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Awesome.”
Reviews.Author: JSMBali
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at many of the usual name brand hotels for business travel over the years, I decided to try what friends said was a "very unique" hotel. And they were right! "W" is a fun and trendy brand that is like no other hotel I had stayed in before. The dream beds and linens were the best I have ever found in a hotel. The decor and art work is young and fresh. The Bliss spa products in the room were outstanding. Breakfast was fabulous. Room service was fast and efficient, food and wine was yummy. The "W" motto is "Whatever, Whenever" and they mean it! Staff are empowered to serve guests. I was standing in the lobby talking to my friend about needing a reusable shopping bag as I refuse to take plastic, and one of the "W" staff overheard my conversation. Not 10 seconds later he ran up to me with a fantastic W recyclable shopping bag that was mine to take home! The hotel is in a great location right on top of the Kowloon MTR so it makes it easy and quick to get pretty much anywhere in Kowloon or Central. Also very convenient to the airport. The shopping centre downstairs is excellent. I highly recommend this hotel for both business and pleasure, "W" is really a unique experience and I can't wait to try "W" hotels in other cities in the future. Highly recommended for a great stay and great fun! Just make sure you like the colour purple :).

Reviews.Title: “Trendy and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Pooky_TH
Reviews.Content: Just spent a night in a "Fabulous room" with a full harbour view. The room was average size but it had everything you can imagine. Very comfortable bed, nice bathroom and very good A/V with flatscreen and surround sound. Unluckily the IPod dock was not compatible with IPhone so we could play our tunes! The view from our room was fantastic and we had a perfect sunset with no clouds. Very friendly and helpful staff and they even gave us W tote bags to carry things around. The location is a bit isolated and you will not be able to walk outside but the connecting mall(Elements), subway station and the Airport Express station offset this. The hotel offer a shuttle service(7 passenger seats Alphard van) to nearby areas and depart every 1/2 hour. If you are taking the Airport Express train then the bellmen will help take your luggage to the airline check-in area. Nice hotel and I will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing W Hotel, Impressive a must when you go to Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: deluxe_afficionado
Reviews.Content: we stayed there for the weekend and were told the hotel's location is a bit off, which we thought it is not. however with the attached elements shopping mall this is great and a taxi ride to Nathan Rd is just 5 minutes the most. however you get "compensated" with a truly spectacular hotel! Amazing design! Amazing hardware! very professional service in all areas, such as the friendly guys by the door, the breakfast team, the pool attendants, just everyone. they have a entrance lobby on the ground floor, from there you take an elevator up to the actual hotel lobby, very trendy and great in design. the elevator floors are iluminate and greet you with either "good morning" or "good afternoon" whatever time of the day it is, nice touch. all the rooms have a TV in the bathrooms, so you have to take a bath, separate shower and separate toilet. the w bed is very comfortable, great to sleep in. pool, gym and Bliss Psa are on the top of the building, 78th floor, with dramatic views over Central and Kowloon. breakfast is worth every penny, they have it all and every day you find something different, new, to taste. the lobby bar is "watching people" all day and has a very nice atmosphere. the hotel is clearly very trendy and modern and we were surprised by the different generations staying there and all enjoying the place. We will be back soon! Keep it up!

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and trendy”
Reviews.Author: pelachi
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights for business - was upgraded to a fantastic suite - that's what they called it and I guess it was pretty fantastic. Location is right above bus terminal, Kowloon airport express and Kowloon railway station. There is a HMV store right next door (great for a night in watching a dvd) and an extensive shopping all within walking distance (again a shopping centre and food court nearby is great for crashing in the hotel room). If you like the hustle and bustle of Nathan Rd, Central or Causeway Bay then this is not for you. The hotel is almost an oasis but convenient enough that if you want to go into the fray then its a quick walk to the bus terminal, subway or 5 minute taxi ride to Nathan Rd. I actually walked from TST and it took me 30 minutes (I took my time after walking off a very big dinner). If you do walk, the road works are a bit of a nuisance. Room was great - really comfortable bed. Shower was AWESOME - rain shower from above and spray shower from the side each with own tap. Big bath too. Only thing I couldn't figure out was how to turn the TV off - they had a B&O system which I just couldn't figure out. Value is subjective - I paid HK$2500++ per night. Compared to say Intercontinental or Penninsula, the location suffers but the cost is lower. Also, the rooms are newer and the suites are more spacious. Only other thing that was a bit annoying was having to change lifts all the time. Reception is hidden on level 6 then you have to take another set of lifts to the room. Gym is accessed through different lifts again but the gym is EXCELLENT - on level 72 with superb views of the harbour and HK island.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was perfect except an evening which ruined by a staff”
Reviews.Author: Daniel_THL
Reviews.Content: Return to the W Hong Kong after my 1st visit 1 year ago. Still love this hotel and was given an upgrade to the harbour view room this time (just obtained my SPG Gold and wish to stay in a suite next year after i got my SPG platinum). Thanks But..... an evening ruined by an impolite staff at the main entrance when arranging the hotel shuttle service to Harbour City at 7.30 or 8.30pm on 17 Oct 2010. The shuttle didn't come on time, I asked this staff and he told me will be arriving in 10 minutes due to traffic jam- thats fine for me. Therefore I went my room to drop something while my wife still waiting at the shuttle waiting area. The shuttle came earlier than the "10 minutes" and my wife saw there were already 5 guest went into the shuttle (I believe a Toyota Alphard only takes 6 passenger max exclude driver- there were already 5 others and how about 2 of us?). My wife told this staff to wait, he refused and mentioned it's our fault not waiting around. I returned a lot earlier than his mentioned "10 minutes", he only replied in an impolite way that i was late and never want to mentioned the occupancy of the shuttle. Is this the attitude to save your time for arranging a return trip to pick us up? or we already registered earlier, why dont you just tell me the shuttle is full? I will still rate my stay in the hotel a perfect 1, but please just train this staff to response customer's question in a more polite way.

Reviews.Title: “Appalling service”
Reviews.Author: catMelbourne
Reviews.Content: This hotel's service is just appalling for a so-called five star hotel, and it started before even arriving at the hotel. I was trying to find out information from the hotel's PR and promotional team, and encountered unreturned phone calls, and numerous promises to provide me with information which never came through. I am in fact still waiting to receive information about a particular hotel package from the hotel's PR manager, and the request was made 6 weeks ago. The service levels are simply appalling. Despite the nice rooms, I will never recommend this hotel to anyone, as the lack of service for the amount you pay has totally turned me off.

Reviews.Title: “Best Shower!”
Reviews.Author: LeeCK
Reviews.Content: Stayed only for one night on business. Can't review much, spent most times in room. Likes: - The Shower - To call it a rain shower is an understatement, it felt like a waterfall!!! I took a little longer than usual under the running water. I feel sorry about the water bill though, but when I think of the rate the company paid, I think the room rate should cover. - The bedside control panel for lights and curtains. convenient, and they work. - Location - Directly above HKIA Express. which is great for business travellers. Dislikes: - View - facing 2 big blocks of apartments, feels like having hundreds of households against you. - Location, a little out of the way. Elements not that a fantastic mall. - I did not feel any warmth about service at all, waited 20 minutes just to check out, granted it is 7am in the morning, with only one staff at reception. but there was no acknowledgement that she is aware I was waiting.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but a little out of the way”
Reviews.Author: RichieCMontreal
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the W Nov 15, 2010. The hotel is very nice with the usual cool W vibe as you walk into the lobby and the elevators. It is located in Kowloon above the airport train station. This can be quite convenient if you are planning a short stay in Hong Kong as you have very quick access to the airport via the very efficient airport train. (best and least expensive way to get to the airport in Hong Kong) It is also located within Elements mall which is a very nice upscale mall with some good places to eat. The check in was quick and well handled I particularly appreciated the complimentary upgrade. The rooms are very nice and quite roomy by Hong Kong standards. I was in a WOW room with a view of the harbour, for a frequent traveler to Hong not a must. The room had great technological features such as a 42 inch television with surround sound, great for watching movies. In addition there is a bedside panel that controls all lighting and the blinds and drapes. The bed was super comfortable as is customary for most Starwood properties. The bathroom was cool and well laid out with a superb rain forrest shower with great pressure. The internet was a bit slow but quite manageable. I checked out the pool up on the 73 floor and it is great. The one drawback to this hotel is it is a bit removed from the bright lights of Nathan road and the rest of TST. All in all I was very satisfied and would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Most people will love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: pine129
Reviews.Content: I just completed a 4 day stay for a business meeting at the W Hotel. Normally I focus on location, price and value for my review. This time I am confused on how to balance these. The W is located inside the Kowloon Statioin / Elements complex in Kowloon. You cannot ask for better logistics for aiport or to get around Hong Kong. But the Elements is quite isolated and there are aspects of the location that are not common for Hong Kong for shopping, eating and sightseeing. I did not like this remoteness. Check in is on 6th floor and you need to search a bit to find the reception, but staff made it easy. My room was not ready due to early arrival, but I was handled well. When I go to the room- WOW. They want to be remembered for the experience of the hotel in general and rooms specifically. Loved the room and the bed is #2 for all time comfort. I especially rememeber that the TV offered many more channels than is common in Hong Kong hotels. Internet was ok- but fee based. Sad that for such as expensive hotel that they still choose to charge. Normally this hotel is outside of my company budget, but with customer meeting I paid the price and it was ok. Personnally I cannot justify the cost of USD $400+ per night- even for the comfort. Staff was outstanding. Food was very good. Checkout speed was great- they found ways to avoid the paperwork common for many hotels. Lovely place overall.

Reviews.Title: “Love the W!”
Reviews.Author: cammy79
Reviews.Content: Loved loved loved the W! I didn't really know what to expect, it being a last minute trip to Hong Kong, and its been a few years since the last time I've been there. I got a good rate from family who gave us a starhot discount. I did some research and I read that the W is very near the Kowloon Airport Express stop, which I thought was a plus. But the reality of it, having arrived, everything was so convenient. Airport express was easy to use, and took us to Kowloon station in 20 minutes. Getting out of Kowloon Station you arrive at a mall, which later I found out was a fairly new mall called Elements. Less than a 5 minute walk inside the mall, and after asking information we were at the W. (The information maps at the malls seem to always have a actual person standing by whom you can ask information from). The W is connected to the mall, so you never really have to go outside. From the moment we enter, we just barely crossed over to W from Elements Mall, a very perky and kind young man welcome us and introduced himself to us and gets our bags from us. We feel welcome right away. You have to take an elevator to the main lobby area where you check in, and we go, and again, stepping off the elevator we are greeted from far away by a woman this time. Who then again introduces herself and takes me aside to what doesn't seem to look like the check in area, more like just a small desk behind the concierge. She gets my info, informs me the room isn't ready yet because we arrived at noon, and check in isn't till 3pm, but she will ask housekeeping to rush the cleaning. She offered for us to stay and have drinks or come back in a couple of hours. We decide to go out, and I realized this woman takes me off to the side table because the line at the main check in and check out area was already very long. Plus plus plus for W! Before our arrival to Hong Kong, I realized though the W is connected to the MTR, there is no MTR that goes straight to Tsim Sha Tsui, we'll have to go take one MTR and get off and connect to another one. Anyway, we decide to take a cab instead, and it seemed like only a 5 minutes drive we were at Tsim Sha Tsui, and it cost only HK$20. Later I realized the W has a free shuttle that goes to Tsim Sha Tsui, but its like every hour or half hour. Anyway, coming back to the hotel, my sister was called and informed by someone that she got the wrong bag at the airport. We leave after our lunch at Tsim Sha Tsui and go back to the hotel to double check and the woman was correct. We got her bag instead, and my sister's bag was left in the airport. My sister thinking that she has to get her bag at the airport and go back and bring this lady back her bag. Seeing our dilemma at the bellboy station on the ground floor where our bags were being kept while waiting for check in, the bellboys are asking what they can do to help. They offer getting our bag at the airport and bringing the mistaken bag to the lady's hotel. Really great service I tell you, we don't even have to ask and they offer already. But my sister decided to get her bag herself because she needed it right away. But we had them take the lady's bag to her hotel. We get to check in right after and our room was just a regular Wonderful room, and it was great. I'll upload the pictures here when I get a chance. For a Wonderful room, I found it exceptional already, what more the higher priced rooms. We also swam there. The pool is on the top floor with a great view. Though it was advertised that the pool is heated, it didn't feel heated. For November, Hong Kong wasn't very cold but wasn't very hot either. There is a hot tub though next to the pool and that was really relaxing, after dipping into the not so heated pool. The breakfast buffet was another amazing experience. I've seen a lot of breakfast buffets but not like this. They had individually bottled fresh fruit juices. I'm guessing homemade yogurt also individually jarred. They had fruit smoothies also in the buffet, right next to the freshly sliced fruit. They had an assortment of hot foods, Chinese dumplings, bacon, perfectly scrambled eggs soft and fluffy, and a lot more. You can have an omelet made to your liking and the first in a long long time that I've seen anyone make a perfectly cooked omelet. Not overcooked, nothing browned or burned, just pure yellow color all around. The have all kinds of breads and pastries. I'm not sure if I got a picture of this Wonderful breakfast spread, but if I didn't I should have. Then at the end of your stay, you can easily check in your baggage at the Kowloon Airport Express and roam around till you need to go to the airport. I left the Kowloon Station only about 80 minutes till my flight. I had more than enough time to get to my boarding gate. I can't wait to go back to Hong Kong and stay at the W. The service was great all around, and I'd like to say the bellyboys at the ground floor was really the best. Because each time you leave or come back, they will always say hi and welcome you and ask you how you are. Its really great cause they are always the first and last person you see coming in and out of the hotel, so they always leave a great impression.

Reviews.Title: “W is for wonderful”
Reviews.Author: timbeen
Reviews.Content: The rooms were very clean and tastefully decorated. The bed was extremely comfortable. We loved our room. Most importantly, though, the service that everyone provided was exceptional. From the doorman, to the housekeeping, to the room service, every employee we encountered was professional, helpful, and friendly. We are very impressed. My wife got a last minute appointment at Bliss spa for a massage which was heavenly.

Reviews.Title: “Superb breakfast buffet”
Reviews.Author: Umbrellaman18560
Reviews.Content: Extraordinary interior design features throughout; friendly attentive service; rooms full of features and bed comfort second to none. The Kitchen restaurant is justifiably busy and the breakfast buffet is superb for variety, presentation and quality. Location right above Kowloon station makes it so convenient for the Airport Express train (and MSR to Island etc.) and the airline check-in counter at that station makes the return journey to the airport luggage free. A complimentary shuttle every 30 minutes wil take you the Kowloon shopping area or near to the Star ferry for trip to the central area of the Island.

Reviews.Title: “Double The Pleasure At W”
Reviews.Author: TravellingCarlito
Reviews.Content: For those in search of a hotel with a great vibe and a funky feel through and through, then this hotel absolutely fits the bill. From the moment you walk in and experience the stunning decor of the lobby, the common areas and each floor, you will truly be pleased you selected this hotel. We were really impressed with the creative design of the decor in the lobby, the bar and even up in the pool area. The rooms are very smart in the design and layout, making clever use of the space to make you feel like there is a lot of room all around you. The furnishings are all very sleek and new. The bathroom is very spacious and has beautiful stone tiling throughout. I love the shower head and the Bliss products they give you to use as amenities. Every item you could ever think off is available for your use, from the plush W slippers, thick robes and the luxurious king-sized bed to help you crash after a long trip. The room also comes with a large safe that is able to fit a laptop and all your necessary valuables. The wardrobe space is very suitable for any shopaholic. A pillow menu is also available for you to choose something to your liking, which is hard to find in many hotels these days. We were also very happy with the automated controls in the room, with multiple light settings, curtains and blinds. Everything you could think of for a comfortable stay has been thought of in the room. The gym is set up high to give you stunning views of Hong Kong harbour while you work out in the hotel's modern facilities. There are plenty of machines around, so there is no queuing. They also provide you with brand new headphones to use (and keep) if you need it. The gym is also stocked with plenty of fresh towels, bottles of water and green apples for the gym patron. Make sure you take a trip to the pool at the rooftop. Great views from the top while you cool off in the pool. Another place to worth hanging out in is the bar. A decent selection of wines and cocktails in an great setting, especially on a Saturday night. You can get all types of crowds coming in to enjoy the scene and makes for a good start to a night out. The other exceptional aspect about this hotel is the service from the staff. All members of staff exhibit a great level of professionalism and courtesy. As an example, I had asked number for a local restaurant. Instead of giving me the number, they asked if they could call the restaurant on our behalf and rearrange our booking. This was excellent since we had to change our booking time 3 times that night. There were many other times that we had made similar requests and they were eager to assist every time. The hotel is also in an ideal location, sitting right above the Kowloon airport station. So you are an easy walk from the airport train station as soon as you get off. There is also the Elements shopping mall, which is dangerous for some. The MTR station is also right below the hotel, so it is quite convenient. A hotel shuttle is also available free of charge to TST and the ferry terminal. Other free services include wifi in the lobby and hiring an ipod for the gym. Overall, this hotel is every great experience you can imagine. Highly recommended for anyone coming over to Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “One of the coolest business hotels”
Reviews.Author: Jack-malki
Reviews.Content: An amazing hotel experience...excellent facilities and excellent service. I would highly recommend not only for business travellers, but anyone visiting hong kong. Located a few minutes walk from Kowloon train station, it is one of the easiest places to arrive to from HK airport.

Reviews.Title: “wow indeedy”
Reviews.Author: catfight55
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the W Hong Kong for 3 nights with my husband for our honeymoon. From the moment we walked in to the moment we checked out, we were constantly wowed by the hotel and the staff. Our first night there, we called for room service and had asked about vegetarian options. The hotel immediately sent up a vegetarian menu, which we didn't even know they had. The decor was modern and chic. The room was spacious and the washroom had a tub (with a tv), rain shower, and a telephone right beside the toilet...not to mention the amazing Bliss products that I am now addicted to! The bed was amazingly comfortable, the surround sound was noticed immediately by my husband and I want the button controlled blacked out blinds/sheers and different mood lighting option console thing in my bedroom at home. I love the fact that you can't hear the other guests when you are in your room - which is a huge pet peeve of mine at most hotels. I also booked a few treatments at the Bliss Spa...which was just out of this world. And roof top pool? just crazy! you have to check it out! Most importantly, the staff. Everyone is so nice and helpful...really makes a guest feel like they really do care. The location is both good and bad. The connecting element mall has some great stores and the grocery store is a great place to pick up a few snacks and drinks. Airport Express is connected to the mall so that is really handy for travelers like us. That being said, we had to cross to the HK island side daily. By MRT was cheap but you always have to pay extra for taxis. Still, W Hong Kong gets my vote for favorite hotel in the world and I wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Typical W luxury”
Reviews.Author: Totti K
Reviews.Content: We have stayed twice at the W hotel in Hong Kong. On both occasions the services has been luxurious, elegant and as smooth as possible. Everyhting from the arrival to the late check-out has worked beautifully. The rooms were spacious (compared to normal Hong Kong hotel rooms), decorations in the hotel were imaginative and the pool on the roof really worth visiting. The only downside from my perspective has been the location compared to business district and nightlife on Hong Kong island. W hotel in Kowloon side is definitely "isolated" compared to many other hotels on Hong Kong island. No biggie, but you do not want sit on a taxi during rush hour. But the on the other hand, the Elements mall (attached to the W hotel) is great for shopping and spending extra time and the smooth connection to Hong Kong International airport with Airport Express and the possibility check in your luggage at the Kowloon / Elements station is absolutely great. If you search for luxury and excellent service with very refreshing decoration, then the W hotel in Kowloon is definitely worth visiting.

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary Chic - Great to Access from Airport - Use Points!”
Reviews.Author: AeroGuy84
Reviews.Content: Being on the Kowloon side affords you excellent access to the airport (via the Airport Train in the mall beneath) and a beautiful view of the Hong Kong styline. However, for visitors wanting to access Hong Kong Island, take into consideration the time and effort to do so. Consolidating feedback, here is my take: Check-in: My best friend, and companion on this trip is SPG Platinum, which is why we chose this particular STarwood property.
