Unfortunately, we arrived around noon and didn't have a room available. We were told one would be ready shortly and that we could enjoy the roof pool. Unfotunately, a room was not available until 4pm without any follow-up from the staff. We were offer 2 drink coupons in the lobby bar for the wait. Rooms: We were upgraded to a corner "suite"; but this is really just a large room with great views, albeit somewhat blocked by the financial centre building ahead. The bathroom is fantastic, and the shower room had floor to ceiling windows to the buidling across. Definitely an experience for the timid - shades are provided! However, the rooms have a distinct damp and slightly mold feeling to them. They are spotless, but because of the humidity in HKG, it never felt dry a/o crisp. Property: The pool is lovely on the roof and great for a few hours of downtime. Also, make your way up at night to see a bit of the skyline lite up. I highly recommend the breakfast buffet. It is a perfect blend of western and traditional choices. If you shoot for the brunch time, it is empty and the food is fresh. This is a great options for tourists looking to fill up and sustain most of the day. Services: The W provided a house van (free shuttle) with 3 drop off points in Kowloon (no HKG island). This is a free service (not advertised well) and only provides a drop off. I recommend using the central drop off by the Sheraton Hotel, which makes for easy access to ferries for HKG Island or to walk the main street in Kowloon. Location: The location is IDEAL to come/go to the airport and a simple walk to the Night Market, Warf, etc. DO note it is a bit removed however, and with the constant construction, you may have to be clever crossing the street. Chic style but too pricey on it's on. If you are an SPG point earner, use the combo points/pay for this property. You will earn more points than it is worth redeeming.

Reviews.Title: “My family stays here to visit - great except pool staff!! lazy lazy”
Reviews.Author: teamflames
Reviews.Content: I live nest door to the hotel so get my family to stay here when visiting. Generally the hotel is very good but I just have to write in the hope management will read this and finally do something about the lazy gits working at the pool. Everytime we go up there we have to leave as its just so disappointing. On most recent occassion had my 85 y/o grandmother with me - stood in front of 6 staff with not one offering to help and when we asked for them to put an umbrella up (which is already there) they sighed!!! and then only put up one umbrella although its clear there were 4 of us sitting down. Then we asked could we order drinks - and the answer is no!!!!! Thats the second time I have been there and they said no - when I was just about to go into a rage they backed down but demanded the drinks be "simple". All this from a supposedly "hip", "trendy" hotel. Anyway - rest of hotel (and most of the staff) are good. Rooms are good size and the beds superb. Reception is usually good and the guys on the door are great. Concierge is hit and miss they can be a little too "cool" to help sometimes. Bar/restaurnat staff usually great. All in all - good hotel, solid rooms, location is ok if u know HK but slightly off the main tourist section. The pool itself is great (highest one in HK) if its not overcrowded (ie avoid w/e's and fri and sat night) but the pool staff - pls just lose them!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Uber sexy hotel will make you feel hip again”
Reviews.Author: HalleAndTheWorld
Reviews.Content: The W in Hong Kong is one of those hotels that makes you feel like a movie star. Every detail has been carefully planned--- from the mix-CD in the AUDI SUV that picks you up from the airport to the layout of the rooms allowing each room sweeping views of the city. I was impressed by everything-- the rooftop pool, the proximity to the subway, the breakfast. Did I mention the breakfast? It's the best buffet breakfast in the world. No joke. The only problem with staying here was that I never wanted to leave...

Reviews.Title: “Its a beautiful hotel, but they love to nickel and dime the customer”
Reviews.Author: powerrose
Reviews.Content: Of course this is a gorgeous hotel in an amazing location. The bed was easily the most luxurious and comfortable bed in the world. However, just to compare against other luxury, high end hotels like the Ritz and Langham Place, I had two complaints: 1. I think a small child wired the electronics in the rooms. First our remote ran out of battery and we had to rip off the TV panel and unplug the TV to turn it off (it was late, so we called down the next day to fix the problem). I couldn't get the ipod player to work, and after an hour, I kindof did but I couldn't adjust the volume. Then whatever I did with the ipod cause the picture to not work in the bathtub TV (but the sound came on). Then at night, I finally got the volume to work after hitting all the A/V buttons, but then it got stuck on too loud and I couldn't even turn it down with the button on the actual TV set. I couldn't find plugs anywhere by the bed to plug in my computer. The curtain-opening button kept getting stuck. And all the buttons for the lights just were too complicated. By far the most technologically complex and frustrating hotel. 2. I felt the mentality at this hotel is that wealthy people stay here, and come with their wallets wide-open for non-stop plundering. Wireless was 115 HKD per day! Most hotels just have an open business center, but to check you email at the W it costs 45 HKD for the first 15 minutes. In-room breakfast was quite the racket, with things like toast costing 35 HKD (I think) and dry french toast was over 100 HKD. No in-room coffee, and coffee to purchase was not cheap. The minibar was incredibly overpriced as well, this is compared to the Ritz, which provides free fresh fruit, etc. They could try harder to provide the illusion of service, like charging for in-room OR business center internet, but not both, giving deals for spa treatments/dining, providing inexpensive/free drinks and snacks. I just thought it was odd to be paying a fortune for a hotel which has the same attitude towards services as a Best Western or Holiday Inn. There were some nice touches like free cookies in the check-in, chocolate with turn-down service, and the Bliss products. I just think they could take it one step further to retain the luxury experience. 3. We couldn't get service in the lounge area. Every time we went down to have a drink, we couldn't get in because we didn't have a reservation. Overall, though, this is a great hotel and I would certainly stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “New & different, exciting & luxurious!”
Reviews.Author: mijansso
Reviews.Content: The W Hotel at Hong Kong is an experience - a great one! From the curiously odd but cool design elevators, lobby and hallways, to the fabulously big rooms with dolby 5.1 sound systems, slide-out TV's, huge bath tubs, bathroom walls that slide and adjust to suit every situation, making the room even more spacious - this hotel is new, innovative and fab fab fab! The spa at 72 - 74th floor is amazing. Swim or bubble at the jacuzzi at the height of 200+ meters, with a grand view to Hong Kong island and all the landscape around - and truly feel like you are on top of the world. The inside spa is also just awesome, with beautiful deco, lights, sauna, etc. One word: QUALITY. I would absolutely recommend this hotel to business travellers, adults on a fun holiday and people who want to enjoy a world-class spa with no extra fees attached to the use of the facilities (much unlike silly Intercontinental hotels etc, shame on you!).

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Broter
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the w Hotel Hong Kong for a Confrence, and it was excellant. The hotel is right next to a shopping centre where there is plenty of shopping to be done, alot of high end shops and places to eat. The train station is also next door and very easy to use (we got the train direct to Hong Kong Disneyland). The hotel also offers a shuttle service to about four destinations around kowlloon, you just have to get your own way back. The staff were so helpful, you could not fault them. I can recommend this hotel to tourists and for business.

Reviews.Title: “techno-chic extravagance”
Reviews.Author: justindelaney
Reviews.Content: So, Hong Kong is a city of beautiful differences. Ying and Yang. Filth and Sparkle. Nature and Steel. Rich and poor. From the rooftop of the Hong Kong W pool, you can sulk back in the jacuzzi, and just beyond the steam, note the massive threads that stitch this masterpiece of divergences together. Design The Hong Kong W is an ambitious stab at techno-chic extravagance. Everything sort of glows, and every expanse of wall, nook and cranny, is crammed with design statements and modernist showcocking. To be honest, I would call it over designed, but in a fun way that makes it tolerable in the short term. I can accept the abandon from the powerful statements simplicity could have made. But only just. Location The hotel is located on reclaimed land in West Kowloon in a ritzy shopping, residential, and office complex known as Elements. The nearby mall is stocked full of expensive shops and designer names. There is also a great grocery store. The Elements mall is the link to subway stations and the city in general, unless you are cabbing it. For auto pickup, there is a cab stand right out the W front door. I would rate the location as decent, but I personally prefer to stay on the other side of the harbor on Hong Kong island. One huge drawback is that it is difficult to set out on foot without walking through the entire mall area, as the court in front of the hotel is sheltered by a highway and a parking garage. Rooms The rooms are nearly without fault. The curtains are heavy, and even better, remote controlled. You can rise, press a button, and the fabric slowly rises, offering a dramatic morning view of cargo ships and outlying mountains. Believe it or not, this was my favorite feature of the hotel. The beds were quite soft. We had a great flat screen television with plenty of channels. The room was generally without fault, aside from one issue. The control panel on the night stand, which served all curtain raising, lighting, and ambiance functions, glowed like a small personal UFO. It was annoying. Bathroom The bathroom felt modern and utilitarian, but lacked function, namely in the shower. After every shower, the floor would flood. This may have been a unique feature of our individual room, but the ridge that separates the shower from the general bathroom was more of a suggestion than an actual attempt to keep water out. I have a suspicion that this issue plagues most rooms. Aside from this shortcomings, I thoroughly enjoyed taking in a man bath while enjoying the tub television. Common Areas The bar is a good place to meet up. Drinks are expensive, but that is expected at a place where rooms are $400 a night. The bar ambiance is generally well polished and slick with the feel of an upscale modern living room. There are even books and games for guests to thumb through. I did not eat at the restaurants in the hotel. They were too expensive. Hong Kong has some of the best food in the world. There is really no good reason to overpay for it. Pool Area For me, this was really the star of the Hong Kong W. After a few nights, we began to plan our evenings around a late night soak in the roof top jacuzzi. The roof of the W, about 77 stories up, offers fantastic views of Hong Kong Island and the outlying territories With the tallest building in Hong Kong, The International Commerce Center, sharing real estate with the W, the view is somewhat broken by its monolithic presence. It definitely puts Hong Kong's grandiose affinity with vertical growth into true perspective. Being 77 floors up and looking straight up at another building that seems to pierce the sky and enter orbit is oddly stimulating. All told, visiting the Hong Kong W pool area is an exercise in modern extravagance. Hotel guest or not, it is worth stopping by for. Pricing and Alternatives The Hong Kong W is an expensive hotel, expect to pay around $300 for a basic room. If you are not on a budget, then I highly recommend it. For about half the price, you can stay at the Metropark on Hong Kong Island which also has a nice rooftop pool with great views. Justin Delaney Goboogo Travel

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel - so easy to get comfortable”
Reviews.Author: K1w1Travel
Reviews.Content: W Hotels are normally quite nice and trendy, but this one is in my mind the best place to stay in Hong Kong. Sure the location isn't ideal, but it is an easy train ride to either the airport or Hong Kong Central right under the hotel. The service here is exceptional - the staff really seem to care about the quality of your stay. The rooms are the best design/use of space I have come across in a hotel and the rooms are quiet and the blackout curtains are incredibly effective. After the horrible experience I had at the Regal Hong Kong this hotel and it's staff were a breath of fresh air, and like I said the rooms are very comfortable and easy to get used to. I have tried other hotels in Hong Kong and nothing comes close to this, especially if you get a room here on one of the deals they often run (web or non changable). This hotel is definitely worth a stay

Reviews.Title: “Lives up to the W brand - one of the best”
Reviews.Author: foiegras99
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at the W Hong Kong. It is very trendy like all Ws, but not intimidating/stuffy like some (see my W Hotel Hollywood review). All Ws have great rooms, but somehow the room here was that bit more refined. Somehow the bed seemed even more comfortable than usual? My those sheets are soft! The room I stayed in was small, but not as small as one I've stayed in in New York a while back, and because of the finish it didn't bother me at all. It's one of those rooms that you look at and go "maybe when I do up my next house....."! The view of the (commerical) harbour was surprisingly nice considering it's a bunch of big ships! I'm not sure if I was in an upgraded room due to being SPG gold, but it was on a high floor and very quiet. Anyway, I only stayed here one night but am heading back before my flight home as we are travelling via Hong Kong again, and I'm really looking forward to it - that says something for someone who spends half their life in hotels (you miss home after a while, trust me!). I didn't get to check out the restaurant during the last visit, but will do this time. I can report that the room service was good, though. Dinner was quite good (had spicy pasta....) but not amazing, another occasion I ordered a Club Sandwich and although a fairly boring order, it was excellent! What was good about dinner was that the food wasn't too fatty, with steamed vegetables etc on the menu - good if you want to stay healthy on your travels, as I find many hotels just shove too much butter with everything.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice, but you have to know what you're getting into”
Reviews.Author: MikeyR
Reviews.Content: I'm frequent traveller to HK (please see other review of Intercontinental HK), and it’s usually an overnight trip to HK on the way to or back from mainland China. As a SPG Platinum, the SPG choices in HK are unfortunately limited, the Sheraton on Nathan Road is old and shabby, and the Meridien in Cybervillage is too far. Which leaves you with the W. The W is part of the Elements mall, with an added advantage of being attached to the airport express train and the city train. Overall the hotel is what you expect from a high end W, all sleek, hip, and LOUD! Over the last few months I've stayed there 7 times. And generally I have very few complaints. The positives are; 1. The location 2. The hotel is spotlessly clean 3. The beds are very comfortable 4. The room amenities are very good The downsides 1. There's no proper lobby, which is usually a W design (flaw in my opinion) 2. The hotel is very loud, in the "exchange' which is the small restaurant/cafe attached to the check in area on 6th floor, there's usually a happy hour, a function, etc. and you have to work your way through the throngs of people, and very loud music to get to the lifts 3. It’s very pricey, everything is very pricy, even by HK standards 4. The TV/DVD entertainment system in the rooms is very complex, and not very reliable Overall all, I would recommend the hotel, but if you are expecting a typical Southeast Asian luxury hotel with a large comfortable lobby, ala Mandarin Oriental, Peninsula, etc., this is not the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Wow. Wow some more. Wow.”
Reviews.Author: Fionarina
Reviews.Content: The best hotel in Hong Kong. The staff are second to none. The whatever whenever service is beyond 150%. Incredible stay. The W Hkg car fleet is the Audi Q7 and the drivers are friendly and cater to the minutest details. The rooms are very nice, my favorite is the bathroom. I love the shower area. If you know your way around Hkg, the location isn't bad. For first timer, it could get confusing.

Reviews.Title: “A very good hotel. We stayed in a...”
Reviews.Author: CCHLondon
Reviews.Content: A very good hotel. We stayed in a fabulous harbourview room. The room was a good size and real care and attention has gone into providing every facility you might conceivably need access to. Facilities are very contemporary with a modern tv and surround sound system, large picture window looking onto the water and one of the most comfortable beds I have slept in. Service was slick and efficient throughout. The rooftop pool also a great feature. The only negative for me would be location - if you have a choice between this and one of the hotels in central (or say the intercon or peninsula in Kowloon) you might find this location less enticing, principally because you can't really walk anywhere - it's either MTR or a cab. Not a problem if you want to go to central but getting to the harbourside in Kowloon and the star ferry is a cab ride. Had this been in a better location I would have given it the maximum score.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JasonWG
Reviews.Content: This is a stunning spot. As usual with a W you have a great vibe and an exceptional style. Loved the rooms and thoroughly enjoyed staying here. It is the easiest place to get to from the airport, take the train right to the mall and head upstairs. Takes no time at all and has the check in counters there. The mall is great as well. I do prefer to stay on the island side though so for touring the hotel is quite removed. Our only issue was needing to taxi back to the hotel from the island so much. We prefer to eat/tour soho and the island so it was a constant trek back and forth. But for staying Kowloon side it is great - you just can;t walk anywhere local other than the mall. Would still go back though because we really appreciated the space.

Reviews.Title: “An Owesome W hotel”
Reviews.Author: AbhinandanR
Reviews.Content: I like staying with W hong Hong. I like its connectivity.I like its hospitality....Its an all together dufferent W experience...

Reviews.Title: “Good, But Tries Too Hard To Be Cool, Which Is, Like, Totally Uncool...”
Reviews.Author: LunaLondon
Reviews.Content: The hotel is new and in the imposing Elements development, which soars above HK's container port. The open air pool is on the giddying 76th floor. The rooms are beautifully designed, many with Harbour views, with wonderful bathrooms and have lots of gadgets. The lobby has some wow factor. However, I left feeling a little disappointed and perhaps even annoyed. The whole W concept is a little too heavyhanded for me. Irritating W alliterations abound and there is a really uncomfortable, forced "funkiness" to interactions with staff. A DJ played very loud, sometimes good, other times not-so-good, house music in the lobby and bar; fine if you liked it and didn't need to actually hear your companions. There is a shop in the lobby selling all that W considers cool. I've stayed in several other Ws before, but found this one particularly irritating, perhaps because its US style seemed ill-suited to Hong Kong. Lots to stimulate and a genuinely impressive pool. Very convenient connections to the airport and the MTR. The large Elements Mall right beneath the hotel, but the location is isolated with little else in the area and not much feeling of Hong Kong, so count on lots of cabs to and from Kowloon and Central.

Reviews.Title: “What a cool experience”
Reviews.Author: walaha
Reviews.Content: Just spent two nights at the W Hotel and I have to say I am a fan! Definitely not on the cheap side, but extremely stylish, cool and with an abundance of friendly staff. It started already at the airport with a friendly greeting, continued when we arrived at the hotel and about 5 people wanted to take care of our luggage and didnt stop at the receiption where we had an extremely efficient and fast check-in. The room is very trendy, with lots of nice features like the iPod docking station, the little TV over the bathtub, lots of powerpoints and internet connections. Enough space to hang your stuff and a nice and comfortable king size bed. Beautiful big windows, allowing for a great view over Victoria Harbour and Central. The location is great, just on top of the Airport Express, Kowloon Station and the Elements Mall. Staff was always around in abundance and extremely friendly and service oriented. The breakfast spread was nice, not the biggest I have seen but more than sufficient on a biz trip. The pool, gym and spa on the top floors (76 floor) are another highlight which one has to see and experience. All in all the best business hotel I have been in HK and I have been to quite a few

Reviews.Title: “Well what's a wow hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Angiiiangle
Reviews.Content: W Hong Kong is one of my favorite hotel. I must admit that the hotel website pictures cannot impress me but once you are there and see the real hotel, it is totally different. My family falls in love with this hotel. The wow suite room is fabulous. You could feel like you are in New York at night time when you look out of the glass and see many high rise buildings 180 degree. The hotel location is very good, right next to the Kowloon station and the Element mall. The room is well designed to utilize the limited space. It is also cozy and clean. The services are excellent. Whatever you asked for, you would get within couple minutes. we enjoyed the swimming pool and the jacuzzi pool on the 76th floor. You can relax and spend the day there enjoy the expensive view of Kowloon. The jacuzzi pool in the changing room is also nice and you can have privacy while sitting there,relaxing and enjoy the lovely view of Kowloon. Do not miss the spa at Bliss, it is worth to try. The concierge was done the job exceeding my expectation. I never expect that they will provide a service to the Kowloon station but they did which could save our time to check in our luggage to the airport. We love this hotel and will come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Very cool hotel with an extremely friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: TheOCfromBigD
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for five days and enjoyed everyday! The airport train has a stop at the Kowloon station that emerges in the Elements Mall attached to the Hotel. They even let you check bags at the airport train station when departing. The Kowloon station gives you access to everywhere. The hotel staff was very friendly/helpful and most of them seemed to know our names by the end of the five days. The room was very modern and highttech. The remote controls located bedside controlled all the rooms lights and the window shades. The bathrooms were very trendy/user friendly and included a tv at the end of the tub. This was a favorite for our kids. I highly recommend a nightime swim in the pool on the 76th floor. We left our camera in a taxi and the staff went above/beyond trying to track it down for us. Our loss was a painful lesson in the importance of daily backing up your photos. I recommend a Star Ferry trip, the tram to Victoria's peak, the cable car to the Big Budda, the Scary bus ride to Stanley on the other side of Hong Kong (Bus 6X), and a day trip to Macau. I also recommend getting the Octupus card for each member of your party to make using the MTR and buses simple. We hightly recommend the W Hong Kong!

Reviews.Title: “Chic, modern yet cool hotel - great service”
Reviews.Author: tsquared123
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really awesome, and I liked the bedrooms, which were nicely furnished. Very new, extremely clean, cool and comfy furnishings. A very unique hotel brand. Service was excellent - staff were extremely friendly. Beds were slightly soft, plush pillows were great, good sleep overall. Amenities were great, including iPod jack to TV and automatic curtains, room was quite spacious (liked the bathroom with sliding doors which made the room seem bigger) with a good view of Kowloon and partial Hong Kong. The adjacent Elements shopping mall was very convenient, with a variety of shops. Although it was not centrally located, the location was good in the sense that the Kowloon station is right beneath the adjacent mall, very fast access (about 3 minutes) to Hong Kong station. Well-connected to the airport and Hong Kong. Quite worth it. Oh yeah - did I mention that the swimming pool was on the 76th floor? The view from up there is spectacular, with great views of the city. I really enjoyed my stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: GCtraveller
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic hotel. We have just returned from HK after a 7 night stay. We were originally booked into the Langham Hotel Mongkok but moved to the W Hotel after a couple of days and wished we had booked here first. (We couldn't stand the Langham Hotel - What a dump compared to this place). We were given a Wonderful room on the 31st floor and the view was amazing. The room had the most incredible electronics with everything being controlled by the push of a switch. The bathroom was really lovely. There was a separate TV at the end of the bath so you could soak in a deep bath and watch TV. The shower was a separate one with a really cool rainshower head. Wish I had one of those at home! Everything in the room was clean and modern and it was a really good size room. It was probably three times bigger than the Langham Mongkok room - no kidding! The hotel was so spotless. We have never seen such an amazing entrance to the lifts. We had to look for the switch for the lift for a few moments as each floor as a bookcase with cool little books, clocks etc on it and it simply didn't look like a lift lobby. The actual lobby for the hotel was on the 6th floor so it was a bit confusing at first, but the staff on the ground floor were always helpful. We found the entire staff here to be super efficient and friendly. Location wise was great for us. The MTR is at the mall attached to the W and we found that really good for going to Disneyland for the day. There is a free shuttle which leaves every 30 minutes and takes you to Nathan Road. Unfortunately you need to get a taxi to get back but that was no bother. It is not walking distance to Nathan Road, but you could have if you are a lot fitter than us. We used the restaurant and room service and found these to be first class. For a cheaper option the Mall has a a number of choices. We found this great little Thai Restaurant which only cost us HKD 68 per meal. Overall I would absolutely recommend the W to anyone. If you are thinking of going to HK then please stay here. You will not be disappointed. We have stayed at a few hotels in HK but this is the best. We are going back to HK in a few months and will be staying here again. On another note, HK is a great place to visit. The shopping and site seeing is incredible.

Reviews.Title: “Cool hotel.”
Reviews.Author: EdwardTylicki
Reviews.Content: I loved the convenience of this hotel over the station where the Airport Express (24 minutes) stops in Kowloon. Within an hour of landing I was in my hotel room. The rooftop pool is beautiful. I especially loved the jaccuzzi in the mens locker room - an infinity pool with a wall of glass overlooking the city. There is also a nice sauna and steam with spa like amenities. The hotel is like most w hotels around the world and tends to attract a younger, gayer, hipper crowd. It is probably one of the nicer w hotels in the chain right now. Like all w hotels, a cool bar scene off of the lobby. In short a perfect place to relax in the evening if you are here on business.

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TokyoCC
Reviews.Content: The W Hotel is just great. Convenient location (the train from the airport to the hotel was just too easy), great shopping and dining in the massive train station/mall building that houses the W, the best "hotel gym" I've ever seen, and attention to every detail. Very trendy, very hip, very fun. My only real complaint is that I enjoyed the hotel so much that I probably didn't see as much of Hong Kong as I should have! Here are two dining tips: If you eat breakfast in the hotel, skip the a la cart options. They might sound yummy, but the buffet is just as yummy as it is beautiful, and just as cheap. If you don't get the buffet, you'll probably spend much of your breakfast staring at the plate of someone who did. Tip #2 - Skip the hotel restaurant (not the one where they have breakfast, but the one on the bottom level - maybe called Heat?). Great atmosphere, but the food was just so-so, and overpriced (like most hotel restaurants). Overall, a great stay at a great hotel. Book this hotel now!

Reviews.Title: “W - for WONDERFUL”
Reviews.Author: thechicko
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for four nights - loved from start to finish - the entire W feeling was amazing! We were treated like a royal couple - whatever we needed - the W staff delivered with a smile. From the bartender - Bonnie to the Chan Jones - manager of the Kitchen - all treated us totally amazing! We were greeted almost everywhere by our names and a smile - each staff introduced themselves to us and told us do not hesitate to contact them if we needed anything. The biggest surprise was the young lady at the front entrance - Michele who each day greeted us by name and ask how we were enjoying our stay! A total great experience from check in to check out - thank you all for making us feel special for a few days! Do not hesitate to stay at this W - onderful Hotel if you get to Hong Kong!

Reviews.Title: “W - For WOW”
Reviews.Author: gauravdoshi
Reviews.Content: A super hotel to be staying in, this is the first time that stayed in kowloon and not mainland hong kong. Hotel is buzzing with activity, check in was fast and staff was very helpfull, rooms are DIFFERENT ! ( in a good way ) funky music system , ipod connecting dock, tv in the bathtub, amazing view, and great mini bar. WIfi is expensive. Breakfast was the best meal i ate here. room service was not all that great, ( maybe cause im a vegetarian ) . What i also like is that they give ipods to guests to borrow ! . The roof top swimming pool is a must see and so is the gym and SPA. What really worked for me about this hotel was the its a 2 min walk to the ICC centre which is where my office is located and the hotel has a AMAZING shopping mall right below the reception( name the brand its there). There is also a movie theatre in the mall. Check out was quick and service of the staff was also good. All in all since this was business being in kowloon did not hurt and after office hours the hotel and mall offer enough things to do. This hotel would be my top pick if i had to stay in kowloon.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!! Thanks W Hong Kong!!”
Reviews.Author: RobStewartSharkwater
Reviews.Content: I was lucky enough to stay at the W Hong Kong during a long trip around Asia filming for a documentary . After arriving from a long flight, it was incredible to find myself in a corner suite showcasing inspiring floor-to-ceiling views of the city skyline. With a intense week of filming, meetings and events, the hotel manager and communication team and staff kindly accommodated all of the team's needs including hosting an amazing VIP reception for my guests and associates. Loved the amazing breakfast buffet, including mountains of fresh mango, and the stunning view of HK from the rooftop pool where we relaxed while filming time-lapses of Hong Kong harbor. I was hard to say goodbye!

Reviews.Title: “Trendy hotel conveniently located in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: simoncox
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the W for two weeks while I was in Hong Kong. The hotel is on top of Kowloon station which is only one stop across the harbour to Hong Kong station, so very convenient for IFC and the rest of Central. I've seen a few other hotels in the W chain and this one lived up to the 'trendy' nature. I think the best feature by far was the outdoor pool on the 76th floor overlooking Hong Kong island. Granted, the ICC (Hong Kong's tallest building) is between the pool and the view, but it's still an awesome panorama to see while floating along, or dipping in the jacuzzi! The staff were very helpful and made me feel quite a valued guest. My only complaint would be having to pay for broadband, despite the hefty price of the room. Although this unfortunately appears to be standard in this class of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “w = wow!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ricky1987
Reviews.Content: i stayed in this hotel last yr!!! its really coool hotel..the designs were great....esp. the lobby!!! the hotel is located near the shoppin mall...under the metro station too...luv tooo visit again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Kind of Cool and Trendy and Very Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: BENLEE123
Reviews.Content: The W chain is one of the SPG group of hotels and it caters to the more trendy, young and hip crowd. It’s more popular in America and Europe but has found it’s way to Asia after the opening of W Hong Kong few years ago. Arriving I only had a very short one night transit stay in Hong Kong and decided to try out the W for convenience reason. Upon arriving at Kowloon Airport Express train station, it’s just a short 5min walk thru the Elements Mall before reaching the hotel entrance. Check-in was speedy at the reception desk at the 6th floor. I was assigned a harbour view room at the 29th floor as per my reservation. The Room The room was advertised by the hotel at about 40sqm though I think it’s smaller than that. Not as spacious as what I am usually used to but perfectly adequate for a short overnight stay. Two features of the room immediately apparent is the open concept bathroom and the large floor to ceiling windows with a day-bed at the side. This is a room that is very high on comfort factor. The King Bed features some of the best hotel linens I have ever slept in and provide a very good night sleep. The bathroom features a rainforest shower cubicle with great water pressure and fluffy bathrobes and towels. Bliss toiletries are provided which smell very nice and foams well. There is a 42” LCD TV with a integrated KEF audio/video system. I was able to play DVD movies and my iPod on the system though at times the interface is a bit quirky. There is intelligent and intuitive mood lighting in the room. From the bedside console, one can select Day, Night or Dream and the lighting of the room adjust automatically. Most in-room amenities are intelligently hidden away in closets and drawers to give the room a very neat and tidy feel. Power plugs are conveniently located throughout the room. Wireless internet works the first time and the speed is fast. The room is very quiet too. I am not sure if it’s because of good soundproofing or just that the rooms next door are not occupied. The location and Common Areas The hotel is connected to Elements Mall which sits right on top of the Kowloon Airport Express train station and the Tung Chung MRT line. This makes it very convenient as a transit hotel for short overnight stay. Check-in and luggage handling can be done at the train station counter without any hassle. The Elements Mall has a wide variety of stores and restaurants. I have to say the common areas doesn’t exactly cater to my personal preference. The lighting can be a bit better as it seems to resemble a nightclub most of the time especially at night with the dark ambience and the pulsating disco-like decorative neon-lights. Even the lift features a neon-display on the floor. There are comfortable sofas and chairs all throughout the common area for lounging and well decorated with abstract art. It’s all very funky, trendy and cool depends on what your taste gravitates towards. I do feel at times a bit out of place as most of the hotel patrons appears to be very young people. The hotel has several restaurants which I didn’t have time to try. Service It’s too short a stay to test out the hotel service. Generally, my impression is that the service is adequate and they generally respond to service call very fast. I would not say it is outstanding though but I can’t make a more in-depth evaluation due to the short stay. Conclusion The W Hong Kong is without doubt a very nice hotel. The room rate is a great value as the hotel room score very highly on the comfort factor and it’s location make this an excellent hotel for travelers on overnight transit. The décor and style of the common areas is not exactly to my taste but I will not discriminate the hotel based on this since the W brand is trying to appeal to the young and trendy crowd in accordance to the chain's brain image. For the room rate charge, I am not expecting top-notch luxury but the materials in the room are of good quality and it’s perfectly decent and very comfortable. I have no qualms about returning to this hotel again. Overall, I have no complains and rate it a very high 4 out of 5.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful W Stay”
Reviews.Author: avocadobacon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W hong kong for 4 nights in early July. We loved the hotel and would go back again. This is what we like about the hotel (we really have no complaints): 1) Clean, large room with a comfortable bed and luxurious shower. Nice TV, furniture and appliance. Very chic. 2) Good location. It is connected to the Elements mall and also the Kowloon subway station. You can take the train to the airport and it is only a 20 minute ride. You can also do airport check in at the Kowloon subway station. From Kowloon station, you only take the subway 1-stop to get to Central. Very convenient. 3) Great customer service. Friendly staff. 4) There is a free shuttle that takes you from the hotel to the TST main shopping area. The shuttle comes every 30 minutes. 5) Awesome rooftop swimming pool on the 76th floor.

Reviews.Title: “Marvellous in all aspects”
Reviews.Author: M_Teo
Reviews.Content: After a series of delays checking into our pre allocated room, we were generously upgraded to a Marvellous Suite by Ms Alison Tai. She was extremely apologetic about the whole situation and graciously took invaluable time to show to our absolutely stunning and chic suite with a magnificient harbor view (both from bedroom and bathroom ) We were overwhelmed, needless to say WOWED by it all. The fully equipped hip roomhas all the conceivable amenties one need . We were also floored by the most comfy sofa and the BAng n Olulfsen home theatre system in the living room. When we were leaving one of the staff,Patrick even offered to help bring our luggage to the Mainland bus station( conveniently located within Elements shopping Mall) where we were to catch the express bus to Shenzhen international airport. Overall, we were thrilled with the room and the warm and personal service. Already planning a return visit. .Needless to say, we enjoyed every single moment here

Reviews.Title: “Generally good - odd & aggravating at times”
Reviews.Author: JayODHK
Reviews.Content: I live in HK but have been staying in a couple hotels over the past few weeks to see the World Cup on the television - interesting perspective to be a guest in your city. Stay at the W was generally positive but at times a little odd & aggravating. First off, the rooms are gorgeous with that classic W blend of luxury & minimalism. Rain shower is fantastic and the stone in the bathroom has just the right amount of porousness to make it feel nice & warm on your feet. Mini TV in bath a nice touch. Upgraded to harbour view as a Starwood member & 2:00 late check out. Now the laundry list of the bad. Non-smoking room but it smelled horrible - like cigars covered up with Raid & stripper perfume, just could not get it out of our clothes. Makes you wonder what people are doing to these rooms - definitely brought to mind Mickey Rourke's line about "carpet cleaner" from Barfly. Bathroom sink is completely flat with no angle & a drain only at 1 edge so it is virtually impossible to rinse down anything you spit in it - a little gross after a while. Like almost every modern hotel, the lighting system is unnecessarily complicated & fussy - you need a degree in electrical engineering to just leave one light on in the bathroom overnight (I usually end up opting for the make-up mirror). Glass elevators from ground floor to 6th floor lobby not air conditioned & always crowded. When the sun shines on them they are greenhouse hot - supposed to be a swanky feature but you feel like Paul Newman spending "a night in the box" in Cool Hand Luke - I definitely did not "get my mind right." 76th floor pool is stunning & breezy but more than a bit of an exhausting scene - clientele divided between weekending Mainland parents fawning over their 1 (or if very wealthy 2) children & men preening for other men & intensely swimming laps while grunting & making faces like they are training for the Olympics . At least in June, after about 14:00 the only sun left is a thin slice near the glass facing the harbour & the beautiful people all pile & wedge themselves in there like it's Gericault's "The Raft of the Medusa" or something by Hieronymous Bosch. Also hamburgers are grilled right next to the pool & if you are not a meat-eater it's like sunning next to a crematorium - the grill is big & so are the hamburgers so there is no escape. Check out was understaffed with only 2 people & the line was literally 10 deep - all while at least 3 other staff were in sight but just standing around fussing with their hair - not their job, I guess Overall view more positive than negative but in hindsight I am pretty happy that I don't need to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Tranquility in the city”
Reviews.Author: losangelesgirl20
Reviews.Content: I just finished a week's stay at the W in HK, and I have to say that I just love staying there. The service is always amazing. Not only do they remember you, but they remember you with such open friendliness that it feels like they really care how your stay is going. The rooms are such a perfect space for the female business traveler... amazing bed, speedy internet, amazing bathtub, totally modern and calm. And then, you also have Bliss spa to pamper after a 14-hour work day. The lobby is a bit cheezy with the music and all that, but it's easy to avoid and there's so many benefits to the hotel that it's worth ignoring. My favorite room service meal was the Caesar salad. totally yummy. So much more fresh, modern and young than the Intercon, but I have to admit they have a better pool.

Reviews.Title: “Good pool and jacuzzi”
Reviews.Author: Vegtraveller2010
Reviews.Content: I had booked this hotel for 5 days. It is a jazzy hotel. the receiption is good and the staff is quite helpful. it has an excellent pool and outdoor jacuzzi on the 76th level which provides good view of the harbour as well as HK island - it is quite windy at that level and one enjoys the pool as well as jacuzzi. The room is quite spacious. Kowloon airport station to take airport express train is in the same mall. For food although the mall offers good options for non vegeterains, vegeterians have to travel to Tsim Sha Tsui - although the hotel provides complimentary drops to Tsim Sha Tsui at regular intervals. the service of the hotel can be improved

Reviews.Title: “Be mindful of annoying staff”
Reviews.Author: VPPG
Reviews.Content: I am a Platinum Member with Starwood and typically spend over 100 nights in hotels around the world. This is my fourth stay at this hotel in the past 18 months together with my staff, so now I am ready to write a review. This W is very new and well decorated. Rooms are well appointed and of course the heavenly beds are awesome. Transportation to all major areas of Hong Kong is very convenient (taxi, train, MTR) including to/from the airport. If you are looking for a hotel to walk out and "live" Hong Kong this is not the place. The hotel is co-located with a shopping mall and no other attractions around. Reaching "city attractions" and/or "points of interest" will require motorized transportation. Consuming anything (breakfast, lunch, dinner, drinks) in the hotel will be expensive even by Hong Kong standards. This hotel will take every opportunity to make money in the form of service fees (10%) and high prices on services and consumables. The staff has a habit of invading personal space with their constant in your face "can I help you" while they pace around you whenever you are in a public space which is very annoying. It would be OK if they were to ask you once and then leave you alone. Instead the staff shadows you through public spaces after declining their offer for help. My staff and I typically end up feeling very uncomfortable and "speeding" in and out of our rooms and the hotel just to avoid the staff. As with most W hotels the layout of the lobby is totally dysfunctional. The bar and restaurants are not “welcoming”. Again a lot has to do with the layout itself and the staff. You simply cannot visit a public space, bar, or restaurant without staff all over you. It is hard to enjoy a conversation, drink and/or a meal with friends, colleagues, or business partners when you are being constantly interrupted by the staff with questions and/or removing items from the table in the restaurants and bars. Adding insult to injury, requests not to be interrupted and/or make accommodations for your preferences as a guest are not respected. During the “Football World Cup” the TV in the bar was not on and I asked for the match that was being played to be shown on TV, my request was denied. I was told that the hotel management had requested that the TV not be turned on at that specific time. Declining this reasonable request for the TV from a hotel guest seems to me contradictory to the “hospitality principles” of hotel operations, so I just went to my room and watched the match from my heavenly bed without the additional expenses associated with a bar bill.

Reviews.Title: “Happening location, superb view, convenient connectivity...much recommended”
Reviews.Author: Boobunny25
Reviews.Content: When I stayed there on March 25 for a few days, it was a very happening place as the International film festival was being held there then and there were good parties at night and the place was glittering with the who's who of the film industry. The rooms are awesome, the views are superb, the restaurants are really very spacious and have a sumptuos exhaustive spread, you name it and they have it...you cant stop eating. the service is very good and the staff is very organised and courteous. Highly recommended place better to be in Kowloon than in Hong Kong ! Very trendy elevators with jazzing lights and everything is modern technology !

Reviews.Title: “Great trendy choice for Kowloon”
Reviews.Author: dre_techie
Reviews.Content: One of the best W Hotels, and a very nice fit with Elements mall. The rooms are nice and big, the bathroom is very exciting, with its large sliding doors, opening it to the room. This alone gives you a view from the bathroom. I only had a Spectacular room, the only reason to splurge for more would be a better view. The bar is great, in the evening it's very popular, even for people from outside the hotel. The proximity of Elements mall and Kowloon station make dining, shopping and a seamless connection to the airport very easy. Kowloon station has an in-town check-in station, therefore you can hang out in the city if you have an evening flight without worrying about your luggage.

Reviews.Title: “WWWoW What a Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: defragger
Reviews.Content: Stunningly modern. Wide rooms, Great service, Festive decorations during Xmas, Cool restaurants and Bar. Great Breakfast spread. Convenient Location on top of a mall and above Express train to airport and the subway.

Reviews.Title: “A new W”
Reviews.Author: RuediAbtwil_Schweiz
Reviews.Content: At first I was a bit surprised a the location since I am usually on Nathan Road in the midst of Hong Kong`s insanity that I love so much. I was positively surprised when the valet greeted me by name (he read my luggage tag!). The entrance was very different, being nothing but a small desk and the W-shop...Elevator to the front desk and your eyes get stuck on the very interesting bar filled with all kinds of people. Makes you forget the distance to downtown. Rooms were great with a great view of the bay and HK. Extremely friendly personel as well.

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: Daniel_THL
Reviews.Content: Everything will make you say WOW. a very modern hotel which make you feel the designer taking care for any corner in the hotel. Location is good if you travel by the express from airport.

Reviews.Title: “The W concept out of USA”
Reviews.Author: HDLBruxelles
Reviews.Content: I am always waiting when i am staying in a W hotel something special. I was disappointed in NYC in december 2009, i understand now why: all the capacity and power of this brand was in Hong Kong to imagine and offer "the special hotel of the place". Hong Kong have a large offer of hotels but the W is certainly a good choice if you like to be not too far of everything in a special and up to date concept and deco, with a good staff. The swimming pool is great, the corner suite is fabulous, the vieuw of the room (not victoria harbour) is spectacular anyway. The subway is easily walking distance, the train from the airport and the check in town for this too. In summary a good choice in this crazy town.

Reviews.Title: “WOW WWWWW”
Reviews.Author: Poppasam13
Reviews.Content: What an amazing hotel. Excellent service, good location and not the long walk to nathan road as people have said previously on this hotel. Its a 10 minute walk to the start of Nathan road, and 15 min if you really want to take it easy. The spa centre is really nice, and the hotel is within a shopping mall, so really conveniant for shopping too. Taxi to the hotel is nothign much at all. Something like abotu 50 HKD from the middle of Nathan road. On departure, you can check in at the airline desk and send your luggage from the train station next to the hotel. So no need to lug anything across. Any specifics please dont hesistate to contact me.

Reviews.Title: “Vacationing in Style”
Reviews.Author: Mullay
Reviews.Content: Very cool hotel with very stylish lounged lobby. Room was beautiful with everything feeling modern and well equipped. Bathroom was beautiful! Swimming pool and gym on the 86th had a good view of parts of HK.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel would be the best hotel in HK...”
Reviews.Author: hugchamel
Reviews.Content: This Hotel would be the best hotel in HK. It is super chic and luxurious. The pool on the 76th floor over looking HK is one of the highest pools in the world. The fitness club is great. I could go on and on you def need ti experience it. The only negative is it is nit walking distance to the main shopping in Nathan Rd but the have a free shuttle there. It is so easy to get around in Hk so not too inconvenient! Take your own tea bags though if you like standard tea eg English breakfast coz all they have free in the rooms is herbal flavoured tea or coffee and when I asked for normal tea it came at a cost.

Reviews.Title: “very cool!”
Reviews.Author: ruthiepegs
Reviews.Content: stayed here with my 19 year old daughter we both loved it as it has a very cool atmosphere. some service issues could be improved.. we came to swim in the pool area and we were told that there was nowhere to change! oh! we could change in the lavatory block... in fact the changing rooms are in the spa on the floor below which we found another day. we would definately return to this or other W hotels for the atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Hong Kong!”
Reviews.Author: ilovethebeach06
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 3 nights stay at W and I must say this is the best Hong Kong hotel I have stayed in so far. Nothing compared with the JW Marriott, Shangri-la, Conrad, Langham Place.... We booked a Fabulous room and it is the most functional room I have ever seen - my only two complaints were - the toilet flush which is so difficult to press and the door to the room which is so heavy and there was no stopper around. The location is fantastic and the restaurants in the hotel and the shopping mall are great too. Room service is great too and when they foresee that the kitchen was busy, they actually prepared us that the waiting time will be longer. All the staff speak relatively good English (including the guy who sent up our room service) which I am quite surprised. From now on, it will only be W for me in Hong Kong!

Reviews.Title: “Oh so FABULOUS in our Fabulous Room!”
Reviews.Author: HelinskiSydney
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W Hotel for 2 nights in May and booked a Fabulous Room. The hotel was so beautiful with its artwork and sculptures, including an Avatar "I see you" like hibiscus statue in the Reception. The staff were wonderful and sooooooo helpful. And the BED! It was the most comfortable we've slept in! It was such a pity when we had to leave! Would come back to Hong Kong just to stay at the W again!

Reviews.Title: “trendy, funky, interesting and great service”
Reviews.Author: TadgeHongKong
Reviews.Content: Firstly this is probably not the best hotel if you have young kids- its clearly aimed at the funky younger crowd. Check in- quick and friendly. 3pm- bit late- we turned up 1.30 no worries. great bar on reception level, nice atmosphere and very trendy decor. Room very nice- gadgets galore, good view and size, gray and minimalist but very nice feeling. large room for Hk standards. Lots of great little touches throughout- fab snack bar (not free!) doors, fixtures, fittings all very funky. Pool and spa area free to use and really nice- mens spa v quiet and some good loungers by pool on top floor. Pool area nice- ate and drank there. Staff a little slow to serve and also tidy up (things blow about up there as it can be windy) but friendly enough. Limited menu up there but lots of water and apples about. Again, lots of interesting touches. not sure about the piped music (which is everywhere!!) could have done without it or just chill out music. great views up there- 76 floor! Fire restaurant was great- tasting menu for 2 -LOTS of food couldnt hardly finish and we are big eaters!- and a bottle of wine was about $1000 HKD. (100 US) rather quiet but good service and amazing presentation throughout. private dining room very nice looking, also a good area for 6 people semi private. Interesting- a great meal. Check out extended to 3 no problem and really fast. Little sweets on check in and out desk- really nice little chocolates. perfect for the young and trendy crowd, hen nights, gay couples and people looking for something a little different! A good hotel that stands out in a city of amazing hotels. worth a visit!

Reviews.Title: “great relaxing weekend”
Reviews.Author: jktpe
Reviews.Content: Looking for a relaxing weekend with some shopping in Hong Kong, we booked two nights at W Hong Kong at the end of September 2009. Arrived by Airport express in no time, up the escalators turn right and already in the W's lower lobby - super convenient ! Very friendly welcome in a hip but relaxing reception area upstairs. Quick and smooth check-in and into a very nice and large corner room at a then-promotional rate, forgot but wasn't cheap. Great design, though and all set up with "Bliss" amenities, would love to buy those after using them up. We came there to enjoy and did exactly that. We had a Churrasco BBQ dinner at FIRE and champagne at the living room. We both dressed up for the occasion and the hotel and had a fabulous time. Tried the Bliss Spa, nice but felt it was too pricey for the experience we got. Outdoor pool is gorgeous. Hotel location may not be so perfect yet for someone doing business, due to ongoing development of the reclaimed land the area sits on. Didn't matter to us - we came for shopping, relaxation and a little luxury and had a great relaxing weekend helped by friendly and casual staff. We expected a very flashy and possibly cold design, but surprisingly found a very accessible, warm and cozy very modern hotel. Perfect for us, we'll stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “best hotel i have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: satavahana
Reviews.Content: This has got to be the best hotel I have stayed in a business trip. In the other hotels I just go back to room to take a nap, but in this one I would look forward to going back to the hotel. When you go back to your room, the set it up with club music playing. The lobby area is super trendy and so is the rest of the hotel. The rooms are large with a really cool bathroom (the top shower is excellent). The furniture looks great and the top to bottom panoramic windows are awesome. I just loved my room. It has a terrace pool which looked really great but I didn't get a chance to use it. The beds are soooo comforable.. I can't think of staying in any other hotel if I go back to HK.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful...A few hickups but overall very good”
Reviews.Author: sammeus
Reviews.Content: This hotel is definatly very trendy. Dolby suround sound in ever room with an amp. in ever room. I had to call down to reception at 1am to check that the sound comming out of my TV wasn't disturbing other guests (the bed was vibrating due to the novelty of having a TV DVD volume up that loud.) However was told that all the rooms where soundproof. Service by the pool was a bit disapointing. Took ages to deliver any food, and when a cheese platter was ordered on the last night, it arrived without any crackers (after 40 minutes....they said they rushed it through because we wanted it striaght away), after questioning this 20 minutes later was told that the hotel had run our of all crackers. Would have liked to have known this before the platter arrived. Also my partner had a lift door shut on him as he was entering a lift. However it did not bounce back and took the two of us to force it open whilst another staff member stoof by and watched this event unfold. I reported this to staff at the front desk so others would not have this happen from a faulty lift, however did not receive any follow up from staff/management about the welfare of my partner (he was quite bruised and shaken from the experience!) The Watever/Whenever (concierge desk) seems to be lacking a bit of the promise of whatever/whenever (it is a tall order after all!) However all was forgiven when they aranged a tour for my partner travelling out to Doha (they have a hotel there and the W Hong Kong where in contact with Doha W for onward travel plans.) As he was only transiting Doha for a day, and not staying over night he did not book accomodation in Doha, yet the W arranged for him to store his bags there and also organised a tour for him with very little fuss. There resteraunt/bar recomendations where also wonderful! I am a very tough hotel critique and despite the issues give this hotel it's 5 star rating. It was an absolute breath of fresh air after the Four Seasons Hong Kong. A few minor places to patch up service but overall the room, trendyness and vibe make up for a lot. Unlike the Four Seasons, this place doesn't promise to be 'perfect', so when they make a little mistake, you can only forgive them. Highly recomend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room, Messy Services”
Reviews.Author: nsw2033
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband did a quick two nights trip in Hong Kong. We usually stay away from Kowloon Island but since what we wanted to do this time was mainly on the Kowloon side, we thought we would give it a try and stay with W. First, the location is OK. It's right above the Kowloon Station BUT, if you have a lot of luggage and planning to travel to the hotel with the Airport Express, then we won't recommend staying here coz you'll need to drag your luggages from the station to the hotel. A lot of walking and very confusing like the other people have mentioned. And personally, we hate the mall downstairs (The Element). It's huge but confusing. We don't like the shops there anyway. It's mainly design for the mainland tourist with heaps of luxury shops but to be honest, not that something I will go shop at regularly. The location is not like other hotel in Central or Causeway Bay where you can easily walk to the city and find nice local foods or restaurants. So not recommend to those who are new to Hong Kong and planning to do a lot of sight seeing. Now the room. The room is nice coz we got upgraded to the Fantastic Suit (I was upgraded because my check-in was delayed and was frustrated with the slow check in process). However, we were told by the staff, during check in, that we have 29,000 points with our SGP membership and that we can redeem the rooms for free. I told them that we didn't think we have so many points but if they see it on the system, it can't be wrong and yeah.. why not. So, when we check out, the staff now told us that we don't have enough points to redeem and that redemption needs to be applied online in advance. To be honest, we don't care about paying and we were planning to pay but it tells us that how messy their system is. Worse, their staff never admit that they make a mistake. They make it sounds like it was all our "miscommunication". Why can't they just admit and say "I'm sorry". Another incident was that on Day 2, we got a message from the hotel saying that our airline trying to contact us. When we called, it was the Lufthansa hotline and obviously the message wasn't for us coz we were flying with Cathy. So, another thing telling us that the system screw up somehow. Oh, did I mention also they sent us the wrong luggage to our room. When I told them that it wasn't our luggage, the staff was like "oh. where are your luggage". Hey, you tell me where my luggage were coz you have my stuff at the first place. So all in all, nice room but bad systems and services to live up with the big name. Not a fan of boutique hotel and definitely not W Hong Kong for that kind of services.

Reviews.Title: “Swanky design combined with modern designer rooms”
Reviews.Author: butanehi
Reviews.Content: The service was great except sometimes the hotel was a bit busy. We had a Fabulous room with great views of the shipping harbour. The bathroom was awesome except the TV in the tub wasn't very practical. The sofa is a great idea, the beds are incredibly comfortable, but the DVD player which controlled the TV sound had to be reset twice. The wired center was closed and we had to go to a different floor just to get it unlocked. The novelty and the design of the hotel and the room and the pool were just out of this world. Despite the small problems we encountered, this hotel is a must stay, at least once for the experience!

Reviews.Title: “Again another wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: ejblue
Reviews.Content: We LOVE this hotel. The staff is great - Louis Fung to name one of the many people who take the time to recognize you and give that extra attention so you feel at home. Our room had a great view. We were asked on a daily basis if we were happy or if their was anything they could do to make things better. And we always responded "no everything is perfect!" We had business in Hong Kong, the train is right down stairs - nothing could be easier. If you don't feel like eating in the hotel, no problem their is a 5 star mall connected with amazing restaurants. We had friends that wanted to meet up. The bar at the W hotel is great for congregating. I nothing bug praise for this hotel. This is our 4th time and we will be back. Thanks W ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Trendiest Hotel in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: mrickHongKong_Boston
Reviews.Content: The only problem with the W Hotel in Hong Kong is that it was hard to leave the hotel! The rooms were designed in a modern and fun manner, the water from the pool seems to drop off the side of the hotel into the city and the gym is convenient and polished. The location is great if you want to be close to the airport but not if you want to be close to Hong Kong island.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I have ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: JWHMelbourne
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel is pure class. The fact it sits above Kowloon Train Station is a huge bonus especially given you can check luggage in at train station rather than airport. W Hong Kong is simply sensational in every aspect. Highlights inc. rooftop pool, friendly staff and amazing breakfast .

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: WTravelerSeattle
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the W Hong Kong last week. I booked two rooms for my family and parents. The hotel is located on the Kowloon side (vs. Hong Kong Island), however the MTR Kowloon Station is located in the Element mall under the hotel. You can take the Airport Express train directly from the airport to the hotel and avoid the crowds and multiple stop. The elevators at Kowloon station could be confusing, however once you get to the mall floor, follow the signs to the W Hotel. If you decide to go to Hong Kong Island, you can take the MTR train also located in the Element mall under the hotel. Hong Kong Island is the next stop so it is really close and convenient. Taxis are also readily available from the first floor if you decide to skip the train. The hotel and mall is very trendy, so expect to dress sharp (jacket) or look out of place. They trained their service staff to look and talk "cool", but underneath it all, they provided exceptional service especially to my parents. They even lent us the hotel wheelchair for my father the entire time of our stay. THANKS! The heated pool on the 76th floor cannot be missed! Go there at night to get the most out of the view from the hot tub. The room we had was nice (great shower!), but the view was of the highway and crane ships...so make sure to ask beforehand. Also the TV didn't work and had to be replaced - not a big deal since they did it when we were away for dinner. We didn't eat at the hotel, but there were multiple Chinese food restaurants to choose from at the mall - even an award winning dim sum restaurant. I would also recommend Harbor City (less than 10 minutes by taxi) for additional good restaurants. The small coke in the fridge was over $6 USD, so skip the fridge beverages…there is a grocery store in the mall where you can buy everything you need including good pastries. There is also a Starbucks located in the mall. The concierge service was very helpful so make sure to drop by and have them help plan your day. Definitely would recommend this hotel to the young professional and the fashion minded. I would stay here again – but next time maybe leaving the kids behind.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel to recommend”
Reviews.Author: Peanut_Dream
Reviews.Content: W Hong Kong is really a "WOW". They care enough with all little detail. We enjoyed everything. The room. The service. The decoration. The design. The amenities. The pool. The bed is literally a heavenly bed!! I definitely will go back again!!!

Reviews.Title: “We were Wowed by W”
Reviews.Author: Rene F
Reviews.Content: W Hotel in HK is definitely a cool place to stay. It may not be your traditional non-surprising dry hotel and you may have to work a little to find the reception at the sixth floor, but then again you do not come to a W hotel because you like being bored, do you? I stayed here with my son of 15 and he liked it as much as I did. I am a platinum member of the Starwood Preferred Guest program, so I have seen quite a few of their hotels, but W Hong Kong is one of the most remarkable ever stayed in. We arrived at 8.30 in the morning from Paris so I would not have been surprised at all if our room had not been available, but instead the reception went out of their way to offer us a room imediately. We were upgraded to a "marvelous suite", which is a sensational corner suite with breath-taking views and, for example, a bathroom where you can have your bath watching TV and in front of a window with sensational harbor view (see our pictures)...I could go on and on about the size and quality of the room.. Then there is the location of the W hotel. It is right next to Kowloon station where you would arrive with the Airport Express Train, 20 minutes ride from HKG airport. Between the station and the hotel is the Elements shopping center, with some good food options (we recommend Wooloomooloo steakhouse, for example). On your way back to the airport you can use the in-city check in, next to the hotel and receive your boarding pass and drop off your luggage already before boarding the Airport Express train. Kowloon station is also an MTR station and in one stop you are at Hong Kong station on the central Island, for example. Don't forget to visit the swimming pool at the 76th floor of the hotel. We noticed that even at this height the neighboring sky scraper had 65 floors above us and it turned out to be the ICC, the World's fourth tallest building. Amazing! Last but no least: DO take your breakfast in the W hotel! The service is friendly and the buffet is overwhelmingly complete, with anything from Asian food to eggs made to your order, to fresh fruit to...to... The check-in and check-out was pleasant and efficient. At that same level they offer free wifi. W Hotel Hong Kong is just simply WOW ! Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel... not so sure about the service”
Reviews.Author: DenJenK
Reviews.Content: I attended a team meeting which was held at the W. The hotel had recently opened and was really very impressive. My room, a Spectacular Room, looked great and had all the amenities needed to make for a comfortable stay. The bed was extremely comfortable and the bathroom was beautiful. I loved the plentiful Bliss toiletries. The view certainly wasn't the most impressive outlook available in Hong Kong but it was still lovely. Breakfasts were delicious and the variety on offer at the breakfast buffet was impressive. The meeting rooms and meeting room catering were also top notch. The only disappointing aspect of my stay was the lackluster service. I found the staff quite disinterested and aloof (at check-out they didn't ask whether I'd enjoyed my stay) and I just didn't feel anyone wanted to go out of their way to help. Perhaps this was teething problems as the hotel had newly opened but it did take a little bit of the shine off the overall experience.

Reviews.Title: “W is Awesome”
Reviews.Author: fromOntarioCanada
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. I agree with some of the reviews a few of the staff have attitude. You can take the train from the airport right into the hotel so that is very convinient. The decor is outstanding, the pool is on the roof and that is outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Lousy Plumbing!!”
Reviews.Author: BARRYA_10
Reviews.Content: Our ship docked half a mile from hotel. Book in fast and very efficient, Room all you could want. With a HK harbor view of the South wonderful!! Room 30 th floor has all modcons great bed BUT the HK plumbing is something else. The shower has flooded into to the toilette and shower was cold. Shower rose up in the roof and a small hand held shower that was hard to manage, the sink was TOO big and wasted a lot of water bath has its own TV? Dinning in hotel first class and great food. Under the hotel is an up market shoppind mall with great restaurants URO and Asian food. Fast airport train direct book in of bags in shopping ctr very fast train to airport bags booked through to airline counter. The whole stay was very professional, if you would like to feel at home in your hoter stay at the Peninsular!! The W is one of the best managed hotels I have had the pleasure to use. It is a bit our of the way has courtisy car and colse public transport Will stay there again

Reviews.Title: “W is for Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: dsw54
Reviews.Content: What an outstanding hotel. We were here during Christmas and had a fabulous stay. The location of this hotel is great. The MTR is located in the shopping mall adjacent to the hotel, so traveling around to the different Hong Kong neighborhoods is easy. The MTR airport express shuttle is also right here, so commuting to and from the airport is simple. The rooms in this W are quite large , which I understand is unusual in Hong Kong. The bed was the most comfortable I have ever slept in. We lowered the electronic darkening shades and could have stayed in bed forever, except Hong Kong was waiting outside for us to explore! I highly recommend the W Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Just WOW”
Reviews.Author: asialoverR
Reviews.Content: We booked W as part of our trip to China, it was my 3rd time to sty thetre so I deceided to treat my gf there, they always get better and better you can't flaw the service or the friendliness of the reception staff, we had to wait for the room to be ready and we good a free up grade as a compensation , it's always happening there, the room was wow, service was impaccable, amenities from bliss spa, we enjoyed the gym and the spa for continues 3 nights, will go there again and again

Reviews.Title: “W puts the W in WOW!!!”
Reviews.Author: ChinaManDan
Reviews.Content: Love what they do at the W Hong Kong, The service is impeccable and very W. Great feel in the hotel bar. my wife loved the location being connected to the shopping mall and was very easy to commute around hong kong. A great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “This review I can keep very short. It puts the W in WOW!!!”
Reviews.Author: GlobalBizHopper
Reviews.Content: Service – Excellent! Food – Excellent! Rooms – Awe inspiring design with spectacular harbor views! Location – Can’t be beat! Just a 22 minute express train ride directly from the airport right to Kowloon Station. The Hotel is built right on top the train station and a very swanky mall. Very nice shopping and dining and very convenient to get in and out of the city and airport. Gym – Very nice, top of the line free weights and Cardio with a beautiful harbor view. Don’t miss the spectacular roof top pool as well! If you can afford it, this is truly one W not to miss!

Reviews.Title: “Harbour view”
Reviews.Author: lukey023
Reviews.Content: Got upgraded to a harbour view room - was stunning and a great room, even a TV above the bath - would recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Good location for a short trip”
Reviews.Author: BungusParis
Reviews.Content: I won't go on about how amazing the hotel is, everyone seems to agree on that point. I just wanted to add my opinion on the location aspect of the hotel, as a few comments nearly put me off booking here. We staid for just a one night stop over and the location was really perfect. Through customs, strait onto the airport express, 20 minute ride and there we were at the W. They took our bags and left us go up to the 6th floor to check-in, then up to the 35th floor to our room. A quick mind blowing tour up to the 76th floor to see the pool and then caught the hotel's free shuttle to Tsim cha Tsui for a bit of shopping at Silvercord. Sunset on kowloon pier and hopped onto the star ferry for some more shopping at Lane Crawford before catching the MTR back to Kowloon just in time for a quick dip in the pool, a sweat in the steam room and a relaxing evening thanks to a wonderfully efficient room service. Next morning checked luggage in at the station just under the hotel and were hands free to go to the airport. This really is a very convenient location to make the most of such a short stop. Will be back at the W even for a longer stay, it's such an amazing hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: MontyB2
Reviews.Content: We only spent one night at the W in Hong Kong to split our long journey from the UK to Australia. It has exceptional service, modern but comfortable rooms and the beds are just heavenly! The express train from the airport stops right at Kowloon Station and the hotel is a short walk through a shopping centre from there. On the day you depart you can check in at the train station in the morning and do any shopping or sightseeing before having to leave for the airport without even having to worry about your luggage again. The ferry is recommended but taxis are also not that expensive. Would really recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel- The W is fantastic”
Reviews.Author: dctwin
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels!! Amazing all around- it is expensive but hey its the W. Very trendy and the rooms are amazing. The best view of HK on the roof and amazing pool. Everyone was very nice and just all around amazing experience! I love the W and so will you!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel! One of the best in Hong Kong!! Must try..”
Reviews.Author: mikemcd
Reviews.Content: if you frequent HK for business or pleasure, on one of your trips you will definitely want to try this hotel.. service, food, decor, rooms, location, are in one word "perfect".. Starting with the decor, this is a modern and very stylish hotel. the food, especially the breakfast is very good. I especially liked the outdoor roof pool.. another plus is the location, if you don't mind being on the Kowloon side. very convenient is the Airport Express Kowloon Station inside the massive complex that houses the hotel. also in the complex are lots of high end stores and restaurants.. i've traveled all over the world and would rate this hotel as one of the very best.. congrats W!!!

Reviews.Title: “Its not really near anything...”
Reviews.Author: sonajet
Reviews.Content: Drove past it last time i was there, its not really near anything, its like in the middle of nowhere next to the entry of the tunnels to the other side of hk.

Reviews.Title: “Slick design, spotty service, location is weak”
Reviews.Author: olindacat
Reviews.Content: I wouldn't call this the trendiest hotel on earth, but is a very nice place, and I do recommend it, as long as you are cool getting around by train or hiring taxis. Remember, you can't take the train after roughly midnight and if you are a night owl like me you will need a cab home, which is no big deal, and who wants a train that late anyway. But forget about walking anywhere from here—it's by the highway attached to a big mall.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: SandgrounderSydney
Reviews.Content: The hotel is excellent in every respect. Great location if arriving late into Hong Kong as it is just a short walk through Kowloon Airport station to the hotel.
