Shopping complex attached to hotel has wide range of shopping a excellent restaurants. Beds are the most comfortable I have ever slept in. Highly recommend this hotel. The heated swimming pool and hot tub on the hotel roof offer fantastic views of Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “A must in Hong Kong......”
Reviews.Author: MHRYU
Reviews.Content: 2nd stay in the hotel in a duration of less than 6 months. Such a fantastic hotel with great location. Arrived with a group of 15 people with both old and young. The reception staff, Alex not only did a fantastic job trying to calm us and accommodating our almost impossible request. Everyone in the hotel from Bell, Concierge, Front Desk, Whatever and Whenever team and Housekeeping makes our staff a comfortable and memorable one. Love the funky Santa and Santarina...... Definitely the hotel to stay in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: arthursiew
Reviews.Content: When I first stepped into the W Hotel, I was amazed. The elevator was fast, secure, and some even had screens on the floor saying Good Morning/Afternoon/Evening. When we checked in, we felt welcome. The lady at the front desk provided us a lot of information and served us well. She even led us to the elevator and bowed to us as the door closed. When the elevator door opened to our floor, I was stunned. The hallway was beautifully decorated. It looked like a library. I liked the style of it, as it was a little dark but somehow... it was just cool. The room was just amazing. There were two queen beds and had a great view of the harbor. Unfortunately, the view we had was a shipping area where there were many cargo boats. However, the room was technologically advanced. The curtains were operated electronically. There were LED reading lights. A TV in the bathtub and much more. We did have some trouble finding the TV as it was hidden behind a door that didn't look like one. The beds were comfortable and the bathroom was spacious. In general, the room was just so big that there was still a lot of space. The pool was just great. From the spa, you can see Hong Kong island as it was located on 80+ floor. It was just spectacular. Overall, I would highly recommend this hotel. I'm not sure whether it's better than the Langham, but it's much more advanced compare to them. It's possibly one of the best hotels in Hong Kong. The location was just the only issue. Although it was located under Kowloon Station, you would have to transfer to a different line to go to places such as Yau Ma Tei, Tsim Sha Tsui, etc. However, it was very convenient to go to the Airport as the Airport Express station was there.

Reviews.Title: “W Hong Kong WOWS almost all of the time”
Reviews.Author: lottie75
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently visited Hong Kong for the first time (22 December for 2 nights) and stayed at the W Hong Kong. We booked a 'fabulous' room with full harbour view. The room was beautiful with so much attention to detail. The staff were friendly and efficient. We've bothed stayed at numerous hotels throughout the world but never a 'W'. We're converted! The two disappointments were the cleanliness of the bathroom and poor management of the mini bar which we found to have opened bottles of drink on arrival, along with opened guidebook. The jacuzzi is an amazing spot to watch the 8pm light show each evening (76th floor) and the buffet breakfast in 'Kitchen' is outstanding. There was a fantastic selection of food and beautifully presented. Being above the airport express train was fantastic - we were able to check in for our onward flight. It is easy to get into Hong Kong itself either via the ferry (recommended) or from the station at the mall downstairs. The Elements Mall is worth a look and definitely make a visit to the Three Sixty supermarket for drinks and nibbles - the mini bar and restaurant drink prices are pretty expensive! One morning we slept in and missed the breakfast buffet which was included in our room rate. Initially we were told we could have a coffee and croissant sent up to our room instead. We pushed hard and eventually a selection of the breakfast was sent up to our room. Great attention to detail with warmers on the table to keep the food hot and cute pepper and salt shakers and a little souvenir car. We returned to the hotel a week later for a further night on our way back to the UK. Our check in was super slow, but staff acknowledged this and provided nibbles and refreshments and we were upgraded. Unfortunately, however, the bathroom wasn't as clean as it should be with a huge pile of hair on the floor and the lighting system wasn't working properly. Even when the hotel is busy ,standards must remain high and I hope this was just a blip. We'll return to give it another go! WIFI should be free of charge in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable hotel...I've stayed at the 4 Seasons, Mand Oriental, JW Mar...W beats them all”
Reviews.Author: mpark730
Reviews.Content: An outstanding hotel. The hotel is right on top of the Airport Express and Kowloon MTR stop. It takes literally 10 minutes max to get to Central. I think the others who say otherwise got lost. The infinity pool and jacuzzi is incredible and the details - e.g., free bathing wear, great gym, tv, room service, terrific views, decor, etc. are top notch. Beds are very comfortable. I travel for work quite a lot and have stayed at a number of great hotels in HK and elsewhere. I think this is one of the best I've stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “Great Design Hotel”
Reviews.Author: diamondsnowball
Reviews.Content: I stayed here just after it opened. The hotel is gorgeous, with unique, modern design everywhere! The rooftop infinity pool is a must, as is the Bliss spa (even if you just go in to use the rooftop jacuzzi - what a view!). My room came with a beautiful view and lots of high tech features. Unlike other W hotels that I've stayed at, this room was bright and full of light. The hotel is attached to a very nice mall, so it's convenient for shoppers. It's also connected to the rail line that takes you directly to the airport. The concierge desk was very helpful. Service couldn't have been better. Room service was reliable. This says a lot given the quality of food we found in Hong Kong restaurants, even the nice ones. I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “W's effort at being different falls flat in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: chirpytravels
Reviews.Content: W brand is all about taking the 5 star experience in a new trendy direction. However, W Hong Kong ends up being a dissapointment. The rooms are modern and sleek, although not exactly to everyone's taste. However there some design flaws that shouldn't exist in a top hotel. The reception is located on the 6th floor, but even once you get there it's not visible from the lifts. There is no place to wait while the reception staff are busy serving other guests, making for a rather awkward experience on check-in. Free internet is only available in the lobby, turning the small lobby area into an impromptu business centre. However, if you want to check your mail in the evening, you end up sharing this space with a bunch of people having drinks and enjoying loud music. Far from ideal, when one wants to send business emails. The consierge desk seemed empty or understaffed for most of the time. The business centre is closed. The shower in one of the rooms was designed in such a way that it was improssible to prevent water from flowing out into the living room. However, my biggest complaint is reserved for service. W claims to make the guests comfortable by allowing hotel staff to "be themselves" and express their own personality. I'm all in favour of hotel staff showing some of their own personality, as long as they are still professional, courteous, and service oriented. I found many of the hotel staff weird and inappropriately friendly. I don't like being greeted by a 22 year old guy telling me "You're looking tired tonight" when returning to the hotel in the evening. When that comment was ignored, he continued to say "Oh you don't get the joke". Similarly weird remarks were made on other occasions. The concierge ladies were too busy talking to each or speaking on the phone to even make eye contact with guests. Overall I found that most of the staff were not service oriented, attentive or professional. And their effort at showing their own personality just comes across as somewhat chummy, often imature, and obnoxious. In a city full of great hotels with superb service I'd rather stay in a place which has consistent professional service levels. This way you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Abnoxious and annoying staff make for a disappointing experience”
Reviews.Author: Benko65
Reviews.Content: On previous trips to Hong Kong we usually stayed at the Sheraton on Nathan Road. However, on our recent visit we thought we'd try the new W Hotel and stayed there for 5 nights. We were disappointed from the moment we entered our room - the room was clearly not properly cleaned after the previous guest, with hair and dirt left all over the bathroom, dirty carpeting in the bedroom and food stains on the table. We called reception and instead of simply moving us to a different room, they had someone from housekeping show up with a vaccum cleaner while we had to vacate our room for 15 minutes. We returned to our room to have a shower and quickly discovered that the shower wasn't draining and that the entire bathroom had flooded. To their credit, the hotel eventually moved us to another, upgraded room. However, what was most annoying was the general style of the staff - most are clearly badly trained - the staff at the front door tended to be overly casual, making innapropriate jokes or chummy comments when we passed. The staff at the beautiful swimming pool were especially unpleasant, more concerned with taking our room details and confirming our right to be at the pool rather than properly welcoming us. Also, the pool staff were sloppily dressed in oversized shirts and mirror sunglasses, and were far too engaged in their own conversations instead of tending to guests' needs. We were also surprised to see one of the pool attendants simply pouring the remains of a drink into the pool. We were also amazed at how often our requests were met with a "no" at a hotel which prides itself on "whatever/whenever" service. When we wanted to order a snack at the pool, we were told that there is no catering service until 11:00 (and no one remembered our interest in ordering something even though we stayed at the pool 'till noon). When we asked whether it would be possible to take a small suitcase with us on the shuttle to Nathan Road, we were told that if other people also needed to take the shuttle, we wouldn't be able to take the suitcase (even though it fully fit into the trunk of the van and took up no space inside). When we wanted to use the business centre, there was no one there and we had to approach reception. There didn't seem to be any management around during our stay and their absence clearly shows. Overall, the management at the W Hong Kong seems to be trying a new "relaxed" approach to guest service, but the result is that service has taken a giant leap backwards. Next time we're in Hong Kong we'll be back at the Sheraton on Nathan Road.

Reviews.Title: “W is Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: TravelerinPS
Reviews.Content: Wonderful, fabulous, these are the names of the room types. They truly live up to these descriptions. Staff couldn't have been more attentive. The room had everything you could think of...3 different preset light scemes, automated black out and shear curtains, tv in bath tub in the mirror, large rain shower, comfy bed with lots of sink in pillow. Roof top infinity pool and jacuzzi on 76th floor, and an incredible health club and spa on 73 with floor to ceiling windows and amazing views of Hong Kong. My first stay at a W. I hope they all live up to this stay.

Reviews.Title: “loved every minute of it”
Reviews.Author: plasticintruder
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at a W hotel and I was surprised at the quality of the service, rooms, and facilities at the W Hong Kong. The room was large with an amazing harbor view, comfortable furniture, an awesome bed, surround sound, mood lighting, TV in the bathroom, spa-like shower, well stocked minibar, electronic bedside controls, the works. The hotel is a bit isolated but quiet, and right on top of a transit station and large upscale shopping mall with various restaurants. Will definitely try and return (book a "fabulous" room....its worth it).

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: yuchung5
Reviews.Content: Good service. Very Nice room. I have a fabulous room with harbour view. Absolutely nice decor. Can not afford the restaurant and spa. But it is in the same building with Element shopping mall, MTR station, and Airport Express Station. There is no problem getting anywhere, shopping, and getting food.

Reviews.Title: “We absolutely loved it!”
Reviews.Author: CelticSis
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nothing short of amazing. Ultra modern with a big focus on nature in the design. It's really funky and interesting & the service is top notch. We stayed in a "fantastic suite" overlooking the bay. The views were stunning and the finishing on everything was totally first class. We would rate this as one of the best hotels we have ever stayed in. The only small grumble would be that they need to lose putting a price on absolutely everything. When you're staying in a suite, it seems very small minded to have prices on things like an extra bottle of water, or having to pay to use the internet. They miss a trick here, but having said that the overall experience is unforgettable. You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Slick Modern Design!”
Reviews.Author: dal-n-lana
Reviews.Content: LOCATION: The hotel is located in Kowloon, which is across the water from downtown HK. The hotel is right above the Kowloon train station, which is integrated into a clean and new underground mall with several good restaurants, shops, and a supermarket. We took the airport express train to/from the airport for 140HKD (Paired Tickets if you buy them from the customer service desk rather than the kiosk. Othwerwise 90HKD per person). The trip only took 18 minutes and the train is very clean. Temple street is about a 20 minute walk from the hotel. Other than that, most of your site seeing will be on the Hong Kong Island side, which is a quick metro ride from Kowloon to Hong Kong. ROOM: The room was very spacious and designed in the unique W style. Very chic. Many amenities in the room, included Bliss bath products, an iron, hair dryer, large flat screen TV with several channels. The bed and pillows were wonderful and provided great sleep. Awesome bathroom with a rain shower head and unique high quality fixtures. STAFF: The entire staff is very friendly and helpful. Concierge recommended great places to eat and also helped with city/site-seeing information. HOTEL: The hotel is fairly new and everything is very clean. The designs throughout are very appealing and unique, which are the expectations of a W hotel. CITY: Hong Kong is awesome. Just plan your site seeing around your interests. We stayed 4 nights, so we took a day trip to Macau. NOTE: All our reviews are not evaluated on the exclusively mutual experience at the respective hotel. Our ratings and standards are benchmarked with other hotels that we have stayed.

Reviews.Title: “One of those unforgettable stays...”
Reviews.Author: lubecm
Reviews.Content: Just finished off a trip to HK that involves a few nights at the Intercontinental, Hyatt Sha Tin, and Hyatt TST. W was a last night treat, and I regret not having done my entire stay there. Upgraded to a harbor view room with stunning views to the west - the view isn't of the downtown, but in a way, I found it refreshing to have a different perspective on the harbor. The room is perfection - most comfortable bedding I've slept on in a hotel in some time, all the technology you could want, including a very powerful sound system for those who like to really listen to music on the go. The pool is great, but the SWEAT facilities (gym, spa pool, sauna, steam) were amongst the most inspiring I've ever seen, namely for the view! If you want a hotel that's more than just comfortable, but rather is just plain fun, this W keeps you feeling inspired. Only downside I would note was the food - needs work in terms of quality and value.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel,we will now book our trips according to W locations!”
Reviews.Author: dablindfrog
Reviews.Content: where do we start? amazing overall, this hotel is the benchmark in the industry for sure! the location is incredibly convenient since it's built atop the Element Mall which also has the MTR Kowloon station attached to. within the hotel there is 2 great restaurant and the room service was fast and delicious the room is the WOW of the stay, it's so modern, trendy and comfortable! rainforest shower, LCD TV on the wall of the bathroom to relax in the tub with a good movie, there is an iphone docking station, wired internet at reasonable charge, super comfy bed, descent view of the harbour and the tunnel the food in the Kitchen buffet was plentiful and varied, and the restaurant manager Louis is a star, thanks to him for the visit of the kitchens and back area! it was too cold to get into the swimming pool but we checked it out and it was awesome on the top floor with amazing views we may not go back to Hong Kong but we'll be sure to visit other W worldwide in the future!

Reviews.Title: “very cool, great location, didn't want to leave”
Reviews.Author: BeijingAussieinchina
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the W for 3 nights and loved it. The hotel is very modern and well designed - great lighting options - there are 3 settings depending on requirements, blackout blinds, very quiet, lovely shower with rainforest shower rose in addition to hand held option, large LCD TV screen in the room as well as one in the bathroom above the bath. The gym is very good and open 24 hours and they have a Bliss spa which I did not get to try. While the breakfast buffet was good (nice fresh juices in individual bottles, and bircher muesli in individual pots), I was surprised that there were not more choices available, but it was fine. There is complimentary wi-fi in the reception/lobby area. Overall a great experience and I did not want to leave!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay!”
Reviews.Author: BB100
Reviews.Content: When you first enter the hotel, you'll notice that it's very chic, very modern, very trendy. The elevator floor lights up like a TV screen! We got one of their "Fabulous Rooms". They offer BLISS products in the bathroom. There's a docking station for the iPod/ iPhone. The rainfall showerhead was very relaxing. We indulged in a bubble bath soak while watching TV in the bathroom. The swimming pool and whirlpool are located on the 76th floor- a MUST GO! You get to see most of the Kowloon side of Hong Kong. The Hong Kong Island view is unfortunately blocked by the tall ICC skyscraper. But what a lovely way to spend an afternoon lounging above beautiful Hong Kong! It was a Saturday when we went, and in the evening, we went to their "Living Room" lounge for free-flowing champagne and such. It was a lovely evening. The Elements Mall is right beside the hotel- a good balance between the luxury brands (like LV, Bottega, Dior, etc. You name it, they've got it) and everyday ones (like Zara, H&M). The mall is connected to Kowloon MTR station, which is about 5-10 minutes away from Central MTR station/ Hong Kong Island.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home.”
Reviews.Author: SandyToesNY
Reviews.Content: In the past year, I have traveled to Hong Kong 7 times and I have chosen to stay at the W each time. In previous years, I have stayed at the Marco Polo hotels, mainly bc of it's location. But those hotels (MP Prince, MP Hong Kong and MP Gateway) are pretty much outdated, small, and depressing. The W Hong Kong is definitely sexy, hip, young and energetic. Because of my frequent stays, most of the bellhops and concierge greet me by my name and treat me like family. The rooms are decently sized, but every room has at least one floor to ceiling windows - with city views or harbor views. The floors alternate with either a preppy theme (more masculine) and a Japanese butterfly theme. (more feminine). The furniture is exactly the same, but color schemes are slightly different. Needless to say, I always request a Japanese themed room. It's quite lovely. The mini bar in the room is pretty dangerous. A mini bottle of Veuve Clicquot is hard to turn down! And a great selection of both red and white wine + beers and organic juices. The snack bar also has a nice selection of snacks for those sleepless, jet-lagged nights. Room service for the most part is good. The food comes from the Kitchen - where they also serve buffet. The breakfast buffet is HIGHLY recommended. I've had dinner at Fire restaurant once. The food is amazing, but the main dining room is a bit claustrophobic. I haven't returned for this reason, although I still think about the lobster dish I had. Yum. Every night before dinner, I have a drink in the Living Room. It is usually filled with locals, which bring a different energy level than if it were filled with other hotel stayers. And there is free wi-fi, so it's great. The decor of the hotel is pretty spectacular. I only wish my apartment in NY was this chic and well designed :-( The rooftop pool is amazing. Even though I travel to Hkg so often, I always have a feeling of, "wow, THIS is Hong Kong" when I'm at the pool. Unbelievable views. Pack your swimsuit! The Bliss Spa is a must. And a good tip is that anybody that stays in the hotel has access to the Bliss showers and jacuzzis. As I have said before, I consider the W Hong Kong my home away from home. My only quip with this hotel is the high price for wi-fi.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel, but wrong location...”
Reviews.Author: maddog2000
Reviews.Content: This is by far the best W hotel that I have ever stayed at - everything is right, from the room, to the amenities, the view, the bar, the staff etc. What I did not like is the location: 1.) You are in Kowloon - i you like being there ok. 2.) The hotel is in the middle of no-where. You have to take a taxi (or tube) to get anywhere but the attached shopping mall, which clearly is a pity when you are in HKG with all the great places to go to.... I would not go there again, but really only only because of its location, otherwise loved it! PS - Swimming pool on the 76th floor is amazing, but realistically, it is too windy up there for enjoying lounging....

Reviews.Title: “Well Whatever Would Wow”
Reviews.Author: gleff
Reviews.Content: The most modern hotel I have ever seen. Electronics, metal, industrial. Upgraded as a platinum to a suite, wonderful design elements, full sized bliss products. Given 6pm checkout without a fuss. Service isn't perfect, arrived at midnight and no one offered assistance with baggage until I was inside the hotel. But aside from that minor fault, it was an outstanding stay. Even had a Harbor view, though not the quintessential Hong Kong skyline...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, beautiful rooms”
Reviews.Author: chuugle
Reviews.Content: The rooms are beautifully decorated and the service was impeccable. The staff was super helpful and friendly. The hotel provides a one way free shuttle to several stops in Kowloon. I was expecting a shuttle bus, and was shocked to find that the "shuttle" was actually an Audi SUV. The shuttles were very convenient since the W hotel is not located as conveniently to MTR stations. It's connected to the Kowloon Aiport Express station which is awesome, but if you want to go to Kowloon using MTR, you have to make some connections and walk quite a bit through the MTR station. It's much easier to take taxis to/from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Coulen't be better”
Reviews.Author: burmans
Reviews.Content: Well having stayed there found all the reviews about the Wow aspect absolutely correct but found absolutely no evidence of the casual service. From the minute we arrived found the service impeccable. As an example we were watching the rugby on TV and my wife found the sound a bit quiet and we were unable to change. We rang the desk who said we'll have an engineer up there within 5 minutes. Well it was only 1 1/2 and 3 arrived and had the problem fixed in 90 seconds. Can't fault that type of service. We found the staff consistently both extremely friendly and polite. I must admit HK can be somewhat impersonal at times but not here. The location not a problem, into town in 10 minutes by train or 5 minutes by cab for a paltry sum to most places in Kowloon. And the view from the pool is certainly one I'll remember for a while!

Reviews.Title: “Mao and the Masters of Kool - a new Cultural Revolution?”
Reviews.Author: kofty
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the W Hong Kong by train from the airport - it's in the same building as the station, just two floors up, together with the brand new Elements shopping mall. The MRT station is also in-house, so transport-wise, the W gets two thumbs up. The lobby on 6th floor is, well, nothing like a usual hotel lobby. It is the epitome of cool, with living room-style seating area next to a nice bar, and interesting decoration just about everywhere. The reception desk is tucked away in a corridor, one of the masterpieces - behind it, there's a huge video wall with moving ornaments? Flowers from another world? Deep sea plants? The staff is friendly and helpful, just not like in other hotels - and that seems to be the overall theme of the W. Differentiation. I received an upgrade to a room with a king size bed on 18th floor, with a view over the harbour in Kowloon that becomes a beauty during sunset. The room itself is quite spacey, 40 sqm or so, with lots of glass and mirrors. It is hard to take a picture of the room without finding yourself in one of the many mirrors. A huge bed, comfy chaiselongue, a big desk with everything you need. A bathroom with a difference, again, all granite and glass, with mood lighting, a nice tub, really well designed and practical as well. The only thing I was missing, at first, was the TV. I found it behind the sliding middle mirror, opposite the bed. A 42" HD monitor with plenty of channels - and definitely the best sound system I ever had in a hotel room. Complete with subwoofer and great sound quality, it provides a TV viewing experience most people do not even have at home. Naturally you can plug in your own USB devices. The internet works fast, as you would expect, the turndown service is efficient, I always had that big smile on my face as everything was just so perfect. Anything less than perfect? Well, operating the toilet flush might break a fingernail - too much design there. And in the elevators from ground floor up (which have a half translucent video screen as a floor - amazing), pressing the L button gets you - nowhere, because the lobby is on 6, and the exit on 1. But they're working on it, a friendly employee confirmed. After a few stays at W Hotels in New York City, I was not too hot about the brand, as just looking cool is never enough. But the W Hong Kong showed me what the brand is really about. Back in the lobby, opposite the Whatever - Whenever Concierge desk (really nice and efficient) there is a huge painting - Chairman Mao waving his Little Red Book. The book, for a change, has a big W on the cover. That's exactly the feeling the hotel conveys - W Hotels have proclaimed the new Cultural Revolution, for hotels around the world, and the W Hong Kong is the benchmark.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible. We will be back”
Reviews.Author: BrisVegasChick
Reviews.Content: Absolutely amazing hotel. And, while you pay for it, it's still just the most incredible place and with sensational service. We took a Cool Corner Room with an adjoining Wonderful Room for our daughter which was the perfect set up. We felt safe knowing we were together, but she had her own privacy. We found everything fantastic and have no complaints at all. We had no issues with the shuttle, found conceirge and all staff very helpful and courteous, and really enjoyed the pool area. You can take a bottle of wine upstairs and drink it on the deck by the pool (just ask first - we brought along duty free wine and some plastic wine glasses). If you get there early enough, you can also order some pool snacks but they close at 9pm so get up there a little earlier. They had an event every night in the bar - we went to a couple of them and they were great. Just bring a shirt/jacket - the air con is freezing! Restaurants are great inside the hotel, and there are also some great ones within Elements. Turn left to the 'food court' and there are a stack of restaurants to choose from. We went to a Thai one that had the best green curry I've ever had (including in Thailand!). I could not find the name for it, but it's the only Thai one next to all the Chinese ones so you should be able to find. We also did room service which was brilliant too. If you've not done so before, we would also recommend taking the junk ride on Victor Habour with Aqualuna. Get there a bit early so you can board first - take a seat upstairs on the long lounges on the side of the junk (downstairs seems to get the fumes from the diesel). You can book this at the whatever/whenever desk or online before you leave home. The biggest convenience is the bag check at the train station - you can precheck your suitcases straight through to the airport, so you can keep shopping and then travel to the airport without having to lug your bags. And, given the hotel is directly upstairs from the station, this was a fantastic convenience for us. I would definitely stay here again, and am trying to sort out my next holidays now to get back there. Can't recommend it highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Experience....”
Reviews.Author: RobDiplomat
Reviews.Content: We had just finished our Asian tour of Cambodia, Vietnam and decided to treat ourselves to a nice hotel in Hong Kong on our last day before returning to Europe. We arrive at the hotel the check-in and service was okay. Got our room as requested on a high floor with an incredible view of the Harbour. The room was nicely done Bathrobes, great toiletries from the Bliss Spa and it had all kinds of gadgets for lighting of the room, mood, music from your ipods and movies etc. The bar was fully stock with Chanpange, chocolates, and treats at a very nice price! We went to the pool on the Top floor it was incredible with the view and you sat in a glass Jacuzzi overlooking the harbour at sunset with infinity pool, the sauna had the same vie on the floor below at night you could sit there and watch the full moon. The bed was very comfortable and sunday brunch was incredible too. We met friends in the bar of the hotel which was nicely done and the entire stay was a W experience! Of course the hotel was new and hopefully they kept up with their service and style. Nice and trendy but, on the expensive side so if you are looking to splurge and treat yourself then go for it!

Reviews.Title: “Unique and Great Hotel in HK”
Reviews.Author: USexpatbiztraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the W with our two children. Really cool design, great rooms , and superb food in the Kitchen. Service was very good overall.

Reviews.Title: “one word -- GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: tc24680
Reviews.Content: I can only describe this hotel with one word -- GREAT! Great Location as it's just above the MTR station. Great room as it's very spacious and my room was overlooking the harbour. Great service, great food..................................... For sure I will stay there again! Keep Wow-ing us, W HK!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Nightclub Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: michellevoyager
Reviews.Content: Don't get me wrong. I love the flashy entrance, the glitzy lobby - ambient light shifting lifts with non-stop dj spun music. But after awhile - it does get quite much. Especially when you are paying close to USD400. The Service was nothing to shout about and niether were the big black gothic rooms. For this reason, im glad i tried W once in HK. But once is enough. People seem to be more in love with idea of the hotel than the hotel itself. I will say though, that it is a well located hotel that is placed at Elements - 1 train ride to the airport on the airport express.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, exclusive and beautifully crafted - why go anywhere else?”
Reviews.Author: GlobalSky_traveller
Reviews.Content: I have had the fortune of staying in a wide variety of hotels but must say that the W Hong Kong is easily the most memorable. Set atop a new development in West Kowloon, the hotels offers a premium service, comfortable living and convenience, all within the modern and well-appointed design typical of a W Hotel. When I arrived, I was immediately struck by how funky the interior is but it still provides comfortable surroundings. The rooms themselves are beautifully furnished with quality upholsteries and the bed is very comfortable to sleep in. The bathroom houses a huge tub with TV, and is tiled in dark stone with interesting lighting. If you like modern design, the W will not disappoint and you will appreciate the high attention to detail such as the sliding mirror cover over the television, patterned wallpaper and open-top drinks cabinet. The pool is one of the highlights of the hotel, and is perched on the 76th floor. The vantage point gives exquisite views of Kowloon and the ocean to the West, while the hot tub looks out towards the harbour and Hong Kong Island. The penthouse pool experience should not be missed and I took a dip every day during the duration of my stay. It would have been ideal to have a bar serving cocktails by the pool but I believe they will soon be introducing this. The infinity pool itself is sizeable and the gold and stone mosaic decoration is an interesting artistic addition. We also enjoyed the Bliss spa service and had a foot soaking and full body massage. The massage was good and pre-treatment relaxation lounge also very comfortable. As hotel guests we were entitled to a complimentary manicure which was very professionally done. We did not try any of the restaurants at the hotel but being on top of the Elements shopping mall and Kowloon MTR/underground station, there is a wide variety of restaurants nearby and all the areas of interest in Hong Kong and Kowloon can be easily reached. The service at check-in and check-out was very quick and we found the staff friendly and accommodating. Overall, I had a great time at the W and will definitely return in the future. There are other hotels in Hong Kong that vie for a similar group of travellers looking for exceptional service but none combine such a modern design and youthful ethos with the same degree of comfort and quality of service. Plus there is always the draw of the 76th storey swimming pool!

Reviews.Title: “Sleek, Modern, Memorable.... Can't wait to return!”
Reviews.Author: mile high traveler
Reviews.Content: This place is easily the most memorable and controversial hotel, I've ever stayed in. The room was the best. We loved everything from the shower to the lighting to the hidden flat screen and view. It's like a heavenly oasis from the hectic, crowded Hong Kong streets. We had daily breakfast in "the Kitchen" and it was top notch. The drinks in "the Living Room" were perfect. The pool and spa area were breathtaking. We thought the service was excellent throughout the hotel and adjoining properties. There's a huge outdoor terrace area with several restaurants above the mall that is excellent. We ate at 3 different places and they were all very good. This type of huge open peaceful space is not easy to find in Hong Kong. We often have heated debates about the location, but in the end, this property provides easy access to the airport express train and HK island via MTR. As mentioned in other reviews, the grocery store, dining, shopping in the attached Elements Mall is superb. All the polished, modern amenities and comfort comes with a hefty bill at checkout, but for us, it was a wonderful place to stay in HK and well worth the splurge.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but bathroom leaks”
Reviews.Author: areyoumad
Reviews.Content: This hotel was drop-dead gorgeous from the elevators to the rooms. It has the look of a modern hip bar/ art museum which made us feel slightly embarrassed when we pass through the lobbies with our 7-year old. Although my son doesn't feel it at all and walks around feeling very at home. In fact, he says it's the best hotel ever (stayed in quite a few) and keeps asking when we're coming back. We think this is largely due to the tv in the bathtub which is a dream come true for him. Staff are very friendly anyway but not intrusive. The rooms are very clean and large, the beds are super-comfy and white and has quite a nice view of the port. Besides the mini-bar, they sell some handy stuff too like umbrellas, guidebooks and converters. Expensive and some are actually lent by other hotels for free. But it was fun reading the descriptions anyway. The internet access in the room was busted (paid, btw). And the engineer couldn't fix it so this is not good news for business travelers. They did send us a letter that the internet was fixed when we got home though. So thanks, I guess...We just used the free 1 hr internet in the lobby. The bathroom was nice but the design of the shower stall is a bit off because the water leaked outside the glass door which flooded the bathroom a bit. I was quite afraid it would leak onto the carpets, thankfully it didn't but there was a big puddle in the middle and small one in the toilet. When we put a bathmat on the door, it was very wet after a shower and still leaked into the toilet stall. Best be careful walking around the bathroom. Otherwise, water pressure is good and the bathtub was big, clean and luxurious. Location is excellent. Hotel is in a mall which has a good grocery (360) and lots of nice restos and cafes and connected to train station. 1 short ride to the airport. Very convenient. Has H&M and See's candies, too. Lastly, we ordered breakfast on our last day and was glad we had breakfast in other places the rest of the time. Not so good. HK has good food in every corner so not a problem. Overall, would stay here again because it's just so pretty and cool.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - I want to go back”
Reviews.Author: leannenath01
Reviews.Content: W Hong Kong is a wonderful property, I stayed with my husband and one year old. The views are fabulous, the bar / restaurant are superb and we stayed in a Corner Room, very spacious and very easy to access Kowloon MTR station which is just under the hotel and Elements, a fab shopping complex.

Reviews.Title: “The only good thing is the swimming pool”
Reviews.Author: kellytttt
Reviews.Content: The room is ok. Clean and Hi-end. The swimming pool is fabulous. However, there is no service at all. The most basic smile is missing. All staff there seem not so welcome you. Totally agree with those previous review, very bad software.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ekartash
Reviews.Content: Now this was my type of a hotel. Modern and fun!!! The rooms were great, with every gadget you can think of. There is a pool on the 76th floor overlooking the city. Oh and ofcourse the W beds. I just love it.

Reviews.Title: “Hardware is Great, but Software Sucks!”
Reviews.Author: maymaywong
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at W for a long weekend. I absolutely agree with the previous person's (Vanderbilt) review. Whilst the room at W is no doubt very cool, contemporary and new, but their service really sucks. The staff are cold and apathetic, their attitude is as if they don't really care. If all they want is to make a salary and do not really have passion about delivering hospitality or care about guest services, then they should not be working in the hotel industry!! The staff at W needs to take a serious lesson from the attitude of hotel staff working in Thailand or Japan who really take pride in what they do. The food & beverage also sucks big time. We had read some very horrible reviews about the restaurants at W posted on "openrice.com" , but we did not really believe them originally. But now we do, we tried the food at their Kitchen, and it was really as bad as people said. All in all, our experience at W was extremely disappointing. It was over-priced, their service lacked heart, and the food was terrible. The only good thing about the hotel was the roof top pool and conveniently locating directly inside the Elements mall.

Reviews.Title: “Uber cool. Great service and facilities, location only criticism.”
Reviews.Author: sdothot
Reviews.Content: Stayed there with my wife while attending a conference at the Sheraton (next to the Peninsula) and really enjoyed the uber cool atmosphere and decor. Service was fantastic and brekfast buffet one of the best I've seen. Really loved it overall, but the only negative was that it is a long (half an hour) walk to the main shooping and restaurant area in Tsim Sha Tsui. Close enough though if you enjoy a brisk walk and plenty of markets etc.. close by. on top of a well appointed shopping centre also and only a few dollars in a cab to get anywhere, so no bug deal. Would stay there again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “If i have only i night in HK, W is no other choice”
Reviews.Author: Steven020
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel, contemporary lift lobby, front desk and room. People are all nice. If i have only 1 night staying in HK, W HK is no other choice But please do not spend time and money on their restaurant, they are not doing Good Highly Recommended

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious cool like no other”
Reviews.Author: SteevJames
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the W Hotel on Austin Road in Kowloon for 3 nights, 4 days in May of 2009 and was as amazed at the start of the stay as I was at the end. Upon arrival, you are greeted(of course) in typical South East Asian style with a degree of warmth and friendliness seemingly alien to European hotels. Once you find the check in desk(a point of consternation for my parents) which is situated around a corner on the 6th floor of the hotel you are greeted by electro light art and the same smiley faces that greeted you downstairs. I must say the hidden check in desk is the ONLY negative thing I can say about the place as every other aspect is exceptional. Once in the room(I had a cool corner suite) you are greeted by stunning views of the harbour and every gadget and accessory required for the modern traveller. Everything controlled by little buttons which to be honest if ur older than 50 will probably leave you perplexed for the first hour or so. The gorgeous interior can only be matched by the most comfortable bed and pillows I have ever had the privilege to sleep on, which is difficult as one is constantly distracted by the 42 inch TV and Ipod dock which all worked seamlessly(who am i kiddin, i really just played with the electric curtains for 3 days). Food and drinks were once again to the highest standards, including a stunning fish and chips in the "Lounge" and a truly remarkable steak in the suitably pricey "Fire" restaurant. MUST CHECK OUT the pool on the 76th floor, they say one of the highest in the world. Sitting in the hot tub looking out over HK cannot be described. If you're looking for a city break and have about £200 a night to burn on a hotel, you cannot look past this hotel. Draped in chic from head to toe this hotel is by far the best I have ever stayed in and could not recommend it higher!

Reviews.Title: “W Hong Kong Was Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: JWillikers
Reviews.Content: My friends and I recently stayed at the W Hong Kong for 8 nights in early May. We were blown away by the sheer coolness of the new hotel. We arrived via the Airport Express train that literally drops you off in a building that connects to the W. It was a short elevator ride and walk to the W from the train. The W staff that greeted us were very friendly and took our luggage right away. We were shown to probably the coolest elevator I've ever been on (neon lights in the floor, mirrored ceiling, and a view to kill), that took us straight up to the W lobby. Check-in was a breeze and we were shown to our room on the 38th floor. 10 minutes later our bags arrived. Our room had an incredible view of the harbor (not across to Hong Kong island but to the west where many cargo ships are) which made for an amazing sight at sunset every night. The entire room was modern from the unique lighting system to the TV hidden behind a mirrored wall, to the bathroom with a killer shower. The hotel features a pool and hot tub on the 76th floor that overlooks the city - albeit with the soon to be tallest building in HK, the ICC, obstructing the view across Victoria Harbour. Still, it was quite a scene to kick back and relax and get away from the hustle and bustle of the city. Perhaps the best part of our stay was the incredibly friendly hotel staff. There was a very friendly gentleman named Sebastian that works out front who speaks great English and offered his advice on everything from where to go and how to get there. The concierges were equally as helpful when we decided to plan a trip to the giant Buddha on Lantau and a day trip to Macau. The only negative thing I have to say about the W were the prices. When I woke up early one morning and the Starbucks in the attached Elements mall wasn't open yet, I walked into Kitchen (restaurant in the W) to get a cup of coffee. When it was all said and done, I calculated that I had spent $7 on a tiny cup of coffee. Lesson learned. The hotel also features free wireless internet access for 1 hour each day which I found to be very useful. You can actually login down in the lobby and then take your computer back up to your room to finish using the rest of the hour in privacy. Having the hotel connected to both a mall and the MTR station was a huge plus. It was a quick ride over to HK island via the MTR whenever we wanted to go. Also, there were 15+ restaurants to choose from in the Elements mall just a short walk from the front door of the hotel. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone who is willing to spend the money for the W experience. It's certainly not for budget travelers. But, if you're feeling the need to splurge in an ultra modern setting, I would suggest the W Hong Kong everytime

Reviews.Title: “Wawawiwa!.....Not”
Reviews.Author: XTC4UOK
Reviews.Content: Just recently stayed for HOFEX the Hospitality Expo. Being a traveller 6-8 month of the year I've lived in hotels for the past 12yrs. I was recommended by a HK friend who stayed for a weekend getaway. I was up graded to a suite which was nice. Room are spacious with all the latest mod cons. ( But already run down & not well maintain) The hotel is very slick with some young beautiful staff but most with little substance/knowledge. The hotel has only 2 restaurant (Fire) the up scale casual dining.....Modern Pan Asian fair....the restaurant is again as expected slick, but that's all. Food was slow and lacked flavour, small portion and quite pricy the room was over half empty. (A forgettable experience) The wine list was well rounded but with a 250-300% mark up.... (Kitchen) the all day dining was the the other I had breakfast on most days and dinner. Breakfast pretty standard...while dinner was now a buffet which was changed recently I was told. Items & selection was poor on the buffet the seafood was flash frozen and was not replenished fequently. Again items lack flavour and variety. The best part was the choice your own Mains. The Lounge bar was the highlight quick efficent service, the only thing cocktails took a little time to arrive but was well made..a little aver priced compared to other venues in HK. The music was uplifting yet not overly loud so we could still chat. Overall the place was like a Faberge Eggs beautiful & expensive on the outside but when you open it...it's just an empty shell.

Reviews.Title: “W Hong Kong...The W is For Whatever”
Reviews.Author: RebeccaPapin
Reviews.Content: I had very high hopes for the W Hotel...hopes that were immediately dashed upon checking in. Check-in is on the 6th floor is difficult to find. We went to the only desk that was immediately visible from the elevator. After watching two workers have a long and lazy conversation, one of them turned to me and said, "I am the concierge. You don't check-in with me." So, off to another line. The check-in area (to the left of the concierge, initially hidden by a wall) is a poorly designed area not meant to accomodate more than 4 waiting guests total. Groups of incoming guests spilled over the sofas, into the hallways around check-in, anywhere, while waiting an abnormally long amount of time to have their check-in processed. And the check-in guys all needed a good smack in the face, a HARD smack in the face, because they were so rude. Once we finally went to check-in (at Noon), they told us that our room wasn't ready and that "check-in wasn't until 2 pm so come back later". When we asked about being upgraded, as we were there on our anniversary, we were told "the hotel was full last night and futhermore, they did not give free upgrades". We went off to lunch and came back two hours later, only to repeat the 30 minute plus wait to check-in. We had booked a Fabulous Room on the 29th floor and were given the WORST room on the floor, directly across from the elevators. We could hear every word that everyone said as they went to and from the elevators. However, we came to Hong Kong to see the city, not to gawk at the W Hotel, so we could handle it. I liked the butterflies on the lampshades but the overall design and size of the room did not merit the $300 plus we were dropping each night for 4 nights. When I went to the bathroom area I was disgusted to find what looked like mold all over the base of the bathroom walls. I immediately called their "whatever/whenever service" and complained. After four more phone calls, including one from a suprisingly snobbish duty manager, we were moved from our room to a Fabulous Suite, which was large, airy and lovely. Over the next few days we were shocked at the number of cheaply dressed, poor looking people that were hanging out in the lobby. The guests of the hotel in NO WAY matched the image. On the second morning we were there, we were woken up at 5:30 am to a loud (fire?)alarm going off in our bedroom. Someone from maintenance came to check on it an hour later and we never received an apology or anything for having to sit in a room with a screeching alarm for over an hour. On the third morning we were there, I went to the gym, where the music was blaring so loud that I could not even hear my iPod with my headphones on full blast. When I came back to my room my key didn't work. I had to go back to the 6th floor in my sweaty workout clothes and then got the third degree before they would give me another key. "What is your name? What is your date of birth?" No apology for my key randomly locking me out. My husband had the same thing happen to him later that day and they did not ask him one question. The pool is the highlight of the W Hotel and is allegedly the highest pool in Hong Kong. Gorgeous, gorgeous (partially obstructed) views of the bay. The jaqcuzzi was one of the nicest I've ever been in, an infinity pool leading into some black sea rocks. The experience was only ruined by the rude hotel staff, in the form of the towel boy who decided whether to give you a nice, purple W hotel beach towel or a plain, white, often stained towel. Guess which one he tried to give me every time? There is a giant, inflatable butterfly in the pool which is ridiculous. Back in our hotel room, the rest of the stay wasn't so bad. The little chocolates that were brought each evening 'Sunday is for Soak, Monday is for Martini, Tuesday is for Tea, etc" were lovely. The bed was exceedingly comfortable. The Bliss products were replenished daily. We went to the LIVING ROOM for dinner one evening. The food was great although the staff hovered too closely. I think the W Hotel is absolutely gorgeous but dislike its poorly trained, rude staff. If you go there you will be made to feel that you are just a number, nothing special, and you might even get the third degree if your hotel key randomly stops working. The W Hong Kong is quite an experience. Until their staff becomes nicer, it is an experience that should be missed.

Reviews.Title: “It could have been *W*onderful...”
Reviews.Author: ryu0803
Reviews.Content: We had requested an early check in. We called the hotel in the morning of our visit and the staff said they will clean the room as soon as the previous guests left at around noon. At 12:15pm, the hotel called to confirm our dinner at FIRE for the evening and we checked with the reception again. We were told the room was being cleaned and they expected it to be available at 1:00pm. We arrived the hotel at 1:10pm but the room has not been cleaned yet. We asked the staff to double check as we were told the room should be ready by then. He did nothing but to repeat the same. He also told us with a blank face that the check in time was 3:00pm. We finally left our cell phone number and went to the LIVING ROOM for lunch. We got our room at 3:15pm. It was bad that we had to wait for two hours even though we had called to confirm the room status. We were more upset with the unfriendly attitude of the staff who did our check in. We asked to talk to the manager but sadly, the guy who was not helping, was the manager. On the other hand, all the other staff we met during our visit were very nice. So it was unfair to rate the service of the hotel as poor because of one person. If we had not encountered the problem at check in, we would have given this hotel a very high rating. The room was fabulous. We had a great time watching our own movie with the 42" LCD HDTV and the amazing theatre sound system.There was also a docking for iPod, which we found it very convenient. We love the food from KITCHEN. We tried their Champagne Brunch on Sunday in the past and it was really good. We went for drinks at the LIVING ROOM after dinner. It was a cool place to lounge while listening to the hip music playing in the background. However, the dinner at FIRE was a big disappointment. We had the six course tasting menu which featured several of their signature dishes. The food was nothing special at all. From the speed that they were served, we had an impression that we were eating at a fast food restaurant. What we loved the most was the hot tub by the pool on the 76/f. A dip during sunset was super nice!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect combination of form and function”
Reviews.Author: katzee_m
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the W on our recent trip in Hong Kong. It was undoubtedly the edgiest and most stylish hotel we've ever stayed in. Careful attention was paid to every detail of this hotel, both aesthetic and service wise. The hotel even had a signature smell! Our room was a Wonderful City View Room and boy was it wonderful! It was spacious, clean and well-appointed. We loved all the features but I especially loved these: - the KEF 5.1 Surround Sound Audio/Visual System: this blew me away - the signature W Bed with 400-thread-count linens: really super comfy - the rainforest shower - the view! - the automatic sheer window curtain and blind Even if it took us a while to get a handle over all the controls, we still loved everything. I was also thrilled to find the Bliss toiletries in the bathroom! These were replenished daily. We loved and appreciated the turn down service too. Aside from fixing our room, they always left us with two pieces of W dark chocolate. The W is very well-located for sightseeing in Hong Kong. You can access it via the very posh Elements mall, which had an exit from the Kowloon MTR station. Be prepared for some walking though. Then if you want to go to Tsim Sha Tsui to take the Star Ferry to Hong Kong Island, you can ride the free shuttle service from the hotel. You can get maps of Hong Kong as well as a visitors' kit from the shuttle, which are very handy for touring the city. The only dining option we tried at the W was the breakfast buffet at Kitchen. The presentation was awesome but we've tasted better. The service was very efficient though and I was able to get a free copy of Newsweek. We checked out the pool too. It was located on the 76th floor and affords really cool views. Both the infinity pool and Jacuzzi were inviting (I bet especially at night when the colorful lights are on) but not inviting enough for me at the temperature we had when we went there. It was cold! Overall it was a very cool experience and we'd definitely go back when we return to Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Very Modern Beautiful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Brit-abroad-in-Asia
Reviews.Content: We just had a fantastic stay at the W Hotel in Hong Kong. I did have to overcome some slight reservations about being on the Kowloon side rather than on the 'Island' but in actual fact the hotel more than made up for the location, I discovered the delights of the Harbour Shopping centre and getting onto the Island was a lot easier that I had anticipated. As for the hotel itself, the interior is very trendy and beautifully designed with great attention to detail. The W branding is expertly woven through everything from the 'Whatever' Concierge service to the many different services presented in the room. The room itself was quite spacious for Hong Kong (we were in a suite) and the bathroom was stunning. Plus, the Bliss Toiletries were in large bottles and really nice. The room had three flat screen TV's including one in the bathroom and was incredibly clean. You were even invited to use the travel plug from the mini bar rather than 'buy-it' which I thought was a really nice touch. Breakfast was in a large cavernous kitchen with a massive selection of different foods, while the dining room was overlooking the busy Typhoon Shelter. For me the best bit of the hotel however was the Swimming pool. Situated on the 76th floor and overlooking the harbor I don't think I've ever swum with such great views. The only slight down-side was the wind, which did make swimming a little like something out of a Perfect Storm, but the attendant did tell us that its not normally like that. All in all one of the best hotels I've stayed in, in Hong Kong for a very long time and one that I can heartily recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Other W is still better than This one”
Reviews.Author: josephberlin
Reviews.Content: Well, Room i have is Fantastic suite and then at 2 am move to Marvelous suite. However both room are nice that the only thing i am choose to stay here. Room clean and All staff at front door are super nice and helpful. Welcome desk (Front staff) Are nice but not all. Ethan and another lady can't remember really nice. Below is Details in each thing that i try. Phone: Don't expect to have any conference call or anything related to. I missed few phone calls that they try to reach from Europe. Operator not do their job well, it take 20 mins at least to get to my room. And i did try to call Whatever Whenever (operator) And also the same, no one response for almost half an hour. So my meeting on the phone can't be done here. In case if someone try to attack me in room or else that could happen. You can't count on this Whatever Whenever ! Room: Room are clean, Turn down service is very low performance. Room not nice at evening turn down. Most of thing are not clean and full garbage still in the bin. (if you wish to let them empty) Bellman: Very Nice!! Front Desk: Most of them are great except the one that checking me in. It seem to be he suffer a lots to helping guest to do most of thing. Service should come from attitude not from the bible. Restaurant: Most of them are really nice, service also excellent. Limo: Great! Entertainment: Bar: Great DJ. Nice staff and great service. Drink also super creative. In room entertainment: Five stars!! Few staff such as Welcome guest mgr. Really nice and make my stay better.

Reviews.Title: “Good access and location - but bling with a sting....”
Reviews.Author: ellysian
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the W for 4 nights recently whilst in HK for the 7's. I agree with other reviewers that the hotel could not be easier to get to from HKG with a short hop on the airport express and then a well signposted stroll through the Elements shopping mall. In general I liked the modern design, swish rooms and public areas. Some of the floor surfaces and wallpapers are however very reflective and I can imagine a few migraines being induced on sunnier days. If you resort to wearing sunglasses your likely to bump into things as the corridor and lift lighting is set very low. The rooms are an ok size, it is HK after all. Most seem to have some kind of restricted views across the harbour to HK island. Nothing stands still in HK for very long and an enormous skyscraper is currently nearing completion and rather spoiled the views from my very nice corner room. I'm used to HK prices. My main gripe with this hotel is that the bar and restaurant pricing verges on the ridiculous. Nearly £10 for G&T, 20 HKD... Surely in light of evident low occupation rates, world recession etc etc, the management will have the common sense to moderate their pricing. Otherwise the place will be a nice wee one night special treat sort of place rather then fulfilling its potential as a longer duration stopover location. I wouldn't rate the staff as overly helpful or interested, not at the prices charged. I had to wait two and a half hours for my room to be available, from 1 pm. Not too early a check in methinks. As a wee comfort, they gave me a voucher for one coffee, which usually costs £6 I think. Their generosity knows no bounds. Nice pool area on 76 floor although when I was there it was so windy up there it was unusable if not dangerous on the slippy, windswept surfaces. The W is I think a victory of style over substance. I can see the younger tubes and donks of HK thinking, for a wee while at least, that this place is the place to be seen in. For me, the next time I want a nice break in HK it will be back to Shangri La Island.

Reviews.Title: “WoW !!! Trendy W !!!”
Reviews.Author: JulienF
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the W Hong Kong beginning of March for 6 nights and I can say WoW. The nicest and most trendy hotel, I ever stayed in. Everything is so hip and fashion, the amazing swimming pool on the 76th floor, the elevators, the very good breakfast buffet in the restaurant (a bit pricy but good quality), the lobby, WoW. Otherwise, the hotel is connected with the nice shopping mall 'Elements' which is connected with the subway + train to the airport, very convenient. The little problem is that the hotel is in Kowloon a bit far from everything. Otherwise, WoW ! I suggest this hotel for people who love trendy and design hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!!!!”
Reviews.Author: GMFLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our way to Vietnam. A perfect hotel for airport access. We had a corner room with a great view. Loved the bathroom and the electronic blinds in the bedroom. Great bed. Great bedding. We just felt pampered. W hotels seem to know how to provide super cool hotels that are also super luxurious. Everything was of the best quality . All the staff were wonderful and could not have been any more helpful. On our way home we had half a day before our connecting flight and spent it at the spa. It was the perfect place to start and finish our holiday!

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in HK right now!!! Hip, stylish & comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: 3cia
Reviews.Content: I booked our room through my travel agent. I don't know what to expect as I've just seen pictures of the hotel from Belle Australian interior design magazine while renovating our new home. We go to Hongkong 2-3 times a year. Mainly for relaxation & some shopping. My husband & I took airport express which cost us hk$140. They accept credit card payment. Upon reaching the Kowloon station, we took the lift then walked into Elements mall following the W sign. It is easy because our luggages have 4 wheels so I would recommend that. Upon reaching HMV, a bell guy approached us asking if we're heading to W? He gladly took our luggages and accompanied us to 6/f. The permeating scent upon entering the hotel is relaxing. On the 6th floor, we were shown the reception and check-in was a breeze. No lines!!! The guy in the reception was very accommodating, even offered us late check out. And gave us an upgrade. After we were given our card keys, the bell guy Gerard took us to 33rd floor. He showed us the amenities & gadgets of our room and asked us if we have any other questions. ROOM: We are impressed with our room. Their harbor view has a view of, well the harbor, ships & container vans. Having the usual harbor view from our usual hotel in Canton Road, this is a welcome change. We love it. With the bed, I was quite skeptical at first because it was so soft. So unlike my bed at home which is semi-firm. I was wrong! This is the best hotel bed I've had since Oriental Bangkok! I always wake up in the morning recharged. It's literally like sleeping on clouds. I love the many switch for lighting. Mentioned in one of the reviews was the bright light shining directly unto the pillow which I thought too can't be switched off until my husband pointed out to me the switch for that. He's a techie so he really enjoyed the room design. The room is excelllently designed and it feels like the room is big. There is a small ref, coffee & tea facilities, dvd player and a good quality LCD tv. The speakers are awesome. We once got back in the room before sunrise, played some 80's music and stayed til sunset. The best! Housekeeping cleans the room thoroughly. I place the card on the bed each morning so they'll change the sheets. They have turndown service at night. It's so nice to come home to your room tired from all that shopping & sightseeing to see your bed ready :) BATHROOM: Design of the bathroom is good too. One has the option to leave it open but still have privacy as the shower & water closet has sliding door. But if you want total privacy, you can just pull two huge sliding door mirrors together and it is an enclosed bathroom. I am very picky with hotel bathrooms but W surpassed my expectations. I rarely use the bath tub in hotels but this time I did. The bath tub is separate from the shower. And it is clean plus there is a tv. I love the Bliss products - shampoo, conditioner, face wash, body wash, soap & lotion. I took home some but regret not buying regular sized bottles in the spa. Maybe when we go back. A lot of thought went to designing the bathroom. Even in the shower where you put the toiletries, even that has lighting! Oh and this is one of the nicest hotel shower, it has overhead rain shower plus a telephone style shower. Water pressure is strong. One thing unique from other usual hotels, they have a loofah sponge. And I absolutely love the fluffy towels!!! And W is generous with towels. Housekeeping goes around at night to ask if we want more drinking water & towels. Who can beat that? HOTEL FACILITIES: The Kitchen restaurant is stylish but we didn't get to try their breakfast since we often wake up late. We checked out the spa on the 73/f(?) and a staff named Rosa, gladly showed us around. The treatment rooms are nice. Not bad for a city spa. They even have couple's treatment room. I never went swimming in any hotel in HK but the pool on the 76th floor looked so inviting that hubby & I went for a dip one early morning. Super relaxing is the heated whirlpool. Sitting there with a view of the city & harbor is a unique experience. W prides itself as having the highest swimming pool in HK right now. The outdoor shower is simple but stylish and so is the rest room. W used Kohler brand for their fixtures. After some laps in the pool, we were given bottles of water before we left. We tried their shuttle service on our 2nd day. It leaves every 30 minutes but you have to inform the bell guys in the lobby. Gerard the bell guy is always at hand to assist us. Turned out he's a Filipino and the housekeeping guy is a Flipino too so that makes the W experience a homely one for us. They provided us with a silver Audi Q7 for our shuttle that time. The W senses continues in their shuttle service. Same music & scent. And clean too. We go back & forth the hotel and Canton Road a few times in a day. Sometimes, the service is a Toyota van. We use taxi when going back to W. We take taxi from our usual Marco Polo Hotel in Canton Road. Taxi is HK$18-20. As for the internet, I used the one in the room with charge as I was lazy to go down. On our 2nd night, my hubby & I hung around in their Living Room for internet and it's a lovely place with a club vibe. So I highly recommend this. This is same set-up with other luxury hotels we've tried in other countries so no problem. SHOPPING & DINING: I was surprised with Elements mall. It was big and carry many brands like Zara, H&M, Kate Spade, Cartier, Piaget etc. Hermes is opening soon. I was happy to see Le Maison du Chocolat! They also have Victorinox, which I was able to buy kitchen knives I need. I just noticed they don't have LV & Chanel(only cosmetics). The mall is still new. There are many restaurants in Elements and we get to try a noodle place across 360 but I forgot the name. 360 has many food bars. We got to try the gourmet sandwich, some cake, shrimp wonton noodle soup. Good enough if you're feeling lazy to go to Canton Road. We bought some sushi there one afternoon and it's excellent quality. 360 has many organic food products on their shelves. When we go to Canton Road, we go to our usual haunts. H&M is opening soon. There's a newly opened Muji in Ocean Terminal. All brands are available there plus the restos like Sweet Dynasty, Taiwan Beef Noodle House & Guandong BBQ House. We always eat cheap & yummy in HK. Food Republic in Silvercord is a good bet. Dimsum, noodles & roasted dishes plus dessert. Pepper Lunch just opened. For a good yummy dessert to go, try Hui Lau Shan in Haiphong Road. We love the mango with jelly in coconut milk. I recommend Zurich(for Rolex & Patek Philippe) and Yes Watch(Rolex, Audemars Piguet, Franck Muller) in the area of Nathan Road. I noticed everytime we come back in a taxi, the bell guys always open our door and say "welcome back" and always offer to assist us with out shopping bags. They even check the taxi for anything we might leave behind. Check out was stress free too. The bell guys made sure our taxi driver knows our next destination which is in Causeway Bay. We did regret not staying in W for the whole of our trip. We stayed here for 2 nights 3 days only as I want to try another hotel in HK island which was a disappointment. Our stay in W made us relaxed, recharged and feeling happy. I would make W my base on my next HK visit if my travel agent can get me the same rate.

Reviews.Title: “Uber-cool”
Reviews.Author: TunbridgeWellsTrevor
Reviews.Content: Firstly, it could not be easier to get to: the second stop on the fast train from the airport is Kawloon. The hotel is literally above the station (actually, there is a big shopping mall between). A couple of lift changes and you are in this excellent art hotel. For those who appreciate modern design, this is a fab place. They have their own language too. Its all aspirational. The rooms have state of the art technology, great beds and bathrooms. The pool is open air and on the 76th floor. For the money, this is a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Coolest hotel ever!!”
Reviews.Author: KOinCT
Reviews.Content: Loved, loved, loved the W Hong Kong! I already am dying to go back. Like others have said, this is certainly a trendy, ultra high-tech, modern hotel. I had to call down to the Front Desk to ask how to turn on the TV (turns out you have to slide over a glass panel first - HA)! I would hardly call this a "negative" though. The polite, helpful staff, incredible amenities, clean, gorgeous rooms, great location and awesome gym made it all worthwhile. While they do not offer free internet in the rooms (I really didn't expect it), they did have complimentary Wi-Fi in the Lobby area, which I happily used in their comfortable, peaceful Living Room area one morning. It was so calm and cozy, I could have stayed there all day (but alas, I had shopping to do)! Check-in and check-out were a total breeze and the Front Desk staff were so nice and pleasant. On your way to the room, one notices how sleek and quick the elevators are and how serene and beautiful the hallways are. There are also these cute panels outside of each room that designates "Do Not Disturb" or "Please Make Up My Room". Very cool! And then of course the rooms themselves are soooooo incredible. Love the Bliss products in the bathroom, plush slippers, soft robes, and all the buttons and switches for the various lights, curtains, TV, etc! The gym was also incredibly high-tech. The machines are equipped with TVs and electronic panels that control just about everything. The hotel's location was also incredibly convenient - right above the Kowloon Airport Express station (and an MTR station) and connected to the beautiful Elements shopping mall. I could live at the W HK!!! Loooooved it.

Reviews.Title: “Hip and comfy!”
Reviews.Author: OliviaGS8
Reviews.Content: It was our first time to stay at W Hotel HongKong and we were very impressed. We took the train from Disneyland and getting there wasnt a problem at all. The location is very convenient as it is attached to the Elements shopping mall and the airport express line is right at Kowloon station. The hotel has a complimentary shuttle every 30 mins and it is just a quick 5 minute drive to Canton road where all brands can be found. The room amenities are quite interesting with all the gadgets to make you feel comfortable---automated curtains/blinds, Ipod docking station, dvd player, a tv at the bath tub area, etc. The bed is heavenly! I loved their complimentary tea as well. The toiletries are usable and of good quality. Buffet breakfast was like a treasure hunt because of the way food was presented so we had fun. Fresh fruit juices was the best as well as the different kinds of berries in their spread. My niece enjoyed the yoghurt station where they mix fresh fruits and yogurt on a frozen marble slab (like ColdStone's). In general, food was very healthy gourmet type. Most of their restaurants are very hip and not very suitable if you have young kids but other places to eat can be found at Elements mall. Checking out was a breeze so even if we were on a hurry it didnt add up to the stress.

Reviews.Title: “Probably the best room I have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: StormGCalifornia
Reviews.Content: The room has every amenity you can imagine including IPOD docks, Flat screen TV with lots of western tv channels, automated curtains and a control panel right next to the bed. The bed was the most comfortable bed I have ever stayed in - it was hard to get up in the mornings ! Great views of the harbor. The only drawback is the hotel is located above a mall and you are a little removed from the hussle and bussle of Kowloon. However, the airport train station is literally walking distance from the hotel which is very convenient. The infinity pool on the room is breathtaking and the gym is one of the best I have used.

Reviews.Title: “Liked it some, didn't like it some”
Reviews.Author: iheartvoyage
Reviews.Content: Just returned from my first trip to Hong Kong. We stayed at the W hotel for almost 2 weeks. Overall our stay was pleasant but with a few bumps. First, arriving there from the airport is direct, fast and easy. The hotel is located at Kowloon Station, and the Elements Mall. It is a bit of a pain to haul your heavy luggage through the mall to get to the hotel reception, but there are signs everywhere guiding you easily to the W, and kind keen mall boys to point you in the right direction. First impressions are high in it's category of designer hotels. The flashy elevator teleports you into the world of 'Whatever/Whenever'. Check-in was a breeze. We were given our room key and guided to the elevator, but not to our rooms. I do like being taken to the room and having all the facilities explained to me. However, the room was very nice, high-tech, spacious and clean. A welcome letter with your name on it was already in the room, neat things about the hotel and vouchers. Our luggage arrived to the room after 20 minutes, which I think is a bit long after a 13 hour flight when all you want to do is take a bath and change. We booked a wonderful room with King size bed. First thing you notice is the beautiful stone tiled bathroom (dries fast of wet foot prints), complete with 2 sets of bliss bathroom amenities. They were a pleasure to use. The room also had a Vidal top of the line hairdryer, built into drawer so no messy wires in the way. Extra toothbrushes, razors, shaving creams, nail files, cotton, swabs etc. Everything in twos for the whole duration of our stay. Shoe shiner and sewing kit, slippers, bathrobes, hangers, safe, daily newspapers etc. Everything you would expect from a 5 star. We had a separate bathtub with built-in mini tv. The rain shower was to die for and one of the best showers I've ever had. There's one door shared between the toilet and shower. Smart design, didn't inconvenience us. Cool way to make the most out of the space. The toilet was hard to flush, as you have to push the small button in the wall with your longest finger to flush. The toilet doesn't flush well either. You really have to push the button until it finishes flushing. It strained my finger each time. The bathroom can be apart of the room or closed up completely with the sliding doors, so you can have privacy. The bed was uber comfy and luxurious. The pillows were like sinking into bliss. The different lighting settings were cool too, except when your really wanted 'black out' the lights on the night stand still glowed. The only way to rid of them completely is covering them with towels or taking the room card out of the slot. Beware, If you choose to take the room card out of the slot, you can't charge your phone or devices anymore, for example, because there's no electricity to the room. Air-con doesn't work as well, but not too bothered with air-con anyway. Too much air-con in Asia. I always try to escape it. Ventilation was good. The rooms are very sound proof as well. I didn't hear one neighbour. Complaints. The hot jacuzzi on the top floor was pleasurable, but the whole pool terrace wasn't so inviting. The big pool was just a rectangle to do laps, quite windy up there as well. Still cool to be on top of all the buildings. Only went and used it once and had no desire to really go back, and didn't. The gym is 24hrs and does the job, used it often. You are given only 2 small bottles of water in your room each day, but you can have as much bottled water on Swimming level and gym level. Also, I've stayed in lavish places before, but I think they exaggerated some of the prices. Extra water in the rooms were at a charge of like HK$70 (7 euros) A can of soda was HK$50, the food was expensive (better off eating in the mall).
